  14. 1var Generator = define(null, {
    15. 

  15.      instance:{
    16. 

  16.          /**@lends patio.SchemaGenerator.prototype*/
    17. 

  17.  
    18. 

  18.          __primaryKey:null,
    19. 

  19.  
    20. 

  20.          /**
    21. 

  21.           * An internal class that the user is not expected to instantiate directly.
    22. 

  22.           * Instances are created by {@link patio.Database#createTable}.
    23. 

  23.           * It is used to specify table creation parameters.  It takes a Database
    24. 

  24.           * object and a block of column/index/constraint specifications, and
    25. 

  25.           * gives the Database a table description, which the database uses to
    26. 

  26.           * create a table.
    27. 

  27.           *
    28. 

  28.           * {@link patio.SchemaGenerator} has some methods but also includes method_missing,
    29. 

  29.           * allowing users to specify column type as a method instead of using
    30. 

  30.           * the column method, which makes for a cleaner code.
    31. 

  31.           * @constructs
    32. 

  32.           * @example
    33. 

  33.           *comb.executeInOrder(DB, function(DB){
    34. 

  34.           *       DB.createTable("airplane_type", function () {
    35. 

  35.           *          this.primaryKey("id");
    36. 

  36.           *          this.name(String, {allowNull:false});
    37. 

  37.           *          this.max_seats(Number, {size:3, allowNull:false});
    38. 

  38.           *          this.company(String, {allowNull:false});
    39. 

  39.           *       });
    40. 

  40.           *      DB.createTable("airplane", function () {
    41. 

  41.           *          this.primaryKey("id");
    42. 

  42.           *          this.total_no_of_seats(Number, {size:3, allowNull:false});
    43. 

  43.           *          this.foreignKey("typeId", "airplane_type", {key:"id"});
    44. 

  44.           *      });
    45. 

  45.           *      DB.createTable("flight_leg", function () {
    46. 

  46.           *          this.primaryKey("id");
    47. 

  47.           *          this.scheduled_departure_time("time");
    48. 

  48.           *          this.scheduled_arrival_time("time");
    49. 

  49.           *          this.foreignKey("departure_code", "airport", {key:"airport_code", type : String, size : 4});
    50. 

  50.           *          this.foreignKey("arrival_code", "airport", {key:"airport_code", type : String, size : 4});
    51. 

  51.           *          this.foreignKey("flight_id", "flight", {key:"id"});
    52. 

  52.           *      });
    53. 

  53.           *      DB.createTable("leg_instance", function () {
    54. 

  54.           *          this.primaryKey("id");
    55. 

  55.           *          this.date("date");
    56. 

  56.           *          this.arr_time("datetime");
    57. 

  57.           *          this.dep_time("datetime");
    58. 

  58.           *          this.foreignKey("airplane_id", "airplane", {key:"id"});
    59. 

  59.           *          this.foreignKey("flight_leg_id", "flight_leg", {key:"id"});
    60. 

  60.           *      });
    61. 

  61.           *});
    62. 

  62.           * @param {patio.Database} the database this generator is for
    63. 

  63.           */
    64. 

  64.          constructor:function (db) {
    65. 

  65. 218            this.db = db;
    66. 

  66. 218            this.columns = [];
    67. 

  67. 218            this.indexes = [];
    68. 

  68. 218            this.constraints = [];
    69. 

  69. 218            this.__primaryKey = null;
    70. 

  70.          },
    71. 

  71.  
    72. 

  72.          /**
    73. 

  73.           * Add an unnamed constraint to the DDL, specified by the given block
    74. 

  74.           * or args:
    75. 

  75.           *
    76. 

  76.           * @example
    77. 

  77.           * db.createTable("test", function(){
    78. 

  78.           *   this.check({num : {between : [1,5]}})
    79. 

  79.           *      //=> CHECK num >= 1 AND num <= 5
    80. 

  80.           *   this.check(function(){return this.num.gt(5);});
    81. 

  81.           *      //=> CHECK num > 5
    82. 

  82.           * });
    83. 

  83.           **/
    84. 

  84.          check:function () {
    85. 

  85. 0            return this.constraint.apply(this, [null].concat(argsToArray(arguments)));
    86. 

  86.          },
    87. 

  87.  
    88. 

  88.          /**
    89. 

  89.           * Add a column with the given name, type, and opts to the DDL.
    90. 

  90.           *
    91. 

  91.           * <pre class="code">
    92. 

  92.           *  DB.createTable("test", function(){
    93. 

  93.           *      this.column("num", "integer");
    94. 

  94.           *          //=> num INTEGER
    95. 

  95.           *      this.column('name", String, {allowNull : false, "default" : "a");
    96. 

  96.           *          //=> name varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'a'
    97. 

  97.           *      this.column("ip", "inet");
    98. 

  98.           *          //=> ip inet
    99. 

  99.           *   });
    100. 

  100.           * </pre>
    101. 

  101.           *
    102. 

  102.           * You can also create columns via method missing, so the following are
    103. 

  103.           * equivalent:
    104. 

  104.           * <pre class="code">
    105. 

  105.           * DB.createTable("test", function(){
    106. 

  106.           *   this.column("number", "integer");
    107. 

  107.           *   this.number("integer");
    108. 

  108.           * });
    109. 

  109.           * </pre>
    110. 

  110.           *
    111. 

  111.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the column
    112. 

  112.           * @param type the datatype of the column.
    113. 

  113.           * @param {Object} [opts] additional options
    114. 

  114.           *
    115. 

  115.           * @param [opts.default] The default value for the column.
    116. 

  116.           * @param [opts.deferrable] This ensure Referential Integrity will work even if
    117. 

  117.           *                reference table will use for its foreign key a value that does not
    118. 

  118.           *                exists(yet) on referenced table. Basically it adds
    119. 

  119.           *                DEFERRABLE INITIALLY DEFERRED on key creation.
    120. 

  120.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.index]  Create an index on this column.
    121. 

  121.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} [key] For foreign key columns, the column in the associated table
    122. 

  122.           *         that this column references.  Unnecessary if this column references the primary key of the
    123. 

  123.           *         associated table.
    124. 

  124.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.allowNull]  Mark the column as allowing NULL values (if true),
    125. 

  125.           *          or not allowing NULL values (if false).  If unspecified, will default
    126. 

  126.           *          to whatever the database default is.
    127. 

  127.           * @param {String} [opts.onDelete] Specify the behavior of this column when being deleted
    128. 

  128.           *               ("restrict", "cascade", "setNull", "setDefault", "noAction").
    129. 

  129.           * @param {String} [opts.onUpdate] Specify the behavior of this column when being updated
    130. 

  130.           *               Valid options ("restrict", "cascade", "setNull", "setDefault", "noAction").
    131. 

  131.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.primaryKey] Make the column as a single primary key column.  This should only
    132. 

  132.           *                 be used if you have a single, non-autoincrementing primary key column.
    133. 

  133.           * @param {Number} [opts.size] The size of the column, generally used with string
    134. 

  134.           *          columns to specify the maximum number of characters the column will hold.
    135. 

  135.           *          An array of two integers can be provided to set the size and the
    136. 

  136.           *          precision, respectively, of decimal columns.
    137. 

  137.           * @param {String} [opts.unique] Mark the column as unique, generally has the same effect as
    138. 

  138.           *            creating a unique index on the column.
    139. 

  139.           * @param {String} [opts.unsigned] Make the column type unsigned, only useful for integer
    140. 

  140.           *              columns.
    141. 

  141.           * @param {Array} [opts.elements] Available items used for set and enum columns.
    142. 

  142.           *
    143. 

  143.           **/
    144. 

  144.          column:function (name, type, opts) {
    145. 

  145. 549            opts = opts || {};
    146. 

  146. 549            this.columns.push(merge({name:name, type:type}, opts));
    147. 

  147. 549            if (opts.index) {
    148. 

  148. 1                this.index(name);
    149. 

  149.              }
    150. 

  150.          },
    151. 

  151.  
    152. 

  152.          /**
    153. 

  153.           * Adds a named constraint (or unnamed if name is nil) to the DDL,
    154. 

  154.           * with the given block or args.
    155. 

  155.           * @example
    156. 

  156.           * DB.createTable("test", function(){
    157. 

  157.           *      this.constraint("blah", {num : {between : [1,5])
    158. 

  158.           *              //=> CONSTRAINT blah CHECK num >= 1 AND num <= 5
    159. 

  159.           *      this.check("foo", function(){
    160. 

  160.           *          return this.num.gt(5);
    161. 

  161.           *      }); # CONSTRAINT foo CHECK num > 5
    162. 

  162.           * });
    163. 

  163.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the constraint
    164. 

  164.           * @param {...} args variable number of arguments to create the constraint filter.
    165. 

  165.           *              See {@link patio.Dataset#filter} for valid filter arguments.
    166. 

  166.           *   */
    167. 

  167.          constraint:function (name, args) {
    168. 

  168. 0            args = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    169. 

  169. 0            var block = isFunction(args[args.length - 1]) ? args.pop : null;
    170. 

  170. 0            this.constraints.push({name:name, type:"check", check:block || args});
    171. 

  171.          },
    172. 

  172.  
    173. 

  173.          /**
    174. 

  174.           *  Add a foreign key in the table that references another table to the DDL. See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#column{
    175. 

  175.           * for options.
    176. 

  176.           *
    177. 

  177.           * @example
    178. 

  178.           * DB.createTable("flight_leg", function () {
    179. 

  179.           *      this.primaryKey("id");
    180. 

  180.           *      this.scheduled_departure_time("time");
    181. 

  181.           *      this.scheduled_arrival_time("time");
    182. 

  182.           *      this.foreignKey("departure_code", "airport", {key:"airport_code", type : String, size : 4});
    183. 

  183.           *      this.foreignKey("arrival_code", "airport", {key:"airport_code", type : String, size : 4});
    184. 

  184.           *      this.foreignKey("flight_id", "flight", {key:"id"});
    185. 

  185.           * });
    186. 

  186.           **/
    187. 

  187.          foreignKey:function (name, table, opts) {
    188. 

  188. 37            opts = opts || {};
    189. 

  189. 37            opts = isHash(table) ? merge({}, table, opts) : isString(table) ? merge({table:table}, opts) : opts;
    190. 

  190. 37            if (isArray(name)) {
    191. 

  191. 5                return this.__compositeForeignKey(name, opts);
    192. 

  192.              } else {
    193. 

  193. 32                return this.column(name, "integer", opts);
    194. 

  194.              }
    195. 

  195.          },
    196. 

  196.  
    197. 

  197.          /**
    198. 

  198.           *Add a full text index on the given columns to the DDL.
    199. 

  199.           *
    200. 

  200.           * @example
    201. 

  201.           *  DB.createTable("posts", function () {
    202. 

  202.           *      this.title("text");
    203. 

  203.           *      this.body("text");
    204. 

  204.           *      this.fullTextIndex("title");
    205. 

  205.           *      this.fullTextIndex(["title", "body"]);
    206. 

  206.           *  });
    207. 

  207.           */
    208. 

  208.          fullTextIndex:function (columns, opts) {
    209. 

  209. 4            opts = opts || {};
    210. 

  210. 4            return this.index(columns, merge({type:"fullText"}, opts));
    211. 

  211.          },
    212. 

  212.  
    213. 

  213.          /**
    214. 

  214.           *
    215. 

  215.           * Check if the DDL includes the creation of a column with the given name.
    216. 

  216.           * @return {Boolean} true if the DDL includes the creation of a column with the given name.
    217. 

  217.           */
    218. 

  218.          hasColumn:function (name) {
    219. 

  219. 70            return this.columns.some(function (c) {
    220. 

  220. 310                return c.name == name
    221. 

  221.              });
    222. 

  222.          },
    223. 

  223.  
    224. 

  224.          /**
    225. 

  225.           * Add an index on the given column(s) with the given options to the DDL.
    226. 

  226.           * The available options are:
    227. 

  227.           * @example
    228. 

  228.           * DB.createTable("test", function(table) {
    229. 

  229.           *       table.primaryKey("id", "integer", {null : false});
    230. 

  230.           *       table.column("name", "text");
    231. 

  231.           *       table.index("name", {unique : true});
    232. 

  232.           * });
    233. 

  233.           *
    234. 

  234.           * @param columns the column/n to create the index from.
    235. 

  235.           * @param {Object}  [opts] Additional options
    236. 

  236.           * @param {String}  [opts.type] The type of index to use (only supported by some databases)
    237. 

  237.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.unique] :: Make the index unique, so duplicate values are not allowed.
    238. 

  238.           * @param [opts.where] :: Create a partial index (only supported by some databases)
    239. 

  239.           **/
    240. 

  240.          index:function (columns, opts) {
    241. 

  241. 17            this.indexes.push(merge({columns:toArray(columns)}, opts || {}));
    242. 

  242.          },
    243. 

  243.  
    244. 

  244.          /**
    245. 

  245.           * Adds an auto-incrementing primary key column or a primary key constraint to the DDL.
    246. 

  246.           * To create a constraint, the first argument should be an array of columns
    247. 

  247.           * specifying the primary key columns. To create an auto-incrementing primary key
    248. 

  248.           * column, a single column can be used. In both cases, an options hash can be used
    249. 

  249.           * as the second argument.
    250. 

  250.           *
    251. 

  251.           * If you want to create a primary key column that is not auto-incrementing, you
    252. 

  252.           * should not use this method.  Instead, you should use the regular {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#column}
    253. 

  253.           * method with a {primaryKey : true} option.
    254. 

  254.           *
    255. 

  255.           * @example
    256. 

  256.           * db.createTable("airplane_type", function () {
    257. 

  257.           *      this.primaryKey("id");
    258. 

  258.           *          //=> id integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT
    259. 

  259.           *      this.name(String, {allowNull:false});
    260. 

  260.           *      this.max_seats(Number, {size:3, allowNull:false});
    261. 

  261.           *      this.company(String, {allowNull:false});
    262. 

  262.           * });
    263. 

  263.           * */
    264. 

  264.          primaryKey:function (name) {
    265. 

  265. 70            if (isArray(name)) {
    266. 

  266. 0                return this.__compositePrimaryKey.apply(this, arguments);
    267. 

  267.              } else {
    268. 

  268. 70                var args = argsToArray(arguments, 1), type;
    269. 

  269. 70                var opts = args.pop();
    270. 

  270. 70                this.__primaryKey = merge({}, this.db.serialPrimaryKeyOptions, {name:name}, opts);
    271. 

  271. 70                if (isDefined((type = args.pop()))) {
    272. 

  272. 3                    merge(opts, {type:type});
    273. 

  273.                  }
    274. 

  274. 70                merge(this.__primaryKey, opts);
    275. 

  275. 70                return this.__primaryKey;
    276. 

  276.              }
    277. 

  277.          },
    278. 

  278.  
    279. 

  279.          /**
    280. 

  280.           * Add a spatial index on the given columns to the DDL.
    281. 

  281.           */
    282. 

  282.          spatialIndex:function (columns, opts) {
    283. 

  283. 2            opts = opts || {};
    284. 

  284. 2            return this.index(columns, merge({type:"spatial"}, opts));
    285. 

  285.          },
    286. 

  286.  
    287. 

  287.          /**
    288. 

  288.           * Add a unique constraint on the given columns to the DDL. See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#constraint}
    289. 

  289.           * for argument types.
    290. 

  290.           * @example
    291. 

  291.           * DB.createTable("test", function(){
    292. 

  292.           *   this.unique("name");
    293. 

  293.           *          //=> UNIQUE (name)
    294. 

  294.           * });
    295. 

  295.           *   */
    296. 

  296.          unique:function (columns, opts) {
    297. 

  297. 0            opts = opts || {};
    298. 

  298. 0            this.constraints.push(merge({type:"unique", columns:toArray(columns)}, opts));
    299. 

  299.          },
    300. 

  300.  
    301. 

  301.  
    302. 

  302.          /**
    303. 

  303.           * @private
    304. 

  304.           * Add a composite primary key constraint
    305. 

  305.           */
    306. 

  306.          __compositePrimaryKey:function (columns) {
    307. 

  307. 0            var args = argsToArray(arguments, 1);
    308. 

  308. 0            var opts = args.pop() || {};
    309. 

  309. 0            this.constraints.push(merge({type:"primaryKey", columns:columns}, opts));
    310. 

  310.          },
    311. 

  311.  
    312. 

  312.          /**
    313. 

  313.           * @private
    314. 

  314.           * Add a composite foreign key constraint
    315. 

  315.           */
    316. 

  316.          __compositeForeignKey:function (columns, opts) {
    317. 

  317. 5            this.constraints.push(merge({type:"foreignKey", columns:columns}, opts));
    318. 

  318.          },
    319. 

  319.  
    320. 

  320.          /**@ignore*/
    321. 

  321.          getters:{
    322. 

  322.              // The name of the primary key for this generator, if it has a primary key.
    323. 

  323.              primaryKeyName:function () {
    324. 

  324. 70                return this.__primaryKey ? this.__primaryKey.name : null;
    325. 

  325.              }
    326. 

  326.  
    327. 

  327.          }
    328. 

  328.  
    329. 

  329.      }
    330. 

  330.  });
