  332. 1exports.SchemaGenerator = function (db, block) {
    333. 

  333. 218    var gen = new Generator(db);
    334. 

  334. 218    var prox = methodMissing(gen, function (name) {
    335. 

  335. 431        return function (type, opts) {
    336. 

  336. 431            name = name || null;
    337. 

  337. 431            opts = opts || {};
    338. 

  338. 431            if (name) {
    339. 

  339. 431                return this.column(name, type, opts);
    340. 

  340.              } else {
    341. 

  341. 0                throw new TypeError();
    342. 

  342.              }
    343. 

  343.          }
    344. 

  344.      }, Generator);
    345. 

  345. 218    block.apply(prox, [prox]);
    346. 

  346. 218    gen.columns = prox.columns;
    347. 

  347. 218    if (gen.__primaryKey && !gen.hasColumn(gen.primaryKeyName)) {
    348. 

  348. 70        gen.columns.unshift(gen.__primaryKey);
    349. 

  349.      }
    350. 

  350. 218    return gen;
    351. 

  351.  }
    352. 

  352.  
    353. 

  353.  
    354. 

  354. 1var AlterTableGenerator = define(null, {
    355. 

  355.      instance:{
    356. 

  356.          /**@lends patio.AlterTableGenerator.prototype*/
    357. 

  357.  
    358. 

  358.          /**
    359. 

  359.           * An internal class that the user is not expected to instantiate directly.
    360. 

  360.           * Instances are created by {@link patio.Database#alterTable}.
    361. 

  361.           * It is used to specify table alteration parameters.  It takes a Database
    362. 

  362.           * object and a function which is called in the scope of the {@link patio.AlterTableGenerator}
    363. 

  363.           * to perform on the table, and gives the Database an array of table altering operations,
    364. 

  364.           * which the database uses to alter a table's description.
    365. 

  365.           *
    366. 

  366.           * @example
    367. 

  367.           * DB.alterTable("xyz", function() {
    368. 

  368.           *      this.addColumn("aaa", "text", {null : false, unique : true});
    369. 

  369.           *      this.dropColumn("bbb");
    370. 

  370.           *      this.renameColumn("ccc", "ddd");
    371. 

  371.           *      this.setColumnType("eee", "integer");
    372. 

  372.           *      this.setColumnDefault("hhh", 'abcd');
    373. 

  373.           *      this.addIndex("fff", {unique : true});
    374. 

  374.           *      this.dropIndex("ggg");
    375. 

  375.           * });
    376. 

  376.           *
    377. 

  377.           * //or using the passed in generator
    378. 

  378.           *  DB.alterTable("xyz", function(table) {
    379. 

  379.           *      table.addColumn("aaa", "text", {null : false, unique : true});
    380. 

  380.           *      table.dropColumn("bbb");
    381. 

  381.           *      table.renameColumn("ccc", "ddd");
    382. 

  382.           *      table.setColumnType("eee", "integer");
    383. 

  383.           *      table.setColumnDefault("hhh", 'abcd');
    384. 

  384.           *      table.addIndex("fff", {unique : true});
    385. 

  385.           *      table.dropIndex("ggg");
    386. 

  386.           * });
    387. 

  387.           * @constructs
    388. 

  388.           *
    389. 

  389.           * @param {patio.Database} db the database object which is performing the alter table operation.
    390. 

  390.           * @param {Function} block a block which performs the operations. The block is called in the scope
    391. 

  391.           * of the {@link patio.AlterTableGenerator} and is passed an instance of {@link patio.AlterTableGenerator}
    392. 

  392.           * as the first argument.
    393. 

  393.           */
    394. 

  394.          constructor:function (db, block) {
    395. 

  395. 80            this.db = db;
    396. 

  396. 80            this.operations = [];
    397. 

  397. 80            block.apply(this, [this]);
    398. 

  398.  
    399. 

  399.          },
    400. 

  400.  
    401. 

  401.          /**
    402. 

  402.           * Add a column with the given name, type, and opts to the DDL for the table.
    403. 

  403.           * See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#column} for the available options.
    404. 

  404.           *
    405. 

  405.           * @example
    406. 

  406.           * DB.alterTable("test", function(){
    407. 

  407.           *   this.addColumn("name", String);
    408. 

  408.           *     //=> ADD COLUMN name varchar(255)
    409. 

  409.           * });
    410. 

  410.           **/
    411. 

  411.          addColumn:function (name, type, opts) {
    412. 

  412. 13            opts = opts || {};
    413. 

  413. 13            this.operations.push(merge({op:"addColumn", name:name, type:type}, opts));
    414. 

  414.          },
    415. 

  415.  
    416. 

  416.          /**
    417. 

  417.           * Add a constraint with the given name and args to the DDL for the table.
    418. 

  418.           * See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#constraint}.
    419. 

  419.           *
    420. 

  420.           * @example
    421. 

  421.           * var sql = patio.sql;
    422. 

  422.           * DB.alterTable("test", function(){
    423. 

  423.           *      this.addConstraint("valid_name", sql.name.like('A%'));
    424. 

  424.           *          //=>ADD CONSTRAINT valid_name CHECK (name LIKE 'A%')
    425. 

  425.           * });
    426. 

  426.           *   */
    427. 

  427.          addConstraint:function (name) {
    428. 

  428. 0            var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    429. 

  429. 0            var block = isFunction(args[args.length - 1]) ? args.pop() : null;
    430. 

  430. 0            this.operations.push({op:"addConstraint", name:name, type:"check", check:block || args});
    431. 

  431.          },
    432. 

  432.  
    433. 

  433.          /**
    434. 

  434.           * Add a unique constraint to the given column(s).
    435. 

  435.           * See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#constraint}.
    436. 

  436.           * @example
    437. 

  437.           * DB.alterTable("test", function(){
    438. 

  438.           *   this.addUniqueConstraint("name");
    439. 

  439.           *      //=> ADD UNIQUE (name)
    440. 

  440.           *   this.addUniqueConstraint("name", {name : "uniqueName});
    441. 

  441.           *      //=> ADD CONSTRAINT uniqueName UNIQUE (name)
    442. 

  442.           * });
    443. 

  443.           **/
    444. 

  444.          addUniqueConstraint:function (columns, opts) {
    445. 

  445. 0            opts = opts || {};
    446. 

  446. 0            this.operations.push(merge({op:"addConstraint", type:"unique", columns:toArray(columns)}, opts));
    447. 

  447.          },
    448. 

  448.  
    449. 

  449.          /**
    450. 

  450.           * Add a foreign key with the given name and referencing the given table
    451. 

  451.           * to the DDL for the table.  See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#column}
    452. 

  452.           * for the available options.
    453. 

  453.           *
    454. 

  454.           * You can also pass an array of column names for creating composite foreign
    455. 

  455.           * keys. In this case, it will assume the columns exists and will only add
    456. 

  456.           * the constraint.
    457. 

  457.           *
    458. 

  458.           * NOTE: If you need to add a foreign key constraint to a single existing column
    459. 

  459.           * use the composite key syntax even if it is only one column.
    460. 

  460.           * @example
    461. 

  461.           * DB.alterTable("albums", function(){
    462. 

  462.           *   this.addForeignKey("artist_id", "table");
    463. 

  463.           *          //=>ADD COLUMN artist_id integer REFERENCES table
    464. 

  464.           *   this.addForeignKey(["name"], "table")
    465. 

  465.           *          //=>ADD FOREIGN KEY (name) REFERENCES table
    466. 

  466.           * });
    467. 

  467.           */
    468. 

  468.          addForeignKey:function (name, table, opts) {
    469. 

  469. 3            opts = opts;
    470. 

  470. 3            if (isArray(name)) {
    471. 

  471. 1                return this.__addCompositeForeignKey(name, table, opts);
    472. 

  472.              } else {
    473. 

  473. 2                return this.addColumn(name, "integer", merge({table:table}, opts));
    474. 

  474.              }
    475. 

  475.          },
    476. 

  476.  
    477. 

  477.          /**
    478. 

  478.           * Add a full text index on the given columns to the DDL for the table.
    479. 

  479.           * See @{link patio.SchemaGenerator#index} for available options.
    480. 

  480.           */
    481. 

  481.          addFullTextIndex:function (columns, opts) {
    482. 

  482. 0            opts = opts || {};
    483. 

  483. 0            return this.addIndex(columns, merge({type:"fullText"}, opts));
    484. 

  484.          },
    485. 

  485.  
    486. 

  486.          /**
    487. 

  487.           * Add an index on the given columns to the DDL for the table.  See
    488. 

  488.           * {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#index} for available options.
    489. 

  489.           * @example
    490. 

  490.           * DB.alterTable("table", function(){
    491. 

  491.           *   this.addIndex("artist_id");
    492. 

  492.           *          //=> CREATE INDEX table_artist_id_index ON table (artist_id)
    493. 

  493.           * });
    494. 

  494.           */
    495. 

  495.          addIndex:function (columns, opts) {
    496. 

  496. 5            opts = opts || {};
    497. 

  497. 5            this.operations.push(merge({op:"addIndex", columns:toArray(columns)}, opts));
    498. 

  498.          },
    499. 

  499.  
    500. 

  500.          /**
    501. 

  501.           * Add a primary key to the DDL for the table.  See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#column}
    502. 

  502.           * for the available options.  Like {@link patio.ALterTableGenerator#addForeignKey}, if you specify
    503. 

  503.           * the column name as an array, it just creates a constraint:
    504. 

  504.           *
    505. 

  505.           * @example
    506. 

  506.           * DB.alterTable("albums", function(){
    507. 

  507.           *      this.addPrimaryKey("id");
    508. 

  508.           *           //=> ADD COLUMN id serial PRIMARY KEY
    509. 

  509.           *      this.addPrimaryKey(["artist_id", "name"])
    510. 

  510.           *          //=>ADD PRIMARY KEY (artist_id, name)
    511. 

  511.           * });
    512. 

  512.           */
    513. 

  513.          addPrimaryKey:function (name, opts) {
    514. 

  514. 0            opts = opts || {};
    515. 

  515. 0            if (isArray(name)) {
    516. 

  516. 0                return this.__addCompositePrimaryKey(name, opts);
    517. 

  517.              } else {
    518. 

  518. 0                opts = merge({}, this.db.serialPrimaryKeyOptions, opts);
    519. 

  519. 0                delete opts.type;
    520. 

  520. 0                return this.addColumn(name, "integer", opts);
    521. 

  521.              }
    522. 

  522.          },
    523. 

  523.  
    524. 

  524.          /**
    525. 

  525.           * Add a spatial index on the given columns to the DDL for the table.
    526. 

  526.           * See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator#index} for available options.
    527. 

  527.           * */
    528. 

  528.          addSpatialIndex:function (columns, opts) {
    529. 

  529. 0            opts = opts || {};
    530. 

  530. 0            this.addIndex(columns, merge({}, {type:"spatial"}, opts))
    531. 

  531.          },
    532. 

  532.  
    533. 

  533.          /**
    534. 

  534.           * Remove a column from the DDL for the table.
    535. 

  535.           *
    536. 

  536.           * @example
    537. 

  537.           * DB.alterTable("albums", function(){
    538. 

  538.           *   this.dropColumn("artist_id");
    539. 

  539.           *      //=>DROP COLUMN artist_id
    540. 

  540.           * });
    541. 

  541.           *
    542. 

  542.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the column to drop.
    543. 

  543.           */
    544. 

  544.          dropColumn:function (name) {
    545. 

  545. 4            this.operations.push({op:"dropColumn", name:name});
    546. 

  546.          },
    547. 

  547.  
    548. 

  548.          /**
    549. 

  549.           * Remove a constraint from the DDL for the table.
    550. 

  550.           * @example
    551. 

  551.           * DB.alterTable("test", function(){
    552. 

  552.           *      this.dropConstraint("constraint_name");
    553. 

  553.           *          //=>DROP CONSTRAINT constraint_name
    554. 

  554.           * });
    555. 

  555.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the constraint to drop.
    556. 

  556.           */
    557. 

  557.          dropConstraint:function (name) {
    558. 

  558. 0            this.operations.push({op:"dropConstraint", name:name});
    559. 

  559.          },
    560. 

  560.  
    561. 

  561.          /**
    562. 

  562.           * Remove an index from the DDL for the table.
    563. 

  563.           *
    564. 

  564.           * @example
    565. 

  565.           * DB.alterTable("albums", function(){
    566. 

  566.           *   this.dropIndex("artist_id")
    567. 

  567.           *      //=>DROP INDEX table_artist_id_index
    568. 

  568.           *   this.dropIndex(["a", "b"])
    569. 

  569.           *      //=>DROP INDEX table_a_b_index
    570. 

  570.           *   this.dropIndex(["a", "b"], {name : "foo"})
    571. 

  571.           *          //=>DROP INDEX foo
    572. 

  572.           * });
    573. 

  573.           */
    574. 

  574.          dropIndex:function (columns, opts) {
    575. 

  575. 2            opts = opts || {};
    576. 

  576. 2            this.operations.push(merge({op:"dropIndex", columns:toArray(columns)}, opts));
    577. 

  577.          },
    578. 

  578.  
    579. 

  579.          /**
    580. 

  580.           * Modify a column's name in the DDL for the table.
    581. 

  581.           *
    582. 

  582.           * @example
    583. 

  583.           * DB.alterTable("artist", function(){
    584. 

  584.           *      this.renameColumn("name", "artistName");
    585. 

  585.           *          //=> RENAME COLUMN name TO artist_name
    586. 

  586.           * });
    587. 

  587.           */
    588. 

  588.          renameColumn:function (name, newName, opts) {
    589. 

  589. 51            opts = opts || {};
    590. 

  590. 51            this.operations.push(merge({op:"renameColumn", name:name, newName:newName}, opts));
    591. 

  591.          },
    592. 

  592.  
    593. 

  593.          /**
    594. 

  594.           * Modify a column's default value in the DDL for the table.
    595. 

  595.           * @example
    596. 

  596.           * DB.alterTable("artist", function(){
    597. 

  597.           *      //=>this.setColumnDefault("artist_name", "a");
    598. 

  598.           *          //=> ALTER COLUMN artist_name SET DEFAULT 'a'
    599. 

  599.           * });
    600. 

  600.           *   */
    601. 

  601.          setColumnDefault:function (name, def) {
    602. 

  602. 5            this.operations.push({op:"setColumnDefault", name:name, "default":def});
    603. 

  603.          },
    604. 

  604.  
    605. 

  605.          /**
    606. 

  606.           * Modify a column's type in the DDL for the table.
    607. 

  607.           *
    608. 

  608.           * @example
    609. 

  609.           * DB.alterTable("artist", function(){
    610. 

  610.           *   this.setColumnType("artist_name", 'char(10)');
    611. 

  611.           *      //=> ALTER COLUMN artist_name TYPE char(10)
    612. 

  612.           * });
    613. 

  613.           */
    614. 

  614.          setColumnType:function (name, type, opts) {
    615. 

  615. 7            opts = opts || {}
    616. 

  616. 7            this.operations.push(merge({op:"setColumnType", name:name, type:type}, opts));
    617. 

  617.          },
    618. 

  618.  
    619. 

  619.          /**
    620. 

  620.           * Modify a column's NOT NULL constraint.
    621. 

  621.           * @example
    622. 

  622.           * DB.alterTable("artist", function(){
    623. 

  623.           *   this.setColumnAllowNull("artist_name", false);
    624. 

  624.           *      //=> ALTER COLUMN artist_name SET NOT NULL
    625. 

  625.           * });
    626. 

  626.           **/
    627. 

  627.          setAllowNull:function (name, allowNull) {
    628. 

  628. 1            this.operations.push({op:"setColumnNull", name:name, "null":allowNull});
    629. 

  629.          },
    630. 

  630.  
    631. 

  631.          /**
    632. 

  632.           * @private
    633. 

  633.           * Add a composite primary key constraint
    634. 

  634.           **/
    635. 

  635.          __addCompositePrimaryKey:function (columns, opts) {
    636. 

  636. 0            this.operations.push(merge({op:"addConstraint", type:"primaryKey", columns:columns}, opts));
    637. 

  637.          },
    638. 

  638.  
    639. 

  639.          /**
    640. 

  640.           * @private
    641. 

  641.           * Add a composite foreign key constraint
    642. 

  642.           * */
    643. 

  643.          __addCompositeForeignKey:function (columns, table, opts) {
    644. 

  644. 1            this.operations.push(merge({op:"addConstraint", type:"foreignKey", columns:columns, table:table}, opts));
    645. 

  645.          }
    646. 

  646.      }
    647. 

  647.  }).as(exports, "AlterTableGenerator");
    648. 

  648.  
    649. 

  649.  
    650. 

  650.
index.js
Coverage71.74 SLOC1081 LOC92 Missed26 
  1.  /**
    2. 

  2.   * @projectName patio
    3. 

  3.   * @github https://github.com/C2FO/patio
    4. 

  4.   * @includeDoc [Connecting] ../docs-md/connecting.md
    5. 

  5.   * @includeDoc [Models] ../docs-md/models.md
    6. 

  6.   * @includeDoc [Associations] ../docs-md/associations.md
    7. 

  7.   * @includeDoc [Model Inheritance] ../docs-md/model-inheritance.md
    8. 

  8.   * @includeDoc [Model Validation] ../docs-md/validation.md
    9. 

  9.   * @includeDoc [Model Plugins] ../docs-md/plugins.md
    10. 

  10.   * @includeDoc [Querying] ../docs-md/querying.md
    11. 

  11.   * @includeDoc [DDL] ../docs-md/DDL.md
    12. 

  12.   * @includeDoc [Migrations] ../docs-md/migrations.md
    13. 

  13.   * @includeDoc [Logging] ../docs-md/logging.md
    14. 

  14.   * @includeDoc [Change Log] ../History.md
    15. 

  15.   * @includeDoc [Test Coverage] [../docs-md/coverage.html]
    16. 

  16.   *
    17. 

  17.   * @header
    18. 

  18.   * [![Build Status](https://secure.travis-ci.org/C2FO/patio.png)](http://travis-ci.org/C2FO/patio)
    19. 

  19.   *
    20. 

  20.   * Patio is a <a href="http://sequel.rubyforge.org/" target="patioapi">Sequel</a> inspired query engine.
    21. 

  21.   *
    22. 

  22.   * <h3>Why Use Patio?</h3>
    23. 

  23.   *
    24. 

  24.   * <p>
    25. 

  25.   * Patio is different because it allows the developers to choose the level of abtraction they are comfortable with.
    26. 

  26.   * </p>
    27. 

  27.   * <p>
    28. 

  28.   * If you want to use <a href="./models.html">ORM</a> functionality you can. If you dont you can just use the
    29. 

  29.   * <a href="./DDL.html">Database</a> and <a href="./querying.html">Datasets</a> as a querying API, and if you need to
    30. 

  30.   * you can <a href="./patio_Database.html#run">write plain SQL</a>.
    31. 

  31.   * </p>
    32. 

  32.   *
    33. 

  33.   *
    34. 

  34.   * ###Getting Started
    35. 

  35.   *
    36. 

  36.   * To install patio run
    37. 

  37.   *
    38. 

  38.   * `npm install comb patio`
    39. 

  39.   *
    40. 

  40.   * If you want to use the patio executable for migrations
    41. 

  41.   *
    42. 

  42.   * `npm install -g patio`
    43. 

  43.   *
    44. 

  44.   *
    45. 

  45.   * Create some tables.
    46. 

  46.   *
    47. 

  47.   * ```
    48. 

  48.   * var patio = require("patio"),
    49. 

  49.   * comb = require("comb"),
    50. 

  50.   * when = comb.when,
    51. 

  51.   * serial = comb.serial;
    52. 

  52.   *
    53. 

  53.   *
    54. 

  54.   * //set all db name to camelize
    55. 

  55.   * patio.camelize = true;
    56. 

  56.   * patio.configureLogging();
    57. 

  57.   * //connect to the db
    58. 

  58.   * var DB = patio.connect(<CONNECTION_URI>);
    59. 

  59.   *
    60. 

  60.   * function errorHandler(error) {
    61. 

  61.   *      console.log(error);
    62. 

  62.   *      patio.disconnect();
    63. 

  63.   * };
    64. 

  64.   *
    65. 

  65.   * function createTables() {
    66. 

  66.   *      return comb.serial([
    67. 

  67.   *           function () {
    68. 

  68.   *                return DB.forceDropTable(["capital", "state"]);
    69. 

  69.   *           },
    70. 

  70.   *           function () {
    71. 

  71.   *                return DB.createTable("state", function () {
    72. 

  72.   *                     this.primaryKey("id");
    73. 

  73.   *                     this.name(String)
    74. 

  74.   *                     this.population("integer");
    75. 

  75.   *                     this.founded(Date);
    76. 

  76.   *                     this.climate(String);
    77. 

  77.   *                     this.description("text");
    78. 

  78.   *                });
    79. 

  79.   *           },
    80. 

  80.   *           function () {
    81. 

  81.   *                return DB.createTable("capital", function () {
    82. 

  82.   *                     this.primaryKey("id");
    83. 

  83.   *                     this.population("integer");
    84. 

  84.   *                     this.name(String);
    85. 

  85.   *                     this.founded(Date);
    86. 

  86.   *                     this.foreignKey("stateId", "state", {key:"id"});
    87. 

  87.   *                });
    88. 

  88.   *           }
    89. 

  89.   *      ]);
    90. 

  90.   * };
    91. 

  91.   *
    92. 

  92.   * createTables().then(function () {
    93. 

  93.   *      patio.disconnect();
    94. 

  94.   * }, errorHandler);
    95. 

  95.   * ```
    96. 

  96.   *
    97. 

  97.   * Next lets create some models for the tables created.
    98. 

  98.   *
    99. 

  99.   * ```
    100. 

  100.   * var State = patio.addModel("state").oneToOne("capital");
    101. 

  101.   * var Capital = patio.addModel("capital").manyToOne("state");
    102. 

  102.   * ```
    103. 

  103.   *
    104. 

  104.   * Next you'll need to sync your models. **Note**: The sync operation returns a promise.
    105. 

  105.   *
    106. 

  106.   * ```
    107. 

  107.   * patio.syncModels();
    108. 

  108.   * ```
    109. 

  109.   *
    110. 

  110.   * Save some data to query.
    111. 

  111.   *
    112. 

  112.   * ```
    113. 

  113.   * //comb.when waits for the save operation to complete
    114. 

  114.   * return comb.when(
    115. 

  115.   *      State.save({
    116. 

  116.   *           name:"Nebraska",
    117. 

  117.   *           population:1796619,
    118. 

  118.   *           founded:new Date(1867, 2, 4),
    119. 

  119.   *           climate:"continental",
    120. 

  120.   *           capital:{
    121. 

  121.   *                name:"Lincoln",
    122. 

  122.   *                founded:new Date(1856, 0, 1),
    123. 

  123.   *                population:258379
    124. 

  124.   *          }
    125. 

  125.   *      }),
    126. 

  126.   *      Capital.save({
    127. 

  127.   *           name:"Austin",
    128. 

  128.   *           founded:new Date(1835, 0, 1),
    129. 

  129.   *           population:790390,
    130. 

  130.   *           state:{
    131. 

  131.   *                name:"Texas",
    132. 

  132.   *                population:25674681,
    133. 

  133.   *                founded:new Date(1845, 11, 29)
    134. 

  134.   *           }
    135. 

  135.   *      })
    136. 

  136.   * );
    137. 

  137.   * ```
    138. 

  138.   *
    139. 

  139.   * Now we can query the states and capitals we created.
    140. 

  140.   *
    141. 

  141.   * ```
    142. 

  142.   * State.order("name").forEach(function (state) {
    143. 

  143.   *      //if you return a promise here it will prevent the foreach from
    144. 

  144.   *      //resolving until all inner processing has finished.
    145. 

  145.   *      return state.capital.then(function (capital) {
    146. 

  146.   *          console.log("%s's capital is %s.", state.name, capital.name);
    147. 

  147.   *      });
    148. 

  148.   * });
    149. 

  149.   * ```
    150. 

  150.   *
    151. 

  151.   * ```
    152. 

  152.   * Capital.order("name").forEach(function (capital) {
    153. 

  153.   *      //if you return a promise here it will prevent the foreach from
    154. 

  154.   *      //resolving until all inner processing has finished.
    155. 

  155.   *      return capital.state.then(function (state) {
    156. 

  156.   *          console.log(comb.string.format("%s is the capital of %s.", capital.name, state.name));
    157. 

  157.   *      });
    158. 

  158.   * });
    159. 

  159.   * ```
    160. 

  160.   */
    161. 

  161.  
    162. 

  162.  
    163. 

  163.  
    164. 

  164.  
    165. 

  165.  
    166. 

  166.  
    167. 

  167. 1var Dataset = require("./dataset"),
    168. 

  168.      Database = require("./database"),
    169. 

  169.      adapters = require("./adapters"),
    170. 

  170.      EventEmitter = require("events").EventEmitter,
    171. 

  171.      PatioError = require("./errors").PatioError,
    172. 

  172.      migrate = require("./migration"),
    173. 

  173.      model = require("./model"),
    174. 

  174.      Model = model.Model,
    175. 

  175.      plugins = require("./plugins"),
    176. 

  176.      comb = require("comb-proxy"),
    177. 

  177.      Time = require("./time"),
    178. 

  178.      date = comb.date,
    179. 

  179.      SQL = require("./sql").sql,
    180. 

  180.      hitch = comb.hitch,
    181. 

  181.      Promise = comb.Promise,
    182. 

  182.      PromiseList = comb.PromiseList,
    183. 

  183.      singleton = comb.singleton,
    184. 

  184.      isFunction = comb.isFunction,
    185. 

  185.      executeInOrder = comb.executeInOrder,
    186. 

  186.      argsToArray = comb.argsToArray,
    187. 

  187.      isString = comb.isString;
    188. 

  188.  
    189. 

  189. 1var LOGGER = comb.logger("patio");
    190. 

  190.  
    191. 

  191. 1var Patio = singleton([EventEmitter, Time], {
    192. 

  192.      instance:{
    193. 

  193.          /**
    194. 

  194.           * @lends patio.prototype
    195. 

  195.           */
    196. 

  196.  
    197. 

  197.          __camelize:false,
    198. 

  198.  
    199. 

  199.          __underscore:false,
    200. 

  200.  
    201. 

  201.          __inImportOfModels:false,
    202. 

  202.  
    203. 

  203.  
    204. 

  204.          /**
    205. 

  205.           * A singleton class that acts as the entry point for all actions performed in patio.
    206. 

  206.           *
    207. 

  207.           * @example
    208. 

  208.           *
    209. 

  209.           * var patio = require("patio");
    210. 

  210.           *
    211. 

  211.           * patio.createConnection(....);
    212. 

  212.           *
    213. 

  213.           * patio.camelize = true;
    214. 

  214.           * patio.quoteIdentifiers=false;
    215. 

  215.           *
    216. 

  216.           * patio.createModel("my_table");
    217. 

  217.           *
    218. 

  218.           *
    219. 

  219.           *  //CHANGING IDENTIFIER INPUT METHOD
    220. 

  220.           *
    221. 

  221.           *
    222. 

  222.           *  //use whatever is passed in
    223. 

  223.           *   patio.identifierInputMethod = null;
    224. 

  224.           *  //convert to uppercase
    225. 

  225.           *  patio.identifierInputMethod = "toUpperCase";
    226. 

  226.           *  //convert to camelCase
    227. 

  227.           *  patio.identifierInputMethod = "camelize";
    228. 

  228.           *  //convert to underscore
    229. 

  229.           *  patio.identifierInputMethod = "underscore";
    230. 

  230.           *
    231. 

  231.           *
    232. 

  232.           *  //CHANGING IDENTIFIER OUTPUT METHOD
    233. 

  233.           *
    234. 

  234.           *  //use whatever the db returns
    235. 

  235.           *   patio.identifierOutputMethod = null;
    236. 

  236.           *  //convert to uppercase
    237. 

  237.           *  patio.identifierOutputMethod = "toUpperCase";
    238. 

  238.           *  //convert to camelCase
    239. 

  239.           *  patio.identifierOutputMethod = "camelize";
    240. 

  240.           *  //convert to underscore
    241. 

  241.           *  patio.identifierOutputMethod = "underscore";
    242. 

  242.           *
    243. 

  243.           *  //TURN QUOTING OFF
    244. 

  244.           *   patio.quoteIdentifiers = false
    245. 

  245.           *
    246. 

  246.           * @constructs
    247. 

  247.           * @augments patio.Time
    248. 

  248.           * @param options
    249. 

  249.           */
    250. 

  250.          constructor:function () {
    251. 

  251. 1            this._super(arguments);
    252. 

  252. 1            var constants = SQL.Constants;
    253. 

  253. 1            for (var i in constants) {
    254. 

  254. 9                this[i] = constants[i];
    255. 

  255.              }
    256. 

  256.          },
    257. 

  257.  
    258. 

  258.          /**
    259. 

  259.           * Returns a {@link patio.Database} object that can be used to for querying.
    260. 

  260.           *
    261. 

  261.           * <p>This method is the entry point for all interactions with a database including getting
    262. 

  262.           * {@link patio.Dataset}s for creating queries(see {@link patio.Database#from}).
    263. 

  263.           * </p>
    264. 

  264.           *
    265. 

  265.           * <p>The {@link patio.Database} returned can also be used to create({@link patio.Database#createTable}),
    266. 

  266.           * alter(@link patio.Database#alterTable}), rename({@link patio.Database#renameTable}), and
    267. 

  267.           * drop({@link patio.Database#dropTable}) as well as many other {@link patio.Database} actions.
    268. 

  268.           * </p>
    269. 

  269.           *
    270. 

  270.           * @example
    271. 

  271.           *
    272. 

  272.           * //connect using an object
    273. 

  273.           * var DB = patio.createConnection({
    274. 

  274.           *              host : "127.0.0.1",
    275. 

  275.           *              port : 3306,
    276. 

  276.           *              type : "mysql",
    277. 

  277.           *              maxConnections : 1,
    278. 

  278.           *              minConnections : 1,
    279. 

  279.           *              user : "test",
    280. 

  280.           *              password : "testpass",
    281. 

  281.           *              database : 'test'
    282. 

  282.           * });
    283. 

  283.           * //connect using a connection string
    284. 

  284.           * var CONNECT_STRING = "mysql://test:testpass@localhost:3306/test?maxConnections=1&minConnections=1";
    285. 

  285.           * var DB = patio.createConnection(CONNECT_STRING);
    286. 

  286.           *
    287. 

  287.           * //...do something
    288. 

  288.           * DB.createTable("myTable", function(){
    289. 

  289.           *    this.name("text");
    290. 

  290.           *    this.value("integer");
    291. 

  291.           * }).then(function(){
    292. 

  292.           *     //tables created!!!
    293. 

  293.           * });
    294. 

  294.           *
    295. 

  295.           * @param {String|Object} options the options used to initialize the database connection.
    296. 

  296.           *                        This may be a database connetion string or object.
    297. 

  297.           * @param {Number} [options.maxConnections = 10] the number of connections to pool.
    298. 

  298.           * @param {Number} [options.minConnections = 3] the number of connections to pool.
    299. 

  299.           * @param {String} [options.type = "mysql"] the type of database to communicate with.
    300. 

  300.           * @param {String} options.user the user to authenticate as.
    301. 

  301.           * @param {String} options.password the password of the user.
    302. 

  302.           * @param {String} options.database the name of the database to use, the database
    303. 

  303.           *                                   specified here is the default database for all connections.
    304. 

  304.           */
    305. 

  305.          createConnection:function (options) {
    306. 

  306. 41            var ret = Database.connect(options);
    307. 

  307. 41            this.emit("connect", ret);
    308. 

  308. 41            return ret;
    309. 

  309.          },
    310. 

  310.  
    311. 

  311.          /**
    312. 

  312.           *  @see patio#createConnection
    313. 

  313.           */
    314. 

  314.          connect:function () {
    315. 

  315. 13            return this.createConnection.apply(this, arguments);
    316. 

  316.          },
    317. 

  317.  
    318. 

  318.          /**
    319. 

  319.           * This method allows one to connect to a database and immediately execute code.
    320. 

  320.           * For connection options @see patio#createConnection
    321. 

  321.           *
    322. 

  322.           * @example
    323. 

  323.           *
    324. 

  324.           *
    325. 

  325.           * var DB;
    326. 

  326.           * var CONNECT_STRING = "dummyDB://test:testpass@localhost/dummySchema";
    327. 

  327.           * var connectPromise = patio.connectAndExecute(CONNECT_STRING, function (db) {
    328. 

  328.           *      db.dropTable("test");
    329. 

  329.           *      db.createTable("test", function () {
    330. 

  330.           *          this.primaryKey("id");
    331. 

  331.           *          this.name(String);
    332. 

  332.           *          this.age(Number);
    333. 

  333.           *      });
    334. 

  334.           * });
    335. 

  335.           *
    336. 

  336.           * connectPromise.then(function (db) {
    337. 

  337.           *      DB = db;
    338. 

  338.           *      //do more stuff!
    339. 

  339.           *  });
    340. 

  340.           *
    341. 

  341.           * @param {String|Object} options @see patio#createConnection
    342. 

  342.           * @param {Function} cb the function to callback once connected.
    343. 

  343.           *
    344. 

  344.           * @returns {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved once the database execution has finished.
    345. 

  345.           */
    346. 

  346.          connectAndExecute:function (options, cb) {
    347. 

  347. 27            if (!isFunction(cb)) {
    348. 

  348. 0                throw new PatioError("callback must be a function");
    349. 

  349.              }
    350. 

  350. 27            var db = this.createConnection.apply(this, arguments);
    351. 

  351. 27            return executeInOrder(db, patio, function (db, patio) {
    352. 

  352. 27                cb(db, patio);
    353. 

  353. 27                return db;
    354. 

  354.              });
    355. 

  355.          },
    356. 

  356.  
    357. 

  357.          /**
    358. 

  358.           * Disconnects all databases in use.
    359. 

  359.           *
    360. 

  360.           * @param {Function} [cb=null] a callback to call when disconnect has completed
    361. 

  361.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved once all databases have disconnected.
    362. 

  362.           */
    363. 

  363.          disconnect:function (cb) {
    364. 

  364. 41            var ret = Database.disconnect(cb);
    365. 

  365. 41            ret.classic(hitch(this, function (err) {
    366. 

  366. 41                if (err) {
    367. 

  367. 0                    this.emit("error", err);
    368. 

  368.                  } else {
    369. 

  369. 41                    this.emit("disconnect");
    370. 

  370.                  }
    371. 

  371.              }));
    372. 

  372. 41            return ret.promise();
    373. 

  373.          },
    374. 

  374.  
    375. 

  375.          /**
    376. 

  376.           * Allows for the importing of multiple models so you do not have to worry about the promise that is returned from create model,
    377. 

  377.           * or a directory if an index.js file is used.
    378. 

  378.           *
    379. 

  379.           * <p>
    380. 

  380.           *     To import a group of model files you can do the following:
    381. 

  381.           * {@code
    382. 

  382.           * patio.import(__dirname + "/models/Flight.js",
    383. 

  383.           *              __dirname + "/models/Airport.js",
    384. 

  384.           *              __dirname + "/models/Airplane.js").then(function(Flight, Airport, Airplane){
    385. 

  385.           *                  //...
    386. 

  386.           *              });
    387. 

  387.           *
    388. 

  388.           * patio.import(__dirname + "/models/Flight.js",
    389. 

  389.           *              __dirname + "/models/Airport.js",
    390. 

  390.           *              __dirname + "/models/Airplane.js").then(function(){
    391. 

  391.           *                  var Flight = patio.getModel("flight"),
    392. 

  392.           *                      Airport = patio.getModel("airport"),
    393. 

  393.           *                      Airplane = patio.getModel("airplane");
    394. 

  394.           *              });
    395. 

  395.           *      </pre>
    396. 

  396.           *     Another approach is to create an index.js file inside of a directory that requires all of the models needed.
    397. 

  397.           *     then use {@link patio#import} on that file.
    398. 

  398.           *     <pre class="code">
    399. 

  399.           * patio.import(__dirname + "/models").then(function(){
    400. 

  400.           *      var Flight = patio.getModel("flight"),
    401. 

  401.           *          Airport = patio.getModel("airport"),
    402. 

  402.           *          Airplane = patio.getModel("airplane");
    403. 

  403.           * });
    404. 

  404.           * }
    405. 

  405.           * </p>
    406. 

  406.           *
    407. 

  407.           * @param files a single or list of files to import.
    408. 

  408.           * @param {Function} [cb] an optional callback to call when importing is complete
    409. 

  409.           *
    410. 

  410.           * @return {Promise} returns a promise that will be resolved when all models in the imported files
    411. 

  411.           * have been loaded.
    412. 

  412.           */
    413. 

  413.          "import":function (files, cb) {
    414. 

  414. 0            files = argsToArray(arguments);
    415. 

  415. 0            if (isFunction(files[files.length])) {
    416. 

  416. 0                cb = files.pop();
    417. 

  417.              } else {
    418. 

  418. 0                cb = null;
    419. 

  419.              }
    420. 

  420. 0            files.map(function (file) {
    421. 

  421. 0                require(file);
    422. 

  422.              });
    423. 

  423. 0            return model.syncModels(cb).promise();
    424. 

  424.          },
    425. 

  425.  
    426. 

  426.          /**
    427. 

  427.           * This method is used to create a {@link patio.Model} object.
    428. 

  428.           *
    429. 

  429.           * @example
    430. 

  430.           * var Flight = patio.addModel("flight", {
    431. 

  431.           *      instance:{
    432. 

  432.           *              toObject:function () {
    433. 

  433.           *                  var obj = this._super(arguments);
    434. 

  434.           *                  obj.weekdays = this.weekdaysArray;
    435. 

  435.           *                  obj.legs = this.legs.map(function (l) {
    436. 

  436.           *                      return l.toObject();
    437. 

  437.           *                  });
    438. 

  438.           *                  return obj;
    439. 

  439.           *              },
    440. 

  440.           *
    441. 

  441.           *              _setWeekdays:function (weekdays) {
    442. 

  442.           *                  this.weekdaysArray = weekdays.split(",");
    443. 

  443.           *                  return weekdays;
    444. 

  444.           *              }
    445. 

  445.           *      },
    446. 

  446.           *
    447. 

  447.           *      static:{
    448. 

  448.           *
    449. 

  449.           *          init:function () {
    450. 

  450.           *              this.oneToMany("legs", {
    451. 

  451.           *                  model:"flightLeg",
    452. 

  452.           *                  orderBy:"scheduledDepartureTime",
    453. 

  453.           *                  fetchType:this.fetchType.EAGER
    454. 

  454.           *              });
    455. 

  455.           *          },
    456. 

  456.           *
    457. 

  457.           *          byAirline:function (airline) {
    458. 

  458.           *              return this.filter({airline:airline}).all();
    459. 

  459.           *          },
    460. 

  460.           *
    461. 

  461.           *          arrivesAt:function (airportCode) {
    462. 

  462.           *              return this.join(this.flightLeg.select("flightId").filter({arrivalCode:airportCode}).distinct(), {flightId:"id"}).all();
    463. 

  463.           *          },
    464. 

  464.           *
    465. 

  465.           *          departsFrom:function (airportCode) {
    466. 

  466.           *              return this.join(this.flightLeg.select("flightId").filter({departureCode:airportCode}).distinct(), {flightId:"id"}).all();
    467. 

  467.           *          },
    468. 

  468.           *
    469. 

  469.           *          getters:{
    470. 

  470.           *              flightLeg:function () {
    471. 

  471.           *                  if (!this.__flightLeg) {
    472. 

  472.           *                      this.__flightLeg = this.patio.getModel("flightLeg");
    473. 

  473.           *                  }
    474. 

  474.           *                  return this.__flightLeg;
    475. 

  475.           *              }
    476. 

  476.           *          }
    477. 

  477.           *      }
    478. 

  478.           *  });
    479. 

  479.           *
    480. 

  480.           *
    481. 

  481.           * @param {String|patio.Dataset} table the table to use as the base for the model.
    482. 

  482.           * @param {patio.Model|patio.Model[]} Parent models of this model.
    483. 

  483.           *                  See {@link patio.plugins.ClassTableInheritancePlugin}.
    484. 

  484.           * @param {Object} [proto] an object to be used as the prototype for the model. See
    485. 

  485.           * <a href="http://c2fo.github.com/comb/symbols/comb.html#.define">comb.define</a>.
    486. 

  486.           * @param [Object[]] [proto.plugins] this can be used to specify additional plugins to use such as.
    487. 

  487.           * <ul>
    488. 

  488.           *     <li>{@link patio.plugins.TimeStampPlugin</li>
    489. 

  489.           *     <li>{@link patio.plugins.CachePlugin</li>
    490. 

  490.           * </ul>
    491. 

  491.           *
    492. 

  492.           *
    493. 

  493.           *
    494. 

  494.           */
    495. 

  495.          addModel:function (table, supers, proto) {
    496. 

  496. 93            return model.create.apply(model, arguments);
    497. 

  497.          },
    498. 

  498.  
    499. 

  499.          /**
    500. 

  500.           * Returns a model from the name of the table for which the model was created.
    501. 

  501.           *
    502. 

  502.           * {@code
    503. 

  503.           * var TestModel = patio.addModel("test_model").sync(function(err){
    504. 

  504.           *      if(err){
    505. 

  505.           *         console.log(err.stack);
    506. 

  506.           *      }else{
    507. 

  507.           *            var TestModel = patio.getModel("test_model");
    508. 

  508.           *      }
    509. 

  509.           * });
    510. 

  510.           * }
    511. 

  511.           *
    512. 

  512.           * If you have two tables with the same name in different databases then you can use the db parameter also.
    513. 

  513.           *
    514. 

  514.           * {@code
    515. 

  515.           *
    516. 

  516.           * var DB1 = patio.createConnection("mysql://test:testpass@localhost:3306/test_1");
    517. 

  517.           * var DB2 = patio.createConnection("mysql://test:testpass@localhost:3306/test_2");
    518. 

  518.           * var Test1 = patio.addModel(DB1.from("test");
    519. 

  519.           * var Test2 = patio.addModel(DB2.from("test");
    520. 

  520.           *
    521. 

  521.           * //sync the models
    522. 

  522.           * patio.syncModels().then(function(){
    523. 

  523.           *      //now you can use them
    524. 

  524.           *      var test1Model = new Test1();
    525. 

  525.           *      var test2Model = new Test2();
    526. 

  526.           * });
    527. 

  527.           * }
    528. 

  528.           *
    529. 

  529.           *
    530. 

  530.           * @param {String} name the name of the table that the model represents.
    531. 

  531.           * @param {@patio.Database} [db] optional database in case you have two models with the same table names in
    532. 

  532.           *                               different databases.
    533. 

  533.           */
    534. 

  534.          getModel:function (name, db) {
    535. 

  535. 83            return model.getModel(name, db);
    536. 

  536.          },
    537. 

  537.  
    538. 

  538.          /**
    539. 

  539.           * Helper method to sync all models at once.
    540. 

  540.           *
    541. 

  541.           * @example
    542. 

  542.           *
    543. 

  543.           * var User = patio.addModel("user");
    544. 

  544.           * var Blog = patio.addModel("blog");
    545. 

  545.           *
    546. 

  546.           * //using promise api
    547. 

  547.           * patio.syncModels().then(function(){
    548. 

  548.           *     var user = new User();
    549. 

  549.           * }, function(error){
    550. 

  550.           *    console.log(err);
    551. 

  551.           * });
    552. 

  552.           *
    553. 

  553.           * //using a callback
    554. 

  554.           *
    555. 

  555.           *  patio.syncModels(function(err){
    556. 

  556.           *      if(err){
    557. 

  557.           *          console.log(err);
    558. 

  558.           *      }else{
    559. 

  559.           *          var user = new User();
    560. 

  560.           *      }
    561. 

  561.           *  });
    562. 

  562.           *
    563. 

  563.           * @param {Function} [cb] an optional callback to be invoked when all models have been synced
    564. 

  564.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that will be resolved when the models have been synced.
    565. 

  565.           */
    566. 

  566.          syncModels:function (cb) {
    567. 

  567. 35            return model.syncModels(cb);
    568. 

  568.          },
    569. 

  569.  
    570. 

  570.          resetIdentifierMethods:function () {
    571. 

  571. 51            this.quoteIdentifiers = true;
    572. 

  572. 51            this.identifierOutputMethod = null;
    573. 

  573. 51            this.identifierInputMethod = null;
    574. 

  574. 51            Model.identifierOutputMethod = null;
    575. 

  575. 51            Model.identifierInputMethod = null;
    576. 

  576.          },
    577. 

  577.  
    578. 

  578.  
    579. 

  579.          /**
    580. 

  580.           * Migrates the database using migration files found in the supplied directory.
    581. 

  581.           * <br/>
    582. 

  582.           * <br/>
    583. 

  583.           * <div>
    584. 

  584.           *     <h3>Integer Migrations</h3>
    585. 

  585.           *      Integer migrations are the simpler of the two migrations but are less flexible than timestamp based migrations.
    586. 

  586.           *      In order for patio to determine which versions to use the file names must end in <versionNumber>.js where
    587. 

  587.           *      versionNumber is a integer value representing the version number. <b>NOTE:</b>With integer migrations
    588. 

  588.           *      missing versions are not allowed.
    589. 

  589.           *      <br/>
    590. 

  590.           *      <br/>
    591. 

  591.           *      An example directory structure might look like the following:
    592. 

  592.           *
    593. 

  593.           *      <pre class="code">
    594. 

  594.           * -migrations
    595. 

  595.           *      - createFirstTables.0.js
    596. 

  596.           *      - shortDescription.1.js
    597. 

  597.           *      - another.2.js
    598. 

  598.           *      .
    599. 

  599.           *      .
    600. 

  600.           *      .
    601. 

  601.           *      -lastMigration.n.js
    602. 

  602.           *      </pre>
    603. 

  603.           *      In order to easily identify where certain schema alterations have taken place it is a good idea to provide a brief
    604. 

  604.           *      but meaningful migration name.
    605. 

  605.           *      <pre class="code">
    606. 

  606.           *          createEmployee.0.js
    607. 

  607.           *          alterEmployeeNameColumn.1.js
    608. 

  608.           *      </pre>
    609. 

  609.           *</div>
    610. 

  610.           *
    611. 

  611.           * <div>
    612. 

  612.           *     <h3>Timestamp Migrations</h3>
    613. 

  613.           *      Timestamp migrations are the more complex of the two migrations but offer greater flexibility especially
    614. 

  614.           *      with development teams. This is because Timestamp migrations do not require consecutive version numbers,
    615. 

  615.           *      ,allow for duplicate version numbers(but this should be avoided), keeps track of all currently applied migrations,
    616. 

  616.           *      and it will merge missing migrations. In order for patio to determine the order of the migration files
    617. 

  617.           *      the file names must end in <timestamp>.js where the timestamp can be any form of a time stamp.
    618. 

  618.           *      <pre class="code">
    619. 

  619.           * //yyyyMMdd
    620. 

  620.           * 20110131
    621. 

  621.           * //yyyyMMddHHmmss
    622. 

  622.           * 20110131123940
    623. 

  623.           * //unix epoch timestamp
    624. 

  624.           * 1328035161
    625. 

  625.           *      </pre>
    626. 

  626.           *      as long as it is greater than 20000101 other wise it will be assumed to be part of an integer migration.
    627. 

  627.           *      <br/>
    628. 

  628.           *      <br/>
    629. 

  629.           *      An example directory structure might look like the following:
    630. 

  630.           *
    631. 

  631.           *      <pre class="code">
    632. 

  632.           * -migrations
    633. 

  633.           *      - createFirstTables.1328035161.js
    634. 

  634.           *      - shortDescription.1328035360.js
    635. 

  635.           *      - another.1328035376.js
    636. 

  636.           *      .
    637. 

  637.           *      .
    638. 

  638.           *      .
    639. 

  639.           *      -lastMigration.n.js
    640. 

  640.           *      </pre>
    641. 

  641.           *      In order to easily identify where certain schema alterations have taken place it is a good idea to provide a brief
    642. 

  642.           *      but meaningful migration name.
    643. 

  643.           *      <pre class="code">
    644. 

  644.           *          createEmployee.1328035161.js
    645. 

  645.           *          alterEmployeeNameColumn.1328035360.js
    646. 

  646.           *      </pre>
    647. 

  647.           *</div>
    648. 

  648.           *
    649. 

  649.           * <b>NOTE:</b>If you start with IntegerBased migrations and decide to transition to Timestamp migrations the
    650. 

  650.           * patio will attempt the migrate the current schema to the timestamp based migration schema.
    651. 

  651.           *
    652. 

  652.           * <div>
    653. 

  653.           * In order to run a migraton all one has to do is call patio.migrate(DB, directory, options);
    654. 

  654.           *
    655. 

  655.           * <pre class="code">
    656. 

  656.           *  var DB = patio.connect("my://connection/string");
    657. 

  657.           *  patio.migrate(DB, __dirname + "/migrations").then(function(){
    658. 

  658.           *      console.log("migrations finished");
    659. 

  659.           *  });
    660. 

  660.           * </pre>
    661. 

  661.           *
    662. 

  662.           * <b>Example migration file</b>
    663. 

  663.           * <pre class="code">
    664. 

  664.           *
    665. 

  665.           * //Up function used to migrate up a version
    666. 

  666.           * exports.up = function(db) {
    667. 

  667.           *   //create a new table
    668. 

  668.           *   db.createTable("company", function() {
    669. 

  669.           *       this.primaryKey("id");
    670. 

  670.           *       this.companyName(String, {size : 20, allowNull : false});
    671. 

  671.           *   });
    672. 

  672.           *   db.createTable("employee", function(table) {
    673. 

  673.           *       this.primaryKey("id");
    674. 

  674.           *       this.firstName(String);
    675. 

  675.           *       this.lastName(String);
    676. 

  676.           *       this.middleInitial("char", {size : 1});
    677. 

  677.           *   });
    678. 

  678.           *};
    679. 

  679.           *
    680. 

  680.           * //Down function used to migrate down version
    681. 

  681.           *exports.down = function(db) {
    682. 

  682.           *    db.dropTable("employee", "company");
    683. 

  683.           *};
    684. 

  684.           * </pre>
    685. 

  685.           *
    686. 

  686.           *</div>
    687. 

  687.           *
    688. 

  688.           * @param {String|patio.Database} db the database or connection string to a database to migrate.
    689. 

  689.           * @param {String} directory directory that the migration files reside in
    690. 

  690.           * @param {Object} [opts={}] optional parameters.
    691. 

  691.           * @param {String} [opts.column] the column in the table that version information should be stored.
    692. 

  692.           * @param {String} [opts.table] the table that version information should be stored.
    693. 

  693.           * @param {Number} [opts.target] the target migration(i.e the migration to migrate up/down to).
    694. 

  694.           * @param {String} [opts.current] the version that the database is currently at if the current version
    695. 

  695.           * is not provided it is retrieved from the database.
    696. 

  696.           *
    697. 

  697.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the migration is complete.
    698. 

  698.           */
    699. 

  699.          migrate:function (db) {
    700. 

  700. 31            db = isString(db) ? this.connect(db) : db;
    701. 

  701. 31            var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    702. 

  702. 31            args.splice(0, 1);
    703. 

  703. 31            return migrate.run.apply(migrate, [db].concat(args));
    704. 

  704.          },
    705. 

  705.  
    706. 

  706.          /**
    707. 

  707.           * This can be used to configure logging. If a options
    708. 

  708.           * hash is passed in then it will passed to the comb.logging.PropertyConfigurator.
    709. 

  709.           * If the options are omitted then a ConsoleAppender will be added and the level will
    710. 

  710.           * be set to info.
    711. 

  711.           *
    712. 

  712.           * @example
    713. 

  713.           * var config = {
    714. 

  714.           *     "patio" : {
    715. 

  715.           *         level : "INFO",
    716. 

  716.           *         appenders : [
    717. 

  717.           *             {
    718. 

  718.           *                 type : "RollingFileAppender",
    719. 

  719.           *                 file : "/var/log/patio.log",
    720. 

  720.           *             },
    721. 

  721.           *             {
    722. 

  722.           *                 type : "RollingFileAppender",
    723. 

  723.           *                 file : "/var/log/patio-error.log",
    724. 

  724.           *                 name : "errorFileAppender",
    725. 

  725.           *                 level : "ERROR"
    726. 

  726.           *             }
    727. 

  727.           *         ]
    728. 

  728.           * };
    729. 

  729.           *
    730. 

  730.           * patio.configureLogging(config);
    731. 

  731.           *
    732. 

  732.           * @param opts
    733. 

  733.           */
    734. 

  734.          configureLogging:function (opts) {
    735. 

  735. 0            comb.logger.configure(opts);
    736. 

  736. 0            if (!opts) {
    737. 

  737. 0                LOGGER.level = "info";
    738. 

  738.              }
    739. 

  739.          },
    740. 

  740.  
    741. 

  741.          /**
    742. 

  742.           * Logs an INFO level message to the "patio" logger.
    743. 

  743.           */
    744. 

  744.          logInfo:function () {
    745. 

  745. 0            if (LOGGER.isInfo) {
    746. 

  746. 0                LOGGER.info.apply(LOGGER, arguments);
    747. 

  747.              }
    748. 

  748.          },
    749. 

  749.  
    750. 

  750.          /**
    751. 

  751.           * Logs a DEBUG level message to the "patio" logger.
    752. 

  752.           */
    753. 

  753.          logDebug:function () {
    754. 

  754. 0            if (LOGGER.isDebug) {
    755. 

  755. 0                LOGGER.debug.apply(LOGGER, arguments);
    756. 

  756.              }
    757. 

  757.          },
    758. 

  758.  
    759. 

  759.          /**
    760. 

  760.           * Logs an ERROR level message to the "patio" logger.
    761. 

  761.           */
    762. 

  762.          logError:function () {
    763. 

  763. 0            if (LOGGER.isError) {
    764. 

  764. 0                LOGGER.error.apply(LOGGER, arguments);
    765. 

  765.              }
    766. 

  766.          },
    767. 

  767.  
    768. 

  768.          /**
    769. 

  769.           * Logs a WARN level message to the "patio" logger.
    770. 

  770.           */
    771. 

  771.          logWarn:function () {
    772. 

  772. 0            if (LOGGER.isWarn) {
    773. 

  773. 0                LOGGER.warn.apply(LOGGER, arguments);
    774. 

  774.              }
    775. 

  775.          },
    776. 

  776.  
    777. 

  777.          /**
    778. 

  778.           * Logs a TRACE level message to the "patio" logger.
    779. 

  779.           */
    780. 

  780.          logTrace:function () {
    781. 

  781. 0            if (LOGGER.isTrace) {
    782. 

  782. 0                LOGGER.trace.apply(LOGGER, arguments);
    783. 

  783.              }
    784. 

  784.          },
    785. 

  785.  
    786. 

  786.          /**
    787. 

  787.           * Logs a FATAL level message to the "patio" logger.
    788. 

  788.           */
    789. 

  789.          logFatal:function () {
    790. 

  790. 0            if (LOGGER.isFatal) {
    791. 

  791. 0                LOGGER.fatal.apply(LOGGER, arguments);
    792. 

  792.              }
    793. 

  793.          },
    794. 

  794.  
    795. 

  795.  
    796. 

  796.          /**@ignore*/
    797. 

  797.          getters:{
    798. 

  798.              /**@lends patio.prototype*/
    799. 

  799.              /**
    800. 

  800.               * An array of databases that are currently connected.
    801. 

  801.               * @field
    802. 

  802.               * @type patio.Database[]
    803. 

  803.               * @default []
    804. 

  804.               */
    805. 

  805.              DATABASES:function () {
    806. 

  806. 733                return Database.DATABASES;
    807. 

  807.              },
    808. 

  808.              /**
    809. 

  809.               * Returns the default database. This is the first database created using {@link patio#connect}.
    810. 

  810.               * @field
    811. 

  811.               * @type patio.Database
    812. 

  812.               * @default null
    813. 

  813.               */
    814. 

  814.              defaultDatabase:function () {
    815. 

  815. 392                return this.DATABASES.length ? this.DATABASES[0] : null;
    816. 

  816.              },
    817. 

  817.              /**@ignore*/
    818. 

  818.              Database:function () {
    819. 

  819. 9                return Database;
    820. 

  820.              },
    821. 

  821.  
    822. 

  822.              /**@ignore*/
    823. 

  823.              Dataset:function () {
    824. 

  824. 57                return Dataset;
    825. 

  825.              },
    826. 

  826.  
    827. 

  827.              /**@ignore*/
    828. 

  828.              SQL:function () {
    829. 

  829. 25                return SQL;
    830. 

  830.              },
    831. 

  831.  
    832. 

  832.              /**@ignore*/
    833. 

  833.              sql:function () {
    834. 

  834. 8                return SQL;
    835. 

  835.              },
    836. 

  836.  
    837. 

  837.              /**@ignore*/
    838. 

  838.              plugins:function () {
    839. 

  839. 7                return plugins;
    840. 

  840.              },
    841. 

  841.  
    842. 

  842.              /**@ignore*/
    843. 

  843.              migrations:function () {
    844. 

  844. 0                return migrate;
    845. 

  845.              },
    846. 

  846.  
    847. 

  847.              /**
    848. 

  848.               * Returns the root comb logger using this logger you
    849. 

  849.               * can set the levels add appenders etc.
    850. 

  850.               *
    851. 

  851.               * @type Logger
    852. 

  852.               * @field
    853. 

  853.               * @default comb.logger("patio")
    854. 

  854.               */
    855. 

  855.              LOGGER:function () {
    856. 

  856. 0                return LOGGER;
    857. 

  857.              },
    858. 

  858.  
    859. 

  859.              /**
    860. 

  860.               * Returns the default method used to transform identifiers sent to the database.
    861. 

  861.               * See (@link patio.Database.identifierInputMethod}
    862. 

  862.               * @ignore
    863. 

  863.               * @field
    864. 

  864.               * @type String
    865. 

  865.               * @default Database.identifierInputMethod
    866. 

  866.               */
    867. 

  867.              identifierInputMethod:function () {
    868. 

  868. 3                return Database.identifierInputMethod;
    869. 

  869.              },
    870. 

  870.  
    871. 

  871.              /**
    872. 

  872.               * Returns the default method used to transform identifiers returned from the database.
    873. 

  873.               * See (@link patio.Database.identifierOutputMethod}
    874. 

  874.               * @ignore
    875. 

  875.               * @field
    876. 

  876.               * @type String
    877. 

  877.               *
    878. 

  878.               */
    879. 

  879.              identifierOutputMethod:function () {
    880. 

  880. 3                return Database.identifierOutputMethod;
    881. 

  881.              },
    882. 

  882.  
    883. 

  883.              /**
    884. 

  884.               * @ignore
    885. 

  885.               * @type Boolean
    886. 

  886.               * Returns whether or not identifiers are quoted before being sent to the database.
    887. 

  887.               */
    888. 

  888.              quoteIdentifiers:function (value) {
    889. 

  889. 1                return Database.quoteIdentifiers;
    890. 

  890.              },
    891. 

  891.  
    892. 

  892.              /**@ignore*/
    893. 

  893.              camelize:function () {
    894. 

  894. 1                return this.__camelize;
    895. 

  895.              },
    896. 

  896.  
    897. 

  897.              /**@ignore*/
    898. 

  898.              underscore:function () {
    899. 

  899. 1                return this.__underscore;
    900. 

  900.              }
    901. 

  901.  
    902. 

  902.          },
    903. 

  903.  
    904. 

  904.  
    905. 

  905.          /**@ignore*/
    906. 

  906.          setters:{
    907. 

  907.              /**@lends patio.prototype*/
    908. 

  908.              /**
    909. 

  909.               * Set the method to call on identifiers going into the database.  This affects
    910. 

  910.               * how identifiers are sent to the database. So if you use camelCased and the db identifiers are all underscored
    911. 

  911.               * use camelize. The method can include
    912. 

  912.               * <ul>
    913. 

  913.               *     <li>toUpperCase</li>
    914. 

  914.               *     <li>toLowerCase</li>
    915. 

  915.               *     <li>camelize</li>
    916. 

  916.               *     <li>underscore</li>
    917. 

  917.               *     <li>Other String instance method names.</li>
    918. 

  918.               * </ul>
    919. 

  919.               *
    920. 

  920.               * patio uses toUpperCase identifiers in all SQL strings for most databases.
    921. 

  921.               *
    922. 

  922.               * @field
    923. 

  923.               * @type String
    924. 

  924.               * @ignoreCode
    925. 

  925.               * @example
    926. 

  926.               *  //use whatever is passed in
    927. 

  927.               *   patio.identifierInputMethod = null;
    928. 

  928.               *  //convert to uppercase
    929. 

  929.               *  patio.identifierInputMethod = "toUpperCase";
    930. 

  930.               *  //convert to camelCase
    931. 

  931.               *  patio.identifierInputMethod = "camelize";
    932. 

  932.               *  //convert to underscore
    933. 

  933.               *  patio.identifierInputMethod = "underscore";
    934. 

  934.               *
    935. 

  935.               * */
    936. 

  936.              identifierInputMethod:function (value) {
    937. 

  937. 79                Database.identifierInputMethod = value;
    938. 

  938.              },
    939. 

  939.  
    940. 

  940.              /**
    941. 

  941.               * Set the method to call on identifiers coming out of the database.  This affects
    942. 

  942.               * the how identifiers are represented by calling the method on them.
    943. 

  943.               * The method can include
    944. 

  944.               * <ul>
    945. 

  945.               *     <li>toUpperCase</li>
    946. 

  946.               *     <li>toLowerCase</li>
    947. 

  947.               *     <li>camelize</li>
    948. 

  948.               *     <li>underscore</li>
    949. 

  949.               *     <li>Other String instance method names.</li>
    950. 

  950.               * </ul>
    951. 

  951.               * most database implementations in patio use toLowerCase
    952. 

  952.               * @ignoreCode
    953. 

  953.               * @field
    954. 

  954.               * @type String
    955. 

  955.               * @example
    956. 

  956.               *  //use whatever the db returns
    957. 

  957.               *   patio.identifierOutputMethod = null;
    958. 

  958.               *  //convert to uppercase
    959. 

  959.               *  patio.identifierOutputMethod = "toUpperCase";
    960. 

  960.               *  //convert to camelCase
    961. 

  961.               *  patio.identifierOutputMethod = "camelize";
    962. 

  962.               *  //convert to underscore
    963. 

  963.               *  patio.identifierOutputMethod = "underscore";
    964. 

  964.               *
    965. 

  965.               * */
    966. 

  966.              identifierOutputMethod:function (value) {
    967. 

  967. 79                Database.identifierOutputMethod = value;
    968. 

  968.              },
    969. 

  969.  
    970. 

  970.              /**
    971. 

  971.               * Set whether to quote identifiers for all databases by default. By default,
    972. 

  972.               * patio quotes identifiers in all SQL strings.
    973. 

  973.               *
    974. 

  974.               * @ignoreCode
    975. 

  975.               * @field
    976. 

  976.               * @type Boolean
    977. 

  977.               *
    978. 

  978.               * @example
    979. 

  979.               *   //Turn quoting off
    980. 

  980.               *   patio.quoteIdentifiers = false
    981. 

  981.               * */
    982. 

  982.              quoteIdentifiers:function (value) {
    983. 

  983. 81                Database.quoteIdentifiers = value;
    984. 

  984.              },
    985. 

  985.  
    986. 

  986.              /**
    987. 

  987.               * Sets the whether or not to camelize identifiers coming from the database and to underscore
    988. 

  988.               * identifiers when sending identifiers to the database. Setting this property to true has the same effect
    989. 

  989.               * as:
    990. 

  990.               * <pre class="code">
    991. 

  991.               *     patio.identifierOutputMethod = "camelize";
    992. 

  992.               *     patio.identifierInputMethod = "underscore";
    993. 

  993.               * </pre>
    994. 

  994.  
    995. 

  995.               * @field
    996. 

  996.               * @ignoreCode
    997. 

  997.               * @example
    998. 

  998.               * patio.camelize = true;
    999. 

  999.               * patio.connectAndExecute("mysql://test:testpass@localhost:3306/airports", function (db) {
    1000. 

  1000.               *      db.createTable("airport", function () {
    1001. 

  1001.               *          this.primaryKey("id");
    1002. 

  1002.               *          this.airportCode(String, {size:4, allowNull:false, unique:true});
    1003. 

  1003.               *          this.name(String, {allowNull:false});
    1004. 

  1004.               *          this.city(String, {allowNull:false});
    1005. 

  1005.               *          this.state(String, {size:2, allowNull:false});
    1006. 

  1006.               *      });
    1007. 

  1007.               *      //=> CREATE TABLE `airport`(
    1008. 

  1008.               *      //    id integer PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    1009. 

  1009.               *      //    airport_code varchar(4) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    1010. 

  1010.               *      //    name varchar(255) NOT NULL,
    1011. 

  1011.               *      //    city varchar(255) NOT NULL,
    1012. 

  1012.               *      //    state varchar(2) NOT NULL
    1013. 

  1013.               *      //);
    1014. 

  1014.               *  }):
    1015. 

  1015.               *
    1016. 

  1016.               * @param {Boolean} camelize set to true to camelize all identifiers coming from the database and to
    1017. 

  1017.               *                  underscore all identifiers sent to the database.
    1018. 

  1018.               */
    1019. 

  1019.              camelize:function (camelize) {
    1020. 

  1020. 21                camelize = camelize === true;
    1021. 

  1021. 21                Model.camelize = camelize;
    1022. 

  1022. 21                this.identifierOutputMethod = camelize ? "camelize" : "underscore";
    1023. 

  1023. 21                this.identifierInputMethod = camelize ? "underscore" : "camelize";
    1024. 

  1024. 21                this.__underscore = !camelize;
    1025. 

  1025. 21                this.__camelize = camelize;
    1026. 

  1026.              },
    1027. 

  1027.  
    1028. 

  1028.              /**
    1029. 

  1029.               * Sets the whether or not to underscore identifiers coming from the database and to camelize
    1030. 

  1030.               * identifiers when sending identifiers to the database. Setting this property to true has the same effect
    1031. 

  1031.               * as:
    1032. 

  1032.               * <pre class="code">
    1033. 

  1033.               *     patio.identifierOutputMethod = "underscore";
    1034. 

  1034.               *     patio.identifierInputMethod = "camelize";
    1035. 

  1035.               * </pre>
    1036. 

  1036.               *
    1037. 

  1037.               *
    1038. 

  1038.               * @field
    1039. 

  1039.               * @ignoreCode
    1040. 

  1040.               * @example
    1041. 

  1041.               * patio.camelize = true;
    1042. 

  1042.               * patio.connectAndExecute("mysql://test:testpass@localhost:3306/airports", function (db) {
    1043. 

  1043.               *      db.createTable("airport", function () {
    1044. 

  1044.               *          this.primaryKey("id");
    1045. 

  1045.               *          this.airport_code(String, {size:4, allowNull:false, unique:true});
    1046. 

  1046.               *          this.name(String, {allowNull:false});
    1047. 

  1047.               *          this.city(String, {allowNull:false});
    1048. 

  1048.               *          this.state(String, {size:2, allowNull:false});
    1049. 

  1049.               *      });
    1050. 

  1050.               *      //=> CREATE TABLE `airport`(
    1051. 

  1051.               *      //    id integer PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    1052. 

  1052.               *      //    airportCode varchar(4) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    1053. 

  1053.               *      //    name varchar(255) NOT NULL,
    1054. 

  1054.               *      //    city varchar(255) NOT NULL,
    1055. 

  1055.               *      //    state varchar(2) NOT NULL
    1056. 

  1056.               *      //);
    1057. 

  1057.               *  }):
    1058. 

  1058.               *
    1059. 

  1059.               * @param {Boolean} camelize set to true to underscore all identifiers coming from the database and to
    1060. 

  1060.               *                  camelize all identifiers sent to the database.
    1061. 

  1061.               */
    1062. 

  1062.              underscore:function (underscore) {
    1063. 

  1063. 1                underscore = underscore === true;
    1064. 

  1064. 1                Model.underscore = underscore;
    1065. 

  1065. 1                this.identifierOutputMethod = underscore ? "underscore" : "camelize";
    1066. 

  1066. 1                this.identifierInputMethod = underscore ? "camelize" : "underscore";
    1067. 

  1067. 1                this.__camelize = !underscore;
    1068. 

  1068. 1                this.__underscore = underscore;
    1069. 

  1069.              }
    1070. 

  1070.          }
    1071. 

  1071.      }
    1072. 

  1072.  });
    1073. 

  1073.  
    1074.

  390.          ACCESS_SHARE:'ACCESS SHARE',
