  391.          ACCESS_EXCLUSIVE:'ACCESS EXCLUSIVE',
    392. 

  392.          BOOL_FALSE:'false',
    393. 

  393.          BOOL_TRUE:'true',
    394. 

  394.          COMMA_SEPARATOR:', ',
    395. 

  395.          DELETE_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("delete", 'qualify with from using where returning'),
    396. 

  396.          EXCLUSIVE:'EXCLUSIVE',
    397. 

  397.          EXPLAIN:'EXPLAIN ',
    398. 

  398.          EXPLAIN_ANALYZE:'EXPLAIN ANALYZE ',
    399. 

  399.          FOR_SHARE:' FOR SHARE',
    400. 

  400.          INSERT_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("insert", 'with into columns values returning'),
    401. 

  401.          LOCK:'LOCK TABLE %s IN %s MODE',
    402. 

  402.          NULL:literal('NULL'),
    403. 

  403.          QUERY_PLAN:'QUERY PLAN',
    404. 

  404.          ROW_EXCLUSIVE:'ROW EXCLUSIVE',
    405. 

  405.          ROW_SHARE:'ROW SHARE',
    406. 

  406.          SELECT_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("select", '' +
    407. 

  407.              'qualify with distinct columns from join where group having compounds order limit lock'),
    408. 

  408.          SHARE:'SHARE',
    409. 

  409.          SHARE_ROW_EXCLUSIVE:'SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE',
    410. 

  410.          SHARE_UPDATE_EXCLUSIVE:'SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE',
    411. 

  411.          SQL_WITH_RECURSIVE:"WITH RECURSIVE ",
    412. 

  412.          TIMESTAMP_FORMAT:"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS",
    413. 

  413.          TIME_FORMAT:"HH:mm:ss.SSS",
    414. 

  414.          UPDATE_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("update", 'with table set from where returning'),
    415. 

  415.          XOR_OP:' # ',
    416. 

  416.          CRLF:"\r\n",
    417. 

  417.          BLOB_RE:/[\000-\037\047\134\177-\377]/,
    418. 

  418.          WINDOW:" WINDOW ",
    419. 

  419.          EMPTY_STRING:literal("''")
    420. 

  420.  
    421. 

  421.  
    422. 

  422.      }
    423. 

  423.  });
    424. 

  424.  
    425.

    430. 

  430.          RE_CURRVAL_ERROR:/currval of sequence "(.*)" is not yet defined in this session|relation "(.*)" does not exist/,
    431. 

  431.          SYSTEM_TABLE_REGEXP:/^pg|sql/,
    432.

  456.          execute:function (sql, opts, conn) {

    458. 

  458.                  .chain(function (conn) {
    459. 

  459. 5782                return this.__execute(conn, sql, opts);
    460. 

  460.              }.bind(this));
    461.

    462. 

  462.  
    463. 

  463.          __execute:function (conn, sql, opts, cb) {
    464. 

  464. 5782            return this.__logAndExecute(sql, comb("query").bindIgnore(conn, sql))
    465. 

  465.                  .both(comb("_returnConnection").bindIgnore(this, conn));
    466. 

  466.  
    467. 

  467.  
    468. 

  468.          },

    470. 

  470.          // Use the pg_* system tables to determine indexes on a table
    471. 

  471.          indexes:function (table, opts) {
    472. 

  472. 0            opts = opts || {};
    473. 

  473. 0            var m = this.outputIdentifierFunc;
    474. 

  474. 0            var im = this.inputIdentifierFunc;
    475. 

  475. 0            var parts = this.__schemaAndTable(table), schema = parts[0];
    476. 

  476. 0            table = parts[1];
    477. 

  477. 0            var ret = new Promise();
    478. 

  478. 0            when(this.serverVersion()).then(function (version) {
    479. 

  479. 0                var attNums;
    480. 

  480. 0                if (version >= 80100) {
    481. 

  481. 0                    attNums = sql.ANY("ind__indkey");
    482. 

  482.                  } else {
    483. 

  483. 0                    attNums = [];
    484. 

  484. 0                    for (var i = 0; i < 32; i++) {
    485. 

  485. 0                        attNums.push(Subscript("ind__indkey", [i]));
    486. 

  486.                      }
    487. 

  487.                  }
    488. 

  488. 0                var orderRange = [];
    489. 

  489. 0                for (var j = 0; j < 32; j++) {
    490. 

  490. 0                    orderRange.push(new Subscript("ind__indkey", [j]));
    491. 

  491.                  }
    492. 

  492. 0                orderRange = sql["case"](orderRange, 32, "att__attnum");
    493. 

  493. 0                var ds = this.metadataDataset.from("pg_class___tab")
    494. 

  494.                      .join("pg_index___ind", [
    495. 

  495.                      [identifier("indrelid"), identifier("oid")],
    496. 

  496.                      [im(table), "relname"]
    497. 

  497.                  ])
    498. 

  498.                      .join("pg_class___indc", [
    499. 

  499.                      [identifier("oid"), identifier("indexrelid")]
    500. 

  500.                  ])
    501. 

  501.                      .join("pg_attribute___att", [
    502. 

  502.                      [identifier("attrelid"), identifier("tab__oid")],
    503. 

  503.                      [identifier("attnum"), attNums]
    504. 

  504.                  ])
    505. 

  505.                      .filter({indc__relkind:'i', ind__indisprimary:false, indexprs:null, indpred:null})
    506. 

  506.                      .order("indc__relname", orderRange)
    507. 

  507.                      .select("indc__relname___name", "ind__indisunique___unique", "att__attname___column");
    508. 

  508.  
    509. 

  509. 0                if (schema) {
    510. 

  510. 0                    ds = ds.join("pg_namespace___nsp", {oid:identifier("tab__relnamespace"), nspname:schema.toString()});
    511. 

  511.                  }
    512. 

  512. 0                if (version >= 80200) {
    513. 

  513. 0                    ds = ds.filter({indisvalid:true});
    514. 

  514.                  }
    515. 

  515. 0                if (version >= 80300) {
    516. 

  516. 0                    ds = ds.filter({indisready:true, indcheckxmin:false});
    517. 

  517.                  }
    518. 

  518. 0                var indexes = {};
    519. 

  519. 0                ds.forEach(function (r) {
    520. 

  520. 0                    var ident = m(r.name), i = indexes[ident];
    521. 

  521. 0                    if (!i) {
    522. 

  522. 0                        i = indexes[ident] = {columns:[], unique:r.unique};
    523. 

  523.                      }
    524. 

  524. 0                    i.columns.push(r.column);
    525. 

  525.                  }).then(function () {
    526. 

  526. 0                        ret.callback(indexes);
    527. 

  527.                      }, ret);
    528. 

  528.              }, ret);
    529. 

  529.  
    530. 

  530. 0            return ret.promise();
    531. 

  531.          },
    532. 

  532.  
    533. 

  533.          locks:function () {
    534. 

  534. 2            return this.dataset.from("pg_class").join("pg_locks", {relation:identifier("relfilenode")}).select("pg_class__relname", identifier("pg_locks").all());
    535. 

  535.          },

    537. 

  537.          // Get version of postgres server, used for determined capabilities.
    538. 

  538.          serverVersion:function () {
    539. 

  539. 1            var ret = new Promise();
    540. 

  540. 1            if (!this.__serverVersion) {
    541. 

  541. 1                this.get(identifier("version").sqlFunction).then(hitch(this, function (version) {
    542. 

  542. 1                    var m = version.match(/PostgreSQL (\d+)\.(\d+)(?:(?:rc\d+)|\.(\d+))?/);
    543. 

  543. 1                    this._serverVersion = (parseInt(m[1], 10) * 10000) + (parseInt(m[2], 10) * 100) + parseInt(m[3], 10);
    544. 

  544. 1                    ret.callback(this._serverVersion);
    545. 

  545.                  }), ret);
    546. 

  546.              } else {
    547. 

  547. 0                ret.callback(this._serverVersion);
    548. 

  548.              }
    549. 

  549. 1            return ret.promise();
    550. 

  550.          },
    551. 

  551.  
    552. 

  552.          /**
    553. 

  553.           * Return an array of table names in the current database.
    554. 

  554.           * The dataset used is passed to the block if one is provided,
    555. 

  555.           * otherwise, an a promise resolved with an array of table names.
    556. 

  556.           *
    557. 

  557.           * Options:
    558. 

  558.           * @param {Object} [opts = {}] options
    559. 

  559.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} [opts.schema] The schema to search (default_schema by default)
    560. 

  560.           * @param {Function} [cb = null] an optional callback that is invoked with the dataset to retrieve tables.
    561. 

  561.           * @return {Promise} a promise resolved with the table names or the result of the cb if one is provided.
    562. 

  562.           */
    563. 

  563.          tables:function (opts, cb) {
    564. 

  564. 0            return this.__pgClassRelname('r', opts, cb);
    565. 

  565.          },
    566. 

  566.  
    567. 

  567.          /**
    568.

    579. 

  579.          primaryKey:function (table, opts) {
    580. 

  580. 1313            var ret, quotedTable = this.__quoteSchemaTable(table).toString(), pks = this.__primaryKeys;
    581. 

  581. 1313            if (pks.hasOwnProperty(quotedTable.toString())) {
    582. 

  582. 1243                ret = pks[quotedTable];
    583. 

  583.              } else {
    584. 

  584. 70                ret = (pks[quotedTable] = this.__primarykey(table));
    585. 

  585.              }
    586. 

  586. 1313            return ret.promise();
    587. 

  587.          },
    588. 

  588.  
    589. 

  589.          __primarykey:function (table) {
    590. 

  590. 70            var parts = this.__schemaAndTable(table);
    591. 

  591. 70            var m2 = this.inputIdentifierFunc;
    592. 

  592. 70            var schema = parts[0];
    593. 

  593. 70            table = parts[1];
    594. 

  594. 70            var ds = this.from(table)
    595. 

  595.                  .select("pg_attribute__attname___name")
    596. 

  596.                  .from("pg_index", "pg_class", "pg_attribute", "pg_namespace")
    597. 

  597.                  .where([
    598. 

  598.                  [identifier("pg_class__oid"), identifier("pg_attribute__attrelid")],
    599. 

  599.                  [identifier("pg_class__relnamespace"), identifier("pg_namespace__oid")],
    600. 

  600.                  [identifier("pg_class__oid"), identifier("pg_index__indrelid")],
    601. 

  601.                  [identifier("pg_index__indkey").sqlSubscript(0), identifier("pg_attribute__attnum")],
    602. 

  602.                  [identifier("indisprimary"), true],
    603. 

  603.                  [identifier("pg_class__relname"), m2(table.toString())]
    604. 

  604.              ]);
    605. 

  605. 70            if (schema) {
    606. 

  606. 0                ds.filter({pg_namespace__nspname:m2(schema)});
    607. 

  607.              }
    608. 

  608. 70            return ds.all();
    609. 

  609.  
    610. 

  610.          },
    611. 

  611.  
    612. 

  612.  
    613. 

  613.          schemaParseTable:function (tableName, opts) {
    614. 

  614. 65            var m = this.outputIdentifierFunc,
    615. 

  615.                  m2 = this.inputIdentifierFunc;
    616. 

  616. 65            var ds = this.metadataDataset
    617. 

  617.                  .select(
    618. 

  618.                  "pg_attribute__attname___name",
    619. 

  619.                  sql.format_type("pg_type__oid", "pg_attribute__atttypmod").as(literal('"dbType"')),
    620. 

  620.                  sql.pg_get_expr("pg_attrdef__adbin", "pg_class__oid").as(literal('"default"')),
    621. 

  621.                  sql.NOT("pg_attribute__attnotnull").as(literal('"allowNull"')),
    622. 

  622.                  sql.COALESCE(BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs({pg_attribute__attnum:sql.ANY("pg_index__indkey")}), false).as(literal('"primaryKey"')),
    623. 

  623.                  "pg_namespace__nspname"
    624. 

  624.              ).from("pg_class")
    625. 

  625.                  .join("pg_attribute", {attrelid:identifier("oid")})
    626. 

  626.                  .join("pg_type", {oid:identifier("atttypid")})
    627. 

  627.                  .join("pg_namespace", {oid:identifier("pg_class__relnamespace")})
    628. 

  628.                  .leftOuterJoin("pg_attrdef", {adrelid:identifier("pg_class__oid"), adnum:identifier("pg_attribute__attnum")})
    629. 

  629.                  .leftOuterJoin("pg_index", {indrelid:identifier("pg_class__oid"), indisprimary:true})
    630. 

  630.                  .filter({pg_attribute__attisdropped:false})
    631. 

  631.                  .filter({pg_attribute__attnum:{gt:0}})
    632. 

  632.                  .filter({pg_class__relname:m2(tableName)})
    633. 

  633.                  .order("pg_attribute__attnum");
    634. 

  634. 65            ds = this.__filterSchema(ds, opts);
    635. 

  635. 65            var currentSchema = null;
    636. 

  636. 65            return ds.map(function (row) {
    637. 

  637. 374                var sch = row.nspname;
    638. 

  638. 374                delete row.nspname;
    639. 

  639. 374                if (currentSchema) {
    640. 

  640. 309                    if (sch !== currentSchema) {
    641. 

  641. 0                        var error = new Error("columns from two tables were returned please specify a schema");
    642. 

  642. 0                        this.logError(error);
    643. 

  643.                      }
    644. 

  644.                  } else {
    645. 

  645. 65                    currentSchema = sch;
    646. 

  646.                  }
    647. 

  647. 374                if (isBlank(row["default"])) {
    648. 

  648. 313                    row["default"] = null;
    649. 

  649.                  }
    650. 

  650. 374                row.type = this.schemaColumnType(row.dbType);
    651. 

  651. 374                var fieldName = m(row.name);
    652. 

  652. 374                delete row.name;
    653. 

  653. 374                return [fieldName, row];
    654. 

  654.  
    655. 

  655.              }.bind(this));
    656. 

  656.  
    657. 

  657.          },
    658. 

  658.  
    659. 

  659.          __commitTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    660. 

  660. 856            opts = opts || {};
    661. 

  661. 856            var s = opts.prepare;
    662. 

  662. 856            if (s && this.__transactionDepth <= 1) {
    663. 

  663. 0                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, ["PREPARE TRANSACTION ", this.literal(s)].join(""));
    664. 

  664.              } else {
    665. 

  665. 856                return this._super(arguments);
    666. 

  666.              }
    667. 

  667.          },
    668. 

  668.  
    669. 

  669.          //Backbone of the tables and views support.
    670. 

  670.          __pgClassRelname:function (type, opts, cb) {
    671. 

  671. 0            var ret = new Promise();
    672. 

  672. 0            var ds = this.metadataDataset.from("pg_class")
    673. 

  673.                  .filter({relkind:type}).select("relname")
    674. 

  674.                  .exclude({relname:{like:this.SYSTEM_TABLE_REGEXP}})
    675. 

  675.                  .join("pg_namespace", {oid:identifier("relnamespace")});
    676. 

  676. 0            ds = this.__filterSchema(ds, opts);
    677. 

  677. 0            var m = this.outputIdentifierFunc;
    678. 

  678. 0            if (cb) {
    679. 

  679. 0                when(cb(ds)).then(ret);
    680. 

  680.              } else {
    681. 

  681. 0                ds.map(function (r) {
    682. 

  682. 0                    return m(r.relname);
    683. 

  683.                  }).then(ret);
    684. 

  684.              }
    685. 

  685. 0            return ret.promise();
    686. 

  686.          },
    687. 

  687.  
    688. 

  688.          //If opts includes a :schema option, or a default schema is used, restrict the dataset to
    689. 

  689.          // that schema.  Otherwise, just exclude the default PostgreSQL schemas except for public.
    690. 

  690.          __filterSchema:function (ds, opts) {
    691. 

  691. 65            opts = opts || {};
    692. 

  692. 65            var schema = opts.schema, ret = ds;
    693. 

  693. 65            if (schema) {
    694. 

  694. 0                ds = ds.filter({pg_namespace__nspname:schema});
    695. 

  695.              } else {
    696. 

  696. 65                ds = ds.exclude({pg_namespace__nspname:this.EXCLUDE_SCHEMAS});
    697. 

  697.              }
    698. 

  698. 65            return ds;
    699. 

  699.          },
    700. 

  700.  
    701. 

  701.          __indexDefinitionSql:function (tableName, index) {
    702. 

  702. 9            tableName = stringToIdentifier(tableName);
    703. 

  703. 9            var cols = index.columns.map(function (col) {
    704. 

  704. 10                    return stringToIdentifier(col);
    705. 

  705.                  }),
    706. 

  706.                  indexName = index.name || this.__defaultIndexName(tableName, cols),
    707. 

  707.                  o = index.opclass,
    708. 

  708.                  indexType = index.type,
    709. 

  709.                  unique = index.unique ? "UNIQUE" : "",
    710. 

  710.                  filter = index.where || index.filter,
    711. 

  711.                  expr;
    712. 

  712. 9            filter = filter ? ["WHERE ", this.__filterExpr(filter)].join("") : "";
    713. 

  713. 9            if (isDefined(o)) {
    714. 

  714. 1                expr = ["(", cols.map(function (c) {
    715. 

  715. 1                    return [this.literal(c), o].join(" ");
    716. 

  716.                  }, this).join(", "), ")"].join("");
    717. 

  717.              } else {
    718. 

  718. 8                expr = this.literal(toArray(cols));
    719. 

  719.              }
    720. 

  720. 9            switch (indexType) {
    721. 

  721.                  case "fullText":
    722. 

  722. 2                    expr = ["(to_tsvector(", this.literal(index.language || "simple"), ", ", this.literal(this.dataset.__fullTextStringJoin(cols)), "))"].join("");
    723. 

  723. 2                    indexType = "gin";
    724. 

  724. 2                    break;
    725. 

  725.                  case "spatial" :
    726. 

  726. 1                    indexType = "gist";
    727. 

  727. 1                    break;
    728. 

  728.              }
    729. 

  729. 9            return ["CREATE", unique, "INDEX", this.__quoteIdentifier(indexName), "ON", this.__quoteSchemaTable(tableName), indexType ? "USING " + indexType : "", expr, filter ].join(" ");
    730. 

  730.  
    731. 

  731.          },
    732. 

  732.          /*
    733. 

  733.           todo might need this?
    734. 

  734.           __insertResult:function (conn, table, values) {
    735. 

  735.           },
    736. 

  736.           */
    737. 

  737.  
    738. 

  738.          __renameTableSql:function (name, newName) {
    739. 

  739. 1            return ["ALTER TABLE ", this.__quoteSchemaTable(name), " RENAME TO ", this.__quoteIdentifier(this.__schemaAndTable(newName).pop())].join("");
    740. 

  740.          },
    741. 

  741.  
    742. 

  742.          __schemaAutoincrementingPrimaryKey:function (schema) {
    743. 

  743. 0            return this._super(arguments) && schema.dbType.match(/^(?:integer|bigint)$/i) && schema["default"].match(/^nextval/i);
    744. 

  744.          },
    745. 

  745.  
    746. 

  746.          __typeLiteralGenericNumeric:function (column) {
    747. 

  747. 2            return column.size ? format("numeric(%s)", array.toArray(column.size).join(', ')) : column.isInt ? "integer" : column.isDouble ? "double precision" : "numeric";
    748. 

  748.          },
    749. 

  749.  
    750. 

  750.          __typeLiteralGenericDateTime:function (column) {
    751. 

  751. 6            return "timestamp";
    752. 

  752.          },
    753. 

  753.  
    754. 

  754.          //handle bigserial
    755. 

  755.          __typeLiteralGenericBigint:function (column) {
    756. 

  756. 1            return column.serial ? "bigserial" : this.__typeLiteralSpecific(column);
    757. 

  757.          },
    758. 

  758.  
    759. 

  759.          __typeLiteralGenericBlob:function (column) {
    760. 

  760. 8            return "bytea";
    761. 

  761.          },
    762. 

  762.  
    763. 

  763.          //handle serial type
    764. 

  764.          __typeLiteralGenericInteger:function (column) {
    765. 

  765. 133            return column.serial ? "serial" : this.__typeLiteralSpecific(column);
    766. 

  766.          },
    767. 

  767.  
    768. 

  768.          // PostgreSQL prefers the text datatype.  If a fixed size is requested,
    769. 

  769.          // the char type is used.  If the text type is specifically
    770. 

  770.          // disallowed or there is a size specified, use the varchar type.
    771. 

  771.          // Otherwise use the type type.
    772. 

  772.          __typeLiteralGenericString:function (column) {
    773. 

  773. 157            if (column.fixed) {
    774. 

  774. 0                return ["char(", column.size || 255, ")"].join("");
    775. 

  775. 157            } else if (column.text === false || column.size) {
    776. 

  776. 139                return ["varchar(", column.size || 255, ")"].join("");
    777. 

  777.              } else {
    778. 

  778. 18                return 'text';
    779. 

  779.              }
    780. 

  780.  
    781. 

  781.          },
    782. 

  782.

  16.      _Association = require("./_Association");
    17. 

  17.  
    18. 

  18.  /**
    19. 

  19.   * @class Class to define a one to many association.
    20. 

  20.   *
    21. 

  21.   * </br>
    22. 

  22.   * <b>NOT to be instantiated directly</b>
    23. 

  23.   * Its just documented for reference.
    24. 

  24.   *
    25. 

  25.   * Adds the following methods to each model.
    26. 

  26.   * <ul>
    27. 

  27.   *  <li>add{ModelName} - add an association</li>
    28. 

  28.   *  <li>add{comb.pluralize(ModelName)} - add multiple associations</li>
    29. 

  29.   *  <li>remove{ModelName} - remove an association</li>
    30. 

  30.   *  <li>remove{comb.pluralize(ModelName)} - remove multiple association</li>
    31. 

  31.   *  <li>removeAll - removes all associations of this type</li>
    32. 

  32.   *  </ul>
    33. 

  33.   *
    34. 

  34.   * @name OneToMany
    35. 

  35.   * @augments patio.associations.Association
    36. 

  36.   * @memberOf patio.associations
    37. 

  37.   *
    38. 

  38.   * */
    39.

    38. 

  38.          /**
    39. 

  39.           * A Database object represents a virtual connection to a database.
    40. 

  40.           * The Database class is meant to be subclassed by database adapters in order
    41. 

  41.           * to provide the functionality needed for executing queries.
    42. 

  42.           *
    43. 

  43.           * @constructs
    44. 

  44.           * @param {Object} opts options used to create the database
    45. 

  45.           *
    46. 

  46.           * @property {String} uri A database URI used to create the database connection. This property is
    47. 

  47.           * available even if an object was used to create the database connection.
    48. 

  48.           * @property {patio.Dataset} dataset returns an empty adapter specific {@link patio.Dataset} that can
    49. 

  49.           * be used to query the {@link patio.Database} with.
    50. 

  50.           */

  53. 122            if (!patio) {
    54. 

  54. 1                patio = require("../index");
    55. 

  55.              }

  56. 122            this.patio = patio;

  57. 122            this._super(arguments, [opts]);

    70. 

  70.           * @example

    95. 

  95.           * Typecast the value to the given columnType. Calls
    96. 

  96.           * typecastValue{ColumnType} if the method exists,
    97. 

  97.           * otherwise returns the value.
    98. 

  98.           *
    99. 

  99.           * @example
    100. 

  100.           * DB.typeCastValue("boolean", 0) //=> false
    101. 

  101.           * DB.typeCastValue("boolean", 1) //=> true
    102. 

  102.           * DB.typeCastValue("timestamp",  '2004-02-01 12:12:12')
    103. 

  103.           *      //=> new patio.sql.TimeStamp(2004, 1, 1, 12, 12, 12);

  90.          // MySQL specific syntax for LIKE/REGEXP searches, as well as
    91. 

  91.          // string concatenation.
    92. 

  92.          complexExpressionSql:function (op, args) {
    93. 

  93. 23            var likeOps = ["~", "~*", "LIKE", "ILIKE"];
    94. 

  94. 23            var notLikeOps = ["!~", "!~*", "NOT LIKE", "NOT ILIKE"];
    95. 

  95. 23            var regExpOps = ["~", "!~", "~*", "!~*"];
    96. 

  96. 23            var binaryOps = ["~", "!~", "LIKE", "NOT LIKE"];
    97. 

  97. 23            if (likeOps.indexOf(op) !== -1 || notLikeOps.indexOf(op) !== -1) {
    98. 

  98. 10                return format("(%s%s %s%s %s)", this.literal(args[0]), notLikeOps.indexOf(op) !== -1 ? " NOT" : "",
    99. 

  99.                      regExpOps.indexOf(op) !== -1 ? "REGEXP" : "LIKE", binaryOps.indexOf(op) !== -1 ? " BINARY" : "",
    100. 

  100.                      this.literal(args[1]));
    101. 

  101. 13            } else if (op === "||") {
    102. 

  102. 5                if (args.length > 1) {
    103. 

  103. 3                    return format("CONCAT(%s)", args.map(this.literal, this).join(", "));
    104. 

  104.                  } else {
    105. 

  105. 2                    return this.literal(args[0]);
    106. 

  106.                  }
    107. 

  107. 8            } else if (op === "B~") {
    108. 

  108. 0                return format("CAST(~%s AS SIGNED INTEGER)", this.literal(args[0]));
    109. 

  109.              } else {
    110. 

  110. 8                return this._super(arguments);
    111. 

  111.              }
    112. 

  112.          },
    113. 

  113.  
    114. 

  114.          // Use GROUP BY instead of DISTINCT ON if arguments are provided.
    115.

  116. 2            args = argsToArray(arguments);

  117. 2            return !args.length ? this._super(arguments) : this.group.apply(this, args);

  135. 3            return format("MATCH %s AGAINST (%s%s)", this.literal(toArray(cols)),
    136. 

  136.                  this.literal(toArray(term).join(" ")), opts.boolean ? " IN BOOLEAN MODE" : "");
    137. 

  137.          },
    138.

  142. 3            return this._filter.apply(this, ["having"].concat(args));

  145.          // Transforms an CROSS JOIN to an INNER JOIN if the expr is not nil.
    146. 

  146.          //Raises an error on use of :full_outer type, since MySQL doesn't support it.
    147. 

  147.          joinTable:function (type, table, expr, tableAlias) {
    148. 

  148. 12            tableAlias = tableAlias || {};
    149. 

  149. 12            if (type === "cross" && !isUndefinedOrNull(expr)) {
    150. 

  150. 1                type = "inner";
    151. 

  151.              }
    152. 

  152. 12            if (type === "fullOuter") {
    153. 

  153. 1                throw new QueryError("MySQL does not support FULL OUTER JOIN");
    154. 

  154.              }
    155. 

  155. 11            return this._super(arguments, [type, table, expr, tableAlias]);
    156.

  164. 1                return "NATURAL LEFT JOIN";

  262.          //MySQL specific syntax for ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE
    263. 

  263.          onDuplicateKeyUpdateSql:function () {
    264. 

  264. 3            var ret = "";
    265. 

  265. 3            var updateCols = this.__opts.onDuplicateKeyUpdate;
    266. 

  266. 3            if (updateCols) {
    267. 

  267. 3                var updateVals = null, l, last;
    268. 

  268. 3                if ((l = updateCols.length) > 0 && isHash((last = updateCols[l - 1]))) {
    269. 

  269. 2                    updateVals = last;
    270. 

  270. 2                    updateCols = l === 2 ? [updateCols[0]] : updateCols.slice(0, l - 2);
    271. 

  271.                  }
    272. 

  272. 3                var updating = updateCols.map(function (c) {
    273. 

  273. 3                    var quoted = this.quoteIdentifier(c);
    274. 

  274. 3                    return format("%s=VALUES(%s)", quoted, quoted);
    275. 

  275.                  }, this);
    276. 

  276. 3                for (var i in updateVals) {
    277. 

  277. 2                    if (i in updateVals) {
    278. 

  278. 2                        updating.push(format("%s=%s", this.quoteIdentifier(i), this.literal(updateVals[i])));
    279. 

  279.                      }
    280. 

  280.                  }
    281. 

  281. 3                if (updating || updateVals) {
    282. 

  282. 3                    ret =
    283. 

  283.                          format(" ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE %s", updating.join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR));
    284. 

  284.                  }
    285. 

  285.              }
    286. 

  286. 3            return ret;
    287. 

  287.          },
    288. 

  288.  
    289. 

  289.          //Support FOR SHARE locking when using the :share lock style.
    290. 

  290.          _selectLockSql:function (sql) {
    291. 

  291. 86            return this.__opts.lock === "share" ? this._static.FOR_SHARE : this._super(arguments);
    292. 

  292.          },
    293. 

  293.  
    294. 

  294.          // Delete rows matching this dataset
    295. 

  295.          remove:function () {
    296. 

  296. 10            return  this.executeDui(this.deleteSql).chain(function (c, info) {
    297. 

  297. 10                return c.affectedRows;
    298. 

  298.              });
    299. 

  299.          },
    300. 

  300.  
    301. 

  301.          fetchRows:function (sql) {
    302. 

  302. 87            return asyncArray(this.execute(sql).chain(function (r, fields) {
    303. 

  303. 87                var i = -1;
    304. 

  304. 87                var cols;
    305. 

  305.  
    306. 

  306. 87                cols = fields.map(function (col) {
    307. 

  307. 304                    var fieldName = col.name;
    308. 

  308. 304                    var type = col.type;
    309. 

  309. 304                    var length = col.fieldLength;
    310. 

  310. 304                    return [this.outputIdentifier(fieldName), DB.convertMysqlType(type === 1 && length !== 1 ? 2 : type), fieldName];
    311. 

  311.                  }, this);
    312. 

  312.  
    313. 

  313. 87                this.__columns = cols.map(function (c) {
    314. 

  314. 304                    return c[0];
    315. 

  315.                  });
    316. 

  316. 87                return this.__processRows(r, cols);
    317. 

  317.              }.bind(this)));
    318. 

  318.          },
    319. 

  319.  
    320. 

  320.  
    321. 

  321.          __processRows:function (rows, cols) {
    322. 

  322.              //dp this so the callbacks are called in appropriate order also.
    323. 

  323. 87            return comb(rows).map(function (row) {
    324. 

  324. 118                var h = {};
    325. 

  325. 118                cols.forEach(function (col) {
    326. 

  326. 468                    h[col[0]] = col[1](row[col[2]]);
    327. 

  327.                  });
    328. 

  328. 115                return h;
    329. 

  329.              });
    330. 

  330.          },
    331. 

  331.  
    332. 

  332.          //Don't allow graphing a dataset that splits multiple statements
    333. 

  333.          graph:function () {
    334. 

  334. 0            if (this.__opts.splitMultipleResultSels) {
    335. 

  335. 0                throw new QueryError("Can't graph a dataset that splits multiple result sets");
    336. 

  336.              }
    337. 

  337. 0            this._super(arguments);
    338. 

  338.          },
    339. 

  339.  
    340. 

  340.          //Insert a new value into this dataset
    341. 

  341.          insert:function () {
    342. 

  342. 32            return  this.executeDui(this.insertSql.apply(this, arguments)).chain(function (c, info) {
    343. 

  343. 32                return c.insertId;
    344. 

  344.              });
    345. 

  345.          },
    346. 

  346.  
    347. 

  347.          // Replace (update or insert) the matching row.
    348. 

  348.          replace:function () {
    349. 

  349. 9            return this.executeDui(this.replaceSql.apply(this, arguments)).chain(function (c, info) {
    350. 

  350. 9                return c.insertId;
    351. 

  351.              });
    352. 

  352.          },
    353. 

  353.  
    354. 

  354.          splitMultipleResultSets:function () {
    355. 

  355. 0            if (this.__opts.graph) {
    356. 

  356. 0                throw new QueryError("Can't split multiple statements on a graphed dataset");
    357. 

  357.              }
    358. 

  358. 0            var ds = this.mergeOptions({splitMultipleResultSets:true});
    359. 

  359. 0            var rowCb = this.rowCb;
    360. 

  360. 0            if (rowCb) {
    361. 

  361. 0                ds.rowCb = function (x) {
    362. 

  362. 0                    return x.map(rowCb, this);
    363. 

  363.                  };
    364. 

  364.              }
    365. 

  365. 0            return ds;
    366. 

  366.          },
    367. 

  367.  
    368. 

  368.          //Update the matching rows.
    369. 

  369.          update:function () {
    370. 

  370. 0            return this.executeDui(this.updateSql.apply(this, arguments)).chain(function (c, info) {
    371. 

  371. 0                return c.affectedRows;
    372. 

  372.              });
    373. 

  373.          },
    374. 

  374.  
    375. 

  375.          //Set the :type option to select if it hasn't been set.
    376. 

  376.          execute:function (sql, opts) {
    377. 

  377. 87            opts = opts || {};
    378. 

  378. 87            return this._super([sql, merge({type:"select"}, opts)]);
    379. 

  379.          },
    380. 

  380.  
    381. 

  381.          //Set the :type option to :select if it hasn't been set.
    382. 

  382.          executeDui:function (sql, opts) {
    383. 

  383. 59            opts = opts || {};
    384. 

  384. 59            return this._super([sql, merge({type:"dui"}, opts)]);
    385. 

  385.          },
    386. 

  386.  
    387. 

  387.          _literalString:function (v) {
    388. 

  388. 51            return "'" + v.replace(/[\0\n\r\t\\\'\"\x1a]/g, function (s) {
    389. 

  389. 1                switch (s) {
    390. 

  390.                      case "0":
    391. 

  391. 0                        return "\\0";
    392. 

  392.                      case "\n":
    393. 

  393. 0                        return "\\n";
    394. 

  394.                      case "\r":
    395. 

  395. 0                        return "\\r";
    396. 

  396.                      case "\b":
    397. 

  397. 0                        return "\\b";
    398. 

  398.                      case "\t":
    399. 

  399. 0                        return "\\t";
    400. 

  400.                      case "\x1a":
    401. 

  401. 0                        return "\\Z";
    402. 

  402.                      default:
    403. 

  403. 1                        return "\\" + s;
    404. 

  404.                  }
    405. 

  405.              }) + "'";
    406. 

  406.          }
    407. 

  407.      },
    408. 

  408.  
    409. 

  409.      "static":{
    410. 

  410.          BOOL_TRUE:'1',
    411. 

  411.          BOOL_FALSE:'0',
    412. 

  412.          COMMA_SEPARATOR:', ',
    413. 

  413.          FOR_SHARE:' LOCK IN SHARE MODE',
    414. 

  414.          DELETE_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("delete", "qualify from where order limit"),
    415. 

  415.          INSERT_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("insert", "ignore into columns values onDuplicateKeyUpdate"),
    416. 

  416.          REPLACE_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("insert", "ignore into columns values onDuplicateKeyUpdate"),
    417. 

  417.          SELECT_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("select", "qualify distinct columns from join where group having compounds order limit lock"),
    418. 

  418.          UPDATE_CLAUSE_METHODS:Dataset.clauseMethods("update", "table set where order limit")
    419. 

  419.      }
    420.

    438.

    439.

    453.

    463. 

  463.          // MySQL's cast rules are restrictive in that you can't just cast to any possible
    464. 

  464.          // database type.
    465. 

  465.          castTypeLiteral:function (type) {
    466. 

  466. 0            var ret = null, meth;
    467. 

  467. 0            if (isString(type)) {
    468. 

  468. 0                ret = this._static.CAST_TYPES[type] || this._super(arguments);
    469. 

  469. 0            } else if (type === String) {
    470. 

  470. 0                meth += "CHAR";
    471. 

  471. 0            } else if (type === Number) {
    472. 

  472. 0                meth += "DECIMAL";
    473. 

  473. 0            } else if (type === DateTime) {
    474. 

  474. 0                meth += "DATETIME";
    475. 

  475. 0            } else if (type === Year) {
    476. 

  476. 0                meth += "Year";
    477. 

  477. 0            } else if (type === Time) {
    478. 

  478. 0                meth += "DATETIME";
    479. 

  479. 0            } else if (type === Double) {
    480. 

  480. 0                meth += "DECIMAL";
    481. 

  481.              } else {
    482. 

  482. 0                ret = this._super(arguments);
    483. 

  483.              }
    484. 

  484. 0            return  ret;
    485. 

  485.          },
    486. 

  486.  
    487. 

  487.          // Use SHOW INDEX FROM to get the index information for the table.
    488. 

  488.          indexes:function (table, opts) {
    489. 

  489. 3            var indexes = {};
    490. 

  490. 3            var removeIndexes = [];
    491. 

  491. 3            var m = this.outputIdentifierFunc;
    492. 

  492. 3            var im = this.inputIdentifierFunc;
    493. 

  493. 3            var ret = new Promise();
    494. 

  494. 3            this.metadataDataset.withSql("SHOW INDEX FROM ?", isInstanceOf(table, sql.Identifier) ? table : sql.identifier(im(table)))
    495. 

  495.                  .forEach(function (r) {
    496. 

  496. 2                    var name = r[m("Key_name")];
    497. 

  497. 2                    if (name !== "PRIMARY") {
    498. 

  498. 2                        name = m(name);
    499. 

  499. 2                        if (r[m("Sub_part")]) {
    500. 

  500. 1                            removeIndexes.push(name);
    501. 

  501.                          }
    502. 

  502. 2                        var i = indexes[name] || (indexes[name] = {columns:[], unique:r[m("Non_unique")] !== 1});
    503. 

  503. 2                        i.columns.push(m(r[m("Column_name")]));
    504. 

  504.                      }
    505. 

  505.                  }).then(function () {
    506. 

  506. 3                    var r = {};
    507. 

  507. 3                    for (var i in indexes) {
    508. 

  508. 2                        if (removeIndexes.indexOf(i) === -1) {
    509. 

  509. 1                            r[i] = indexes[i];
    510. 

  510.                          }
    511. 

  511.                      }
    512. 

  512. 3                    ret.callback(r);
    513. 

  513.                  }, ret);
    514. 

  514. 3            return ret.promise();
    515. 

  515.  
    516. 

  516.          },
    517. 

  517.  
    518. 

  518.          // Get version of MySQL server, used for determined capabilities.
    519. 

  519.          serverVersion:function () {
    520. 

  520. 1            var ret = new Promise();
    521. 

  521. 1            if (!this.__serverVersion) {
    522. 

  522. 1                this.get(sql.version().sqlFunction).then(hitch(this, function (version) {
    523. 

  523. 1                    var m = version.match(/(\d+)\.(\d+)\.(\d+)/);
    524. 

  524. 1                    this._serverVersion = (parseInt(m[1], 10) * 10000) + (parseInt(m[2], 10) * 100) + parseInt(m[3], 10);
    525. 

  525. 1                    ret.callback(this._serverVersion);
    526. 

  526.                  }), ret);
    527. 

  527.              } else {
    528. 

  528. 0                ret.callback(this._serverVersion);
    529. 

  529.              }
    530. 

  530. 1            return ret.promise();
    531. 

  531.          },
    532. 

  532.

  533.          //Return an array of strings specifying table names in the current database.

    535.

    537.

    538.

    540.

    541. 

  541.  
    542. 

  542.          use:function (dbName) {
    543.

    544. 

  544. 0            this.disconnect().then(hitch(this, function () {
    545.

  554.  
    555. 

  555.          //Use MySQL specific syntax for rename column, set column type, and
    556. 

  556.          // drop index cases.
    557. 

  557.          __alterTableSql:function (table, op) {
    558. 

  558. 21            var ret = new Promise();
    559. 

  559. 21            if (op.op === "addColumn") {
    560. 

  560. 7                var related = op.table;
    561. 

  561. 7                if (related) {
    562. 

  562. 2                    delete op.table;
    563. 

  563. 2                    this._super(arguments).then(hitch(this, function (sql) {
    564. 

  564. 2                        op.table = related;
    565. 

  565. 2                        ret.callback([sql, format("ALTER TABLE %s ADD FOREIGN KEY (%s)%s",
    566. 

  566.                              this.__quoteSchemaTable(table), this.__quoteIdentifier(op.name),
    567. 

  567.                              this.__columnReferencesSql(op))]);
    568. 

  568.                      }), ret);
    569. 

  569.  
    570. 

  570.                  } else {
    571. 

  571. 5                    ret = this._super(arguments);
    572. 

  572.                  }
    573. 

  573. 14            } else if (['renameColumn', "setColumnType", "setColumnNull", "setColumnDefault"].indexOf(op.op) !== -1) {
    574. 

  574. 11                var o = op.op;
    575. 

  575. 11                this.schema(table).then(hitch(this, function (schema) {
    576. 

  576. 11                    var name = op.name;
    577. 

  577. 11                    var opts = schema[Object.keys(schema).filter(function (i) {
    578. 

  578. 28                        return i === name;
    579. 

  579.                      })[0]];
    580. 

  580. 11                    opts = merge({}, opts || {});
    581. 

  581. 11                    opts.name = op.newName || name;
    582. 

  582. 11                    opts.type = op.type || opts.dbType;
    583. 

  583. 11                    opts.allowNull = isUndefined(op["null"]) ? opts.allowNull : op["null"];
    584. 

  584. 11                    opts["default"] = op["default"] || opts.jsDefault;
    585. 

  585. 11                    if (isUndefinedOrNull(opts["default"])) {
    586. 

  586. 5                        delete opts["default"];
    587. 

  587.                      }
    588. 

  588. 11                    ret.callback(format("ALTER TABLE %s CHANGE COLUMN %s %s", this.__quoteSchemaTable(table),
    589. 

  589.                          this.__quoteIdentifier(op.name), this.__columnDefinitionSql(merge(op, opts))));
    590. 

  590.                  }), ret);
    591. 

  591. 3            } else if (op.op === "dropIndex") {
    592. 

  592. 0                ret.callback(format("%s ON %s", this.__dropIndexSql(table, op), this.__quoteSchemaTable(table)));
    593. 

  593.              } else {
    594. 

  594. 3                ret = this._super(arguments);
    595. 

  595.              }
    596. 

  596. 21            return ret.promise();
    597. 

  597.          },
    598. 

  598.  
    599. 

  599.          //MySQL needs to set transaction isolation before beginning a transaction
    600. 

  600.          __beginNewTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    601. 

  601. 9            return this.__setTransactionIsolation(conn, opts)
    602. 

  602.                  .chain(comb("__logConnectionExecute").bindIgnore(this, conn, this.beginTransactionSql));
    603. 

  603.          },
    604. 

  604.  
    605. 

  605.          // Use XA START to start a new prepared transaction if the :prepare
    606. 

  606.          //option is given.
    607. 

  607.          __beginTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    608. 

  608. 9            opts = opts || {};
    609. 

  609. 9            var s;
    610. 

  610. 9            if ((s = opts.prepare)) {
    611. 

  611. 0                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, comb("XA START %s").format(this.literal(s)));
    612. 

  612.              } else {
    613. 

  613. 9                return this._super(arguments);
    614. 

  614.              }
    615. 

  615.          },
    616. 

  616.  
    617. 

  617.          // MySQL doesn't allow default values on text columns, so ignore if it the
    618. 

  618.          // generic text type is used
    619. 

  619.          __columnDefinitionSql:function (column) {
    620. 

  620. 144            if (isString(column.type) && column.type.match(/string/i) && column.text) {
    621. 

  621. 1                delete column["default"];
    622. 

  622.              }
    623. 

  623. 144            return this._super(arguments, [column]);
    624. 

  624.          },
    625. 

  625.  
    626. 

  626.          // Prepare the XA transaction for a two-phase commit if the
    627. 

  627.          // prepare option is given.
    628. 

  628.          __commitTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    629. 

  629. 9            opts = opts || {};
    630. 

  630. 9            var s = opts.prepare;
    631. 

  631. 9            if (s) {
    632. 

  632. 0                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, comb("XA END %s").format(this.literal(s)))
    633. 

  633.                      .chain(comb("__logConnectionExecute").bindIgnore(this, comb("XA PREPARE %s").format(this.literal(s))))
    634. 

  634.              } else {
    635. 

  635. 9                return this._super(arguments);
    636. 

  636.              }
    637. 

  637.          },
    638. 

  638.  
    639. 

  639.          //Use MySQL specific syntax for engine type and character encoding
    640. 

  640.          __createTableSql:function (name, generator, options) {
    641. 

  641. 48            options = options || {};
    642. 

  642. 48            var engine = options.engine, charset = options.charset, collate = options.collate;
    643. 

  643. 48            if (isUndefined(engine)) {
    644. 

  644. 40                engine = this._static.defaultEngine;
    645. 

  645.              }
    646. 

  646. 48            if (isUndefined(charset)) {
    647. 

  647. 43                charset = this._static.defaultCharset;
    648. 

  648.              }
    649. 

  649. 48            if (isUndefined(collate)) {
    650. 

  650. 46                collate = this._static.defaultCollate;
    651. 

  651.              }
    652. 

  652. 48            generator.columns.forEach(function (c) {
    653. 

  653. 126                var t = c.table;
    654. 

  654. 126                if (t) {
    655. 

  655. 2                    delete c.table;
    656. 

  656. 2                    generator.foreignKey([c.name], t, merge({}, c, {name:null, type:"foreignKey"}));
    657. 

  657.                  }
    658. 

  658.              });
    659. 

  659. 48            return format(" %s%s%s%s", this._super(arguments), engine ? " ENGINE=" + engine : "",
    660. 

  660.                  charset ? " DEFAULT CHARSET=" + charset : "", collate ? " DEFAULT COLLATE=" + collate : "");
    661. 

  661.          },
    662. 

  662.  
    663. 

  663.          //Handle MySQL specific index SQL syntax
    664. 

  664.          __indexDefinitionSql:function (tableName, index) {
    665. 

  665. 7            var indexName = this.__quoteIdentifier(index.name || this.__defaultIndexName(tableName,
    666. 

  666.                  index.columns)), t = index.type, using = "";
    667. 

  667. 7            var indexType = "";
    668. 

  668. 7            if (t === "fullText") {
    669. 

  669. 2                indexType = "FULLTEXT ";
    670. 

  670. 5            } else if (t === "spatial") {
    671. 

  671. 1                indexType = "SPATIAL ";
    672. 

  672.              } else {
    673. 

  673. 4                indexType = index.unique ? "UNIQUE " : "";
    674. 

  674. 4                using = t ? " USING " + t : "";
    675. 

  675.              }
    676. 

  676. 7            return format("CREATE %sINDEX %s%s ON %s %s", indexType, indexName, using,
    677. 

  677.                  this.__quoteSchemaTable(tableName), this.literal(index.columns.map(function (c) {
    678. 

  678. 8                    return isString(c) ? sql.identifier(c) : c;
    679. 

  679.                  })));
    680. 

  680.          },
    681. 

  681.  
    682. 

  682.          // Rollback the currently open XA transaction
    683. 

  683.          __rollbackTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    684. 

  684. 0            opts = opts || {};
    685. 

  685. 0            var s = opts.prepare;
    686. 

  686. 0            var logConnectionExecute = comb("__logConnectionExecute");
    687. 

  687. 0            if (s) {
    688. 

  688. 0                s = this.literal(s);
    689. 

  689. 0                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, "XA END " + s)
    690. 

  690.                      .chain(logConnectionExecute.bindIngore(this, conn, "XA PREPARE " + s))
    691. 

  691.                      .chain(logConnectionExecute.bindIngore(this, conn, "XA ROLLBACK " + s))
    692. 

  692.              } else {
    693. 

  693. 0                return this._super(arguments);
    694. 

  694.              }
    695. 

  695.          },
    696. 

  696.  
    697. 

  697.          // MySQL treats integer primary keys as autoincrementing.
    698. 

  698.          _schemaAutoincrementingPrimaryKey:function (schema) {
    699. 

  699. 0            return this._super(arguments) && schema.dbType.match(/int/i);
    700. 

  700.          },
    701. 

  701.  
    702. 

  702.          //Use the MySQL specific DESCRIBE syntax to get a table description.
    703. 

  703.          schemaParseTable:function (tableName, opts) {
    704. 

  704. 15            var m = this.outputIdentifierFunc;
    705. 

  705. 15            var im = this.inputIdentifierFunc;
    706. 

  706. 15            return this.metadataDataset.withSql("DESCRIBE ?", sql.identifier(im(tableName))).map(hitch(this,
    707. 

  707.                  function (row) {
    708. 

  708. 39                    var ret = {};
    709. 

  709. 39                    var e = row[m("Extra")];
    710. 

  710. 39                    var allowNull = row[m("Null")];
    711. 

  711. 39                    var key = row[m("Key")];
    712. 

  712. 39                    ret.autoIncrement = e.match(/auto_increment/i) !== null;
    713. 

  713. 39                    ret.allowNull = allowNull.match(/Yes/i) !== null;
    714. 

  714. 39                    ret.primaryKey = key.match(/PRI/i) !== null;
    715. 

  715. 39                    var defaultValue = row[m("Default")];
    716. 

  716. 39                    ret["default"] = Buffer.isBuffer(defaultValue) ? defaultValue.toString() : defaultValue;
    717. 

  717. 39                    if (isEmpty(row["default"])) {
    718. 

  718. 39                        row["default"] = null;
    719. 

  719.                      }
    720. 

  720. 39                    ret.dbType = row[m("Type")];
    721. 

  721. 39                    if (Buffer.isBuffer(ret.dbType)) {
    722. 

  722.                          //handle case for field type being returned at 252  (i.e. BLOB)
    723. 

  723. 39                        ret.dbType = ret.dbType.toString();
    724. 

  724.                      }
    725. 

  725. 39                    ret.type = this.schemaColumnType(ret.dbType.toString("utf8"));
    726. 

  726. 39                    var fieldName = m(row[m("Field")]);
    727. 

  727. 39                    return [fieldName, ret];
    728. 

  728.                  }));
    729. 

  729.          },
    730. 

  730.  
    731.

  805.  
    806. 

  806.          convertMysqlType:function (type) {
    807. 

  807. 304            var convert = this.convertTinyintToBool, convertDateTime = this.__convertInvalidDateTime;
    808. 

  808. 304            if (!patio) {
    809. 

  809. 1                patio = require("../index");
    810. 

  810.              }
    811. 

  811. 304            return hitch(this.FIELD_TYPES, function (type, o) {
    812. 

  812. 468                var ret = o;
    813. 

  813. 468                if (o !== null) {
    814. 

  814. 347                    switch (type) {
    815. 

  815.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
    816. 

  816.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_DATETIME:
    817. 

  817. 5                            ret = convertDate(o, "stringToDateTime", convertDateTime);
    818. 

  818. 4                            break;
    819. 

  819.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_DATE:
    820. 

  820.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_NEWDATE:
    821. 

  821. 5                            ret = convertDate(o, "stringToDate", convertDateTime);
    822. 

  822. 4                            break;
    823. 

  823.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_TIME:
    824. 

  824. 5                            ret = convertDate(o, "stringToTime", convertDateTime);
    825. 

  825. 4                            break;
    826. 

  826.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_TINY:
    827. 

  827. 3                            ret = convert ? parseInt(o, 10) === 1 : parseInt(o, 10);
    828. 

  828. 3                            break;
    829. 

  829.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_YEAR:
    830. 

  830. 0                            ret = convertDate(o, "stringToYear", convertDateTime);
    831. 

  831. 0                            break;
    832. 

  832.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_SHORT:
    833. 

  833.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_LONG:
    834. 

  834.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_LONGLONG:
    835. 

  835.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_INT24:
    836. 

  836. 68                            ret = parseInt(o, 10);
    837. 

  837. 68                            break;
    838. 

  838.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_FLOAT:
    839. 

  839.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_DOUBLE:
    840. 

  840.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_DECIMAL:
    841. 

  841.                              // decimal types cannot be parsed as floats because
    842. 

  842.                              // V8 Numbers have less precision than some MySQL Decimals
    843. 

  843. 1                            ret = parseFloat(o);
    844. 

  844. 1                            break;
    845. 

  845.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_TINY_BLOB:
    846. 

  846.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_MEDIUM_BLOB:
    847. 

  847.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_LONG_BLOB:
    848. 

  848.                          case this.FIELD_TYPE_BLOB:
    849. 

  849. 68                            ret = new Buffer(o);
    850. 

  850. 68                            break;
    851. 

  851.                      }
    852. 

  852.                  }
    853. 

  853. 465                return ret;
    854. 

  854.              }, type);
    855. 

  855.          },
    856.

    50. 

  50.  
    51. 

  51.          /**
    52. 

  52.           * Forces the reload of the data for a particular model instance.  The Promise returned is resolved with the
    53. 

  53.           * model.
    54. 

  54.           *
    55. 

  55.           * @example
    56. 

  56.           *
    57. 

  57.           * myModel.reload().then(function(model){
    58. 

  58.           *    //model === myModel
    59. 

  59.           * });
    60. 

  60.           *
    61. 

  61.           * @return {comb.Promise} resolved with the model instance.
    62. 

  62.           */
    63. 

  63.          __reload:function () {
    64. 

  64. 1319            if (!this.__isNew) {
    65. 

  65. 1319                return this.dataset.naked().filter(this._getPrimaryKeyQuery()).one().chain(function (values) {
    66. 

  66. 1319                    this.__setFromDb(values, true);
    67. 

  67. 1319                    return this;
    68. 

  68.                  }.bind(this));
    69. 

  69.              } else {
    70. 

  70. 0                return when(this);
    71. 

  71.              }
    72. 

  72.          },
    73. 

  73.  
    74. 

  74.          /**
    75. 

  75.           * This method removes the instance of the model. If the model {@link patio.Model#isNew} then the promise is
    76. 

  76.           * resolved with a 0 indicating no rows were affected. Otherwise the model is removed, primary keys are cleared
    77. 

  77.           * and the model's isNew flag is set to true.
    78. 

  78.           *
    79. 

  79.           * @example
    80. 

  80.           * myModel.remove().then(function(){
    81. 

  81.           *     //model is deleted
    82. 

  82.           *     assert.isTrue(myModel.isNew);
    83. 

  83.           * });
    84. 

  84.           *
    85. 

  85.           * //dont use a transaction to remove this model
    86. 

  86.           * myModel.remove({transaction : false}).then(function(){
    87. 

  87.           *     //model is deleted
    88. 

  88.           *     assert.isTrue(myModel.isNew);
    89. 

  89.           * });
    90. 

  90.           *
    91. 

  91.           * @param {Object} [options] additional options.
    92. 

  92.           * @param {Boolean} [options.transaction] boolean indicating if a transaction should be used when
    93. 

  93.           * removing the model.
    94. 

  94.           *
    95. 

  95.           * @return {comb.Promise} called back after the deletion is successful.
    96. 

  96.           */
    97. 

  97.          remove:function (options) {
    98. 

  98. 537            if (this.synced) {
    99. 

  99. 537                if (!this.__isNew) {
    100. 

  100. 537                    return this._checkTransaction(options, hitch(this, function () {
    101. 

  101. 537                        return serial([
    102. 

  102.                              this._hook.bind(this, "pre", "remove", [options]),
    103. 

  103.                              this._remove.bind(this, options),
    104. 

  104.                              this._hook.bind(this, "post", "remove", [options]),
    105. 

  105.                              function () {
    106. 

  106. 537                                this._clearPrimaryKeys();
    107. 

  107. 537                                this.__isNew = true;
    108. 

  108. 537                                if (this._static.emitOnRemove) {
    109. 

  109. 537                                    this.emit("remove", this);
    110. 

  110. 537                                    this._static.emit("remove", this);
    111. 

  111.                                  }

  113.                          ]).chain(this);
    114. 

  114.                      }));
    115.

  116. 0                    return when(0);
    117.

  119. 0                throw new ModelError("Model " + this.tableName + " has not been synced");

  121.          },
    122.

  143.          _updateReload:function (options) {

  144. 162            options = options || {};

  145. 162            options || (options = {});

  146. 162            var reload = isBoolean(options.reload) ? options.reload : this._static.reloadOnUpdate;
    147. 

  147. 162            return reload ? this.__reload() : when(this);
    148. 

  148.          },
    149. 

  149.  
    150. 

  150.          /**
    151. 

  151.           * Updates a model. This action checks if the model is not new and values have changed.
    152. 

  152.           * If the model is new then the {@link patio.Model#save} action is called.
    153. 

  153.           *
    154. 

  154.           * When updating a model you can pass values you want set as the first argument.
    155. 

  155.           *
    156. 

  156.           * {@code
    157. 

  157.           *
    158. 

  158.           * someModel.update({
    159. 

  159.           *      myVal1 : "newValue1",
    160. 

  160.           *      myVal2 : "newValue2",
    161. 

  161.           *      myVal3 : "newValue3"
    162. 

  162.           * }).then(function(){
    163. 

  163.           *      //do something
    164. 

  164.           * }, errorHandler);
    165. 

  165.           *
    166. 

  166.           * }
    167. 

  167.           *
    168. 

  168.           * Or you can set values on the model directly
    169. 

  169.           *
    170. 

  170.           * {@code
    171. 

  171.           *
    172. 

  172.           * someModel.myVal1 = "newValue1";
    173. 

  173.           * someModel.myVal2 = "newValue2";
    174. 

  174.           * someModel.myVal3 = "newValue3";
    175. 

  175.           *
    176. 

  176.           * //update model with current values
    177. 

  177.           * someModel.update().then(function(){
    178. 

  178.           *     //do something
    179. 

  179.           * });
    180. 

  180.           *
    181. 

  181.           * }
    182. 

  182.           *
    183. 

  183.           * Update also accepts an options object as the second argument allowing the overriding of default behavior.
    184. 

  184.           *
    185. 

  185.           * To override <code>useTransactions</code> you can set the <code>transaction</code> option.
    186. 

  186.           *
    187. 

  187.           * {@code
    188. 

  188.           * someModel.update(null, {transaction : false});
    189. 

  189.           * }
    190. 

  190.           *
    191. 

  191.           * You can also override the <code>reloadOnUpdate</code> property by setting the <code>reload</code> option.
    192. 

  192.           * {@code
    193. 

  193.           * someModel.update(null, {reload : false});
    194. 

  194.           * }
    195. 

  195.           *
    196. 

  196.           * @param {Object} [vals] optional values hash to set on the model before saving.
    197. 

  197.           * @param {Object} [options] additional options.
    198. 

  198.           * @param {Boolean} [options.transaction] boolean indicating if a transaction should be used when
    199. 

  199.           * updating the model.
    200. 

  200.           * @param {Boolean} [options.reload] boolean indicating if the model should be reloaded after the update. This will take
    201. 

  201.           * precedence over {@link patio.Model.reloadOnUpdate}
    202. 

  202.           *
    203. 

  203.           * @return {comb.Promise} resolved when the update action has completed.
    204. 

  204.           */
    205. 

  205.          update:function (vals, options) {
    206. 

  206. 158            if (this.synced) {
    207. 

  207. 158                if (!this.__isNew) {
    208. 

  208. 158                    return this._checkTransaction(options, hitch(this, function () {
    209. 

  209. 158                        if (isHash(vals)) {
    210. 

  210. 107                            this.__set(vals);
    211. 

  211.                          }
    212. 

  212. 158                        var saveChange = !isEmpty(this.__changed);
    213. 

  213. 158                        return serial([
    214. 

  214.                              this._hook.bind(this, "pre", "update", [options]),
    215. 

  215.                              function () {
    216. 

  216. 158                                return saveChange ? this._update(options) : null;
    217. 

  217.                              }.bind(this),
    218. 

  218.                              this._hook.bind(this, "post", "update", [options]),
    219. 

  219.                              this._updateReload.bind(this, options),
    220. 

  220.                              function () {
    221. 

  221. 158                                if (this._static.emitOnUpdate) {
    222. 

  222. 158                                    this.emit("update", this);
    223. 

  223. 158                                    this._static.emit("update", this);
    224. 

  224.                                  }
    225. 

  225.                              }.bind(this)
    226. 

  226.                          ]).chain(this);
    227. 

  227.  
    228. 

  228.                      }));
    229. 

  229. 0                } else if (this.__isNew && this.__isChanged) {
    230. 

  230. 0                    return this.save(vals, options);
    231. 

  231.                  } else {
    232. 

  232. 0                    return when(this);
    233. 

  233.                  }
    234. 

  234.              } else {
    235. 

  235. 0                throw new ModelError("Model " + this.tableName + " has not been synced");
    236. 

  236.              }
    237. 

  237.          },
    238. 

  238.  
    239. 

  239.          _update:function (options) {
    240. 

  240. 139            var ret = this.dataset.filter(this._getPrimaryKeyQuery()).update(this.__changed);
    241. 

  241. 139            this.__changed = {};
    242. 

  242. 139            return ret;
    243. 

  243.          },
    244. 

  244.  
    245. 

  245.          /**
    246. 

  246.           * Saves a model. This action checks if the model is new and values have changed.
    247. 

  247.           * If the model is not new then the {@link patio.Model#update} action is called.
    248. 

  248.           *
    249. 

  249.           * When saving a model you can pass values you want set as the first argument.
    250. 

  250.           *
    251. 

  251.           * {@code
    252. 

  252.           *
    253. 

  253.           * someModel.save({
    254. 

  254.           *      myVal1 : "newValue1",
    255. 

  255.           *      myVal2 : "newValue2",
    256. 

  256.           *      myVal3 : "newValue3"
    257. 

  257.           * }).then(function(){
    258. 

  258.           *      //do something
    259. 

  259.           * }, errorHandler);
    260. 

  260.           *
    261. 

  261.           * }
    262. 

  262.           *
    263. 

  263.           * Or you can set values on the model directly
    264. 

  264.           *
    265. 

  265.           * {@code
    266. 

  266.           *
    267. 

  267.           * someModel.myVal1 = "newValue1";
    268. 

  268.           * someModel.myVal2 = "newValue2";
    269. 

  269.           * someModel.myVal3 = "newValue3";
    270. 

  270.           *
    271. 

  271.           * //update model with current values
    272. 

  272.           * someModel.save().then(function(){
    273. 

  273.           *     //do something
    274. 

  274.           * });
    275. 

  275.           *
    276. 

  276.           * }
    277. 

  277.           *
    278. 

  278.           * Save also accepts an options object as the second argument allowing the overriding of default behavior.
    279. 

  279.           *
    280. 

  280.           * To override <code>useTransactions</code> you can set the <code>transaction</code> option.
    281. 

  281.           *
    282. 

  282.           * {@code
    283. 

  283.           * someModel.save(null, {transaction : false});
    284. 

  284.           * }
    285. 

  285.           *
    286. 

  286.           * You can also override the <code>reloadOnSave</code> property by setting the <code>reload</code> option.
    287. 

  287.           * {@code
    288. 

  288.           * someModel.save(null, {reload : false});
    289. 

  289.           * }
    290. 

  290.           *
    291. 

  291.           *
    292. 

  292.           * @param {Object} [vals] optional values hash to set on the model before saving.
    293. 

  293.           * @param {Object} [options] additional options.
    294. 

  294.           * @param {Boolean} [options.transaction] boolean indicating if a transaction should be used when
    295. 

  295.           * saving the model.
    296. 

  296.           * @param {Boolean} [options.reload] boolean indicating if the model should be reloaded after the save. This will take
    297. 

  297.           * precedence over {@link patio.Model.reloadOnSave}
    298. 

  298.           *
    299. 

  299.           * @return {comb.Promise} resolved when the save action has completed.
    300. 

  300.           */
    301. 

  301.          save:function (vals, options) {
    302. 

  302. 1233            if (this.synced) {
    303. 

  303. 1233                if (this.__isNew) {
    304. 

  304. 1185                    return this._checkTransaction(options, hitch(this, function () {
    305. 

  305. 1185                        if (isHash(vals)) {
    306. 

  306. 0                            this.__set(vals);
    307. 

  307.                          }
    308. 

  308. 1185                        return serial([
    309. 

  309.                              this._hook.bind(this, "pre", "save", [options]),
    310. 

  310.                              this._save.bind(this, options),
    311. 

  311.                              this._hook.bind(this, "post", "save", [options]),
    312. 

  312.                              this._saveReload.bind(this, options),
    313. 

  313.                              function () {
    314. 

  314. 1141                                if (this._static.emitOnSave) {
    315. 

  315. 1141                                    this.emit("save", this);
    316. 

  316. 1141                                    this._static.emit("save", this);
    317. 

  317.                                  }
    318. 

  318.                              }.bind(this)
    319. 

  319.                          ]).chain(this);
    320. 

  320.                      }));
    321. 

  321.                  } else {
    322. 

  322. 48                    return this.update(vals, options);
    323. 

  323.                  }
    324. 

  324.              } else {
    325. 

  325. 0                throw new ModelError("Model " + this.tableName + " has not been synced");
    326. 

  326.              }
    327. 

  327.          },
    328. 

  328.  
    329. 

  329.          _save:function (options) {
    330. 

  330. 1136            var pk = this._static.primaryKey[0];
    331. 

  331. 1136            return this.dataset.insert(this._toObject()).chain(function (id) {
    332. 

  332. 1136                this.__ignore = true;
    333. 

  333. 1136                if (id) {
    334. 

  334. 1136                    this[pk] = id;
    335. 

  335.                  }
    336. 

  336. 1136                this.__ignore = false;
    337. 

  337. 1136                this.__isNew = false;
    338. 

  338. 1136                this.__isChanged = false;
    339. 

  339. 1136                return this;
    340.

    341. 

  341.          },

  378.      static:{

  382.          /**

    384.

  386.          emitOnSave:true,

    397. 

  397.           */
    398. 

  398.          emitOnRemove:true,
    399. 

  399.  
    400. 

  400.          /**
    401. 

  401.           * Retrieves a record by the primaryKey/s of a table.
    402. 

  402.           *
    403. 

  403.           * @example
    404. 

  404.           *
    405. 

  405.           * var User = patio.getModel("user");
    406. 

  406.           *
    407. 

  407.           * User.findById(1).then(function(userOne){
    408. 

  408.           *
    409. 

  409.           * });
    410. 

  410.           *
    411. 

  411.           * //assume the primary key is a compostie of first_name and last_name
    412. 

  412.           * User.findById(["greg", "yukon"]).then(function(userOne){
    413. 

  413.           *
    414. 

  414.           * });
    415. 

  415.           *
    416. 

  416.           *
    417. 

  417.           * @param {*} id the primary key of the record to find.
    418.

    419. 

  419.           * @return {comb.Promise} called back with the record or null if one is not found.
    420. 

  420.           */
    421. 

  421.          findById:function (id) {
    422. 

  422. 3            var pk = this.primaryKey;
    423. 

  423. 3            pk = pk.length == 1 ? pk[0] : pk;
    424. 

  424. 3            var q = {};
    425. 

  425. 3            if (isArray(id) && isArray(pk)) {
    426. 

  426. 0                if (id.length === pk.length) {
    427. 

  427. 0                    pk.forEach(function (k, i) {
    428. 

  428. 0                        q[k] = id[i];
    429. 

  429.                      });
    430. 

  430.                  } else {
    431. 

  431. 0                    throw new ModelError("findById : ids length does not equal the primaryKeys length.");
    432. 

  432.                  }
    433. 

  433.              } else {
    434. 

  434. 3                q[pk] = id;
    435. 

  435.              }
    436. 

  436. 3            return this.filter(q).one();
    437. 

  437.          },
    438. 

  438.  
    439. 

  439.          /**
    440. 

  440.           * Finds a single model according to the supplied filter.
    441. 

  441.           * See {@link patio.Dataset#filter} for filter options.
    442. 

  442.           *
    443. 

  443.           *
    444. 

  444.           *
    445.

    446.
