  447.          find:function (id) {
    448. 

  448. 0            return this.filter.apply(this, arguments).first();
    449. 

  449.          },
    450. 

  450.  
    451. 

  451.          /**
    452. 

  452.           * Finds a single model according to the supplied filter.
    453. 

  453.           * See {@link patio.Dataset#filter} for filter options. If the model
    454. 

  454.           * does not exist then a new one is created as passed back.
    455. 

  455.           * @param q
    456. 

  456.           */
    457. 

  457.          findOrCreate:function (q) {
    458. 

  458. 0            return this.find(q).chain(hitch(this, function (res) {
    459. 

  459. 0                return res || this.create(q);
    460. 

  460.              }));
    461. 

  461.          },
    462. 

  462.  
    463. 

  463.          /**
    464. 

  464.           * Update multiple rows with a set of values.
    465. 

  465.           *
    466. 

  466.           * @example
    467. 

  467.           * var User = patio.getModel("user");
    468. 

  468.           *
    469. 

  469.           * //BEGIN
    470. 

  470.           * //UPDATE `user` SET `password` = NULL WHERE (`last_accessed` <= '2011-01-27')
    471. 

  471.           * //COMMIT
    472. 

  472.           * User.update({password : null}, function(){
    473. 

  473.           *  return this.lastAccessed.lte(comb.date.add(new Date(), "year", -1));
    474. 

  474.           * });
    475. 

  475.           * //same as
    476. 

  476.           * User.update({password : null}, {lastAccess : {lte : comb.date.add(new Date(), "year", -1)}});
    477. 

  477.           *
    478. 

  478.           * //UPDATE `user` SET `password` = NULL WHERE (`last_accessed` <= '2011-01-27')
    479. 

  479.           * User.update({password : null}, function(){
    480. 

  480.           *  return this.lastAccessed.lte(comb.date.add(new Date(), "year", -1));
    481. 

  481.           * }, {transaction : false});
    482. 

  482.           *
    483. 

  483.           * @param {Object} vals a hash of values to update. See {@link patio.Dataset#update}.
    484. 

  484.           * @param query a filter to apply to the UPDATE.  See {@link patio.Dataset#filter}.
    485. 

  485.           *
    486. 

  486.           * @param {Object} [options] additional options.
    487. 

  487.           * @param {Boolean} [options.transaction] boolean indicating if a transaction should be used when
    488. 

  488.           * updating the models.
    489. 

  489.           *
    490. 

  490.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the update statement has completed.
    491. 

  491.           */
    492. 

  492.          update:function (vals, /*?object*/query, options) {
    493. 

  493. 2            options = options || {};
    494. 

  494. 2            var args = comb(arguments).toArray();
    495. 

  495. 2            return this._checkTransaction(options, hitch(this, function () {
    496. 

  496. 2                var dataset = this.dataset;
    497. 

  497. 2                if (!isUndefined(query)) {
    498. 

  498. 2                    dataset = dataset.filter(query);
    499. 

  499.                  }
    500. 

  500. 2                return dataset.update(vals);
    501. 

  501.              }));
    502. 

  502.          },
    503. 

  503.  
    504. 

  504.          /**
    505. 

  505.           * Remove(delete) models. This can be used to do a mass delete of models.
    506. 

  506.           *
    507. 

  507.           * @example
    508. 

  508.           * var User = patio.getModel("user");
    509. 

  509.           *
    510. 

  510.           * //remove all users
    511. 

  511.           * User.remove();
    512. 

  512.           *
    513. 

  513.           * //remove all users who's names start with a.
    514. 

  514.           * User.remove({name : /A%/i});
    515. 

  515.           *
    516. 

  516.           * //remove all users who's names start with a, without a transaction.
    517. 

  517.           * User.remove({name : /A%/i}, {transaction : false});
    518. 

  518.           *
    519. 

  519.           * @param {Object} [q] query to filter the rows to remove. See {@link patio.Dataset#filter}.
    520. 

  520.           * @param {Object} [options] additional options.
    521. 

  521.           * @param {Boolean} [options.transaction] boolean indicating if a transaction should be used when
    522. 

  522.           * removing the models.
    523. 

  523.           * @param {Boolean} [options.load=true] boolean set to prevent the loading of each model. This is more efficient
    524. 

  524.           * but the pre/post remove hooks not be notified of the deletion.
    525. 

  525.           *
    526. 

  526.           * @return {comb.Promise} called back when the removal completes.
    527. 

  527.           */
    528. 

  528.          remove:function (q, options) {
    529. 

  529. 377            options = options || {};
    530. 

  530. 377            var loadEach = isBoolean(options.load) ? options.load : true;
    531. 

  531.              //first find all records so we call alert the middleware for each model
    532. 

  532. 377            return this._checkTransaction(options, hitch(this, function () {
    533. 

  533. 377                var ds = this.dataset;
    534. 

  534. 377                ds = ds.filter.call(ds, q);
    535. 

  535. 377                if (loadEach) {
    536. 

  536. 377                    return ds.map(function (r) {
    537. 

  537.                          //todo this sucks find a better way!
    538. 

  538. 447                        return r.remove(options);
    539. 

  539.                      });
    540. 

  540.                  } else {
    541. 

  541. 0                    return ds.remove();
    542. 

  542.                  }
    543. 

  543.              }));
    544. 

  544.          },
    545. 

  545.  
    546. 

  546.          /**
    547. 

  547.           * Similar to remove but takes an id or an array for a composite key.
    548. 

  548.           *
    549. 

  549.           * @example
    550. 

  550.           *
    551. 

  551.           * User.removeById(1);
    552. 

  552.           *
    553. 

  553.           * @param id id or an array for a composite key, to find the model by
    554.

    556.

    557. 

  557.           *
    558.

    559.

    560. 

  560.          removeById:function (id, options) {
    561. 

  561. 0            return this._checkTransaction(options, hitch(this, function () {

  562. 0                return this.findById(id).chain(function (model) {

  564. 0                        return model.remove(options);

    566. 

  566.                  });

  568.          },
    569. 

  569.  
    570. 

  570.          /**

    599.

    609.

    610. 

  610.           *          classYear:"Freshman"
    611. 

  611.           *      }
    612. 

  612.           * ]).then(function(users){
    613. 

  613.           *     //work with the users
    614. 

  614.           * });
    615. 

  615.           *
    616. 

  616.           * Save a single record
    617. 

  617.           * MyModel.save(m1);
    618. 

  618.           *
    619. 

  619.           * @param {patio.Model|Object|patio.Model[]|Object[]} record the record/s to save.
    620. 

  620.           * @param {Object} [options] additional options.
    621. 

  621.           * @param {Boolean} [options.transaction] boolean indicating if a transaction should be used when
    622. 

  622.           * saving the models.
    623. 

  623.           *
    624. 

  624.           * @return {comb.Promise} called back with the saved record/s.
    625. 

  625.           */
    626. 

  626.          save:function (items, options) {
    627. 

  627. 40            options = options || {};
    628. 

  628. 40            var isArr = isArray(items);
    629. 

  629. 40            return this._checkTransaction(options, hitch(this, function () {
    630. 

  630. 40                return asyncArray(items).map(function (o) {
    631. 

  631. 537                    if (!isInstanceOf(o, this)) {
    632. 

  632. 57                        o = new this(o);
    633. 

  633.                      }
    634. 

  634. 537                    return o.save(null, options);
    635. 

  635.                  }, this).chain(function (res) {
    636. 

  636. 40                        return isArr ? res : res[0];
    637. 

  637.                      });
    638. 

  638.              }));
    639. 

  639.          }
    640. 

  640.      }
    641. 

  641.  }).as(exports, "QueryPlugin");
    642. 

  642.  
    643. 

  643. 1Dataset.ACTION_METHODS.concat(Dataset.QUERY_METHODS).forEach(function (m) {
    644. 

  644. 162    if (!QueryPlugin[m]) {

  645. 98        QueryPlugin[m] = function () {
    646. 

  646. 358            if (this.synced) {
    647. 

  647. 358                var ds = this.dataset;
    648. 

  648. 358                return ds[m].apply(ds, arguments);
    649. 

  649.              } else {
    650. 

  650. 0                throw new ModelError("Model " + this.tableName + " has not been synced");
    651. 

  651.              }
    652. 

  652.          }
    653. 

  653.      }
    654. 

  654.  });

  79.              url:function () {
    80. 

  80. 1                return this.uri;
    81. 

  81.              }
    82. 

  82.          }
    83. 

  83.      },
    84. 

  84.  
    85. 

  85.      "static":{
    86. 

  86.          /**@lends patio.Database*/
    87. 

  87.  
    88. 

  88.          /**
    89. 

  89.           * Creates a connection to a Database see {@link patio#createConnection}.
    90. 

  90.           */
    91. 

  91.          connect:function (connectionString, opts) {
    92. 

  92. 41            opts = opts || {};
    93. 

  93. 41            if (isString(connectionString)) {
    94. 

  94. 41                var url = URL.parse(connectionString, true);
    95. 

  95. 41                if (url.auth) {
    96. 

  96. 40                    var parts = url.auth.split(":");
    97. 

  97. 40                    if (!opts.user) {
    98. 

  98. 40                        opts.user = parts[0];
    99. 

  99.                      }
    100. 

  100. 40                    if (!opts.password) {
    101. 

  101. 40                        opts.password = parts[1];
    102. 

  102.                      }
    103. 

  103.                  }
    104. 

  104. 41                opts.type = url.protocol.replace(":", "");
    105. 

  105. 41                opts.host = url.hostname;
    106. 

  106. 41                if (url.pathname) {
    107. 

  107. 41                    var path = url.pathname;
    108. 

  108. 41                    var pathParts = path.split("/").slice(1);
    109. 

  109. 41                    if (pathParts.length >= 1) {
    110. 

  110. 41                        opts.database = pathParts[0];
    111. 

  111.                      }
    112. 

  112.                  }
    113. 

  113. 41                opts = merge(opts, url.query, {uri:connectionString});
    114. 

  114.              } else {
    115. 

  115. 0                opts = merge({}, connectionString, opts);
    116. 

  116.              }
    117. 

  117. 41            if (opts && isHash(opts) && (opts.adapter || opts.type)) {
    118. 

  118.  
    119. 

  119. 41                var type = (opts.type = opts.adapter || opts.type);
    120. 

  120. 41                var Adapter = ADAPTERS[type];
    121. 

  121. 41                if (Adapter) {
    122. 

  122. 41                    var adapter = new Adapter(opts);
    123. 

  123. 41                    this.DATABASES.push(adapter);
    124. 

  124. 41                    return adapter;
    125. 

  125.                  } else {
    126. 

  126. 0                    throw DatabaseError(type + " adapter was not found");
    127. 

  127.                  }
    128. 

  128.              } else {
    129. 

  129. 0                throw new DatabaseError("Options required when connecting.");
    130. 

  130.              }
    131. 

  131.          },
    132. 

  132.  
    133. 

  133.          setAdapterType:function (type) {
    134. 

  134. 5            type = type.toLowerCase();
    135. 

  135. 5            this.type = type;
    136. 

  136. 5            ADAPTERS[type] = this;
    137. 

  137.          },
    138. 

  138.  
    139. 

  139.          disconnect:function (cb) {
    140. 

  140. 41            var dbs = this.DATABASES;
    141. 

  141. 41            var ret = new PromiseList(dbs.map(function (d) {
    142. 

  142. 40                return d.disconnect();
    143. 

  143.              }), true);
    144. 

  144. 41            dbs.length = 0;
    145. 

  145. 41            ret.classic(cb);
    146. 

  146. 41            return ret.promise();
    147. 

  147.          },
    148. 

  148.  
    149. 

  149.          ADAPTERS:ADAPTERS
    150. 

  150.      }
    151.

  20. 1var fetch = {
    21. 

  21.      LAZY:"lazy",
    22. 

  22.      EAGER:"eager"
    23. 

  23.  };
    24. 

  24.  
    25. 

  25.  
    26. 

  26.  /**
    27. 

  27.   * @class
    28. 

  28.   * Base class for all associations.
    29. 

  29.   *
    30. 

  30.   * </br>
    31. 

  31.   * <b>NOT to be instantiated directly</b>
    32. 

  32.   * Its just documented for reference.
    33. 

  33.   *
    34. 

  34.   * @constructs
    35. 

  35.   * @param {Object} options
    36. 

  36.   * @param {String} options.model a string to look up the model that we are associated with
    37. 

  37.   * @param {Function} options.filter  a callback to find association if a filter is defined then
    38. 

  38.   *                                    the association is read only
    39. 

  39.   * @param {Object} options.key object with left key and right key
    40. 

  40.   * @param {String|Object} options.orderBy<String|Object> - how to order our association @see Dataset.order
    41. 

  41.   * @param {fetch.EAGER|fetch.LAZY} options.fetchType the fetch type of the model if fetch.Eager is supplied then
    42. 

  42.   *                                    the associations are automatically filled, if fetch.Lazy is supplied
    43. 

  43.   *                                    then a promise is returned and is called back with the loaded models
    44. 

  44.   * @property {Model} model the model associatied with this association.
    45. 

  45.   * @name Association
    46. 

  46.   * @memberOf patio.associations
    47. 

  47.   * */
    48.

    366. 

  366.           * @param {Function} next function to pass control up the middleware stack.
    367. 

  367.           * @param {_Association} self reference to the Association that is being called.
    368. 

  368.           */
    369. 

  369.          _preLoad:function (next, model) {
    370. 

  370. 1588            next();
    371. 

  371.          },
    372. 

  372.  
    373. 

  373.          /**
    374.

    384.

  389.          _setter:function (val, model) {

  417.          _toModel:function (val, fromDb) {

    428. 

  428.  
    429. 

  429.          /**
    430. 

  430.           * Method to inject functionality into a model. This method alters the model
    431. 

  431.           * to prepare it for associations, and initializes all required middleware calls
    432. 

  432.           * to fulfill requirements needed to loaded the associations.
    433. 

  433.           *
    434. 

  434.           * @param {Model} parent the model that is having an associtaion set on it.
    435. 

  435.           * @param {String} name the name of the association.
    436. 

  436.           */
    437. 

  437.          inject:function (parent, name) {
    438. 

  438. 55            this.name = name;
    439. 

  439. 55            var self = this;
    440. 

  440. 55            this.parent = parent;
    441. 

  441. 55            var parentProto = parent.prototype;
    442. 

  442. 55            parentProto.__defineGetter__(name, function () {
    443. 

  443. 616                return  self._getter(this);
    444. 

  444.              });
    445. 

  445. 55            parentProto.__defineGetter__(this.associatedDatasetName, function () {
    446. 

  446. 146                return  self._filter(this);
    447. 

  447.              });
    448. 

  448.  
    449. 

  449. 55            if (!this.readOnly && this.createSetter) {
    450. 

  450.                  //define a setter because we arent read only
    451. 

  451. 55                parentProto.__defineSetter__(name, function (vals) {
    452. 

  452. 139                    self._setter(vals, this);
    453. 

  453.                  });
    454. 

  454.              }
    455. 

  455.  
    456. 

  456.              //set up all callbacks
    457. 

  457. 55            ["pre", "post"].forEach(function (op) {
    458. 

  458. 110                ["save", "update", "remove", "load"].forEach(function (type) {
    459. 

  459. 440                    parent[op](type, function (next) {
    460. 

  460. 5646                        return self["_" + op + type.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + type.slice(1)](next, this);
    461. 

  461.                      });
    462. 

  462.                  }, this);
    463. 

  463.              }, this);
    464. 

  464.          },
    465.

  277. 381                if (!this.__joinTableDataset) {
    278. 

  278. 18                    var ds = this.__joinTableDataset = this.model.dataset.db.from(this.joinTableName), model = this.model, options = this.__opts;
    279. 

  279. 18                    var identifierInputMethod = isUndefined(options.identifierInputMethod) ? model.identifierInputMethod : options.identifierInputMethod,
    280. 

  280.                          identifierOutputMethod = isUndefined(options.identifierOutputMethod) ? model.identifierOutputMethod : options.identifierOutputMethod;
    281. 

  281. 18                    if (identifierInputMethod) {
    282. 

  282. 14                        ds.identifierInputMethod = identifierInputMethod;
    283. 

  283.                      }
    284. 

  284. 18                    if (identifierOutputMethod) {
    285. 

  285. 14                        ds.identifierOutputMethod = identifierOutputMethod;
    286. 

  286.                      }
    287. 

  287.                  }
    288. 

  288. 381                return this.__joinTableDataset;
    289. 

  289.              },
    290. 

  290.  
    291. 

  291.              defaultJoinTable:function () {
    292. 

  292. 18                var ret;
    293. 

  293. 18                var recip = this.model._findAssociation(this);
    294. 

  294. 18                if (recip && recip.length) {
    295. 

  295. 18                    var names = [pluralize(this._model), pluralize(recip[1]._model)].sort();
    296. 

  296. 18                    names[1] = names[1].charAt(0).toUpperCase() + names[1].substr(1);
    297. 

  297. 18                    ret = names.join("");
    298. 

  298.                  }
    299. 

  299. 18                return ret;
    300. 

  300.              }
    301. 

  301.          }
    302. 

  302.      }
    303. 

  303.  });
    304.

  30. 1var LOGGER = comb.logger("patio.Dataset");

  31. 1define([actions, graph, features, query, sql], {
    32. 

  32.      instance:{
    33. 

  33.  
    34. 

  34.          /**@lends patio.Dataset.prototype*/
    35. 

  35.  
    36. 

  36.          /**
    37. 

  37.           * Class that is used for querying/retirving datasets from a database.
    38. 

  38.           *
    39. 

  39.           * <p> Dynamically genertated methods include
    40. 

  40.           * <ul>
    41. 

  41.           *     <li>Join methods from {@link patio.Dataset.CONDITIONED_JOIN_TYPES} and
    42. 

  42.           *         {@link  patio.Dataset.UNCONDITIONED_JOIN_TYPES}, these methods handle the type call
    43. 

  43.           *         to {@link patio.Dataset#joinTable}, so to invoke include all arguments that
    44. 

  44.           *         {@link patio.Dataset#joinTable} requires except the type parameter. The default list includes.
    45. 

  45.           *         <ul>
    46. 

  46.           *             <li>Conditioned join types that accept conditions.
    47. 

  47.           *                  <ul>
    48. 

  48.           *                      <li>inner - INNER JOIN</li>
    49. 

  49.           *                      <li>fullOuter - FULL OUTER</li>
    50. 

  50.           *                      <li>rightOuter - RIGHT OUTER JOIN</li>
    51. 

  51.           *                      <li>leftOuter - LEFT OUTER JOIN</li>
    52. 

  52.           *                      <li>full - FULL JOIN</li>
    53. 

  53.           *                      <li>right - RIGHT JOIN</li>
    54. 

  54.           *                      <li>left - LEFT JOIN</li>
    55. 

  55.           *                  </ul>
    56. 

  56.           *             </li>
    57. 

  57.           *             <li>Unconditioned join types that do not accept join conditions
    58. 

  58.           *                  <ul>
    59. 

  59.           *                      <li>natural - NATURAL JOIN</li>
    60. 

  60.           *                      <li>naturalLeft - NATURAL LEFT JOIN</li>
    61. 

  61.           *                      <li>naturalRight - NATURAL RIGHT JOIN</li>
    62. 

  62.           *                      <li>naturalFull - NATURA FULLL JOIN</li>
    63. 

  63.           *                      <li>cross - CROSS JOIN</li>
    64. 

  64.           *                  </ul>
    65. 

  65.           *             </li>
    66. 

  66.           *         </ul>
    67. 

  67.           *      </li>
    68. 

  68.           *  </li>
    69. 

  69.           * </ul>
    70. 

  70.           *
    71. 

  71.           * <p>
    72. 

  72.           *     <h4>Features:</h4>
    73. 

  73.           *     <p>
    74. 

  74.           *           Features that a particular {@link patio.Dataset} supports are shown in the example below.
    75. 

  75.           *           If you wish to implement an adapter please override these values depending on the database that
    76. 

  76.           *           you are developing the adapter for.
    77. 

  77.           *      </p>
    78. 

  78.           *      <pre class="code">
    79. 

  79.           *          var ds = DB.from("test");
    80. 

  80.           *
    81. 

  81.           *          //The default values returned
    82. 

  82.           *
    83. 

  83.           *          //Whether this dataset quotes identifiers.
    84. 

  84.           *          //Whether this dataset quotes identifiers.
    85. 

  85.           *          ds.quoteIdentifiers //=>true
    86. 

  86.           *
    87. 

  87.           *          //Whether this dataset will provide accurate number of rows matched for
    88. 

  88.           *          //delete and update statements.  Accurate in this case is the number of
    89. 

  89.           *          //rows matched by the dataset's filter.
    90. 

  90.           *          ds.providesAccurateRowsMatched; //=>true
    91. 

  91.           *
    92. 

  92.           *          //Times Whether the dataset requires SQL standard datetimes (false by default,
    93. 

  93.           *          // as most allow strings with ISO 8601 format).
    94. 

  94.           *          ds.requiresSqlStandardDate; //=>false
    95. 

  95.           *
    96. 

  96.           *          //Whether the dataset supports common table expressions (the WITH clause).
    97. 

  97.           *          ds.supportsCte; //=>true
    98. 

  98.           *
    99. 

  99.           *          //Whether the dataset supports the DISTINCT ON clause, false by default.
    100. 

  100.           *          ds.supportsDistinctOn; //=>false
    101. 

  101.           *
    102. 

  102.           *          //Whether the dataset supports the INTERSECT and EXCEPT compound operations, true by default.
    103. 

  103.           *          ds.supportsIntersectExcept; //=>true
    104. 

  104.           *
    105. 

  105.           *          //Whether the dataset supports the INTERSECT ALL and EXCEPT ALL compound operations, true by default
    106. 

  106.           *          ds.supportsIntersectExceptAll; //=>true
    107. 

  107.           *
    108. 

  108.           *          //Whether the dataset supports the IS TRUE syntax.
    109. 

  109.           *          ds.supportsIsTrue; //=>true
    110. 

  110.           *
    111. 

  111.           *          //Whether the dataset supports the JOIN table USING (column1, ...) syntax.
    112. 

  112.           *          ds.supportsJoinUsing; //=>true
    113. 

  113.           *
    114. 

  114.           *          //Whether modifying joined datasets is supported.
    115. 

  115.           *          ds.supportsModifyingJoin; //=>false
    116. 

  116.           *
    117. 

  117.           *          //Whether the IN/NOT IN operators support multiple columns when an
    118. 

  118.           *          ds.supportsMultipleColumnIn; //=>true
    119. 

  119.           *
    120. 

  120.           *          //Whether the dataset supports timezones in literal timestamps
    121. 

  121.           *          ds.supportsTimestampTimezone; //=>false
    122. 

  122.           *
    123. 

  123.           *          //Whether the dataset supports fractional seconds in literal timestamps
    124. 

  124.           *          ds.supportsTimestampUsecs; //=>true
    125. 

  125.           *
    126. 

  126.           *          //Whether the dataset supports window functions.
    127. 

  127.           *          ds.supportsWindowFunctions; //=>false
    128. 

  128.           *       </pre>
    129. 

  129.           * <p>
    130. 

  130.           * <p>
    131. 

  131.           *     <h4>Actions</h4>
    132. 

  132.           *     <p>
    133. 

  133.           *         Each dataset does not actually send any query to the database until an action method has
    134. 

  134.           *         been called upon it(with the exception of {@link patio.Dataset#graph} because columns
    135. 

  135.           *         from the other table might need retrived in order to set up the graph). Each action
    136. 

  136.           *         returns a <i>comb.Promise</i> that will be resolved with the result or errback, it is important
    137. 

  137.           *         that you account for errors otherwise it can be difficult to track down issues.
    138. 

  138.           *         The list of action methods is:
    139. 

  139.           *         <ul>
    140. 

  140.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#all}</li>
    141. 

  141.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#one}</li>
    142. 

  142.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#avg}</li>
    143. 

  143.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#count}</li>
    144. 

  144.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#columns}</li>
    145. 

  145.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#remove}</li>
    146. 

  146.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#forEach}</li>
    147. 

  147.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#empty}</li>
    148. 

  148.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#first}</li>
    149. 

  149.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#get}</li>
    150. 

  150.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#import}</li>
    151. 

  151.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#insert}</li>
    152. 

  152.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#save}</li>
    153. 

  153.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#insertMultiple}</li>
    154. 

  154.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#saveMultiple}</li>
    155. 

  155.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#interval}</li>
    156. 

  156.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#last}</li>
    157. 

  157.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#map}</li>
    158. 

  158.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#max}</li>
    159. 

  159.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#min}</li>
    160. 

  160.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#multiInsert}</li>
    161. 

  161.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#range}</li>
    162. 

  162.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#selectHash}</li>
    163. 

  163.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#selectMap}</li>
    164. 

  164.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#selectOrderMap}</li>
    165. 

  165.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#set}</li>
    166. 

  166.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#singleRecord}</li>
    167. 

  167.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#singleValue}</li>
    168. 

  168.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#sum}</li>
    169. 

  169.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#toCsv}</li>
    170. 

  170.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#toHash}</li>
    171. 

  171.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#truncate}</li>
    172. 

  172.           *             <li>{@link patio.Dataset#update}</li>
    173. 

  173.           *         </ul>
    174. 

  174.           *
    175. 

  175.           *     </p>
    176. 

  176.           * </p>
    177. 

  177.           *
    178. 

  178.           * @constructs
    179. 

  179.           *
    180. 

  180.           *
    181. 

  181.           * @param {patio.Database} db the database this dataset should use when querying for data.
    182. 

  182.           * @param {Object} opts options to set on this dataset instance
    183. 

  183.           *
    184. 

  184.           * @property {Function} rowCb callback to be invoked for each row returned from the database.
    185. 

  185.           *                      the return value will be used as the result of query. The rowCb can also return a promise,
    186. 

  186.           *                      The resolved value of the promise will be used as result.
    187. 

  187.           *
    188. 

  188.           * @property {String} identifierInputMethod this is the method that will be called on each identifier returned from the database.
    189. 

  189.           *                                          This value will be defaulted to whatever the identifierInputMethod
    190. 

  190.           *                                          is on the database used in initialization.
    191. 

  191.           *
    192. 

  192.           * @property {String} identifierOutputMethod this is the method that will be called on each identifier sent to the database.
    193. 

  193.           *                                          This value will be defaulted to whatever the identifierOutputMethod
    194. 

  194.           *                                          is on the database used in initialization.
    195. 

  195.           * @property {String} firstSourceAlias The first source (primary table) for this dataset. If the table is aliased, returns the aliased name.
    196. 

  196.           *                                     throws a {patio.DatasetError} tf the dataset doesn't have a table.
    197. 

  197.           * <pre class="code">
    198. 

  198.           *   DB.from("table").firstSourceAlias;
    199. 

  199.           *   //=> "table"
    200. 

  200.           *
    201. 

  201.           *   DB.from("table___t").firstSourceAlias;
    202. 

  202.           *   //=> "t"
    203. 

  203.           * </pre>
    204. 

  204.           *
    205. 

  205.           * @property {String} firstSourceTable  The first source (primary table) for this dataset.  If the dataset doesn't
    206. 

  206.           *                                      have a table, raises a {@link patio.erros.DatasetError}.
    207. 

  207.           *<pre class="code">
    208. 

  208.           *
    209. 

  209.           *  DB.from("table").firstSourceTable;
    210. 

  210.           *         //=> "table"
    211. 

  211.           *
    212. 

  212.           *  DB.from("table___t").firstSourceTable;
    213. 

  213.           *         //=> "t"
    214. 

  214.           * </pre>
    215. 

  215.           * @property {Boolean} isSimpleSelectAll Returns true if this dataset is a simple SELECT * FROM {table}, otherwise false.
    216. 

  216.           * <pre class="code">
    217. 

  217.           *     DB.from("items").isSimpleSelectAll; //=> true
    218. 

  218.           *     DB.from("items").filter({a : 1}).isSimpleSelectAll; //=> false
    219. 

  219.           * </pre>
    220. 

  220.           * @property {boolean} [quoteIdentifiers=true]  Whether this dataset quotes identifiers.
    221. 

  221.           * @property {boolean} [providesAccurateRowsMatched=true] Whether this dataset will provide accurate number of rows matched for
    222. 

  222.           *   delete and update statements.  Accurate in this case is the number of
    223. 

  223.           *   rows matched by the dataset's filter.
    224. 

  224.           * @property {boolean} [requiresSqlStandardDate=false] Whether the dataset requires SQL standard datetimes (false by default,
    225. 

  225.           *                                                     as most allow strings with ISO 8601 format).
    226. 

  226.           * @property {boolean} [supportsCte=true] Whether the dataset supports common table expressions (the WITH clause).
    227. 

  227.           * @property {boolean} [supportsDistinctOn=false] Whether the dataset supports the DISTINCT ON clause, false by default.
    228. 

  228.           * @property {boolean} [supportsIntersectExcept=true] Whether the dataset supports the INTERSECT and EXCEPT compound operations, true by default.
    229. 

  229.           * @property {boolean} [supportsIntersectExceptAll=true] Whether the dataset supports the INTERSECT ALL and EXCEPT ALL compound operations, true by default.
    230. 

  230.           * @property {boolean} [supportsIsTrue=true] Whether the dataset supports the IS TRUE syntax.
    231. 

  231.           * @property {boolean} [supportsJoinUsing=true] Whether the dataset supports the JOIN table USING (column1, ...) syntax.
    232. 

  232.           * @property {boolean} [supportsModifyingJoin=false] Whether modifying joined datasets is supported.
    233. 

  233.           * @property {boolean} [supportsMultipleColumnIn=true] Whether the IN/NOT IN operators support multiple columns when an
    234. 

  234.           * @property {boolean} [supportsTimestampTimezone=false] Whether the dataset supports timezones in literal timestamps
    235. 

  235.           * @property {boolean} [supportsTimestampUsecs=true] Whether the dataset supports fractional seconds in literal timestamps
    236. 

  236.           * @property {boolean} [supportsWindowFunctions=false] Whether the dataset supports window functions.
    237. 

  237.           * @property {patio.sql.Identifier[]} [sourceList=[]] a list of sources for this dataset.
    238. 

  238.           * @property {patio.sql.Identifier[]} [joinSourceList=[]] a list of join sources
    239. 

  239.           * @property {Boolean} hasSelectSource true if this dataset already has a select sources.
    240. 

  240.           */
    241. 

  241.          constructor:function (db, opts) {
    242. 

  242. 28756            this._super(arguments);
    243. 

  243. 28756            this.db = db;
    244. 

  244. 28756            this.__opts = {};
    245. 

  245. 28756            this.__rowCb = null;
    246. 

  246. 28756            if (db) {
    247. 

  247. 14960                this.__quoteIdentifiers = db.quoteIdentifiers;
    248. 

  248. 14960                this.__identifierInputMethod = db.identifierInputMethod;
    249. 

  249. 14960                this.__identifierOutputMethod = db.identifierOutputMethod;
    250. 

  250.              }
    251. 

  251.          },
    252. 

  252.  
    253. 

  253.  
    254. 

  254.          /**
    255. 

  255.           * Returns a new clone of the dataset with with the given options merged into the current datasets options.
    256. 

  256.           * If the options changed include options in {@link patio.dataset.Query#COLUMN_CHANGE_OPTS}, the cached
    257. 

  257.           * columns are deleted.  This method should generally not be called
    258. 

  258.           * directly by user code.
    259. 

  259.           *
    260. 

  260.           * @param {Object} opts options to merge into the curred datasets options and applied to the returned dataset.
    261. 

  261.           * @return [patio.Dataset] a cloned dataset with the merged options
    262. 

  262.           **/
    263. 

  263.          mergeOptions:function (opts) {
    264. 

  264. 14971            opts = isUndefined(opts) ? {} : opts;
    265. 

  265. 14971            var ds = new this._static(this.db, {});
    266. 

  266. 14971            ds.rowCb = this.rowCb;
    267. 

  267. 14971            this._static.FEATURES.forEach(function (f) {
    268. 

  268. 209594                ds[f] = this[f];
    269. 

  269.              }, this);
    270. 

  270. 14971            var dsOpts = ds.__opts = merge({}, this.__opts, opts);
    271. 

  271. 14971            ds.identifierInputMethod = this.identifierInputMethod;
    272. 

  272. 14971            ds.identifierOutputMethod = this.identifierOutputMethod;
    273. 

  273. 14971            var columnChangeOpts = this._static.COLUMN_CHANGE_OPTS;
    274. 

  274. 14971            if (Object.keys(opts).some(function (o) {
    275. 

  275. 13535                return columnChangeOpts.indexOf(o) !== -1;
    276. 

  276.              })) {
    277. 

  277. 2359                dsOpts.columns = null;
    278. 

  278.              }
    279. 

  279. 14971            return ds;
    280. 

  280.          },
    281. 

  281.  
    282. 

  282.  
    283. 

  283.          /**
    284. 

  284.           * Converts a string to an {@link patio.sql.Identifier}, {@link patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier},
    285. 

  285.           * or {@link patio.sql.AliasedExpression}, depending on the format:
    286. 

  286.           *
    287. 

  287.           * <ul>
    288. 

  288.           *      <li>For columns : table__column___alias.</li>
    289. 

  289.           *      <li>For tables : schema__table___alias.</li>
    290. 

  290.           * </ul>
    291. 

  291.           * each portion of the identifier is optional. See example below
    292. 

  292.           *
    293. 

  293.           * @example
    294. 

  294.           *
    295. 

  295.           * ds.stringToIdentifier("a") //= > new patio.sql.Identifier("a");
    296. 

  296.           * ds.stringToIdentifier("table__column"); //=> new patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier(table, column);
    297. 

  297.           * ds.stringToIdentifier("table__column___alias");
    298. 

  298.           *      //=> new patio.sql.AliasedExpression(new patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier(table, column), alias);
    299. 

  299.           *
    300. 

  300.           * @param {String} name the name to covert to an an {@link patio.sql.Identifier}, {@link patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier},
    301. 

  301.           * or {@link patio.sql.AliasedExpression}.
    302. 

  302.           *
    303. 

  303.           * @return  {patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} an identifier generated based on the name string.
    304. 

  304.           */
    305. 

  305.          stringToIdentifier:function (name) {
    306. 

  306. 14544            if (isString(name)) {
    307. 

  307. 9701                var parts = this._splitString(name);
    308. 

  308. 9701                var schema = parts[0], table = parts[1], alias = parts[2];
    309. 

  309. 9701                return (schema && table && alias
    310. 

  310.                      ? new AliasedExpression(new QualifiedIdentifier(schema, table), alias)
    311. 

  311.                      : (schema && table
    312. 

  312.                      ? new QualifiedIdentifier(schema, table)
    313. 

  313.                      : (table && alias
    314. 

  314.                      ? new AliasedExpression(new Identifier(table), alias) : new Identifier(table))));
    315. 

  315.              } else {
    316. 

  316. 4843                return name;
    317. 

  317.              }
    318. 

  318.          },
    319. 

  319.  
    320. 

  320.          /**
    321. 

  321.           * Can either be a string or null.
    322. 

  322.           *
    323. 

  323.           *
    324. 

  324.           * @example
    325. 

  325.           * //columns
    326. 

  326.           *  table__column___alias //=> table.column as alias
    327. 

  327.           *  table__column //=> table.column
    328. 

  328.           *  //tables
    329. 

  329.           *  schema__table___alias //=> schema.table as alias
    330. 

  330.           *  schema__table //=> schema.table
    331. 

  331.           *
    332. 

  332.           * //name and alias
    333. 

  333.           * columnOrTable___alias //=> columnOrTable as alias
    334. 

  334.           *
    335. 

  335.           *
    336. 

  336.           *
    337. 

  337.           * @return {String[]} an array with the elements being:
    338. 

  338.           * <ul>
    339. 

  339.           *      <li>For columns :[table, column, alias].</li>
    340. 

  340.           *      <li>For tables : [schema, table, alias].</li>
    341. 

  341.           * </ul>
    342. 

  342.           */
    343. 

  343.          _splitString:function (s) {
    344. 

  344. 19288            var ret, m;
    345. 

  345. 19288            if ((m = s.match(this._static.COLUMN_REF_RE1)) !== null) {
    346. 

  346. 156                ret = m.slice(1);
    347. 

  347.              }
    348. 

  348. 19132            else if ((m = s.match(this._static.COLUMN_REF_RE2)) !== null) {
    349. 

  349. 24                ret = [null, m[1], m[2]];
    350. 

  350.              }
    351. 

  351. 19108            else if ((m = s.match(this._static.COLUMN_REF_RE3)) !== null) {
    352. 

  352. 1782                ret = [m[1], m[2], null];
    353. 

  353.              }
    354. 

  354.              else {
    355. 

  355. 17326                ret = [null, s, null];
    356. 

  356.              }
    357. 

  357. 19288            return ret;
    358. 

  358.          },
    359.

  381.                  }

  217.          __set:function (values, ignore) {
    218. 

  218. 1531            values = values || {};
    219. 

  219. 1531            this.__ignore = ignore === true;
    220. 

  220. 1531            Object.keys(values).forEach(function (attribute) {
    221. 

  221. 6705                var value = values[attribute];

    223. 

  223. 6705                !ignore && this._checkIfColumnIsConstrained(attribute);
    224. 

  224. 6705                this[attribute] = value;

  229.          __setFromDb:function (values, ignore) {
    230. 

  230. 3101            values = values || {};
    231. 

  231. 3101            this.__ignore = ignore === true;
    232. 

  232. 3101            var schema = this.schema;
    233. 

  233. 3101            Object.keys(values).forEach(function (column) {
    234. 

  234. 26154                var value = values[column];
    235. 

  235.                  // Typecast value retrieved from db
    236. 

  236. 26154                if (schema.hasOwnProperty(column)) {
    237. 

  237. 25473                    this.__values[column] = this._typeCastValue(column, value, ignore);

  242. 3101            this.__ignore = false;

    245. 

  245.  
    246. 

  246.          /**
    247. 

  247.           * Set multiple values at once. Useful if you have a hash of properties that you want to set.
    248. 

  248.           *
    249. 

  249.           * <b>NOTE:</b> This method will use the static restrictedColumns property of the model.
    250. 

  250.           *
    251. 

  251.           * @example
    252. 

  252.           *
    253. 

  253.           * myModel.setValues({firstName : "Bob", lastName : "yukon"});
    254. 

  254.           *
    255. 

  255.           * //this will throw an error by default, assuming id is a pk.
    256. 

  256.           * myModel.setValues({id : 1, firstName : "Bob", lastName : "yukon"});
    257. 

  257.           *
    258. 

  258.           * @param {Object} values value to set on the model.
    259. 

  259.           *
    260. 

  260.           * @return {patio.Model} return this for chaining.
    261. 

  261.           */
    262. 

  262.          setValues:function (values) {
    263. 

  263. 17            this.__set(values, false);
    264. 

  264. 17            return this;
    265. 

  265.          },
    266. 

  266.  
    267. 

  267.          _toObject:function () {
    268. 

  268. 1140            if (this.synced) {
    269. 

  269. 1140                var columns = this._static.columns, ret = {};
    270. 

  270. 1140                for (var i in columns) {
    271. 

  271. 10376                    var col = columns[i];
    272. 

  272. 10376                    var val = this.__values[col];
    273. 

  273. 10376                    if (!isUndefined(val)) {
    274. 

  274. 6285                        ret[col] = val;
    275. 

  275.                      }
    276. 

  276.                  }
    277. 

  277. 1140                return ret;
    278. 

  278.              } else {
    279. 

  279. 0                throw new ModelError("Model " + this.tableName + " has not been synced");
    280. 

  280.              }
    281. 

  281.          },
    282. 

  282.  
    283. 

  283.          _addColumnToIsChanged:function (name, val) {
    284. 

  284. 7652            if (!this.isNew && !this.__ignore) {
    285. 

  285. 174                this.__isChanged = true;
    286. 

  286. 174                this.__changed[name] = val;
    287. 

  287.              }
    288. 

  288.          },
    289. 

  289.  
    290. 

  290.          _checkIfColumnIsConstrained:function (name) {
    291. 

  291. 6705            if (this.synced && !this.__ignore) {
    292. 

  292. 6705                var col = this.schema[name], restrictedCols = this._static.restrictedColumns || [];
    293. 

  293. 6705                if (!isUndefined(col) && (col.primaryKey && this._static.isRestrictedPrimaryKey) || restrictedCols.indexOf(name) != -1) {
    294. 

  294. 0                    throw new ModelError("Cannot set primary key of model " + this._static.tableName);
    295. 

  295.                  }
    296. 

  296.              }
    297. 

  297.          },
    298. 

  298.  
    299. 

  299.          _getColumnValue:function (name) {
    300. 

  300. 6867            var val = this.__values[name];
    301. 

  301. 6867            var getterFunc = this["_get" + name.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + name.substr(1)];
    302. 

  302. 6867            var columnValue = isFunction(getterFunc) ? getterFunc.call(this, val) : val;
    303. 

  303.  
    304. 

  304. 6867            return columnValue;
    305. 

  305.          },
    306. 

  306.  
    307. 

  307.          _setColumnValue:function (name, val) {
    308. 

  308. 7652            var ignore = this.__ignore;
    309. 

  309. 7652            val = this._typeCastValue(name, val, ignore);
    310. 

  310. 7652            this._addColumnToIsChanged(name, val);
    311. 

  311. 7652            var setterFunc = this["_set" + name.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + name.substr(1)];
    312. 

  312. 7652            var columnValue = isFunction(setterFunc) ? setterFunc.call(this, val, ignore) : val;
    313. 

  313. 7652            this.__values[name] = columnValue;
    314. 

  314. 7652            if (this._static.emitOnColumnSet) {
    315. 

  315. 7652                this.emit("column", name, columnValue, ignore);
    316. 

  316.              }
    317. 

  317.          },
    318. 

  318.  
    319. 

  319.  
    320. 

  320.          //Typecast the value to the column's type if typecasting.  Calls the database's
    321. 

  321.          //typecast_value method, so database adapters can override/augment the handling
    322. 

  322.          //for database specific column types.
    323. 

  323.          _typeCastValue:function (column, value, fromDatabase) {
    324. 

  324. 33125            var colSchema, clazz = this._static;
    325. 

  325. 33125            if (((fromDatabase && clazz.typecastOnLoad) || (!fromDatabase && clazz.typecastOnAssignment)) && !isUndefinedOrNull(this.schema) && !isUndefinedOrNull((colSchema = this.schema[column]))) {
    326. 

  326. 33125                var type = colSchema.type;
    327. 

  327. 33125                if (value === "" && clazz.typecastEmptyStringToNull === true && !isUndefinedOrNull(type) && ["string", "blob"].indexOf(type) === -1) {
    328. 

  328. 3                    value = null;
    329. 

  329.                  }
    330. 

  330. 33125                var raiseOnError = clazz.raiseOnTypecastError;
    331. 

  331. 33125                if (raiseOnError === true && isUndefinedOrNull(value) && colSchema.allowNull === false) {
    332. 

  332. 0                    throw new ModelError("null is not allowed for the " + column + " column.");
    333. 

  333.                  }
    334. 

  334. 33125                try {
    335. 

  335. 33125                    value = clazz.db.typecastValue(type, value);
    336. 

  336.                  } catch (e) {
    337. 

  337. 0                    if (raiseOnError === true) {
    338. 

  338. 0                        throw e;
    339. 

  339.                      }
    340. 

  340.                  }
    341. 

  341.              }
    342. 

  342. 33125            return value;
    343. 

  343.          },
    344. 

  344.  
    345.

  606.          init:function () {
    607. 

  607. 92            var emitter = new EventEmitter();
    608. 

  608. 92            ["addListener", "on", "once", "removeListener",
    609. 

  609.                  "removeAllListeners", "setMaxListeners", "listeners", "emit"].forEach(function (name) {
    610. 

  610. 736                    this[name] = emitter[name].bind(emitter);
    611. 

  611.                  }, this);
    612. 

  612. 92            if (this.__tableName) {
    613. 

  613. 91                this._setTableName(this.__tableName);
    614. 

  614.              }
    615. 

  615. 92            if (this.__db) {
    616.

    617. 

  617.              }
    618. 

  618.          },
    619. 

  619.  
    620. 

  620.  
    621. 

  621.          sync:function (cb) {
    622. 

  622. 4026            var ret = new Promise();
    623. 

  623. 4026            if (!this.synced) {
    624. 

  624. 93                var db = this.db, tableName = this.tableName, supers = this.__supers;
    625. 

  625. 93                ret = db.schema(tableName).chain(hitch(this, function (schema) {
    626. 

  626. 93                    if (!this.synced && schema) {
    627. 

  627. 93                        this._setSchema(schema);
    628. 

  628. 93                        if (supers && supers.length) {
    629. 

  629. 3                            return when(supers.map(function (sup) {
    630. 

  630. 3                                return sup.sync();
    631. 

  631.                              })).chain(hitch(this, function () {
    632. 

  632. 3                                this.synced = true;
    633. 

  633. 3                                supers.forEach(this.inherits, this);
    634. 

  634. 3                                return this;
    635. 

  635.                              }));
    636. 

  636.                          } else {
    637. 

  637. 90                            this.synced = true;
    638. 

  638. 90                            return this;
    639. 

  639.                          }
    640. 

  640.                      } else {
    641. 

  641. 0                        var error = new ModelError("Unable to find schema for " + tableName);
    642. 

  642. 0                        this.emit("error", error);
    643. 

  643. 0                        throw error;
    644. 

  644.  
    645. 

  645.                      }
    646. 

  646.                  }));
    647. 

  647.              } else {
    648. 

  648. 3933                ret.callback(this);
    649. 

  649.              }
    650. 

  650. 4026            if (isFunction(cb)) {
    651. 

  651. 0                ret.classic(cb);
    652. 

  652.              }
    653. 

  653. 4026            return ret.promise();
    654. 

  654.          },
    655. 

  655.  
    656. 

  656.          /**
    657. 

  657.           * Stub for plugins to notified of model inheritance
    658. 

  658.           *
    659. 

  659.           * @param {patio.Model} model a model class to inherit from
    660. 

  660.           */
    661. 

  661.          inherits:function (model) {
    662. 

  662.          },
    663. 

  663.  
    664. 

  664.  
    665. 

  665.          /**
    666. 

  666.           * Create a new model initialized with the specified values.
    667. 

  667.           *
    668. 

  668.           * @param {Object} values  the values to initialize the model with.
    669. 

  669.           *
    670. 

  670.           * @returns {Model} instantiated model initialized with the values passed in.
    671. 

  671.           */
    672. 

  672.          create:function (values) {
    673. 

  673.              //load an object from an object
    674. 

  674. 0            return new this(values, false);
    675. 

  675.          },
    676. 

  676.  
    677. 

  677.          load:function (vals) {
    678. 

  678. 936            var ret = new Promise();
    679. 

  679.              //sync our model
    680. 

  680. 936            return this.sync().chain(function () {
    681. 

  681. 936                var m = new this(vals, true);
    682. 

  682.                  //call the hooks!
    683. 

  683. 936                return m._hook("post", "load").chain(function () {
    684. 

  684. 936                    return m;
    685. 

  685.                  });
    686. 

  686.              }.bind(this));
    687. 

  687.          },
    688. 

  688.  
    689. 

  689.          _checkTransaction:function (opts, cb) {
    690. 

  690. 2938            if (isFunction(opts)) {
    691. 

  691. 639                cb = opts;
    692. 

  692. 639                opts = {};
    693. 

  693.              } else {
    694. 

  694. 2299                opts = opts || {};
    695. 

  695.              }
    696. 

  696. 2938            var ret = new Promise(), retVal = null, errored = false;
    697. 

  697. 2938            this.sync().then(hitch(this, function () {
    698. 

  698. 2938                if (this.useTransaction(opts)) {
    699. 

  699. 2938                    this.db.transaction(opts, hitch(this, function () {
    700. 

  700. 2938                        return when(cb()).then(function () {
    701. 

  701. 2894                            retVal = argsToArray(arguments);
    702. 

  702.                          }, function () {
    703. 

  703. 44                            retVal = argsToArray(arguments);
    704. 

  704. 44                            errored = true;
    705. 

  705.                          });
    706. 

  706.                      })).then(hitch(this, function () {
    707. 

  707. 2894                        ret[errored ? "errback" : "callback"].apply(ret, retVal);
    708. 

  708.                      }), hitch(this, function () {
    709. 

  709. 44                        if (errored) {
    710. 

  710. 44                            ret.errback.apply(ret, retVal);
    711. 

  711.                          } else {
    712. 

  712. 0                            ret.errback.apply(ret, arguments);
    713. 

  713.                          }
    714. 

  714.                      }));
    715. 

  715.                  } else {
    716. 

  716. 0                    when(cb()).then(ret);
    717. 

  717.                  }
    718. 

  718.              }), ret);
    719. 

  719. 2938            return ret.promise();
    720. 

  720.          },
    721. 

  721.  
    722. 

  722.          /**
    723. 

  723.           * @private
    724. 

  724.           * Returns a boolean indicating whether or not to use a transaction.
    725. 

  725.           * @param {Object} [opts] set a transaction property to override the {@link patio.Model#useTransaction}.
    726. 

  726.           */
    727. 

  727.          useTransaction:function (opts) {
    728. 

  728. 2938            opts = opts || {};
    729. 

  729. 2938            return isBoolean(opts.transaction) ? opts.transaction === true : this.useTransactions === true;
    730. 

  730.          },
    731. 

  731.  
    732. 

  732.          _setDataset:function (ds) {
    733. 

  733. 3            this.__dataset = ds;
    734. 

  734. 3            if (ds.db) {
    735. 

  735. 3                this._setDb(ds.db);
    736. 

  736.              }
    737. 

  737.          },
    738. 

  738.  
    739. 

  739.          _setDb:function (db) {
    740. 

  740. 43            this.__db = db;
    741. 

  741.          },
    742. 

  742.  
    743. 

  743.          _setTableName:function (name) {
    744. 

  744. 91            this.__tableName = name;
    745. 

  745.          },
    746. 

  746.  
    747. 

  747.          _setColumns:function (cols) {
    748. 

  748. 96            var proto = this.prototype;
    749. 

  749. 96            if (this.__columns) {
    750. 

  750. 6                this.__columns.forEach(function (name) {
    751. 

  751. 16                    delete proto[name];
    752. 

  752.                  });
    753. 

  753.              }
    754. 

  754. 96            this.__columns = cols;
    755. 

  755. 96            cols.forEach(function (name) {
    756. 

  756. 779                this._defineColumnSetter(name);
    757. 

  757. 779                this._defineColumnGetter(name);
    758. 

  758.              }, this);
    759. 

  759.          },
    760. 

  760.  
    761. 

  761.          _setPrimaryKey:function (pks) {
    762. 

  762. 99            this.__primaryKey = pks || [];
    763. 

  763.          },
    764. 

  764.  
    765. 

  765.          _setSchema:function (schema) {
    766. 

  766. 96            var columns = [];
    767. 

  767. 96            var pks = [];
    768. 

  768. 96            for (var i in schema) {

  769. 779                var col = schema[i];

  770. 779                var name = applyColumnTransformMethod(i, this.identifierOutputMethod);
    771. 

  771. 779                schema[name] = col;

  772. 779                columns.push(name);
    773. 

  773. 779                col.primaryKey && pks.push(name);
    774. 

  774.              }

  775. 96            this.__schema = schema;

  1003. 1exports.create = function (name, supers, modelOptions) {
    1004. 

  1004. 93    if (!patio) {
    1005. 

  1005. 1        (patio = require("./index"));
    1006. 

  1006. 1        patio.on("disconnect", function () {
    1007. 

  1007. 39            MODELS.clear();
    1008. 

  1008.          });
    1009. 

  1009.      }
    1010. 

  1010. 93    var db, ds, tableName;
    1011. 

  1011. 93    var key, modelKey;
    1012. 

  1012. 93    if (isString(name)) {
    1013. 

  1013. 87        tableName = name;
    1014. 

  1014. 87        key = db = patio.defaultDatabase || "default";
    1015. 

  1015. 6    } else if (isInstanceOf(name, patio.Dataset)) {
    1016. 

  1016. 6        ds = name;
    1017. 

  1017. 6        tableName = ds.firstSourceAlias;
    1018. 

  1018. 6        key = db = ds.db;
    1019. 

  1019.      }
    1020. 

  1020. 93    var hasSuper = false;
    1021. 

  1021. 93    if (isHash(supers) || isUndefinedOrNull(supers)) {
    1022. 

  1022. 90        modelOptions = supers;
    1023. 

  1023. 90        supers = [Model];
    1024. 

  1024.      } else {
    1025. 

  1025. 3        supers = toArray(supers);
    1026. 

  1026. 3        supers = supers.map(function (sup) {
    1027. 

  1027. 3            return exports.getModel(sup, db);
    1028. 

  1028.          });
    1029. 

  1029. 3        hasSuper = true;
    1030. 

  1030.      }
    1031. 

  1031.  
    1032. 

  1032. 93    var model;
    1033. 

  1033. 93    checkAndAddDBToTable(key, MODELS);
    1034. 

  1034.  
    1035. 

  1035. 93    var DEFAULT_PROTO = {instance:{}, "static":{}};
    1036. 

  1036. 93    modelOptions = merge(DEFAULT_PROTO, modelOptions || {});
    1037. 

  1037. 93    modelOptions.instance._hooks = ["save", "update", "remove", "load"];
    1038. 

  1038. 93    modelOptions.instance.__hooks = {pre:{}, post:{}};
    1039. 

  1039.      //Mixin the column setter/getters
    1040. 

  1040. 93    modelOptions["static"].synced = false;
    1041. 

  1041. 93    modelOptions["static"].__tableName = tableName;
    1042. 

  1042. 93    modelOptions["static"].__db = (db === "default" ? null : db);
    1043. 

  1043. 93    modelOptions["static"].__supers = hasSuper ? supers : [];
    1044. 

  1044. 93    modelOptions["static"].__dataset = ds;
    1045. 

  1045. 93    model = define(supers.concat(modelOptions.plugins || []).concat([AssociationPlugin]), modelOptions);
    1046. 

  1046. 93    ["pre", "post"].forEach(function (op) {
    1047. 

  1047. 186        var optionsOp = modelOptions[op];
    1048. 

  1048. 186        if (optionsOp) {
    1049. 

  1049. 0            for (var i in optionsOp) {
    1050. 

  1050. 0                model[op](i, optionsOp[i]);
    1051. 

  1051.              }
    1052. 

  1052.          }
    1053. 

  1053.      });
    1054. 

  1054. 93    if (!(MODELS.get(key).contains(checkAndTransformName(name)))) {
    1055. 

  1055. 61        MODELS.get(key).set(name, model);
    1056. 

  1056.      }
    1057. 

  1057. 93    return model;
    1058. 

  1058.  };

  1060. 1exports.syncModels = function (cb) {
    1061. 

  1061. 35    var ret = new Promise();
    1062. 

  1062. 35    serial(MODELS.entrySet.map(function (entry) {
    1063. 

  1063. 34        return function () {
    1064. 

  1064. 34            var value = entry.value;
    1065. 

  1065. 34            return serial(value.entrySet.map(function (m) {
    1066. 

  1066. 61                return hitch(m.value, "sync");
    1067. 

  1067.              }));
    1068. 

  1068.          };
    1069. 

  1069.      })).then(hitchIgnore(ret, "callback", true), ret);
    1070. 

  1070. 35    if (isFunction(cb)) {
    1071. 

  1071. 0        ret.classic(cb);
    1072. 

  1072.      }
    1073. 

  1073. 35    return ret.promise();
    1074. 

  1074.  };

  1076. 1var checkAndGetModel = function (db, name) {

  1085. 1exports.getModel = function (name, db) {
    1086. 

  1086. 86    var ret = null;
    1087. 

  1087. 86    if (isDefined(name)) {
    1088. 

  1088. 86        !patio && (patio = require("./index"));
    1089. 

  1089. 86        if (isFunction(name)) {
    1090. 

  1090. 3            ret = name;
    1091. 

  1091.          } else {
    1092. 

  1092. 83            if (!db && isInstanceOf(name, patio.Dataset)) {
    1093. 

  1093. 2                db = name.db;
    1094. 

  1094.              }
    1095. 

  1095. 83            var defaultDb = patio.defaultDatabase;
    1096. 

  1096. 83            if (db) {
    1097. 

  1097. 57                ret = checkAndGetModel(db, name);
    1098. 

  1098. 57                if (!ret && db === defaultDb) {
    1099. 

  1099. 55                    ret = checkAndGetModel("default", name);
    1100. 

  1100.                  }
    1101. 

  1101.              } else {
    1102. 

  1102. 26                db = patio.defaultDatabase;
    1103. 

  1103. 26                ret = checkAndGetModel(db, name);
    1104. 

  1104. 26                if (!ret) {
    1105. 

  1105. 26                    ret = checkAndGetModel("default", name);
    1106. 

  1106.                  }
    1107. 

  1107.              }
    1108. 

  1108.          }
    1109. 

  1109.      } else {
    1110. 

  1110. 0        ret = name;
    1111. 

  1111.      }
    1112. 

  1112. 86    if (isUndefinedOrNull(ret)) {
    1113. 

  1113. 0        throw new ModelError("Model " + name + " has not been registered with patio");
    1114. 

  1114.      }
    1115. 

  1115. 86    return ret;
    1116. 

  1116.  };

    12. 

  12.      toArray = comb.array.toArray,
    13. 

  13.      hitch = comb.hitch,
    14. 

  14.      format = comb.string.format,
    15. 

  15.      Dataset = require("../dataset"),
    16. 

  16.      Promise = comb.Promise,
    17. 

  17.      PromiseList = comb.PromiseList,
    18. 

  18.      errors = require("../errors"),
    19. 

  19.      DatabaseError = errors.DatabaseError,
    20. 

  20.      generators = require("./schemaGenerators"),
    21. 

  21.      SchemaGenerator = generators.SchemaGenerator,
    22. 

  22.      AlterTableGenerator = generators.AlterTableGenerator,
    23.

    24.
