  34.  
    35. 

  35.  
    36. 

  36. 1define(null, {
    37. 

  37.      instance:{
    38. 

  38.          /**@lends patio.Database.prototype*/
    39. 

  39.  
    40. 

  40.          /**@ignore*/
    41. 

  41.          constructor:function () {
    42. 

  42. 122            this._super(arguments);
    43. 

  43. 122            this.schemas = {};
    44. 

  44.          },
    45. 

  45.  
    46. 

  46.          /**
    47. 

  47.           * Adds a column to the specified table. This method expects a column name,
    48. 

  48.           * a datatype and optionally a hash with additional constraints and options:
    49. 

  49.           *
    50. 

  50.           * <p>
    51. 

  51.           *     This method is a shortcut to {@link patio.Database#alterTable} with an
    52. 

  52.           *     addColumn call.
    53. 

  53.           * </p>
    54. 

  54.           *
    55. 

  55.           *
    56. 

  56.           * @example
    57. 

  57.           * //Outside of a table
    58. 

  58.           * //ALTER TABLE test ADD COLUMN name text UNIQUE'
    59. 

  59.           * DB.addColumn("test", "name", "text", {unique : true});
    60. 

  60.           *
    61. 

  61.           * @param {String} table the table to add the column to.
    62. 

  62.           * @param {String} column the name of the column to add.
    63. 

  63.           * @param type datatype of the column
    64. 

  64.           * @param {Object} [opts] additional options that can be used when adding a column.
    65. 

  65.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.primaryKey] set to true if this column is a primary key.
    66. 

  66.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.allowNull] whether or not this column should allow null.
    67. 

  67.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.unique] set to true to add a UNIQUE constraint to a column,
    68. 

  68.           *
    69. 

  69.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved when the ADD COLUMN action is complete.
    70. 

  70.           **/
    71. 

  71.          addColumn:function (table, column, type, opts) {
    72. 

  72. 9            var args = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    73. 

  73. 9            return this.alterTable(table, function () {
    74. 

  74. 9                this.addColumn.apply(this, args);
    75. 

  75.              });
    76. 

  76.          },
    77. 

  77.  
    78. 

  78.          /**
    79. 

  79.           * Adds an index to a table for the given columns
    80. 

  80.           *
    81. 

  81.           * <p>
    82. 

  82.           *     This method is a shortcut to {@link patio.Database#alterTable} with an
    83. 

  83.           *     addIndex call.
    84. 

  84.           * </p>
    85. 

  85.           * @example
    86. 

  86.           * DB.addIndex("test", "name", {unique : true});
    87. 

  87.           *      //=> 'CREATE UNIQUE INDEX test_name_index ON test (name)'
    88. 

  88.           * DB.addIndex("test", ["one", "two"]);
    89. 

  89.           *      //=> ''CREATE INDEX test_one_two_index ON test (one, two)''
    90. 

  90.           *
    91. 

  91.           * @param {String} table the table to add the index to.
    92. 

  92.           * @param {String|String[]} columns the name of the column/s to create an index for.
    93. 

  93.           * @param {Object} [options] additional options that can be used when adding an index.
    94. 

  94.           * @param {Boolean} [options.unique] set to true if this this index should have a UNIQUE constraint.
    95. 

  95.           * @param {Boolean} [options.ignoreErrors] set to true to ignore errors.
    96. 

  96.           *
    97. 

  97.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved when the CREATE INDEX action is complete.
    98. 

  98.           * */
    99. 

  99.          addIndex:function (table, columns, options) {
    100. 

  100. 4            options = options || {};
    101. 

  101. 4            var ignoreErrors = options.ignoreErrors === true;
    102. 

  102. 4            var ret = new Promise();
    103. 

  103. 4            this.alterTable(table,function () {
    104. 

  104. 4                this.addIndex(columns, options);
    105. 

  105.              }).then(ret, function (err) {
    106. 

  106. 0                    if (!ignoreErrors) {
    107. 

  107. 0                        ret.errback(err);
    108. 

  108.                      } else {
    109. 

  109. 0                        ret.callback();
    110. 

  110.                      }
    111. 

  111.                  });
    112. 

  112. 4            return ret.promise();
    113. 

  113.          },
    114. 

  114.  
    115. 

  115.          /**
    116. 

  116.           *  Removes a column from the specified table.
    117. 

  117.           * <p>
    118. 

  118.           *     This method is a shortcut to {@link patio.Database#alterTable} with an
    119. 

  119.           *     dropColumn call.
    120. 

  120.           * </p>
    121. 

  121.           *
    122. 

  122.           * @example
    123. 

  123.           *   DB.dropColumn("items", "category");
    124. 

  124.           *          //=> 'ALTER TABLE items DROP COLUMN category',
    125. 

  125.           *
    126. 

  126.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} table the table to alter.
    127. 

  127.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the column to drop.
    128. 

  128.           *
    129. 

  129.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the DROP COLUMN action is complete.
    130. 

  130.           * */
    131. 

  131.          dropColumn:function (table, column) {
    132. 

  132. 3            column = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    133. 

  133. 3            return this.alterTable(table, function () {
    134. 

  134. 3                this.dropColumn.apply(this, column);
    135. 

  135.              });
    136. 

  136.          },
    137. 

  137.  
    138. 

  138.          /**
    139. 

  139.           * Removes an index for the given table and column/s.
    140. 

  140.           *
    141. 

  141.           * <p>
    142. 

  142.           *     This method is a shortcut to {@link patio.Database#alterTable} with an
    143. 

  143.           *     dropIndex call.
    144. 

  144.           * </p>
    145. 

  145.           *
    146. 

  146.           * @example
    147. 

  147.           *   DB.dropIndex("posts", "title");
    148. 

  148.           *      //=>'DROP INDEX posts_title_index
    149. 

  149.           *   DB.dropIndex("posts", ["author", "title"]);
    150. 

  150.           *      //'DROP INDEX posts_author_title_index'
    151. 

  151.           *
    152. 

  152.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} table the table to alter.
    153. 

  153.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the name of the column/s the index was created from.
    154. 

  154.           *
    155. 

  155.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the DROP INDEX action is complete.
    156. 

  156.           * */
    157. 

  157.          dropIndex:function (table, columns, options) {
    158. 

  158. 1            var args = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    159. 

  159. 1            return this.alterTable(table, function () {
    160. 

  160. 1                this.dropIndex.apply(this, args);
    161. 

  161.              });
    162. 

  162.          },
    163. 

  163.  
    164. 

  164.          /**
    165. 

  165.           * Renames a column in the specified table.
    166. 

  166.           *
    167. 

  167.           * <p>
    168. 

  168.           *     This method is a shortcut to {@link patio.Database#alterTable} with an
    169. 

  169.           *     renameColumn call.
    170. 

  170.           * </p>
    171. 

  171.           *
    172. 

  172.           * @example
    173. 

  173.           * DB.renameColumn("items", "cntr", "counter");
    174. 

  174.           *      //=> ALTER TABLE items RENAME COLUMN cntr TO counter
    175. 

  175.           *
    176. 

  176.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} table the table to alter.
    177. 

  177.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the name of the column to rename.
    178. 

  178.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} newColumn the new name of the column.
    179. 

  179.           *
    180. 

  180.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the RENAME COLUMN action is complete.
    181. 

  181.           * */
    182. 

  182.          renameColumn:function (table, column, newColumn) {
    183. 

  183. 4            var args = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    184. 

  184. 4            return this.alterTable(table, function () {
    185. 

  185. 4                this.renameColumn.apply(this, args);
    186. 

  186.              });
    187. 

  187.          },
    188. 

  188.  
    189. 

  189.  
    190. 

  190.          /**
    191. 

  191.           *Sets the default value for the given column in the given table:
    192. 

  192.           *
    193. 

  193.           * <p>
    194. 

  194.           *     This method is a shortcut to {@link patio.Database#alterTable} with an
    195. 

  195.           *     setColumnDefault call.
    196. 

  196.           * </p>
    197. 

  197.           *
    198. 

  198.           * @example
    199. 

  199.           * DB.setColumnDefault("items", "category", "misc");
    200. 

  200.           *      //=> ALTER TABLE items ALTER COLUMN category SET DEFAULT 'misc'
    201. 

  201.           *
    202. 

  202.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} table the table to alter.
    203. 

  203.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the name of the column to set the DEFAULT on.
    204. 

  204.           * @param  def the new default value of the column.
    205. 

  205.           *
    206. 

  206.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the SET DEFAULT action is complete.
    207. 

  207.           * */
    208. 

  208.          setColumnDefault:function (table, column, def) {
    209. 

  209. 1            var args = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    210. 

  210. 1            return this.alterTable(table, function () {
    211. 

  211. 1                this.setColumnDefault.apply(this, args);
    212. 

  212.              });
    213. 

  213.          },
    214. 

  214.  
    215. 

  215.  
    216. 

  216.          /**
    217. 

  217.           *  Set the data type for the given column in the given table:
    218. 

  218.           * <p>
    219. 

  219.           *     This method is a shortcut to {@link patio.Database#alterTable} with an
    220. 

  220.           *     setColumnType call.
    221. 

  221.           * </p>
    222. 

  222.           *
    223. 

  223.           * @example
    224. 

  224.           * DB.setColumnType("items", "category", String);
    225. 

  225.           *      //=> ALTER TABLE items ALTER COLUMN category TYPE varchar(255)
    226. 

  226.           *
    227. 

  227.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} table the table to alter.
    228. 

  228.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the name of the column to set the TYPE on.
    229. 

  229.           * @param  type the datatype of the column.
    230. 

  230.           *
    231. 

  231.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the SET TYPE action is complete.
    232. 

  232.           * */
    233. 

  233.          setColumnType:function (table, column, type) {
    234. 

  234. 3            var args = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    235. 

  235. 3            return this.alterTable(table, function () {
    236. 

  236. 3                this.setColumnType.apply(this, args);
    237. 

  237.              });
    238. 

  238.          },
    239. 

  239.  
    240. 

  240.  
    241. 

  241.          /**
    242. 

  242.           *  Alters the given table with the specified block.
    243. 

  243.           *  <p>
    244. 

  244.           *      <b>NOTE:</b> The block is invoked in the scope of the table that is being altered. The block
    245. 

  245.           *      is also called with the table as the first argument. Within the block you must use
    246. 

  246.           *      <b>this</b>(If the block has not been bound to a different scope), or the table object
    247. 

  247.           *      that is passed in for all alter table operations. See {@link patio.AlterTableGenerator} for
    248. 

  248.           *      avaiable operations.
    249. 

  249.           *  </p>
    250. 

  250.           *
    251. 

  251.           *  <p>
    252. 

  252.           *      <b>Note</b> that addColumn accepts all the options available for column
    253. 

  253.           *      definitions using createTable, and addIndex accepts all the options
    254. 

  254.           *      available for index definition.
    255. 

  255.           *  </p>
    256. 

  256.           *
    257. 

  257.           * @example
    258. 

  258.           *   //using the table object
    259. 

  259.           *   DB.alterTable("items", function(table){
    260. 

  260.           *      //you must use the passed in table object.
    261. 

  261.           *     table.addColumn("category", "text", {default : 'javascript'});
    262. 

  262.           *     table.dropColumn("category");
    263. 

  263.           *     table.renameColumn("cntr", "counter");
    264. 

  264.           *     table.setColumnType("value", "float");
    265. 

  265.           *     table.setColumnDefault("value", "float");
    266. 

  266.           *     table.addIndex(["group", "category"]);
    267. 

  267.           *     table.dropIndex [:group, :category]
    268. 

  268.           *   });
    269. 

  269.           *
    270. 

  270.           *   //using this
    271. 

  271.           *    DB.alterTable("items", function(){
    272. 

  272.           *     this.addColumn("category", "text", {default : 'javascript'});
    273. 

  273.           *     this.dropColumn("category");
    274. 

  274.           *     this.renameColumn("cntr", "counter");
    275. 

  275.           *     this.setColumnType("value", "float");
    276. 

  276.           *     this.setColumnDefault("value", "float");
    277. 

  277.           *     this.addIndex(["group", "category"]);
    278. 

  278.           *     this.dropIndex [:group, :category]
    279. 

  279.           *   });
    280. 

  280.           *
    281. 

  281.           *   //This will not work
    282. 

  282.           *   DB.alterTable("items", comb.hitch(someObject, function(){
    283. 

  283.           *    //This is called in the scope of someObject so this
    284. 

  284.           *    //will not work and will throw an error
    285. 

  285.           *     this.addColumn("category", "text", {default : 'javascript'});
    286. 

  286.           *   }));
    287. 

  287.           *
    288. 

  288.           *    //This will work
    289. 

  289.           *   DB.alterTable("items", comb.hitch(someObject, function(table){
    290. 

  290.           *    //This is called in the scope of someObject so you must
    291. 

  291.           *    //use the table argument
    292. 

  292.           *     table.category("text", {default : 'javascript'});
    293. 

  293.           *   }));
    294. 

  294.           *
    295. 

  295.           *
    296. 

  296.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} table to the table to perform the ALTER TABLE operations on.
    297. 

  297.           * @param {Function} block the block to invoke for the ALTER TABLE operations
    298. 

  298.           *
    299. 

  299.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once all ALTER TABLE operations have completed.
    300. 

  300.           * */
    301. 

  301.          alterTable:function (name, generator, block) {
    302. 

  302. 80            if (isFunction(generator)) {
    303. 

  303. 80                block = generator;
    304. 

  304. 80                generator = new AlterTableGenerator(this, block);
    305. 

  305.              }
    306. 

  306. 80            var ret = new Promise();
    307. 

  307. 80            return this.__alterTableSqlList(name, generator.operations).chain(function (res) {
    308. 

  308. 80                return asyncArray(comb(res).pluck("1").flatten()).forEach(function (sql) {
    309. 

  309. 91                    return this.executeDdl(sql);
    310. 

  310.                  }, this).chain(comb("removeCachedSchema").bindIgnore(this, name));
    311. 

  311.              }.bind(this));
    312. 

  312.          },
    313. 

  313.  
    314. 

  314.          /**
    315. 

  315.           * Creates a table with the columns given in the provided block:
    316. 

  316.           *
    317. 

  317.           * <p>
    318. 

  318.           *      <b>NOTE:</b> The block is invoked in the scope of the table that is being created. The block
    319. 

  319.           *      is also called with the table as the first argument. Within the block you must use
    320. 

  320.           *      <b>this</b>(If the block has not been bound to a different scope), or the table object
    321. 

  321.           *      that is passed in for all create table operations. See {@link patio.SchemaGenerator} for
    322. 

  322.           *      available operations.
    323. 

  323.           *  </p>
    324. 

  324.           *
    325. 

  325.           *
    326. 

  326.           * @example
    327. 

  327.           *
    328. 

  328.           *   //using the table to create the table
    329. 

  329.           *   DB.createTable("posts", function(table){
    330. 

  330.           *     table.primaryKey("id");
    331. 

  331.           *     table.column('title", "text");
    332. 

  332.           *     //you may also invoke the column name as
    333. 

  333.           *     //function on the table
    334. 

  334.           *     table.content(String);
    335. 

  335.           *     table.index(title);
    336. 

  336.           *   });
    337. 

  337.           *
    338. 

  338.           *   //using this to create the table
    339. 

  339.           *   DB.createTable("posts", function(){
    340. 

  340.           *     this.primaryKey("id");
    341. 

  341.           *     this.column('title", "text");
    342. 

  342.           *     //you may also invoke the column name as
    343. 

  343.           *     //function on the table
    344. 

  344.           *     this.content(String);
    345. 

  345.           *     this.index(title);
    346. 

  346.           *   });
    347. 

  347.           *
    348. 

  348.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the table to create.
    349. 

  349.           * @param {Object} [options] an optional options object
    350. 

  350.           * @param {Boolean} [options.temp] set to true if this table is a TEMPORARY table.
    351. 

  351.           * @param {Boolean} [options.ignoreIndexErrors] Ignore any errors when creating indexes.
    352. 

  352.           * @param {Function} block the block to invoke when creating the table.
    353. 

  353.           *
    354. 

  354.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved when the CREATE TABLE action is completed.
    355. 

  355.           *
    356. 

  356.           */
    357. 

  357.          createTable:function (name, options, block) {
    358. 

  358. 218            if (isFunction(options)) {
    359. 

  359. 208                block = options;
    360. 

  360. 208                options = {};
    361. 

  361.              }
    362. 

  362. 218            this.removeCachedSchema(name);
    363. 

  363. 218            if (isInstanceOf(options, SchemaGenerator)) {
    364. 

  364. 0                options = {generator:options};
    365. 

  365.              }
    366. 

  366. 218            var generator = options.generator || new SchemaGenerator(this, block);
    367. 

  367. 218            return this.__createTableFromGenerator(name, generator, options)
    368. 

  368.                  .chain(comb("__createTableIndexesFromGenerator").bindIgnore(this, name, generator, options));
    369. 

  369.          },
    370. 

  370.  
    371. 

  371.          /**
    372. 

  372.           * Forcibly creates a table, attempting to drop it unconditionally (and catching any errors), then creating it.
    373. 

  373.           * <p>
    374. 

  374.           *      See {@link patio.Database#createTable} for parameter types.
    375. 

  375.           * </p>
    376. 

  376.           *
    377. 

  377.           * @example
    378. 

  378.           *  // DROP TABLE a
    379. 

  379.           *  // CREATE TABLE a (a integer)
    380. 

  380.           *   DB.forceCreateTable("a", function(){
    381. 

  381.           *      this.a("integer");
    382. 

  382.           *   });
    383. 

  383.           *
    384. 

  384.           **/
    385. 

  385.          forceCreateTable:function (name, options, block) {
    386. 

  386. 18            return this.dropTable(name).chainBoth(comb("createTable").bindIgnore(this, name, options, block));
    387. 

  387.          },
    388. 

  388.  
    389. 

  389.  
    390. 

  390.          /**
    391. 

  391.           * Creates the table unless the table already exists.
    392. 

  392.           * <p>
    393. 

  393.           *      See {@link patio.Database#createTable} for parameter types.
    394. 

  394.           * </p>
    395. 

  395.           */
    396. 

  396.          createTableUnlessExists:function (name, options, block) {
    397. 

  397. 0            var ret = new Promise();
    398. 

  398. 0            return this.tableExists(name).chain(function (exists) {
    399. 

  399. 0                if (!exists) {
    400. 

  400. 0                    return this.createTable(name, options, block);
    401. 

  401.                  }
    402. 

  402.              }.bind(this));
    403. 

  403.          },
    404. 

  404.  
    405. 

  405.          /**
    406. 

  406.           * Creates a view, replacing it if it already exists:
    407. 

  407.           * @example
    408. 

  408.           *   DB.createOrReplaceView("cheapItems", "SELECT * FROM items WHERE price < 100");
    409. 

  409.           *      //=> CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW cheapItems AS SELECT * FROM items WHERE price < 100
    410. 

  410.           *   DB.createOrReplaceView("miscItems", DB[:items].filter({category : 'misc'}));
    411. 

  411.           *     //=> CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW miscItems AS SELECT * FROM items WHERE category = 'misc'
    412. 

  412.           *
    413. 

  413.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the view to create.
    414. 

  414.           * @param {String|patio.Dataset} source the SQL or {@link patio.Dataset} to use as the source of the
    415. 

  415.           * view.
    416. 

  416.           *
    417. 

  417.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved when the CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW action is complete.
    418. 

  418.           **/
    419. 

  419.          createOrReplaceView:function (name, source) {
    420. 

  420. 4            if (isInstanceOf(source, Dataset)) {
    421. 

  421. 2                source = source.sql;
    422. 

  422.              }
    423. 

  423. 4            return this.executeDdl(format("CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW %s AS %s", this.__quoteSchemaTable(name), source)).chain(function () {
    424. 

  424. 4                this.removeCachedSchema(name);
    425. 

  425.              }.bind(this));
    426. 

  426.          },
    427. 

  427.  
    428. 

  428.          /**
    429. 

  429.           * Creates a view based on a dataset or an SQL string:
    430. 

  430.           * @example
    431. 

  431.           *   DB.createView("cheapItems", "SELECT * FROM items WHERE price < 100");
    432. 

  432.           *      //=> CREATE VIEW cheapItems AS SELECT * FROM items WHERE price < 100
    433. 

  433.           *   DB.createView("miscItems", DB[:items].filter({category : 'misc'}));
    434. 

  434.           *     //=> CREATE  VIEW miscItems AS SELECT * FROM items WHERE category = 'misc'
    435. 

  435.           *
    436. 

  436.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the view to create.
    437. 

  437.           * @param {String|patio.Dataset} source the SQL or {@link patio.Dataset} to use as the source of the
    438. 

  438.           * view.
    439. 

  439.           **/
    440. 

  440.          createView:function (name, source) {
    441. 

  441. 4            if (isInstanceOf(source, Dataset)) {
    442. 

  442. 2                source = source.sql;
    443. 

  443.              }
    444. 

  444. 4            return this.executeDdl(format("CREATE VIEW %s AS %s", this.__quoteSchemaTable(name), source));
    445. 

  445.          },
    446. 

  446.  
    447. 

  447.          /**
    448. 

  448.           *  Drops one or more tables corresponding to the given names.
    449. 

  449.           *
    450. 

  450.           * @example
    451. 

  451.           * DB.dropTable("test");
    452. 

  452.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE test'
    453. 

  453.           * DB.dropTable("a", "bb", "ccc");
    454. 

  454.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE a',
    455. 

  455.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE bb',
    456. 

  456.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE ccc'
    457. 

  457.           *
    458. 

  458.           * @param {String|String[]|patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.Identifier[]} names the names of the tables
    459. 

  459.           * to drop.
    460. 

  460.           *
    461. 

  461.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once all tables have been dropped.
    462. 

  462.           **/
    463. 

  463.          dropTable:function (names) {
    464. 

  464. 48            if (!isArray(names)) {
    465. 

  465. 33                names = comb(arguments).toArray();
    466. 

  466.              }
    467. 

  467. 48            return serial(names.filter(function (t) {
    468. 

  468. 67                return isString(t) || isInstanceOf(t, Identifier, QualifiedIdentifier);
    469. 

  469.              }).map(function (name) {
    470. 

  470. 65                return function () {
    471. 

  471. 65                    return this.executeDdl(this.__dropTableSql(name)).chain(function () {
    472. 

  472. 55                        return this.removeCachedSchema(name);
    473. 

  473.                      }.bind(this));
    474. 

  474.                  }.bind(this);
    475. 

  475.              }.bind(this)));
    476. 

  476.          },
    477. 

  477.  
    478. 

  478.          /**
    479. 

  479.           *  Forcible drops one or more tables corresponding to the given names, ignoring errors.
    480. 

  480.           *
    481. 

  481.           * @example
    482. 

  482.           * DB.dropTable("test");
    483. 

  483.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE test'
    484. 

  484.           * DB.dropTable("a", "bb", "ccc");
    485. 

  485.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE a',
    486. 

  486.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE bb',
    487. 

  487.           *      //=>'DROP TABLE ccc'
    488. 

  488.           *
    489. 

  489.           * @param {String|String[]|patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.Identifier[]} names the names of the tables
    490. 

  490.           * to drop.
    491. 

  491.           *
    492. 

  492.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once all tables have been dropped.
    493. 

  493.           **/
    494. 

  494.          forceDropTable:function (names) {
    495. 

  495. 97            var ret = new Promise();
    496. 

  496. 97            if (!isArray(names)) {
    497. 

  497. 63                names = comb(arguments).toArray();
    498. 

  498.              }
    499. 

  499. 97            names = names.filter(function (t) {
    500. 

  500. 146                return isString(t) || isInstanceOf(t, Identifier, QualifiedIdentifier);
    501. 

  501.              });
    502. 

  502. 97            var l = names.length;
    503. 

  503. 97            var drop = function (i) {
    504. 

  504. 243                if (i < l) {
    505. 

  505. 146                    var name = names[i++];
    506. 

  506. 146                    this.executeDdl(this.__dropTableSql(name)).both(hitch(this, function () {
    507. 

  507. 146                        this.removeCachedSchema(name);
    508. 

  508. 146                        drop(i);
    509. 

  509.                      }));
    510. 

  510.                  } else {
    511. 

  511. 97                    ret.callback();
    512. 

  512.                  }
    513. 

  513.              }.bind(this);
    514. 

  514. 97            drop(0);
    515. 

  515.  
    516. 

  516. 97            return ret.promise();
    517. 

  517.          },
    518. 

  518.  
    519. 

  519.          /**
    520. 

  520.           *  Drops one or more views corresponding to the given names.
    521. 

  521.           *
    522. 

  522.           * @example
    523. 

  523.           * DB.dropView("test_view");
    524. 

  524.           *      //=>'DROP VIEW test_view'
    525. 

  525.           * DB.dropTable("test_view_1", "test_view_2", "test_view_3");
    526. 

  526.           *      //=>'DROP VIEW test_view_1',
    527. 

  527.           *      //=>'DROP VIEW test_view_2',
    528. 

  528.           *      //=>'DROP VIEW test_view_3'
    529. 

  529.           *
    530. 

  530.           * @param {String|String[]|patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.Identifier[]} names the names of the views
    531. 

  531.           * to drop.
    532. 

  532.           *
    533. 

  533.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the view/s have been dropped.
    534. 

  534.           **/
    535. 

  535.          dropView:function (names) {
    536. 

  536. 8            var ret = new Promise(), l = names.length;
    537. 

  537. 8            if (isArray(names)) {
    538. 

  538. 4                var drop = hitch(this, function (i) {
    539. 

  539. 8                    if (i < l) {
    540. 

  540. 4                        var name = names[i++];
    541. 

  541. 4                        this.executeDdl(format("DROP VIEW %s", this.__quoteSchemaTable(name))).then(hitch(this, function () {
    542. 

  542. 4                            this.removeCachedSchema(name);
    543. 

  543. 4                            drop(i);
    544. 

  544.                          }), ret);
    545. 

  545.                      } else {
    546. 

  546. 4                        ret.callback();
    547. 

  547.                      }
    548. 

  548.                  });
    549. 

  549. 4                drop(0);
    550. 

  550. 4                return ret.promise();
    551. 

  551.              } else {
    552. 

  552. 4                return this.dropView(argsToArray(arguments).filter(function (t) {
    553. 

  553. 4                    return isString(t) || isInstanceOf(t, Identifier, QualifiedIdentifier);
    554. 

  554.                  }));
    555. 

  555.  
    556. 

  556.              }
    557. 

  557.          },
    558. 

  558.  
    559. 

  559.          /**
    560. 

  560.           * Renames a table.
    561. 

  561.           *
    562. 

  562.           * @example
    563. 

  563.           * comb.executeInOrder(DB, function(DB){
    564. 

  564.           *   DB.tables(); //=> ["items"]
    565. 

  565.           *   DB.renameTable("items", "old_items");
    566. 

  566.           *          //=>'ALTER TABLE items RENAME TO old_items'
    567. 

  567.           *   DB.tables; //=> ["old_items"]
    568. 

  568.           *});
    569. 

  569.           *
    570. 

  570.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} name the name of the table to rename
    571. 

  571.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} newName the new name of the table
    572. 

  572.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the table is renamed.
    573. 

  573.           **/
    574. 

  574.          renameTable:function (name, newName) {
    575. 

  575. 2            return this.executeDdl(this.__renameTableSql(name, newName)).chain(hitch(this, function () {
    576. 

  576. 2                this.removeCachedSchema(name);
    577. 

  577.              })).promise();
    578. 

  578.  
    579. 

  579.          },
    580. 

  580.  
    581. 

  581.          /**
    582. 

  582.           * @private
    583. 

  583.           *  The SQL to execute to modify the DDL for the given table name.  op
    584. 

  584.           * should be one of the operations returned by the AlterTableGenerator.
    585. 

  585.           * */
    586. 

  586.          __alterTableSql:function (table, op) {
    587. 

  587. 79            var ret = new Promise();
    588. 

  588. 79            var quotedName = op.name ? this.__quoteIdentifier(op.name) : null;
    589. 

  589. 79            var alterTableOp = null;
    590. 

  590. 79            switch (op.op) {
    591. 

  591.                  case "addColumn":
    592. 

  592. 13                    alterTableOp = format("ADD COLUMN %s", this.__columnDefinitionSql(op));
    593. 

  593. 13                    break;
    594. 

  594.                  case "dropColumn":
    595. 

  595. 4                    alterTableOp = format("DROP COLUMN %s", quotedName);
    596. 

  596. 4                    break;
    597. 

  597.                  case "renameColumn":
    598. 

  598. 48                    alterTableOp = format("RENAME COLUMN %s TO %s", quotedName, this.__quoteIdentifier(op.newName));
    599. 

  599. 48                    break;
    600. 

  600.                  case "setColumnType":
    601. 

  601. 3                    alterTableOp = format("ALTER COLUMN %s TYPE %s", quotedName, this.typeLiteral(op));
    602. 

  602. 3                    break;
    603. 

  603.                  case "setColumnDefault":
    604. 

  604. 2                    alterTableOp = format("ALTER COLUMN %s SET DEFAULT %s", quotedName, this.literal(op["default"]));
    605. 

  605. 2                    break;
    606. 

  606.                  case "setColumnNull":
    607. 

  607. 0                    alterTableOp = format("ALTER COLUMN %s %s NOT NULL", quotedName, op["null"] ? "DROP" : "SET");
    608. 

  608. 0                    break;
    609. 

  609.                  case "addIndex":
    610. 

  610. 5                    return ret.callback(this.__indexDefinitionSql(table, op)).promise();
    611. 

  611.                  case "dropIndex":
    612. 

  612. 2                    return ret.callback(this.__dropIndexSql(table, op)).promise();
    613. 

  613.                  case "addConstraint":
    614. 

  614. 1                    alterTableOp = format("ADD %s", this.__constraintDefinitionSql(op));
    615. 

  615. 1                    break;
    616. 

  616.                  case "dropConstraint":
    617. 

  617. 0                    alterTableOp = format("DROP CONSTRAINT %s", quotedName);
    618. 

  618. 0                    break;
    619. 

  619.                  default :
    620. 

  620. 1                    throw new DatabaseError("Invalid altertable operator");
    621. 

  621.              }
    622. 

  622. 71            return ret.callback(format("ALTER TABLE %s %s", this.__quoteSchemaTable(table), alterTableOp)).promise();
    623. 

  623.          },
    624. 

  624.  
    625. 

  625.          /**
    626. 

  626.           * @private
    627. 

  627.           * Array of SQL DDL modification statements for the given table,
    628. 

  628.           * corresponding to the DDL changes specified by the operations.
    629. 

  629.           * */
    630. 

  630.          __alterTableSqlList:function (table, operations) {
    631. 

  631. 80            return new PromiseList(operations.map(hitch(this, "__alterTableSql", table)));
    632. 

  632.          },
    633. 

  633.  
    634. 

  634.          /**
    635. 

  635.           * @private
    636. 

  636.           * SQL DDL fragment containing the column creation SQL for the given column.
    637. 

  637.           *
    638. 

  638.           * @param column
    639. 

  639.           */
    640. 

  640.          __columnDefinitionSql:function (column) {
    641. 

  641. 643            var sql = [format("%s %s", this.__quoteIdentifier(column.name), this.typeLiteral(column))];
    642. 

  642. 643            column.unique && sql.push(this._static.UNIQUE);
    643. 

  643. 643            (column.allowNull === false || column["null"] === false) && sql.push(this._static.NOT_NULL);
    644. 

  644. 643            (column.allowNull === true || column["null"] === true) && sql.push(this._static.NULL);
    645. 

  645. 643            !isUndefined(column["default"]) && sql.push(format(" DEFAULT %s", this.literal(column["default"])));
    646. 

  646. 643            column.primaryKey && sql.push(this._static.PRIMARY_KEY);
    647. 

  647. 643            column.autoIncrement && sql.push(" " + this.autoIncrementSql);
    648. 

  648. 643            column.table && sql.push(this.__columnReferencesColumnConstraintSql(column));
    649. 

  649. 643            return sql.join("");
    650. 

  650.          },
    651. 

  651.  
    652. 

  652.          /**
    653. 

  653.           * @private
    654. 

  654.           * SQL DDL fragment containing the column creation
    655. 

  655.           * SQL for all given columns, used inside a CREATE TABLE block.
    656. 

  656.           */
    657. 

  657.          __columnListSql:function (generator) {
    658. 

  658. 218            return generator.columns.map(hitch(this, "__columnDefinitionSql")).concat(generator.constraints.map(hitch(this, "__constraintDefinitionSql"))).join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR);
    659. 

  659.          },
    660. 

  660.  
    661. 

  661.          /**
    662. 

  662.           * @private
    663. 

  663.           *SQL DDL fragment for column foreign key references (column constraints)
    664. 

  664.           */
    665. 

  665.          __columnReferencesColumnConstraintSql:function (column) {
    666. 

  666. 30            return this.__columnReferencesSql(column);
    667. 

  667.          },
    668. 

  668.  
    669. 

  669.          /**
    670. 

  670.           * @private
    671. 

  671.           * SQL DDL fragment for column foreign key references
    672. 

  672.           */
    673. 

  673.          __columnReferencesSql:function (column) {
    674. 

  674. 38            var sql = format(" REFERENCES %s", this.__quoteSchemaTable(column.table));
    675. 

  675. 38            column.key && (sql += format("(%s)", array.toArray(column.key).map(this.__quoteIdentifier, this).join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR)));
    676. 

  676. 38            column.onDelete && (sql += format(" ON DELETE %s", this.__onDeleteClause(column.onDelete)));
    677. 

  677. 38            column.onUpdate && (sql += format(" ON UPDATE %s", this.__onUpdateClause(column.onUpdate)));
    678. 

  678. 38            column.deferrable && (sql += " DEFERRABLE INITIALLY DEFERRED");
    679. 

  679. 38            return sql;
    680. 

  680.          },
    681. 

  681.  
    682. 

  682.          /**
    683. 

  683.           * @private
    684. 

  684.           * SQL DDL fragment for table foreign key references (table constraints)
    685. 

  685.           * */
    686. 

  686.          __columnReferencesTableConstraintSql:function (constraint) {
    687. 

  687. 6            return format("FOREIGN KEY %s%s", this.literal(constraint.columns.map(function (c) {
    688. 

  688. 6                return isString(c) ? sql.stringToIdentifier(c) : c;
    689. 

  689.              })), this.__columnReferencesSql(constraint));
    690. 

  690.          },
    691. 

  691.  
    692. 

  692.          /**
    693. 

  693.           * @private
    694. 

  694.           * SQL DDL fragment specifying a constraint on a table.
    695. 

  695.           */
    696. 

  696.          __constraintDefinitionSql:function (constraint) {
    697. 

  697. 6            var ret = [constraint.name ? format("CONSTRAINT %s ", this.__quoteIdentifier(constraint.name)) : ""];
    698. 

  698. 6            switch (constraint.type) {
    699. 

  699.                  case "check":
    700. 

  700. 0                    var check = constraint.check;
    701. 

  701. 0                    ret.push(format("CHECK %s", this.__filterExpr(isArray(check) && check.length === 1 ? check[0] : check)));
    702. 

  702. 0                    break;
    703. 

  703.                  case "primaryKey":
    704. 

  704. 0                    ret.push(format("PRIMARY KEY %s", this.literal(constraint.columns.map(function (c) {
    705. 

  705. 0                        return isString(c) ? sql.stringToIdentifier(c) : c;
    706. 

  706.                      }))));
    707. 

  707. 0                    break;
    708. 

  708.                  case "foreignKey":
    709. 

  709. 6                    ret.push(this.__columnReferencesTableConstraintSql(constraint));
    710. 

  710. 6                    break;
    711. 

  711.                  case "unique":
    712. 

  712. 0                    ret.push(format("UNIQUE %s", this.literal(constraint.columns.map(function (c) {
    713. 

  713. 0                        return isString(c) ? sql.stringToIdentifier(c) : c;
    714. 

  714.                      }))));
    715. 

  715. 0                    break;
    716. 

  716.                  default:
    717. 

  717. 0                    throw new DatabaseError(format("Invalid constriant type %s, should be 'check', 'primaryKey', foreignKey', or 'unique'", constraint.type));
    718. 

  718.              }
    719. 

  719. 6            return ret.join("");
    720. 

  720.          },
    721. 

  721.  
    722. 

  722.          /**
    723. 

  723.           * @private
    724. 

  724.           * Execute the create table statements using the generator.
    725. 

  725.           * */
    726. 

  726.          __createTableFromGenerator:function (name, generator, options) {
    727. 

  727. 218            return this.executeDdl(this.__createTableSql(name, generator, options));
    728. 

  728.          },
    729. 

  729.  
    730. 

  730.          /**
    731. 

  731.           * @private
    732. 

  732.           * Execute the create index statements using the generator.
    733. 

  733.           * */
    734. 

  734.          __createTableIndexesFromGenerator:function (name, generator, options) {
    735. 

  735. 218            var e = options.ignoreIndexErrors;
    736. 

  736. 218            var ret = new Promise();
    737. 

  737. 218            var promises = generator.indexes.map(function (index) {
    738. 

  738. 17                var ps = this.__indexSqlList(name, [index]).map(this.executeDdl, this);
    739. 

  739. 17                return new PromiseList(ps);
    740. 

  740.              }, this);
    741. 

  741. 218            if (promises.length) {
    742. 

  742. 15                new PromiseList(promises).then(ret, hitch(ret, e ? "callback" : "errback"));
    743. 

  743.              } else {
    744. 

  744. 203                ret.callback();
    745. 

  745.              }
    746. 

  746. 218            return ret.promise();
    747. 

  747.          },
    748. 

  748.  
    749. 

  749.          /**
    750. 

  750.           * @private
    751. 

  751.           * DDL statement for creating a table with the given name, columns, and options
    752. 

  752.           * */
    753. 

  753.          __createTableSql:function (name, generator, options) {
    754. 

  754. 218            return format("CREATE %sTABLE %s (%s)", options.temp ? this.temporaryTableSql : "", this.__quoteSchemaTable(name), this.__columnListSql(generator));
    755. 

  755.          },
    756. 

  756.  
    757. 

  757.          /**
    758. 

  758.           * @private
    759. 

  759.           * Default index name for the table and columns, may be too long
    760. 

  760.           * for certain databases.
    761. 

  761.           */
    762. 

  762.          __defaultIndexName:function (tableName, columns) {
    763. 

  763. 24            var parts = this.__schemaAndTable(tableName);
    764. 

  764. 24            var schema = parts[0], table = parts[1];
    765. 

  765. 24            var index = [];
    766. 

  766. 24            if (schema && schema !== this.defaultSchema) {
    767. 

  767. 0                index.push(schema);
    768. 

  768.              }
    769. 

  769. 24            index.push(table);
    770. 

  770. 24            index = index.concat(columns.map(function (c) {
    771. 

  771. 27                return isString(c) ? c : this.literal(c).replace(/\W/g, "");
    772. 

  772.              }, this));
    773. 

  773. 24            index.push("index");
    774. 

  774. 24            return index.join(this._static.UNDERSCORE);
    775. 

  775.  
    776. 

  776.          },
    777. 

  777.  
    778. 

  778.          /**
    779. 

  779.           * @private
    780. 

  780.           * The SQL to drop an index for the table.
    781. 

  781.           * */
    782. 

  782.          __dropIndexSql:function (table, op) {
    783. 

  783. 2            return format("DROP INDEX %s", this.__quoteIdentifier(op.name || this.__defaultIndexName(table, op.columns)));
    784. 

  784.          },
    785. 

  785.  
    786. 

  786.          /**
    787. 

  787.           * @private
    788. 

  788.           *
    789. 

  789.           *  SQL DDL statement to drop the table with the given name.
    790. 

  790.           **/
    791. 

  791.          __dropTableSql:function (name) {
    792. 

  792. 211            return format("DROP TABLE %s", this.__quoteSchemaTable(name));
    793. 

  793.          },
    794. 

  794.  
    795. 

  795.          /**
    796. 

  796.           * @private
    797. 

  797.           * Proxy the filterExpr call to the dataset, used for creating constraints.
    798. 

  798.           * */
    799. 

  799.          __filterExpr:function (args, block) {
    800. 

  800. 2            var ds = this.__schemaUtiltyDataset;
    801. 

  801. 2            return ds.literal(ds._filterExpr.apply(ds, arguments));
    802. 

  802.          },
    803. 

  803.  
    804. 

  804.  
    805. 

  805.          /**
    806. 

  806.           * @private
    807. 

  807.           * SQL DDL statement for creating an index for the table with the given name
    808. 

  808.           * and index specifications.
    809. 

  809.           */
    810. 

  810.          __indexDefinitionSql:function (tableName, index) {
    811. 

  811. 6            var indexName = index.name || this.__defaultIndexName(tableName, index.columns);
    812. 

  812. 6            if (index.type) {
    813. 

  813. 0                throw new DatabaseError("Index types are not supported for this database");
    814. 

  814. 6            } else if (index.where) {
    815. 

  815. 0                throw new DatabaseError("Partial indexes are not supported for this database");
    816. 

  816.              } else {
    817. 

  817. 6                return format("CREATE %sINDEX %s ON %s %s", index.unique ? "UNIQUE " : "", this.__quoteIdentifier(indexName), this.__quoteSchemaTable(tableName), this.literal(index.columns.map(function (c) {
    818. 

  818. 7                    return isString(c) ? new Identifier(c) : c;
    819. 

  819.                  })));
    820. 

  820.              }
    821. 

  821.          },
    822. 

  822.  
    823. 

  823.          /**
    824. 

  824.           * Array of SQL DDL statements, one for each index specification,
    825. 

  825.           * for the given table.
    826. 

  826.           */
    827. 

  827.          __indexSqlList:function (tableName, indexes) {
    828. 

  828. 17            return indexes.map(hitch(this, this.__indexDefinitionSql, tableName));
    829. 

  829.          },
    830. 

  830.  
    831. 

  831.          /**
    832. 

  832.           * @private
    833. 

  833.           * SQL DDL ON DELETE fragment to use, based on the given action.
    834. 

  834.           *The following actions are recognized:
    835. 

  835.           * <ul>
    836. 

  836.           *  <li>cascade - Delete rows referencing this row.</li>
    837. 

  837.           *  <li>noAction (default) - Raise an error if other rows reference this
    838. 

  838.           *   row, allow deferring of the integrity check.
    839. 

  839.           *  </li>
    840. 

  840.           *  <li>restrict - Raise an error if other rows reference this row,
    841. 

  841.           *   but do not allow deferring the integrity check.</li>
    842. 

  842.           *  <li> setDefault - Set columns referencing this row to their default value.</li>
    843. 

  843.           *   <li>setNull - Set columns referencing this row to NULL.</li>
    844. 

  844.           * </ul>
    845. 

  845.           */
    846. 

  846.          __onDeleteClause:function (action) {
    847. 

  847. 23            return this._static[action.toUpperCase()] || this._static.NO_ACTION;
    848. 

  848.          },
    849. 

  849.  
    850. 

  850.          /**
    851. 

  851.           * @private
    852. 

  852.           * SQL DDL ON UPDATE fragment to use, based on the given action.
    853. 

  853.           *The following actions are recognized:
    854. 

  854.           * <ul>
    855. 

  855.           *  <li>cascade - Delete rows referencing this row.</li>
    856. 

  856.           *  <li>noAction (default) - Raise an error if other rows reference this
    857. 

  857.           *   row, allow deferring of the integrity check.
    858. 

  858.           *  </li>
    859. 

  859.           *  <li>restrict - Raise an error if other rows reference this row,
    860. 

  860.           *   but do not allow deferring the integrity check.</li>
    861. 

  861.           *  <li> setDefault - Set columns referencing this row to their default value.</li>
    862. 

  862.           *   <li>setNull - Set columns referencing this row to NULL.</li>
    863. 

  863.           * </ul>
    864. 

  864.           */
    865. 

  865.          __onUpdateClause:function (action) {
    866.

    868.

  927.          /**

  928.           * @private
    929. 

  929.           * SQL fragment specifying the full type of a column,
    930. 

  930.           * consider the type with possible modifiers.
    931. 

  931.           */
    932. 

  932.          __typeLiteralGeneric:function (column) {
    933. 

  933. 689            var type = column.type;
    934. 

  934. 689            var meth = "__typeLiteralGeneric";
    935. 

  935. 689            var isStr = isString(type);
    936. 

  936. 689            var proper = isStr ? type.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + type.substr(1) : null;
    937. 

  937. 689            if (type === String || (isStr && type.match(/string/i))) {
    938. 

  938. 198                meth += "String";
    939. 

  939. 491            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/number/i)) || type === Number) {
    940. 

  940. 12                meth += "Numeric";
    941. 

  941. 479            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/datetime/i)) || type === DateTime) {
    942. 

  942. 8                meth += "DateTime";
    943. 

  943. 471            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/date/i)) || type === Date) {
    944. 

  944. 11                meth += "Date";
    945. 

  945. 460            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/year/i)) || type === Year) {
    946. 

  946. 2                meth += "Year";
    947. 

  947. 458            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/timestamp/i)) || type === TimeStamp) {
    948. 

  948. 4                meth += "Timestamp";
    949. 

  949. 454            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/time/i)) || type === Time) {
    950. 

  950. 2                meth += "Time";
    951. 

  951. 452            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/decimal/i)) || type === Decimal) {
    952. 

  952. 2                meth += "Decimal";
    953. 

  953. 450            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/float/i)) || type === Float) {
    954. 

  954. 15                meth += "Float";
    955. 

  955. 435            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/boolean/i)) || type === Boolean) {
    956. 

  956. 5                meth += "Boolean";
    957. 

  957. 430            } else if ((isStr && type.match(/buffer/i)) || type === Buffer) {
    958. 

  958. 29                meth += "Blob";
    959. 

  959. 401            } else if (isStr && isFunction(this[meth + proper])) {
    960. 

  960. 138                meth += proper;

    963.

    964. 

  964. 426            return this[meth](column);

  965.          },
    966. 

  966.  
    967. 

  967.          /**
    968. 

  968.           * @private
    969. 

  969.           * patio uses the date type by default for Dates.
    970. 

  970.           * <ul>
    971. 

  971.           *      <li>if onlyTime is present then time is used</li>
    972. 

  972.           *      <li>if timeStamp is present then timestamp is used,</li>
    973. 

  973.           *      <li>if dateTime is present then datetime is used</li>
    974. 

  974.           *      <li>if yearOnly is present then year is used</li>
    975. 

  975.           *       <li>else date is used</li>
    976. 

  976.           * </ul>
    977. 

  977.           */
    978. 

  978.          __typeLiteralGenericDate:function (column) {
    979. 

  979. 11            var type = column.type, ret = "date";
    980. 

  980. 11            if (column.onlyTime) {
    981. 

  981. 2                ret = "time";
    982. 

  982. 9            } else if (column.timeStamp) {
    983. 

  983. 2                ret = "timestamp";
    984. 

  984. 7            } else if (column.dateTime) {
    985. 

  985. 2                ret = "datetime";
    986. 

  986. 5            } else if (column.yearOnly) {
    987. 

  987. 2                ret = "year";
    988. 

  988.              }
    989. 

  989. 11            return ret;
    990. 

  990.          },
    991.

  1040.          /**
    1041. 

  1041.           * @private
    1042. 

  1042.           * patio uses the numeric type by default for NumericTypes
    1043. 

  1043.           * If a size is given, it is used, otherwise, it will default to whatever
    1044. 

  1044.           * the database default is for an unsized value.
    1045. 

  1045.           * <ul>
    1046. 

  1046.           * <li> if isInt is present the int is used</li>
    1047. 

  1047.           * <li> if isDouble is present then double precision is used</li>
    1048. 

  1048.           * </ul>
    1049. 

  1049.           */
    1050. 

  1050.          __typeLiteralGenericNumeric:function (column) {
    1051.

    1052. 

  1052.          },
    1053. 

  1053.  
    1054. 

  1054.

  1068.  
    1069. 

  1069.          /**
    1070. 

  1070.           * @private
    1071. 

  1071.           * patio uses the varchar type by default for Strings.  If a
    1072. 

  1072.           * size isn't present, patio assumes a size of 255.  If the
    1073. 

  1073.           * fixed option is used, patio uses the char type.  If the
    1074. 

  1074.           * text option is used, patio uses the :text type.
    1075. 

  1075.           */
    1076. 

  1076.          __typeLiteralGenericString:function (column) {
    1077.

  1078.          },
    1079. 

  1079.  
    1080. 

  1080.          /**
    1081. 

  1081.           * @private

    1083. 

  1083.           * generic types specified with a native javascript type class.
    1084. 

  1084.           */
    1085. 

  1085.          __typeLiteralSpecific:function (column) {
    1086. 

  1086. 335            var type = column.type;
    1087. 

  1087. 335            type = type === "double" ? "double precision" : type;
    1088. 

  1088. 335            if (type === "varchar") {
    1089. 

  1089. 7                column.size = isNumber(column.size) ? column.size : 255;
    1090. 

  1090.              }
    1091. 

  1091. 335            var elements = column.size || column.elements;
    1092. 

  1092. 335            return format("%s%s%s", type, elements ? this.literal(toArray(elements)) : "", column.unsigned ? " UNSIGNED" : "");
    1093. 

  1093.          },
    1094.

    1191.

  26. 1var virtualRow = function (name) {
    27. 

  27. 1016    var WILDCARD = new LiteralString('*');
    28. 

  28. 1016    var QUESTION_MARK = new LiteralString('?');
    29. 

  29. 1016    var COMMA_SEPARATOR = new LiteralString(', ');
    30. 

  30. 1016    var DOUBLE_UNDERSCORE = '__';
    31. 

  31.  
    32. 

  32. 1016    var parts = name.split(DOUBLE_UNDERSCORE);
    33. 

  33. 1016    var table = parts[0], column = parts[1];
    34. 

  34. 1016    var ident = column ? QualifiedIdentifier.fromArgs([table, column]) : Identifier.fromArgs([name]);
    35. 

  35. 1016    var prox = methodMissing(ident, function (m) {
    36. 

  36. 4        return function () {
    37. 

  37. 3            var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    38. 

  38. 3            return SQLFunction.fromArgs([m, name].concat(args));
    39. 

  39.          }
    40. 

  40.      }, column ? QualifiedIdentifier : Identifier);
    41. 

  41. 1016    var ret = createFunctionWrapper(prox, function (m) {
    42. 

  42. 548        var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    43. 

  43. 548        if (args.length) {
    44. 

  44. 542            return SQLFunction.fromArgs([name].concat(args));
    45. 

  45.          } else {
    46. 

  46. 6            return prox;
    47. 

  47.          }
    48. 

  48.      }, function () {
    49. 

  49. 0        return SQLFunction.fromArgs(arguments);
    50. 

  50.      });
    51. 

  51. 1016    ret.__proto__ = ident;
    52. 

  52. 1016    return ret;
    53. 

  53.  };
    54. 

  54.  
    55. 

  55. 1var DATE_METHODS = ["getDate", "getDay", "getFullYear", "getHours", "getMilliseconds", "getMinutes", "getMonth", "getSeconds",
    56. 

  56.      "getTime", "getTimezoneOffset", "getUTCDate", "getUTCDay", "getUTCFullYear", "getUTCHours", "getUTCMilliseconds",
    57. 

  57.      "getUTCMinutes", "getUTCMonth", "getUTCSeconds", "getYear", "parse", "setDate", "setFullYear", "setHours", "setMilliseconds",
    58. 

  58.      "setMinutes", "setMonth", "setSeconds", "setTime", "setUTCDate", "setUTCFullYear", "setUTCHours", "setUTCMilliseconds",
    59. 

  59.      "setUTCMinutes", "setUTCMonth", "setUTCSeconds", "setYear", "toDateString", "toGMTString", "toLocaleDateString",
    60. 

  60.      "toLocaleTimeString", "toLocaleString", "toTimeString", "toUTCString", "UTC", "valueOf"];
    61. 

  61.  
    62. 

  62. 1var addDateMethod = function (op) {
    63. 

  63. 180    return function () {
    64. 

  64. 4        return this.date[op].apply(this.date, arguments);
    65. 

  65.      }
    66. 

  66.  };
    67. 

  67.  
    68. 

  68.  /**
    69. 

  69.   * @constructor
    70. 

  70.   * Creates a Year type to be used in queries that require a SQL year datatype.
    71. 

  71.   * All <i>Date</i> methods ar included in the prototype of the Year type. toString and toJSON
    72. 

  72.   * are overridden to return a year format instead of the default <i>Date</i> formatting.
    73. 

  73.   * See {@link patioTime#yearToString} for formatting information.
    74. 

  74.   *
    75. 

  75.   * @example
    76. 

  76.   *
    77. 

  77.   * var year = patio.Year(2009); //=> 2009
    78. 

  78.   * JSON.stringify(year)l //=> 2009
    79. 

  79.   *
    80. 

  80.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    81. 

  81.   * @param {Number} y the year this year represents.
    82. 

  82.   */
    83. 

  83. 1var Year = function (y) {
    84. 

  84. 10    this.date = isUndefined(y) ? new Date() : isDate(y) ? y : new Date(y, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0);
    85. 

  85.  };
    86. 

  86.  
    87. 

  87. 1Year.prototype.toJSON = function () {
    88. 

  88. 0    return isUndefined(this.date) ? this.date : sql.patio.dateToString(this);
    89. 

  89.  };
    90. 

  90.  
    91. 

  91. 1Year.prototype.toString = function () {
    92. 

  92. 0    return isUndefined(this.date) ? this.date : sql.patio.dateToString(this);
    93. 

  93.  };
    94. 

  94. 1DATE_METHODS.forEach(function (op) {
    95. 

  95. 45    Year.prototype[op] = addDateMethod(op);
    96. 

  96.  }, this);
    97. 

  97.  
    98. 

  98.  
    99. 

  99.  /**
    100. 

  100.   * @constructor
    101. 

  101.   * Creates a Time type to be used in queries that require a SQL time datatype.
    102. 

  102.   * All <i>Date</i> methods ar included in the prototype of the Time type. toString and toJSON
    103. 

  103.   * are overridden to return a time format instead of the default <i>Date</i> formatting.
    104. 

  104.   * See {@link patioTime#timeToString} for formatting information.
    105. 

  105.   *
    106. 

  106.   * @example
    107. 

  107.   *
    108. 

  108.   * var time = patio.Time(12, 12, 12); //=> 12:12:12
    109. 

  109.   * JSON.stringify(time); //=> 12:12:12
    110. 

  110.   *
    111. 

  111.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    112. 

  112.   * @param {Number} [h=0] the hour
    113. 

  113.   * @param {Number} [min=0] the minute/s
    114. 

  114.   * @param {Number} [s=0] the second/s
    115. 

  115.   * @param {Number} [ms=0] the millisecond/s, this paramater is not be used, but may depending on the adapter.
    116. 

  116.   */
    117. 

  117. 1var Time = function (h, min, s, ms) {
    118. 

  118. 14    var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    119. 

  119. 14    if (args.length === 0) {
    120. 

  120. 0        this.date = new Date();
    121. 

  121. 14    } else if (isDate(h)) {
    122. 

  122. 9        this.date = h;
    123. 

  123.      } else {
    124. 

  124. 5        var date = new Date(1970, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0);
    125. 

  125. 5        isNumber(h) && date.setHours(h);
    126. 

  126. 5        isNumber(min) && date.setMinutes(min);
    127. 

  127. 5        isNumber(s) && date.setSeconds(s);
    128. 

  128. 5        isNumber(ms) && date.setMilliseconds(ms);
    129. 

  129. 5        this.date = date;
    130. 

  130.      }
    131. 

  131.  
    132. 

  132.  };
    133. 

  133.  
    134. 

  134. 1Time.prototype.toJSON = function () {
    135. 

  135. 0    return isUndefined(this.date) ? this.date : sql.patio.dateToString(this);
    136. 

  136.  };
    137. 

  137.  
    138. 

  138. 1Time.prototype.toString = function () {
    139. 

  139. 0    return isUndefined(this.date) ? this.date : sql.patio.dateToString(this);
    140. 

  140.  };
    141. 

  141.  
    142. 

  142. 1DATE_METHODS.forEach(function (op) {
    143. 

  143. 45    Time.prototype[op] = addDateMethod(op);
    144. 

  144.  }, this);
    145. 

  145.  
    146. 

  146.  /**
    147. 

  147.   * @constructor
    148. 

  148.   * Creates a TimeStamp type to be used in queries that require a SQL timestamp datatype.
    149. 

  149.   * All <i>Date</i> methods ar included in the prototype of the TimeStamp type. toString and toJSON
    150. 

  150.   * are overridden to return a ISO8601 format instead of the default <i>Date</i> formatting.
    151. 

  151.   * See {@link patioTime#timeStampToString} for formatting information.
    152. 

  152.   *
    153. 

  153.   * @example
    154. 

  154.   *
    155. 

  155.   * var timeStamp = patio.TimeStamp(2009, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10); //=> '2009-11-10 10:10:10'
    156. 

  156.   * JSON.stringify(timeStamp); //=> '2009-11-10 10:10:10'
    157. 

  157.   *
    158. 

  158.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    159. 

  159.   * @param {Number} [y=1970] the year
    160. 

  160.   * @param {Number} [m=0] the month
    161. 

  161.   * @param {Number} [d=1] the day
    162. 

  162.   * @param {Number} [h=0] the hour
    163. 

  163.   * @param {Number} [min=0] the minute/s
    164. 

  164.   * @param {Number} [s=0] the second/s
    165. 

  165.   * @param {Number} [ms=0] the millisecond/s, this paramater is not be used, but may depending on the adapter.
    166. 

  166.   */
    167. 

  167. 1var TimeStamp = function (y, m, d, h, min, s, ms) {
    168. 

  168. 54    var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    169. 

  169. 54    if (args.length === 0) {
    170. 

  170. 1        this.date = new Date();
    171. 

  171. 53    } else if (isDate(y)) {
    172. 

  172. 49        this.date = y;
    173. 

  173.      } else {
    174. 

  174. 4        var date = new Date(1970, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0);
    175. 

  175. 4        isNumber(y) && date.setYear(y);
    176. 

  176. 4        isNumber(m) && date.setMonth(m);
    177. 

  177. 4        isNumber(d) && date.setDate(d);
    178. 

  178. 4        isNumber(h) && date.setHours(h);
    179. 

  179. 4        isNumber(min) && date.setMinutes(min);
    180. 

  180. 4        isNumber(s) && date.setSeconds(s);
    181. 

  181. 4        isNumber(ms) && date.setMilliseconds(ms);
    182. 

  182. 4        this.date = date;
    183. 

  183.      }
    184. 

  184.  };
    185. 

  185.  
    186. 

  186. 1TimeStamp.prototype.toJSON = function () {
    187. 

  187. 0    return isUndefined(this.date) ? this.date : sql.patio.dateToString(this);
    188. 

  188.  };
    189. 

  189.  
    190. 

  190. 1TimeStamp.prototype.toString = function () {
    191. 

  191. 0    return isUndefined(this.date) ? this.date : sql.patio.dateToString(this);
    192. 

  192.  };
    193. 

  193.  
    194. 

  194. 1DATE_METHODS.forEach(function (op) {
    195. 

  195. 45    TimeStamp.prototype[op] = addDateMethod(op);

  198.  
    199. 

  199.  /**
    200. 

  200.   * @constructor
    201. 

  201.   * Creates a DateTime type to be used in queries that require a SQL datetime datatype.
    202. 

  202.   * All <i>Date</i> methods ar included in the prototype of the DateTime type. toString and toJSON
    203. 

  203.   * are overridden to return a ISO8601 formatted date string instead of the default <i>Date</i> formatting.
    204. 

  204.   * See {@link patioTime#dateTimeToString} for formatting information.
    205. 

  205.   *
    206. 

  206.   * @example
    207. 

  207.   *
    208. 

  208.   * var dateTime = patio.DateTime(2009, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10); //=> '2009-11-10 10:10:10'
    209. 

  209.   * JSON.stringify(dateTime); //=> '2009-11-10 10:10:10'
    210. 

  210.   *
    211. 

  211.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    212. 

  212.   * @param {Number} [y=1970] the year
    213. 

  213.   * @param {Number} [m=0] the month
    214. 

  214.   * @param {Number} [d=1] the day
    215. 

  215.   * @param {Number} [h=0] the hour
    216. 

  216.   * @param {Number} [min=0] the minute/s
    217. 

  217.   * @param {Number} [s=0] the second/s
    218. 

  218.   * @param {Number} [ms=0] the millisecond/s, this paramater is not be used, but may depending on the adapter.
    219. 

  219.   */
    220. 

  220. 1var DateTime = function (y, m, d, h, min, s, ms) {
    221. 

  221. 83    var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    222. 

  222. 83    if(args.length === 0){
    223. 

  223. 0        this.date = new Date();
    224. 

  224. 83    }else if (isDate(y)) {
    225. 

  225. 77        this.date = y;
    226. 

  226.      } else {
    227. 

  227. 6        var date = new Date(1970, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0);
    228. 

  228. 6        isNumber(y) && date.setYear(y);
    229. 

  229. 6        isNumber(m) && date.setMonth(m);
    230. 

  230. 6        isNumber(d) && date.setDate(d);
    231. 

  231. 6        isNumber(h) && date.setHours(h);
    232. 

  232. 6        isNumber(min) && date.setMinutes(min);
    233. 

  233. 6        isNumber(s) && date.setSeconds(s);
    234. 

  234. 6        isNumber(ms) && date.setMilliseconds(ms);
    235. 

  235. 6        this.date = date;
    236. 

  236.      }
    237. 

  237.  };
    238. 

  238.

  240. 0    return isUndefined(this.date) ? this.date : sql.patio.dateToString(this);
    241.

    251. 

  251.  /**

    255.

    256.

    258.

    261.

    262. 

  262.  };

  264.  /**
    265. 

  265.   * @class

    268. 

  268.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    269. 

  269.   */
    270.

    271.

    272.

    273. 

  273.
