  274. 1Decimal.prototype.toJSON = function () {
    275. 

  275. 0    return this.number;
    276. 

  276.  };
    277. 

  277.  
    278. 

  278. 1var hashToArray = function (hash) {
    279. 

  279. 3    var ret = [];
    280. 

  280. 3    if (isHash(hash)) {
    281. 

  281. 3        for (var i in hash) {
    282. 

  282. 3            var k = sql.stringToIdentifier(i), v = hash[i];
    283. 

  283. 3            v = isHash(v) ? hashToArray(v) : v;
    284. 

  284. 3            ret.push([k , v]);
    285. 

  285.          }
    286. 

  286.      }
    287. 

  287. 3    return ret;
    288. 

  288.  };
    289. 

  289.  
    290. 

  290.  /**
    291. 

  291.   * @namespace  Collection of SQL related types, and expressions.
    292. 

  292.   *
    293. 

  293.   * <p>
    294. 

  294.   *  The {@link patio.sql} object
    295. 

  295.   *  can be used directly to create {@link patio.sql.Expression}s, {@link patio.sql.Identifier}s, {@link patio.sql.SQLFunction}s,
    296. 

  296.   *  and {@link patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier}s.
    297. 

  297.   * <pre class='code'>
    298. 

  298.   *  var sql = patio.sql;
    299. 

  299.   *  //creating an identifier
    300. 

  300.   *  sql.a; //=> a;
    301. 

  301.   *
    302. 

  302.   *  //creating a qualified identifier
    303. 

  303.   *  sql.table__column; //table.column;
    304. 

  304.   *
    305. 

  305.   *  //BooleanExpression
    306. 

  306.   *  sql.a.lt(sql.b); //=> a < 'b';
    307. 

  307.   *
    308. 

  308.   *  //SQL Functions
    309. 

  309.   *  sql.sum(sql.a); //=> sum(a)
    310. 

  310.   *  sql.avg(sql.b); //=> avg(b)
    311. 

  311.   *  sql.a("b", 1); //=> a(b, 1)
    312. 

  312.   *  sql.myDatabasesObjectFunction(sql.a, sql.b, sql.c); //=> myDatabasesObjectFunction(a, b, c);
    313. 

  313.   *
    314. 

  314.   *  //combined
    315. 

  315.   *  sql.a.cast("boolean"); //=> 'CAST(a AS boolean)'
    316. 

  316.   *  sql.a.plus(sql.b).lt(sql.c.minus(3) //=> ((a + b) < (c - 3))
    317. 

  317.   *
    318. 

  318.   * </pre>
    319. 

  319.   *
    320. 

  320.   * This is useful when combined with dataset filtering
    321. 

  321.   *
    322. 

  322.   * <pre class="code">
    323. 

  323.   *  var ds = DB.from("t");
    324. 

  324.   *
    325. 

  325.   *  ds.filter({a:[sql.b, sql.c]}).sql;
    326. 

  326.   *      //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE (a IN (b, c))
    327. 

  327.   *
    328. 

  328.   *  ds.select(sql["case"]({b:{c:1}}, false)).sql;
    329. 

  329.   *      //=> SELECT (CASE WHEN b THEN (c = 1) ELSE 'f' END) FROM t
    330. 

  330.   *
    331. 

  331.   *  ds.select(sql.a).qualifyToFirstSource().sql;
    332. 

  332.   *      //=>  SELECT a FROM t
    333. 

  333.   *
    334. 

  334.   *  ds.order(sql.a.desc(), sql.b.asc()).sql;
    335. 

  335.   *      //=>  SELECT * FROM t ORDER BY a DESC, b ASC
    336. 

  336.   *
    337. 

  337.   *  ds.select(sql.a.as("b")).sql;
    338. 

  338.   *      //=> SELECT a AS b FROM t
    339. 

  339.   *
    340. 

  340.   *  ds.filter(sql["case"]({a:sql.b}, sql.c, sql.d)).sql
    341. 

  341.   *      //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE (CASE d WHEN a THEN b ELSE c END)
    342. 

  342.   *
    343. 

  343.   *  ds.filter(sql.a.cast("boolean")).sql;
    344. 

  344.   *      //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE CAST(a AS boolean)
    345. 

  345.   *
    346. 

  346.   *  ds.filter(sql.a("b", 1)).sql
    347. 

  347.   *      //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE a(b, 1)
    348. 

  348.   *  ds.filter(sql.a.plus(sql.b).lt(sql.c.minus(3)).sql;
    349. 

  349.   *      //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE ((a + b) < (c - 3))
    350. 

  350.   *
    351. 

  351.   *  ds.filter(sql.a.sqlSubscript(sql.b, 3)).sql;
    352. 

  352.   *      //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE a[b, 3]
    353. 

  353.   *
    354. 

  354.   *  ds.filter('? > ?', sql.a, 1).sql;
    355. 

  355.   *     //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE (a > 1);
    356. 

  356.   *
    357. 

  357.   *  ds.filter('{a} > {b}', {a:sql.c, b:1}).sql;
    358. 

  358.   *      //=>SELECT * FROM t WHERE (c > 1)
    359. 

  359.   *
    360. 

  360.   *  ds.select(sql.literal("'a'"))
    361. 

  361.   *     .filter(sql.a(3))
    362. 

  362.   *     .filter('blah')
    363. 

  363.   *     .order(sql.literal(true))
    364. 

  364.   *     .group(sql.literal('a > ?', [1]))
    365. 

  365.   *     .having(false).sql;
    366. 

  366.   *      //=>"SELECT 'a' FROM t WHERE (a(3) AND (blah)) GROUP BY a > 1 HAVING 'f' ORDER BY true");
    367. 

  367.   </pre>
    368. 

  368.   *
    369. 

  369.   * </p>
    370. 

  370.   * @name sql
    371. 

  371.   * @memberOf patio
    372. 

  372.   */
    373. 

  373. 1var sql = {
    374. 

  374.      /**@lends patio.sql*/
    375. 

  375.  
    376. 

  376.      /**
    377. 

  377.       * Returns a {@link patio.sql.Identifier}, {@link patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier},
    378. 

  378.       * or {@link patio.sql.ALiasedExpression} depending on the format of the string
    379. 

  379.       * passed in.
    380. 

  380.       *
    381. 

  381.       * <ul>
    382. 

  382.       *      <li>For columns : table__column___alias.</li>
    383. 

  383.       *      <li>For tables : schema__table___alias.</li>
    384. 

  384.       * </ul>
    385. 

  385.       * each portion of the identifier is optional. See example below
    386. 

  386.       *
    387. 

  387.       * @example
    388. 

  388.       *
    389. 

  389.       * patio.sql.identifier("a") //= > new patio.sql.Identifier("a");
    390. 

  390.       * patio.sql.identifier("table__column"); //=> new patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier(table, column);
    391. 

  391.       * patio.sql.identifier("table__column___alias");
    392. 

  392.       *      //=> new patio.sql.AliasedExpression(new patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier(table, column), alias);
    393. 

  393.       *
    394. 

  394.       * @param {String} name the name to covert to an an {@link patio.sql.Identifier}, {@link patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier},
    395. 

  395.       * or {@link patio.sql.AliasedExpression}.
    396. 

  396.       *
    397. 

  397.       * @return  {patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} an identifier generated based on the name string.
    398. 

  398.       */
    399. 

  399.      identifier:function (s) {
    400. 

  400. 1575        return sql.stringToIdentifier(s);
    401. 

  401.      },
    402. 

  402.  
    403. 

  403.      /**
    404. 

  404.       * @see patio.sql.identifier
    405. 

  405.       */
    406. 

  406.      stringToIdentifier:function (name) {
    407. 

  407. 11853        !Dataset && (Dataset = require("./dataset"));
    408. 

  408. 11853        return new Dataset().stringToIdentifier(name);
    409. 

  409.      },
    410. 

  410.  
    411. 

  411.      /**
    412. 

  412.       * Creates a {@link patio.sql.LiteralString} or {@link patio.sql.PlaceHolderLiteralString}
    413. 

  413.       * depending on the arguments passed in. If a single string is passed in then
    414. 

  414.       * it is assumed to be a {@link patio.sql.LiteralString}. If more than one argument is
    415. 

  415.       * passed in then it is assumed to be a {@link patio.sql.PlaceHolderLiteralString}.
    416. 

  416.       *
    417. 

  417.       * @example
    418. 

  418.       *
    419. 

  419.       * //a literal string that will be placed in an SQL query with out quoting.
    420. 

  420.       * patio.sql.literal("a"); //=> new patio.sql.LiteralString('a');
    421. 

  421.       *
    422. 

  422.       * //a placeholder string that will have ? replaced with the {@link patio.Dataset#literal} version of
    423. 

  423.       * //the arugment and replaced in the string.
    424. 

  424.       * patio.sql.literal("a = ?", 1)  //=> a = 1
    425. 

  425.       * patio.sql.literal("a = ?", "b"); //=> a = 'b'
    426. 

  426.       * patio.sql.literal("a = {a} AND b = {b}", {a : 1, b : 2}); //=> a = 1 AND b = 2
    427. 

  427.       *
    428. 

  428.       * @param {String ...} s variable number of arguments where the first argument
    429. 

  429.       * is a string. If multiple arguments are passed it is a assumed to be a {@link patio.sql.PlaceHolderLiteralString}
    430. 

  430.       *
    431. 

  431.       * @return {patio.sql.LiteralString|patio.sql.PlaceHolderLiteralString} an expression that can be used as an argument
    432. 

  432.       * for {@link patio.Dataset} query methods.
    433. 

  433.       */
    434. 

  434.      literal:function (s) {
    435. 

  435. 458        var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    436. 

  436. 458        return args.length > 1 ? PlaceHolderLiteralString.fromArgs(args) : new LiteralString(s);
    437. 

  437.      },
    438. 

  438.  
    439. 

  439.      /**
    440. 

  440.       * Returns a {@link patio.sql.CaseExpression}. See {@link patio.sql.CaseExpression} for argument types.
    441. 

  441.       *
    442. 

  442.       * @example
    443. 

  443.       *
    444. 

  444.       * sql["case"]({a:sql.b}, sql.c, sql.d); //=> (CASE t.d WHEN t.a THEN t.b ELSE t.c END)
    445. 

  445.       *
    446. 

  446.       */
    447. 

  447.      "case":function (hash, /*args**/opts) {
    448. 

  448. 2        var args = argsToArray(arguments, 1);
    449. 

  449. 2        return CaseExpression.fromArgs([hashToArray(hash)].concat(args));
    450. 

  450.      },
    451. 

  451.  
    452. 

  452.      /**
    453. 

  453.       * Creates a {@link patio.sql.StringExpression}
    454. 

  454.       *
    455. 

  455.       * Return a {@link patio.sql.StringExpression} representing an SQL string made up of the
    456. 

  456.       * concatenation of this array's elements.  If an joiner is passed
    457. 

  457.       * it is used in between each element of the array in the SQL
    458. 

  458.       * concatenation.
    459. 

  459.       *
    460. 

  460.       * @example
    461. 

  461.       *   patio.sql.sqlStringJoin(["a"]); //=> a
    462. 

  462.       *   //you can use sql.* as a shortcut to get an identifier
    463. 

  463.       *   patio.sql.sqlStringJoin([sql.identifier("a"), sql.b]);//=> a || b
    464. 

  464.       *   patio.sql.sqlStringJoin([sql.a, 'b']) # SQL: a || 'b'
    465. 

  465.       *   patio.sql.sqlStringJoin(['a', sql.b], ' '); //=> 'a' || ' ' || b
    466. 

  466.       */
    467. 

  467.      sqlStringJoin:function (arr, joiner) {
    468. 

  468. 6        joiner = joiner || null;
    469. 

  469. 6        var args;
    470. 

  470. 6        arr = arr.map(function (a) {
    471. 

  471. 12            return isInstanceOf(a, Expression, LiteralString, Boolean) || isNull(a) ? a : sql.stringToIdentifier(a)
    472. 

  472.          });
    473. 

  473. 6        if (joiner) {
    474. 

  474. 4            var newJoiner = [];
    475. 

  475. 4            for (var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
    476. 

  476. 9                newJoiner.push(joiner);
    477. 

  477.              }
    478. 

  478. 4            args = array.flatten(array.zip(arr, newJoiner));
    479. 

  479. 4            args.pop();
    480. 

  480.          } else {
    481. 

  481. 2            args = arr;
    482. 

  482.          }
    483. 

  483. 6        args = args.map(function (a) {
    484. 

  484. 17            return isInstanceOf(a, Expression, LiteralString, Boolean) || isNull(a) ? a : "" + a;
    485. 

  485.          });
    486. 

  486. 6        return StringExpression.fromArgs(["||"].concat(args));
    487. 

  487.      },
    488. 

  488.  
    489. 

  489.      Year:Year,
    490. 

  490.      TimeStamp:TimeStamp,
    491. 

  491.      Time:Time,
    492. 

  492.      DateTime:DateTime,
    493. 

  493.      Float:Float,
    494. 

  494.      Decimal:Decimal
    495. 

  495.  
    496. 

  496.  };
    497. 

  497.  
    498. 

  498. 1sql.__defineGetter__("patio", function () {
    499. 

  499. 0    !patio && (patio = require("./index"));
    500. 

  500. 0    return patio;
    501. 

  501.  });
    502. 

  502.  
    503. 

  503. 1exports.sql = methodMissing(sql, function (name) {
    504. 

  504. 1016    return virtualRow(name);
    505. 

  505.  });
    506. 

  506.  
    507. 

  507. 1var OPERTATOR_INVERSIONS = {
    508. 

  508.      AND:"OR",
    509. 

  509.      OR:"AND",
    510. 

  510.      GT:"lte",
    511. 

  511.      GTE:"lt",
    512. 

  512.      LT:"gte",
    513. 

  513.      LTE:"gt",
    514. 

  514.      EQ:"neq",
    515. 

  515.      NEQ:"eq",
    516. 

  516.      LIKE:'NOT LIKE',
    517. 

  517.      "NOT LIKE":"LIKE",
    518. 

  518.      '!~*':'~*',
    519. 

  519.      '~*':'!~*',
    520. 

  520.      "~":'!~',
    521. 

  521.      "IN":'NOTIN',
    522. 

  522.      "NOTIN":"IN",
    523. 

  523.      "IS":'IS NOT',
    524. 

  524.      "ISNOT":"IS",
    525. 

  525.      NOT:"NOOP",
    526. 

  526.      NOOP:"NOT",
    527. 

  527.      ILIKE:'NOT ILIKE',
    528. 

  528.      NOTILIKE:"ILIKE"
    529. 

  529.  };
    530. 

  530.  
    531. 

  531.  // Standard mathematical operators used in +NumericMethods+
    532. 

  532. 1var MATHEMATICAL_OPERATORS = {PLUS:"+", MINUS:"-", DIVIDE:"/", MULTIPLY:"*"};
    533. 

  533.  
    534. 

  534.  // Bitwise mathematical operators used in +NumericMethods+
    535. 

  535. 1var BITWISE_OPERATORS = {bitWiseAnd:"&", bitWiseOr:"|", exclusiveOr:"^", leftShift:"<<", rightShift:">>"};
    536. 

  536.  
    537. 

  537.  
    538. 

  538. 1var INEQUALITY_OPERATORS = {GT:">", GTE:">=", LT:"<", LTE:"<="};
    539. 

  539.  
    540. 

  540.  //Hash of ruby operator symbols to SQL operators, used in +BooleanMethods+
    541. 

  541. 1var BOOLEAN_OPERATORS = {AND:"AND", OR:"OR"};
    542. 

  542.  
    543. 

  543.  //Operators that use IN/NOT IN for inclusion/exclusion
    544. 

  544. 1var IN_OPERATORS = {IN:"IN", NOTIN:'NOT IN'};
    545. 

  545.  
    546. 

  546.  //Operators that use IS, used for special casing to override literal true/false values
    547. 

  547. 1var IS_OPERATORS = {IS:"IS", ISNOT:'IS NOT'};
    548. 

  548.  
    549. 

  549.  //Operator symbols that take exactly two arguments
    550. 

  550. 1var TWO_ARITY_OPERATORS = merge({
    551. 

  551.      EQ:'=',
    552. 

  552.      NEQ:'!=', LIKE:"LIKE",
    553. 

  553.      "NOT LIKE":'NOT LIKE',
    554. 

  554.      ILIKE:"ILIKE",
    555. 

  555.      "NOT ILIKE":'NOT ILIKE',
    556. 

  556.      "~":"~",
    557. 

  557.      '!~':"!~",
    558. 

  558.      '~*':"~*",
    559. 

  559.      '!~*':"!~*"}, INEQUALITY_OPERATORS, BITWISE_OPERATORS, IS_OPERATORS, IN_OPERATORS);
    560. 

  560.  
    561. 

  561.  //Operator symbols that take one or more arguments
    562. 

  562. 1var N_ARITY_OPERATORS = merge({"||":"||"}, BOOLEAN_OPERATORS, MATHEMATICAL_OPERATORS);
    563. 

  563.  
    564. 

  564.  //Operator symbols that take only a single argument
    565. 

  565. 1var ONE_ARITY_OPERATORS = {"NOT":"NOT", "NOOP":"NOOP"};
    566. 

  566.  
    567. 

  567.  /**
    568. 

  568.   * @class Mixin to provide alias methods to an expression.
    569. 

  569.   *
    570. 

  570.   * @name AliasMethods
    571. 

  571.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    572. 

  572.   */
    573. 

  573. 1var AliasMethods = define(null, {
    574. 

  574.      instance:{
    575. 

  575.          /**@lends patio.sql.AliasMethods.prototype*/
    576. 

  576.  
    577. 

  577.          /**
    578. 

  578.           *  Create an SQL alias {@link patio.sql.AliasedExpression} of the receiving column or expression
    579. 

  579.           *  to the given alias.
    580. 

  580.           *
    581. 

  581.           * @example
    582. 

  582.           *
    583. 

  583.           *  sql.identifier("column").as("alias");
    584. 

  584.           *      //=> "column" AS "alias"
    585. 

  585.           *
    586. 

  586.           * @param {String} alias the alias to assign to the expression.
    587. 

  587.           *
    588. 

  588.           * @return {patio.sql.AliasedExpression} the aliased expression.
    589. 

  589.           */
    590. 

  590.          as:function (alias) {
    591. 

  591. 552            return new AliasedExpression(this, alias);
    592. 

  592.          }
    593. 

  593.  
    594. 

  594.      }
    595. 

  595.  }).as(sql, "AliasMethods");
    596. 

  596.  
    597. 

  597. 1var bitWiseMethod = function (op) {
    598. 

  598. 5    return function (expression) {
    599. 

  599. 0        if (isInstanceOf(expression, StringExpression) || isInstanceOf(expression, BooleanExpression)) {
    600. 

  600. 0            throw new ExpressionError("Cannot apply " + op + " to a non numeric expression");
    601. 

  601.          }
    602. 

  602.          else {
    603. 

  603. 0            return new BooleanExpression(op, this, expression);
    604. 

  604.          }
    605. 

  605.      }
    606. 

  606.  };
    607. 

  607.  
    608. 

  608.  /**
    609. 

  609.   * @class Defines the bitwise methods: bitWiseAnd, bitWiseOr, exclusiveOr, leftShift, and rightShift.  These
    610. 

  610.   * methods are only on {@link patio.sql.NumericExpression}
    611. 

  611.   *
    612. 

  612.   * @example
    613. 

  613.   *   sql.a.sqlNumber.bitWiseAnd("b"); //=> "a" & "b"
    614. 

  614.   *   sql.a.sqlNumber.bitWiseOr("b") //=> "a" | "b"
    615. 

  615.   *   sql.a.sqlNumber.exclusiveOr("b") //=> "a" ^ "b"
    616. 

  616.   *   sql.a.sqlNumber.leftShift("b") // "a" << "b"
    617. 

  617.   *   sql.a.sqlNumber.rightShift("b") //=> "a" >> "b"
    618. 

  618.   *
    619. 

  619.   * @name BitWiseMethods
    620. 

  620.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    621. 

  621.   */
    622. 

  622. 1var BitWiseMethods = define(null, {
    623. 

  623.      instance:{
    624. 

  624.          /**@lends patio.sql.BitWiseMethods.prototype*/
    625. 

  625.  
    626. 

  626.          /**
    627. 

  627.           * Bitwise and
    628. 

  628.           *
    629. 

  629.           * @example
    630. 

  630.           * sql.a.sqlNumber.bitWiseAnd("b"); //=> "a" & "b"
    631. 

  631.           */
    632. 

  632.          bitWiseAnd:bitWiseMethod("bitWiseAnd"),
    633. 

  633.  
    634. 

  634.          /**
    635. 

  635.           * Bitwise or
    636. 

  636.           *
    637. 

  637.           * @example
    638. 

  638.           * sql.a.sqlNumber.bitWiseOr("b") //=> "a" | "b"
    639. 

  639.           */
    640. 

  640.          bitWiseOr:bitWiseMethod("bitWiseOr"),
    641. 

  641.  
    642. 

  642.          /**
    643. 

  643.           * Exclusive Or
    644. 

  644.           *
    645. 

  645.           * @example
    646. 

  646.           *
    647. 

  647.           * sql.a.sqlNumber.exclusiveOr("b") //=> "a" ^ "b"
    648. 

  648.           */
    649. 

  649.          exclusiveOr:bitWiseMethod("exclusiveOr"),
    650. 

  650.  
    651. 

  651.          /**
    652. 

  652.           *  Bitwise shift left
    653. 

  653.           *
    654. 

  654.           *  @example
    655. 

  655.           *
    656. 

  656.           *  sql.a.sqlNumber.leftShift("b") // "a" << "b"
    657. 

  657.           */
    658. 

  658.          leftShift:bitWiseMethod("leftShift"),
    659. 

  659.  
    660. 

  660.          /**
    661. 

  661.           * Bitwise shift right
    662. 

  662.           *
    663. 

  663.           * @example
    664. 

  664.           *
    665. 

  665.           * sql.a.sqlNumber.rightShift("b") //=> "a" >> "b"
    666. 

  666.           */
    667. 

  667.          rightShift:bitWiseMethod("rightShift")
    668. 

  668.      }
    669. 

  669.  }).as(sql, "BitWiseMethods");
    670. 

  670.  
    671. 

  671. 1var booleanMethod = function (op) {
    672. 

  672. 2    return function (expression) {
    673. 

  673. 7        if (isInstanceOf(expression, StringExpression) || isInstanceOf(expression, NumericExpression)) {
    674. 

  674. 0            throw new ExpressionError("Cannot apply " + op + " to a non boolean expression");
    675. 

  675.          }
    676. 

  676.          else {
    677. 

  677. 7            return new BooleanExpression(op, this, expression);
    678. 

  678.          }
    679. 

  679.      }
    680. 

  680.  };
    681. 

  681.  
    682. 

  682.  /**
    683. 

  683.   * @class Defines boolean/logical AND (&), OR (|) and NOT (~) operators
    684. 

  684.   * that are defined on objects that can be used in a boolean context in SQL
    685. 

  685.   * ({@link patio.sql.LiteralString}, and {@link patio.sql.GenericExpression}).
    686. 

  686.   *
    687. 

  687.   * @example
    688. 

  688.   * sql.a.and(sql.b) //=> "a" AND "b"
    689. 

  689.   * sql.a.or(sql.b) //=> "a" OR "b"
    690. 

  690.   * sql.a.not() //=> NOT "a"
    691. 

  691.   *
    692. 

  692.   * @name BooleanMethods
    693. 

  693.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    694. 

  694.   */
    695. 

  695. 1var BooleanMethods = define(null, {
    696. 

  696.      instance:{
    697. 

  697.          /**@lends patio.sql.BooleanMethods.prototype*/
    698. 

  698.  
    699. 

  699.          /**
    700. 

  700.           *
    701. 

  701.           * @function
    702. 

  702.           * Logical AND
    703. 

  703.           *
    704. 

  704.           * @example
    705. 

  705.           *
    706. 

  706.           * sql.a.and(sql.b) //=> "a" AND "b"
    707. 

  707.           *
    708. 

  708.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} a ANDed boolean expression.
    709. 

  709.           */
    710. 

  710.          and:booleanMethod("and"),
    711. 

  711.  
    712. 

  712.          /**
    713. 

  713.           * @function
    714. 

  714.           * Logical OR
    715. 

  715.           *
    716. 

  716.           * @example
    717. 

  717.           *
    718. 

  718.           * sql.a.or(sql.b) //=> "a" OR "b"
    719. 

  719.           *
    720. 

  720.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} a ORed boolean expression
    721. 

  721.           */
    722. 

  722.          or:booleanMethod("or"),
    723. 

  723.  
    724. 

  724.          /**
    725. 

  725.           * Logical NOT
    726. 

  726.           *
    727. 

  727.           * @example
    728. 

  728.           *
    729. 

  729.           * sql.a.not() //=> NOT "a"
    730. 

  730.           *
    731. 

  731.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} a inverted boolean expression.
    732. 

  732.           */
    733. 

  733.          not:function () {
    734. 

  734. 5            return BooleanExpression.invert(this);
    735. 

  735.          }
    736. 

  736.  
    737. 

  737.      }
    738. 

  738.  }).as(sql, "BooleanMethods");
    739. 

  739.  
    740. 

  740.  /**
    741. 

  741.   * @class Defines case methods
    742. 

  742.   *
    743. 

  743.   * @name CastMethods
    744. 

  744.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    745. 

  745.   */
    746. 

  746. 1var CastMethods = define(null, {
    747. 

  747.      instance:{
    748. 

  748.          /**@lends patio.sql.CastMethods.prototype*/
    749. 

  749.          /**
    750. 

  750.           * Cast the reciever to the given SQL type.
    751. 

  751.           *
    752. 

  752.           * @example
    753. 

  753.           *
    754. 

  754.           * sql.a.cast("integer") //=> CAST(a AS integer)
    755. 

  755.           * sql.a.cast(String) //=> CAST(a AS varchar(255))
    756. 

  756.           *
    757. 

  757.           * @return {patio.sql.Cast} the casted expression
    758. 

  758.           */
    759. 

  759.          cast:function (type) {
    760. 

  760. 2            return new Cast(this, type);
    761. 

  761.          },
    762. 

  762.  
    763. 

  763.          /**
    764. 

  764.           * Cast the reciever to the given SQL type (or the database's default Number type if none given.
    765. 

  765.           *
    766. 

  766.           * @example
    767. 

  767.           *
    768. 

  768.           * sql.a.castNumeric() //=> CAST(a AS integer)
    769. 

  769.           * sql.a.castNumeric("double") //=> CAST(a AS double precision)
    770. 

  770.           *
    771. 

  771.           * @param type the numeric type to cast to
    772. 

  772.           *
    773. 

  773.           * @return {patio.sql.NumericExpression} a casted numberic expression
    774. 

  774.           */
    775. 

  775.          castNumeric:function (type) {
    776. 

  776. 0            return this.cast(type || "integer").sqlNumber;
    777. 

  777.          },
    778. 

  778.  
    779. 

  779.          /**
    780. 

  780.           * Cast the reciever to the given SQL type (or the database's default String type if none given),
    781. 

  781.           * and return the result as a {@link patio.sql.StringExpression}.
    782. 

  782.           *
    783. 

  783.           * @example
    784. 

  784.           *
    785. 

  785.           *  sql.a.castString() //=> CAST(a AS varchar(255))
    786. 

  786.           *  sql.a.castString("text") //=> CAST(a AS text)
    787. 

  787.           * @param type the string type to cast to
    788. 

  788.           *
    789. 

  789.           * @return {patio.sql.StringExpression} the casted string expression
    790. 

  790.           */
    791. 

  791.          castString:function (type) {
    792. 

  792. 0            return this.cast(type || String).sqlString;
    793. 

  793.          }
    794. 

  794.      }
    795. 

  795.  }).as(sql, "CastMethods");
    796. 

  796.  
    797. 

  797.  
    798. 

  798.  /**
    799. 

  799.   * @class Provides methods to assist in assigning a SQL type to
    800. 

  800.   * particular types, i.e. Boolean, Function, Number or String.
    801. 

  801.   *
    802. 

  802.   * @name ComplexExpressionMethods
    803. 

  803.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    804. 

  804.   * @property {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} sqlBoolean Return a {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} representation of this expression type.
    805. 

  805.   * @property {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} sqlFunction Return a {@link patio.sql.SQLFunction} representation of this expression type.
    806. 

  806.   * @property {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} sqlNumber Return a {@link patio.sql.NumericExpression} representation of this expression type.
    807. 

  807.   * <pre class="code">
    808. 

  808.   * sql.a.not("a") //=> NOT "a"
    809. 

  809.   * sql.a.sqlNumber.not() //=> ~"a"
    810. 

  810.   * </pre>
    811. 

  811.   * @property {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} sqlString  Return a {@link patio.sql.StringExpression} representation of this expression type.
    812. 

  812.   * <pre class="code">
    813. 

  813.   * sql.a.plus(sql.b); //=> "a" + "b"
    814. 

  814.   * sql.a.sqlString.concat(sql.b) //=> "a" || "b"
    815. 

  815.   * </pre>
    816. 

  816.   */
    817. 

  817. 1var ComplexExpressionMethods = define(null, {
    818. 

  818.      instance:{
    819. 

  819.          /**@ignore*/
    820. 

  820.          getters:{
    821. 

  821.  
    822. 

  822.              /**
    823. 

  823.               * @ignore
    824. 

  824.               */
    825. 

  825.              sqlBoolean:function () {
    826. 

  826. 0                return new BooleanExpression("noop", this);
    827. 

  827.              },
    828. 

  828.  
    829. 

  829.  
    830. 

  830.              /**
    831. 

  831.               * @ignore
    832. 

  832.               */
    833. 

  833.              sqlFunction:function () {
    834. 

  834. 13                return new SQLFunction(this);
    835. 

  835.              },
    836. 

  836.  
    837. 

  837.  
    838. 

  838.              /**
    839. 

  839.               * @ignore
    840. 

  840.               */
    841. 

  841.              sqlNumber:function () {
    842. 

  842. 50                return new NumericExpression("noop", this);
    843. 

  843.              },
    844. 

  844.  
    845. 

  845.              /**
    846. 

  846.               * @ignore
    847. 

  847.               */
    848. 

  848.              sqlString:function () {
    849. 

  849. 0                return new StringExpression("noop", this);
    850. 

  850.              }
    851. 

  851.          }
    852. 

  852.      }
    853. 

  853.  }).as(sql, "ComplexExpressionMethods");
    854. 

  854.  
    855. 

  855. 1var inequalityMethod = function (op) {
    856. 

  856. 6    return function (expression) {
    857. 

  857. 88        if (isInstanceOf(expression, BooleanExpression)
    858. 

  858.              || isBoolean(expression)
    859. 

  859.              || isNull(expression)
    860. 

  860.              || (isHash(expression))
    861. 

  861.              || isArray(expression)) {
    862. 

  862. 0            throw new ExpressionError("Cannot apply " + op + " to a boolean expression");
    863. 

  863.          } else {
    864. 

  864. 88            return new BooleanExpression(op, this, expression);
    865. 

  865.          }
    866. 

  866.      }
    867. 

  867.  };
    868. 

  868.  
    869. 

  869.  /**
    870. 

  870.   * @class This mixin includes the inequality methods (>, <, >=, <=) that are defined on objects that can be
    871. 

  871.   * used in a numeric or string context in SQL.
    872. 

  872.   *
    873. 

  873.   * @example
    874. 

  874.   * sql.a.gt("b")  //=> a > "b"
    875. 

  875.   * sql.a.lt("b")  //=> a > "b"
    876. 

  876.   * sql.a.gte("b") //=> a >= "b"
    877. 

  877.   * sql.a.lte("b") //=> a <= "b"
    878. 

  878.   * sql.a.eq("b") //=> a = "b"
    879. 

  879.   *
    880. 

  880.   * @name InequalityMethods
    881. 

  881.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    882. 

  882.   */
    883. 

  883. 1var InequalityMethods = define(null, {
    884. 

  884.      instance:{
    885. 

  885.          /**@lends patio.sql.InequalityMethods.prototype*/
    886. 

  886.  
    887. 

  887.          /**
    888. 

  888.           * @function Creates a gt {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} compared to this expression.
    889. 

  889.           * @example
    890. 

  890.           *
    891. 

  891.           * sql.a.gt("b")  //=> a > "b"
    892. 

  892.           *
    893. 

  893.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression}
    894. 

  894.           */
    895. 

  895.          gt:inequalityMethod("gt"),
    896. 

  896.          /**
    897. 

  897.           * @function Creates a gte {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} compared to this expression.
    898. 

  898.           *
    899. 

  899.           * @example
    900. 

  900.           *
    901. 

  901.           * sql.a.gte("b")  //=> a >= "b"
    902. 

  902.           *
    903. 

  903.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression}
    904. 

  904.           */
    905. 

  905.          gte:inequalityMethod("gte"),
    906. 

  906.          /**
    907. 

  907.           * @function Creates a lt {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} compared to this expression.
    908. 

  908.           *
    909. 

  909.           * @example
    910. 

  910.           *
    911. 

  911.           * sql.a.lt("b")  //=> a < "b"
    912. 

  912.           *
    913. 

  913.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression}
    914. 

  914.           */
    915. 

  915.          lt:inequalityMethod("lt"),
    916. 

  916.          /**
    917. 

  917.           * @function  Creates a lte {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} compared to this expression.
    918. 

  918.           *
    919. 

  919.           * @example
    920. 

  920.           *
    921. 

  921.           * sql.a.lte("b")  //=> a <= "b"
    922. 

  922.           *
    923. 

  923.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression}
    924. 

  924.           */
    925. 

  925.          lte:inequalityMethod("lte"),
    926. 

  926.          /**
    927. 

  927.           * @function  Creates a eq {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} compared to this expression.
    928. 

  928.           *
    929. 

  929.           * @example
    930. 

  930.           *
    931. 

  931.           * sql.a.eq("b")  //=> a = "b"
    932. 

  932.           *
    933. 

  933.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression}
    934. 

  934.           */
    935. 

  935.          eq:inequalityMethod("eq"),
    936. 

  936.  
    937. 

  937.          neq:inequalityMethod("neq"),
    938. 

  938.  
    939. 

  939.          /**
    940. 

  940.           * @private
    941. 

  941.           *
    942. 

  942.           * Creates a boolean expression where the key is '>=' value 1 and '<=' value two.
    943. 

  943.           *
    944. 

  944.           * @example
    945. 

  945.           *
    946. 

  946.           * sql.x.between([1,2]) => //=> WHERE ((x >= 1) AND (x <= 10))
    947. 

  947.           * sql.x.between([1,2]).invert() => //=> WHERE ((x < 1) OR (x > 10))
    948. 

  948.           *
    949. 

  949.           * @param {Object} items a two element array where the first element it the item to be gte and the second item lte.
    950. 

  950.           *
    951. 

  951.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} a boolean expression containing the between expression.
    952. 

  952.           */
    953. 

  953.          between:function (items) {
    954. 

  954. 6            return new BooleanExpression("AND", new BooleanExpression("gte", this, items[0]), new BooleanExpression("lte", this, items[1]))
    955. 

  955.          }
    956. 

  956.      }
    957. 

  957.  }).as(sql, "InequalityMethods");
    958. 

  958.  
    959. 

  959.  /**
    960. 

  960.   * @class This mixin augments the default constructor for {@link patio.sql.ComplexExpression},
    961. 

  961.   * so that attempting to use boolean input when initializing a {@link patio.sql.NumericExpression}
    962. 

  962.   * or {@link patio.sql.StringExpression} results in an error. <b>It is not expected to be used directly.</b>
    963. 

  963.   *
    964. 

  964.   * @name NoBooleanInputMethods
    965. 

  965.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    966. 

  966.   */
    967. 

  967. 1var NoBooleanInputMethods = define(null, {
    968. 

  968.      instance:{
    969. 

  969.          constructor:function (op) {
    970. 

  970. 22            var args = argsToArray(arguments, 1);
    971. 

  971. 22            args.forEach(function (expression) {
    972. 

  972. 26                if ((isInstanceOf(expression, BooleanExpression))
    973. 

  973.                      || isBoolean(expression)
    974. 

  974.                      || isNull(expression)
    975. 

  975.                      || (isObject(expression) && !isInstanceOf(expression, Expression, Dataset, LiteralString))
    976. 

  976.                      || isArray(expression)) {
    977. 

  977. 0                    throw new ExpressionError("Cannot apply " + op + " to a boolean expression");
    978. 

  978.                  }
    979. 

  979.              });
    980. 

  980. 22            this._super(arguments);
    981. 

  981.          }
    982. 

  982.      }
    983. 

  983.  }).as(sql, "NoBooleanInputMethods");
    984. 

  984.  
    985. 

  985. 1var numericMethod = function (op) {
    986. 

  986. 4    return function (expression) {
    987. 

  987. 12        if (isInstanceOf(expression, BooleanExpression, StringExpression)) {
    988. 

  988. 0            throw new ExpressionError("Cannot apply " + op + " to a non numeric expression");
    989. 

  989.          } else {
    990. 

  990. 12            return new NumericExpression(op, this, expression);
    991. 

  991.          }
    992. 

  992.      }
    993. 

  993.  };
    994. 

  994.  
    995. 

  995.  
    996. 

  996.  /**
    997. 

  997.   * @class This mixin includes the standard mathematical methods (+, -, *, and /)
    998. 

  998.   * that are defined on objects that can be used in a numeric context in SQL.
    999. 

  999.   *
    1000. 

  1000.   * @example
    1001. 

  1001.   * sql.a.plus(sql.b) //=> "a" + "b"
    1002. 

  1002.   * sql.a.minus(sql.b) //=> "a" - "b"
    1003. 

  1003.   * sql.a.multiply(sql.b) //=> "a" * "b"
    1004. 

  1004.   * sql.a.divide(sql.b) //=> "a" / "b"
    1005. 

  1005.   *
    1006. 

  1006.   * @name NumericMethods
    1007. 

  1007.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    1008. 

  1008.   */
    1009. 

  1009. 1var NumericMethods = define(null, {
    1010. 

  1010.      instance:{
    1011. 

  1011.          /**@lends patio.sql.NumericMethods.prototype*/
    1012. 

  1012.  
    1013. 

  1013.  
    1014. 

  1014.          /**
    1015. 

  1015.           * @function  Adds the provided expression to this expression and returns a {@link patio.sql.NumericExpression}.
    1016. 

  1016.           *
    1017. 

  1017.           * @example
    1018. 

  1018.           *
    1019. 

  1019.           * sql.a.plus(sql.b)  //=> "a" + "b"
    1020. 

  1020.           *
    1021. 

  1021.           * @return {patio.sql.NumericExpression}
    1022. 

  1022.           */
    1023. 

  1023.          plus:numericMethod("plus"),
    1024. 

  1024.  
    1025. 

  1025.          /**
    1026. 

  1026.           * @function  Subtracts the provided expression from this expression and returns a {@link patio.sql.NumericExpression}.
    1027. 

  1027.           *
    1028. 

  1028.           * @example
    1029. 

  1029.           *
    1030. 

  1030.           * sql.a.minus(sql.b)  //=> "a" - "b"
    1031. 

  1031.           *
    1032. 

  1032.           * @return {patio.sql.NumericExpression}
    1033. 

  1033.           */
    1034. 

  1034.          minus:numericMethod("minus"),
    1035. 

  1035.  
    1036. 

  1036.          /**
    1037. 

  1037.           * @function  Divides this expression by the  provided expression and returns a {@link patio.sql.NumericExpression}.
    1038. 

  1038.           *
    1039. 

  1039.           * @example
    1040. 

  1040.           *
    1041. 

  1041.           * sql.a.divide(sql.b)  //=> "a" / "b"
    1042. 

  1042.           *
    1043. 

  1043.           * @return {patio.sql.NumericExpression}
    1044. 

  1044.           */
    1045. 

  1045.          divide:numericMethod("divide"),
    1046. 

  1046.  
    1047. 

  1047.          /**
    1048. 

  1048.           * @function  Divides this expression by the  provided expression and returns a {@link patio.sql.NumericExpression}.
    1049. 

  1049.           *
    1050. 

  1050.           * @example
    1051. 

  1051.           *
    1052. 

  1052.           * sql.a.multiply(sql.b)  //=> "a" * "b"
    1053. 

  1053.           *
    1054. 

  1054.           * @return {patio.sql.NumericExpression}
    1055. 

  1055.           */
    1056. 

  1056.          multiply:numericMethod("multiply")
    1057. 

  1057.      }
    1058. 

  1058.  }).as(sql, "NumericMethods");
    1059. 

  1059.  
    1060. 

  1060.  
    1061. 

  1061.  /**
    1062. 

  1062.   * @class This mixin provides ordering methods ("asc", "desc") to expression.
    1063. 

  1063.   *
    1064. 

  1064.   * @example
    1065. 

  1065.   *
    1066. 

  1066.   * sql.name.asc(); //=> name ASC
    1067. 

  1067.   * sql.price.desc(); //=> price DESC
    1068. 

  1068.   * sql.name.asc({nulls:"last"}); //=> name ASC NULLS LAST
    1069. 

  1069.   * sql.price.desc({nulls:"first"}); //=> price DESC NULLS FIRST
    1070. 

  1070.   *
    1071. 

  1071.   * @name OrderedMethods
    1072. 

  1072.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    1073. 

  1073.   */
    1074. 

  1074. 1var OrderedMethods = define(null, {
    1075. 

  1075.      instance:{
    1076. 

  1076.          /**@lends patio.sql.OrderedMethods.prototype*/
    1077. 

  1077.  
    1078. 

  1078.          /**
    1079. 

  1079.           * Mark the receiving SQL column as sorting in an ascending fashion (generally a no-op).
    1080. 

  1080.           *
    1081. 

  1081.           * @example
    1082. 

  1082.           * sql.name.asc(); //=> name ASC
    1083. 

  1083.           * sql.name.asc({nulls:"last"}); //=> name ASC NULLS LAST
    1084. 

  1084.           *
    1085. 

  1085.           * @param {Object} [options] options to use when sorting
    1086. 

  1086.           * @param {String} [options.nulls = null] Set to "first" to use NULLS FIRST (so NULL values are ordered
    1087. 

  1087.           *           before other values), or "last" to use NULLS LAST (so NULL values are ordered after other values).
    1088. 

  1088.           * @return {patio.sql.OrderedExpression}
    1089. 

  1089.           */
    1090. 

  1090.          asc:function (options) {
    1091. 

  1091. 7            return new OrderedExpression(this, false, options);
    1092. 

  1092.          },
    1093. 

  1093.  
    1094. 

  1094.          /**
    1095. 

  1095.           * Mark the receiving SQL column as sorting in a descending fashion.
    1096. 

  1096.           * @example
    1097. 

  1097.           *
    1098. 

  1098.           * sql.price.desc(); //=> price DESC
    1099. 

  1099.           * sql.price.desc({nulls:"first"}); //=> price DESC NULLS FIRST
    1100. 

  1100.           *
    1101. 

  1101.           * @param {Object} [options] options to use when sorting
    1102. 

  1102.           * @param {String} [options.nulls = null] Set to "first" to use NULLS FIRST (so NULL values are ordered
    1103. 

  1103.           *           before other values), or "last" to use NULLS LAST (so NULL values are ordered after other values).
    1104. 

  1104.           * @return {patio.sql.OrderedExpression}
    1105. 

  1105.           */
    1106. 

  1106.          desc:function (options) {
    1107. 

  1107. 26            return new OrderedExpression(this, true, options);
    1108. 

  1108.          }
    1109. 

  1109.      }
    1110. 

  1110.  }).as(sql, "OrderedMethods");
    1111. 

  1111.  
    1112. 

  1112.  
    1113. 

  1113.  /**
    1114. 

  1114.   * @class This mixin provides methods related to qualifying expression.
    1115. 

  1115.   *
    1116. 

  1116.   * @example
    1117. 

  1117.   *
    1118. 

  1118.   * sql.column.qualify("table") //=> "table"."column"
    1119. 

  1119.   * sql.table.qualify("schema") //=> "schema"."table"
    1120. 

  1120.   * sql.column.qualify("table").qualify("schema") //=> "schema"."table"."column"
    1121. 

  1121.   *
    1122. 

  1122.   * @name QualifyingMethods
    1123. 

  1123.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    1124. 

  1124.   */
    1125. 

  1125. 1var QualifyingMethods = define(null, {
    1126. 

  1126.      instance:{
    1127. 

  1127.          /**@lends patio.sql.QualifyingMethods.prototype*/
    1128. 

  1128.  
    1129. 

  1129.          /**
    1130. 

  1130.           * Qualify the receiver with the given qualifier (table for column/schema for table).
    1131. 

  1131.           *
    1132. 

  1132.           * @example
    1133. 

  1133.           * sql.column.qualify("table") //=> "table"."column"
    1134. 

  1134.           * sql.table.qualify("schema") //=> "schema"."table"
    1135. 

  1135.           * sql.column.qualify("table").qualify("schema") //=> "schema"."table"."column"
    1136. 

  1136.           *
    1137. 

  1137.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} qualifier table/schema to qualify this expression to.
    1138. 

  1138.           *
    1139. 

  1139.           * @return {patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier}
    1140. 

  1140.           */
    1141. 

  1141.          qualify:function (qualifier) {
    1142. 

  1142. 578            return new QualifiedIdentifier(qualifier, this);
    1143. 

  1143.          },
    1144. 

  1144.  
    1145. 

  1145.          /**
    1146. 

  1146.           * Use to create a .* expression.
    1147. 

  1147.           *
    1148. 

  1148.           * @example
    1149. 

  1149.           * sql.table.all() //=> "table".*
    1150. 

  1150.           * sql.table.qualify("schema").all() //=> "schema"."table".*
    1151. 

  1151.           *
    1152. 

  1152.           *
    1153. 

  1153.           * @return {patio.sql.ColumnAll}
    1154. 

  1154.           */
    1155. 

  1155.          all:function () {
    1156. 

  1156. 3            return new ColumnAll(this);
    1157. 

  1157.          }
    1158. 

  1158.  
    1159. 

  1159.  
    1160. 

  1160.      }
    1161. 

  1161.  }).as(sql, "QualifyingMethods");
    1162. 

  1162.  
    1163. 

  1163.  
    1164. 

  1164.  /**
    1165. 

  1165.   * @class This mixin provides SQL string methods such as (like and iLike).
    1166. 

  1166.   *
    1167. 

  1167.   * @example
    1168. 

  1168.   *
    1169. 

  1169.   * sql.a.like("A%"); //=> "a" LIKE 'A%'
    1170. 

  1170.   * sql.a.iLike("A%"); //=> "a" LIKE 'A%'
    1171. 

  1171.   * sql.a.like(/^a/); //=>  "a" ~* '^a'
    1172. 

  1172.   *
    1173. 

  1173.   * @name StringMethods
    1174. 

  1174.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    1175. 

  1175.   */
    1176. 

  1176. 1var StringMethods = define(null, {
    1177. 

  1177.      instance:{
    1178. 

  1178.          /**@lends patio.sql.StringMethods.prototype*/
    1179. 

  1179.  
    1180. 

  1180.          /**
    1181. 

  1181.           * Create a {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} case insensitive pattern match of the receiver
    1182. 

  1182.           * with the given patterns.  See {@link patio.sql.StringExpression#like}.
    1183. 

  1183.           *
    1184. 

  1184.           * @example
    1185. 

  1185.           * sql.a.iLike("A%"); //=> "a" LIKE 'A%'
    1186. 

  1186.           *
    1187. 

  1187.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression}
    1188. 

  1188.           */
    1189. 

  1189.          ilike:function (expression) {
    1190. 

  1190. 310            expression = argsToArray(arguments);
    1191. 

  1191. 310            return StringExpression.like.apply(StringExpression, [this].concat(expression).concat([
    1192. 

  1192.                  {caseInsensitive:true}
    1193. 

  1193.              ]));
    1194. 

  1194.          },
    1195. 

  1195.  
    1196. 

  1196.          /**
    1197. 

  1197.           * Create a {@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} case sensitive (if the database supports it) pattern match of the receiver with
    1198. 

  1198.           * the given patterns.  See {@link patio.sql.StringExpression#like}.
    1199. 

  1199.           *
    1200. 

  1200.           * @example
    1201. 

  1201.           * sql.a.like(/^a/); //=>  "a" ~* '^a'
    1202. 

  1202.           * sql.a.like("A%"); //=> "a" LIKE 'A%'
    1203. 

  1203.           *
    1204. 

  1204.           * @param expression
    1205. 

  1205.           */
    1206. 

  1206.          like:function (expression) {
    1207. 

  1207. 11            expression = argsToArray(arguments);
    1208. 

  1208. 11            return StringExpression.like.apply(StringExpression, [this].concat(expression));
    1209. 

  1209.          }
    1210. 

  1210.      }
    1211. 

  1211.  }).as(sql, "StringMethods");
    1212. 

  1212.  
    1213. 

  1213.  /**
    1214. 

  1214.   * @class This mixin provides string concatenation methods ("concat");
    1215. 

  1215.   *
    1216. 

  1216.   * @example
    1217. 

  1217.   *
    1218. 

  1218.   * sql.x.sqlString.concat("y"); //=> "x" || "y"
    1219. 

  1219.   *
    1220. 

  1220.   * @name StringConcatenationMethods
    1221. 

  1221.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    1222. 

  1222.   */
    1223. 

  1223. 1var StringConcatenationMethods = define(null, {
    1224. 

  1224.      instance:{
    1225. 

  1225.          /**@lends patio.sql.StringConcatenationMethods.prototype*/
    1226. 

  1226.  
    1227. 

  1227.          /**
    1228. 

  1228.           * Return a {@link patio.sql.StringExpression} representing the concatenation of this expression
    1229. 

  1229.           * with the given argument.
    1230. 

  1230.           *
    1231. 

  1231.           * @example
    1232. 

  1232.           *
    1233. 

  1233.           * sql.x.sqlString.concat("y"); //=> "x" || "y"
    1234. 

  1234.           *
    1235. 

  1235.           * @param expression expression to concatenate this expression with.
    1236. 

  1236.           */
    1237. 

  1237.          concat:function (expression) {
    1238. 

  1238. 0            return new StringExpression("||", this, expression);
    1239. 

  1239.          }
    1240. 

  1240.      }
    1241. 

  1241.  }).as(sql, "StringConcatenationMethods");
    1242. 

  1242.  
    1243. 

  1243.  /**
    1244. 

  1244.   * @class This mixin provides the ability to access elements within a SQL array.
    1245. 

  1245.   *
    1246. 

  1246.   * @example
    1247. 

  1247.   * sql.array.sqlSubscript(1) //=> array[1]
    1248. 

  1248.   * sql.array.sqlSubscript(1, 2) //=> array[1, 2]
    1249. 

  1249.   * sql.array.sqlSubscript([1, 2]) //=> array[1, 2]
    1250. 

  1250.   *
    1251. 

  1251.   * @name SubscriptMethods
    1252. 

  1252.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    1253. 

  1253.   */
    1254. 

  1254. 1var SubscriptMethods = define(null, {
    1255. 

  1255.      instance:{
    1256. 

  1256.  
    1257. 

  1257.          /**
    1258. 

  1258.           * Return a {@link patio.sql.Subscript} with the given arguments, representing an
    1259. 

  1259.           * SQL array access.
    1260. 

  1260.           *
    1261. 

  1261.           * @example
    1262. 

  1262.           * sql.array.sqlSubscript(1) //=> array[1]
    1263. 

  1263.           * sql.array.sqlSubscript(1, 2) //=> array[1, 2]
    1264. 

  1264.           * sql.array.sqlSubscript([1, 2]) //=> array[1, 2]
    1265. 

  1265.           *
    1266. 

  1266.           * @param subscript
    1267. 

  1267.           */
    1268. 

  1268.          sqlSubscript:function (subscript) {
    1269. 

  1269. 75            var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    1270. 

  1270. 75            return new SubScript(this, flatten(args));
    1271. 

  1271.          }
    1272. 

  1272.      }
    1273. 

  1273.  }).as(sql, "SubScriptMethods");
    1274. 

  1274.  
    1275. 

  1275.  
    1276. 

  1276.  /**
    1277. 

  1277.   * @class This is the parent of all expressions.
    1278. 

  1278.   *
    1279. 

  1279.   * @name Expression
    1280. 

  1280.   * @memberOf patio.sql
    1281. 

  1281.   */
    1282. 

  1282. 1var Expression = define(null, {
    1283. 

  1283.  
    1284. 

  1284.      instance:{
    1285. 

  1285.          /**@lends patio.sql.Expression.prototype*/
    1286. 

  1286.  
    1287. 

  1287.          /**
    1288. 

  1288.           * Returns the string representation of this expression
    1289. 

  1289.           *
    1290. 

  1290.           * @param {patio.Dataset} ds the dataset that will be used to SQL-ify this expression.
    1291. 

  1291.           * @return {String} a string literal version of this expression.
    1292. 

  1292.           */
    1293. 

  1293.          sqlLiteral:function (ds) {
    1294. 

  1294. 0            return this.toString(ds);
    1295. 

  1295.          }
    1296. 

  1296.  
    1297. 

  1297.      },
    1298. 

  1298.  
    1299. 

  1299.      static:{
    1300. 

  1300.          /**@lends patio.sql.Expression*/
    1301. 

  1301.  
    1302. 

  1302.          /**
    1303. 

  1303.           * This is a helper method that will take in an array of arguments and return an expression.
    1304. 

  1304.           *
    1305. 

  1305.           * @example
    1306. 

  1306.           *
    1307. 

  1307.           * QualifiedIdentifier.fromArgs(["table", "column"]);
    1308. 

  1308.           *
    1309. 

  1309.           * @param {*[]} args array of arguments to pass into the constructor of the function.
    1310. 

  1310.           *
    1311. 

  1311.           * @return {patio.sql.Expression} an expression.
    1312. 

  1312.           */
    1313. 

  1313.          fromArgs:function (args) {
    1314. 

  1314. 2327            var ret;
    1315. 

  1315. 2327            try {
    1316. 

  1316. 2327                ret = new this();
    1317. 

  1317.              } catch (ignore) {
    1318. 

  1318.              }
    1319. 

  1319. 2327            this.apply(ret, args);
    1320. 

  1320. 2327            return ret;
    1321. 

  1321.          },
    1322. 

  1322.  
    1323. 

  1323.          /**
    1324. 

  1324.           * Helper to determine if something is a condition specifier. Returns true if the object
    1325. 

  1325.           * is a Hash or is an array of two element arrays.
    1326. 

  1326.           *
    1327. 

  1327.           * @example
    1328. 

  1328.           * Expression.isConditionSpecifier({a : "b"}); //=> true
    1329. 

  1329.           * Expression.isConditionSpecifier("a"); //=> false
    1330. 

  1330.           * Expression.isConditionSpecifier([["a", "b"], ["c", "d"]]); //=> true
    1331. 

  1331.           * Expression.isConditionSpecifier([["a", "b", "e"], ["c", "d"]]); //=> false
    1332. 

  1332.           *
    1333. 

  1333.           * @param {*} obj object to test if it is a condition specifier
    1334. 

  1334.           * @return {Boolean} true if the object is a Hash or is an array of two element arrays.
    1335. 

  1335.           */
    1336. 

  1336.          isConditionSpecifier:function (obj) {
    1337. 

  1337. 22237            return isHash(obj) || (isArray(obj) && obj.length && obj.every(function (i) {
    1338. 

  1338. 9576                return isArray(i) && i.length === 2;
    1339. 

  1339.              }));
    1340. 

  1340.          }
    1341. 

  1341.      }
    1342. 

  1342.  
    1343. 

  1343.  }).as(sql, "Expression");
    1344. 

  1344.  
    1345. 

  1345.  /**
    1346. 

  1346.   * @class Base class for all GenericExpressions
    1347. 

  1347.   *
    1348. 

  1348.   * @augments patio.sql.Expression
    1349. 

  1349.   * @augments patio.sql.AliasMethods
    1350. 

  1350.   * @augments patio.sql.BooleanMethods
    1351.

    1352.

  1359.   * @name GenericExpression

    1361. 

  1361.   */
    1362. 

  1362. 1var GenericExpression = define([Expression, AliasMethods, BooleanMethods, CastMethods, ComplexExpressionMethods, InequalityMethods, NumericMethods, OrderedMethods, StringMethods, SubscriptMethods]).as(sql, "GenericExpression");

  1363.

  1404. 1var CaseExpression = define(GenericExpression, {
    1405. 

  1405.      instance:{
    1406. 

  1406.          /**@lends patio.sql.CaseExpression.prototype*/
    1407. 

  1407.  
    1408. 

  1408.          /**
    1409. 

  1409.           * Create an object with the given conditions and
    1410. 

  1410.           * default value.  An expression can be provided to
    1411. 

  1411.           * test each condition against, instead of having
    1412. 

  1412.           * all conditions represent their own boolean expression.
    1413. 

  1413.           *
    1414. 

  1414.           * @constructs
    1415. 

  1415.           * @augments patio.sql.GenericExpression
    1416. 

  1416.           * @param {Array|Object} conditions conditions to create the case expression from
    1417. 

  1417.           * @param def default value
    1418. 

  1418.           * @param expression expression to create the CASE expression from
    1419. 

  1419.           *
    1420. 

  1420.           * @property {Boolean} hasExpression returns true if this case expression has a expression
    1421. 

  1421.           * @property conditions the conditions of the {@link patio.sql.CaseExpression}.
    1422. 

  1422.           * @property def the default value of the {@link patio.sql.CaseExpression}.
    1423. 

  1423.           * @property expression the expression of the {@link patio.sql.CaseExpression}.
    1424. 

  1424.           * @property {Boolean} noExpression true if this {@link patio.sql.CaseExpression}'s expression is undefined.
    1425. 

  1425.           */
    1426. 

  1426.          constructor:function (conditions, def, expression) {
    1427. 

  1427. 8            if (Expression.isConditionSpecifier(conditions)) {
    1428. 

  1428. 4                this.conditions = toArray(conditions);
    1429. 

  1429. 4                this.def = def;
    1430. 

  1430. 4                this.expression = expression;
    1431. 

  1431. 4                this.noExpression = isUndefined(expression);
    1432. 

  1432.              }
    1433. 

  1433.          },
    1434. 

  1434.  
    1435. 

  1435.          /**
    1436. 

  1436.           * Converts the case expression to a string
    1437. 

  1437.           *
    1438.

    1439.

    1440. 

  1440.           *
    1441.

    1442.

    1443. 

  1443.          toString:function (ds) {
    1444. 

  1444. 2            !Dataset && (Dataset = require("./dataset"));
    1445.

    1446. 

  1446. 2            return ds.caseExpressionSql(this);
    1447. 

  1447.          },
    1448.

    1449.

    1450.

    1452. 

  1452.              hasExpression:function () {
    1453. 

  1453. 2                return !this.noExpression;
    1454.

    1455.

  1460. 1var Cast = define(GenericExpression, {

  1497. 1var ColumnAll = define(Expression, {

    1510.
