    38. 

  38.          SQL_BEGIN:'BEGIN',
    39. 

  39.  
    40. 

  40.          /**
    41. 

  41.           * The <b>COMMIT</b> SQL fragment used to signify the end of a transaction and the final commit.
    42. 

  42.           */
    43. 

  43.          SQL_COMMIT:'COMMIT',
    44. 

  44.  
    45. 

  45.          /**
    46. 

  46.           * The <b>RELEASE SAVEPOINT</b> SQL fragment used by trasactions when using save points.
    47. 

  47.           * The adapter should override this SQL fragment if the adapters SQL is different.
    48. 

  48.           * <p>
    49. 

  49.           *      <b>This fragment will not be used if {@link patio.Database#supportsSavepoints} is false.</b>
    50. 

  50.           * </p>
    51. 

  51.           */
    52. 

  52.          SQL_RELEASE_SAVEPOINT:'RELEASE SAVEPOINT autopoint_%d',
    53. 

  53.  
    54. 

  54.          /**
    55. 

  55.           * The <b>ROLLBACK</b> SQL fragment used to rollback a database transaction.
    56. 

  56.           * This should be overrode by adapters if the SQL for the adapters
    57. 

  57.           * database is different.
    58. 

  58.           */
    59. 

  59.          SQL_ROLLBACK:'ROLLBACK',
    60. 

  60.  
    61. 

  61.          /**
    62. 

  62.           * The <b>ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT</b> SQL fragment used to rollback a database transaction
    63. 

  63.           * to a particular save point.
    64. 

  64.           * This should be overrode by adapters if the SQL for the adapters
    65. 

  65.           * database is different.
    66. 

  66.           *
    67. 

  67.           * <p>
    68. 

  68.           *      <b>This fragment will not be used if {@link patio.Database#supportsSavepoints} is false.</b>
    69. 

  69.           * </p>
    70. 

  70.           */
    71. 

  71.          SQL_ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT:'ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT autopoint_%d',
    72. 

  72.  
    73. 

  73.          /**
    74. 

  74.           * The <b>SAVEPOINT</b> SQL fragment used for creating a save point in a
    75. 

  75.           * database transaction.
    76. 

  76.           * <p>
    77. 

  77.           *      <b>This fragment will not be used if {@link patio.Database#supportsSavepoints} is false.</b>
    78. 

  78.           * </p>
    79. 

  79.           */
    80. 

  80.          SQL_SAVEPOINT:'SAVEPOINT autopoint_%d',
    81. 

  81.  
    82. 

  82.          /**
    83. 

  83.           * Object containing different database transaction isolation levels.
    84. 

  84.           * This object is used to look up the proper SQL when starting a new transaction
    85. 

  85.           * and setting the isolation level in the options.
    86. 

  86.           * @field
    87. 

  87.           */
    88. 

  88.          TRANSACTION_ISOLATION_LEVELS:{
    89. 

  89.              uncommitted:'READ UNCOMMITTED',
    90. 

  90.              committed:'READ COMMITTED',
    91. 

  91.              repeatable:'REPEATABLE READ',
    92. 

  92.              serializable:'SERIALIZABLE'
    93. 

  93.          },
    94. 

  94.  
    95. 

  95.          /**
    96. 

  96.           * @ignore
    97. 

  97.           */
    98. 

  98.          POSTGRES_DEFAULT_RE:/^(?:B?('.*')::[^']+|\((-?\d+(?:\.\d+)?)\))$/,
    99. 

  99.  
    100. 

  100.          /**
    101. 

  101.           * @ignore
    102. 

  102.           */
    103. 

  103.          MSSQL_DEFAULT_RE:/^(?:\(N?('.*')\)|\(\((-?\d+(?:\.\d+)?)\)\))$/,
    104. 

  104.  
    105. 

  105.          /**
    106. 

  106.           * @ignore
    107. 

  107.           */
    108. 

  108.          MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_RE:/^CURRENT_(?:DATE|TIMESTAMP)?$/,
    109. 

  109.  
    110. 

  110.          /**
    111. 

  111.           * @ignore
    112. 

  112.           */
    113. 

  113.          STRING_DEFAULT_RE:/^'(.*)'$/,
    114. 

  114.  
    115. 

  115.          /**
    116. 

  116.           * @ignore
    117. 

  117.           */
    118. 

  118.          POSTGRES_TIME_PATTERN:"HH:mm:ss",
    119. 

  119.  
    120. 

  120.          /**
    121. 

  121.           * @ignore
    122. 

  122.           */
    123. 

  123.          POSTGRES_DATE_TIME_PATTERN:"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSZ",
    124. 

  124.  
    125. 

  125.          __transactions:null,
    126. 

  126.  
    127. 

  127.  
    128. 

  128.          /**
    129. 

  129.           * @ignore
    130. 

  130.           */
    131. 

  131.          constructor:function () {
    132. 

  132. 122            this._super(arguments);
    133. 

  133. 122            this.__transactions = [];
    134. 

  134. 122            this.__transactionQueue = new Queue();
    135. 

  135.          },
    136. 

  136.  
    137. 

  137.          /**
    138. 

  138.           * Executes the given SQL on the database. This method should be implemented by adapters.
    139. 

  139.           * <b>This method should not be called directly by user code.</b>
    140. 

  140.           */
    141. 

  141.          execute:function (sql, options, cb, conn) {
    142. 

  142. 1            throw new NotImplemented("execute should be implemented by adapter");
    143. 

  143.          },
    144. 

  144.  
    145. 

  145.          /**
    146. 

  146.           * Return a Promise that is resolved with an object containing index information.
    147. 

  147.           * <p>
    148. 

  148.           *     The keys are index names. Values are objects with two keys, columns and unique.  The value of columns
    149. 

  149.           *     is an array of column names.  The value of unique is true or false
    150. 

  150.           *     depending on if the index is unique.
    151. 

  151.           * </p>
    152. 

  152.           *
    153. 

  153.           * <b>Should not include the primary key index, functional indexes, or partial indexes.</b>
    154. 

  154.           *
    155. 

  155.           * @example
    156. 

  156.           *   DB.indexes("artists").then(function(indexes){
    157. 

  157.           *     //e.g. indexes === {artists_name_ukey : {columns : [name], unique : true}};
    158. 

  158.           *   })
    159. 

  159.           **/
    160. 

  160.          indexes:function (table, opts) {
    161. 

  161. 1            throw new NotImplemented("indexes should be overridden by adapters");
    162. 

  162.          },
    163. 

  163.  
    164. 

  164.          /**
    165. 

  165.           * Proxy for {@link patio.Dataset#get}.
    166. 

  166.           */
    167. 

  167.          get:function () {
    168. 

  168. 6            return this.dataset.get.apply(this.dataset, arguments);
    169. 

  169.          },
    170. 

  170.  
    171. 

  171.          /**
    172. 

  172.           * @ignore
    173. 

  173.           * //todo implement prepared statements
    174. 

  174.           *
    175. 

  175.           * Call the prepared statement with the given name with the given object
    176. 

  176.           * of arguments.
    177. 

  177.           *
    178. 

  178.           *   DB.from("items").filter({id : 1}).prepare("first", "sa");
    179. 

  179.           *   DB.call("sa") //=> SELECT * FROM items WHERE id = 1
    180. 

  180.           *   */
    181. 

  181.          call:function (psName, hash) {
    182. 

  182. 0            hash = hash || {};
    183. 

  183. 0            this.preparedStatements[psName](hash);
    184. 

  184.          },
    185. 

  185.  
    186. 

  186.          /**
    187. 

  187.           * Method that should be used when submitting any DDL (Data DefinitionLanguage) SQL,
    188. 

  188.           * such as {@link patio.Database#createTable}. By default, calls {@link patio.Database#executeDui}.
    189. 

  189.           * <b>This method should not be called directly by user code.</b>
    190. 

  190.           */
    191. 

  191.          executeDdl:function (sql, opts) {
    192. 

  192. 620            opts = opts || {};
    193. 

  193. 620            return this.executeDui(sql, opts);
    194. 

  194.          },
    195. 

  195.  
    196. 

  196.  
    197. 

  197.          /**
    198. 

  198.           * Method that should be used when issuing a DELETE, UPDATE, or INSERT
    199. 

  199.           * statement.  By default, calls {@link patio.Database#execute}.
    200. 

  200.           * <b>This method should not be called directly by user code.</b>
    201. 

  201.           **/
    202. 

  202.          executeDui:function (sql, opts) {
    203. 

  203. 3149            opts = opts || {};
    204. 

  204. 3149            return this.execute(sql, opts);
    205. 

  205.          },
    206. 

  206.  
    207. 

  207.          /**
    208. 

  208.           * Method that should be used when issuing a INSERT
    209. 

  209.           * statement.  By default, calls {@link patio.Database#executeDui}.
    210. 

  210.           * <b>This method should not be called directly by user code.</b>
    211. 

  211.           **/
    212. 

  212.          executeInsert:function (sql, opts) {
    213. 

  213. 1317            opts = opts || {};
    214. 

  214. 1317            return this.executeDui(sql, opts);
    215. 

  215.          },
    216. 

  216.  
    217. 

  217.  
    218. 

  218.          /**
    219. 

  219.           * Runs the supplied SQL statement string on the database server..
    220. 

  220.           *
    221. 

  221.           * @example
    222. 

  222.           * DB.run("SET some_server_variable = 42")
    223. 

  223.           *
    224. 

  224.           * @param {String} sql the SQL to run.
    225. 

  225.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved with the result of the query.
    226. 

  226.           **/
    227. 

  227.          run:function (sql, opts) {
    228. 

  228. 43            opts = opts || {};
    229. 

  229. 43            return this.executeDdl(sql, opts);
    230. 

  230.          },
    231. 

  231.  
    232. 

  232.          /**
    233. 

  233.           * Parse the schema from the database.
    234. 

  234.           *
    235. 

  235.           * @example
    236. 

  236.           *
    237. 

  237.           *   DB.schema("artists").then(function(schema){
    238. 

  238.           *     //example schema
    239. 

  239.           *     {
    240. 

  240.           *      id :  {
    241. 

  241.           *          type : "integer",
    242. 

  242.           *          primaryKey : true,
    243. 

  243.           *          "default" : "nextval('artist_id_seq'::regclass)",
    244. 

  244.           *          jsDefault : null,
    245. 

  245.           *          dbType : "integer",
    246. 

  246.           *          allowNull : false
    247. 

  247.           *       },
    248. 

  248.           *      name : {
    249. 

  249.           *          type : "string",
    250. 

  250.           *          primaryKey : false,
    251. 

  251.           *          "default" : null,
    252. 

  252.           *          jsDefault  : null,
    253. 

  253.           *          dbType : "text",
    254. 

  254.           *          allowNull : false
    255. 

  255.           *       }
    256. 

  256.           *     }
    257. 

  257.           *   })
    258. 

  258.           *
    259. 

  259.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier} table the table to get the schema for.
    260. 

  260.           * @param {Object} [opts=null] Additinal options.
    261. 

  261.           * @param {boolean} [opts.reload=false] Set to true to ignore any cached results.
    262. 

  262.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} [opts.schema] An explicit schema to use.  It may also be implicitly provided
    263. 

  263.           *            via the table name.
    264. 

  264.           *
    265. 

  265.           * @return {Promise} Returns a Promise that is resolved with the schema for the given table as an object
    266. 

  266.           * where the key is the column name and the value is and object containg column information. The default
    267. 

  267.           * column information returned.
    268. 

  268.           * <ul>
    269. 

  269.           *     <li>allowNull : Whether NULL is an allowed value for the column.</li>
    270. 

  270.           *     <li>dbType : The database type for the column, as a database specific string.</li>
    271. 

  271.           *     <li>"default" : The database default for the column, as a database specific string.</li>
    272. 

  272.           *     <li>primaryKey : Whether the columns is a primary key column.  If this column is not present,
    273. 

  273.           *                 it means that primary key information is unavailable, not that the column
    274. 

  274.           *                 is not a primary key.</li>
    275. 

  275.           *     <li>jsDefault : The database default for the column, as a javascript object.  In many cases, complex
    276. 

  276.           *                  database defaults cannot be parsed into javascript objects.</li>
    277. 

  277.           *     <li>type : A string specifying the type, such as "integer" or "string".</li>
    278. 

  278.           * <ul>
    279. 

  279.           *
    280. 

  280.           */
    281. 

  281.          schema:function (table, opts) {
    282. 

  282. 115            if (!isFunction(this.schemaParseTable)) {
    283. 

  283. 0                throw new Error("Schema parsing is not implemented on this database");
    284. 

  284.              }
    285. 

  285. 115            var ret = new Promise();
    286. 

  286. 115            opts = opts || {};
    287. 

  287. 115            var schemaParts = this.__schemaAndTable(table);
    288. 

  288. 115            var sch = schemaParts[0], tableName = schemaParts[1];
    289. 

  289. 115            var quotedName = this.__quoteSchemaTable(table);
    290. 

  290. 115            opts = sch && !opts.schema ? merge({schema:sch}, opts) : opts;
    291. 

  291. 115            if (opts.reload) {
    292. 

  292. 1                delete this.schemas[quotedName];
    293. 

  293.              }
    294. 

  294. 115            if (this.schemas[quotedName]) {
    295. 

  295. 35                ret.callback(this.schemas[quotedName]);
    296. 

  296. 35                return ret;
    297. 

  297.              } else {
    298. 

  298. 80                this.schemaParseTable(tableName, opts).then(hitch(this, function (cols) {
    299. 

  299. 80                    var schema = {};
    300. 

  300. 80                    if (!cols || cols.length === 0) {
    301. 

  301. 0                        ret.errback("Error parsing schema, no columns returns, table probably doesnt exist");
    302. 

  302.                      } else {
    303. 

  303. 80                        cols.forEach(function (c) {
    304. 

  304. 413                            var name = c[0];
    305. 

  305. 413                            c = c[1];
    306. 

  306. 413                            c.jsDefault = this.__columnSchemaToJsDefault(c["default"], c.type);
    307. 

  307. 413                            schema[name] = c;
    308. 

  308.                          }, this);
    309. 

  309. 80                        this.schemas[quotedName] = schema;
    310. 

  310. 80                        ret.callback(schema);
    311. 

  311.                      }
    312. 

  312.                  }), ret);
    313. 

  313.              }
    314. 

  314. 80            return ret.promise();
    315. 

  315.          },
    316. 

  316.  
    317. 

  317.          /**
    318. 

  318.           * Remove the cached schema for the given table name
    319. 

  319.           * @example
    320. 

  320.           * DB.schema("artists").then(function(){
    321. 

  321.           *      DB.removeCachedSchema("artists");
    322. 

  322.           * });
    323. 

  323.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier} the table to remove from this
    324. 

  324.           * databases cached schemas.
    325. 

  325.           */
    326. 

  326.          removeCachedSchema:function (table) {
    327. 

  327. 509            if (this.schemas && !isEmpty(this.schemas)) {
    328. 

  328. 205                delete this.schemas[this.__quoteSchemaTable(table)];
    329. 

  329.              }
    330. 

  330.          },
    331. 

  331.  
    332. 

  332.          /**
    333. 

  333.           * Determine if a table exists.
    334. 

  334.           * @example
    335. 

  335.           * comb.executeInOrder(DB, function(DB){
    336. 

  336.           *    return {
    337. 

  337.           *          table1Exists : DB.tableExists("table1"),
    338. 

  338.           *          table2Exists : DB.tableExists("table2")
    339. 

  339.           *    };
    340. 

  340.           * }).then(function(ret){
    341. 

  341.           *      //ret.table1Exists === true
    342. 

  342.           *      //ret.table2Exists === false
    343. 

  343.           * });
    344. 

  344.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier} the table to remove from this
    345. 

  345.           *
    346. 

  346.           * @return {Promise} a promise resolved with a boolean indicating if the table exists.
    347. 

  347.           */
    348. 

  348.          tableExists:function (table, cb) {
    349. 

  349. 2            var ret = new Promise().classic(cb);
    350. 

  350. 2            this.from(table).first().then(function () {
    351. 

  351. 1                ret.callback(true);
    352. 

  352.              }, function () {
    353. 

  353. 1                ret.callback(false);
    354. 

  354.              });
    355. 

  355. 2            return ret.promise();
    356. 

  356.          },
    357. 

  357.  
    358. 

  358.          /**
    359. 

  359.           * Returns a promise with a list of tables names in this database. This method
    360. 

  360.           * should be implemented by the adapter.
    361. 

  361.           *
    362. 

  362.           * @example
    363. 

  363.           * DB.tables().then(function(tables){
    364. 

  364.           *    //e.g. tables === ["table1", "table2", "table3"];
    365. 

  365.           * });
    366. 

  366.           *
    367. 

  367.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved with a list of tablenames.
    368. 

  368.           */
    369. 

  369.          tables:function () {
    370. 

  370. 1            throw new NotImplemented("tables should be implemented by the adapter");
    371. 

  371.          },
    372. 

  372.  
    373. 

  373.          /**
    374. 

  374.           * Starts a database transaction.  When a database transaction is used,
    375. 

  375.           * either all statements are successful or none of the statements are
    376. 

  376.           * successful.
    377. 

  377.           * <p>
    378. 

  378.           *      <b>Note</b> that MySQL MyISAM tables do not support transactions.</p>
    379. 

  379.           * </p>
    380. 

  380.           *
    381. 

  381.           * ```
    382. 

  382.           * //normal transaction
    383. 

  383.           * DB.transaction(function() {
    384. 

  384.           *      return comb.when(
    385. 

  385.           *          this.execute('DROP TABLE test;'),
    386. 

  386.           *          this.execute('DROP TABLE test2;')
    387. 

  387.           *      );
    388. 

  388.           *  });
    389. 

  389.           *
    390. 

  390.           * //transaction with a save point.
    391. 

  391.           * DB.transaction(function() {
    392. 

  392.           *      return this.transaction({savepoint : true}, function() {
    393. 

  393.           *         return comb.when(
    394. 

  394.           *              this.execute('DROP TABLE test;'),
    395. 

  395.           *              this.execute('DROP TABLE test2;')
    396. 

  396.           *         );
    397. 

  397.           *      });
    398. 

  398.           *});
    399. 

  399.           * ```
    400. 

  400.           *
    401. 

  401.           * Using a promise.
    402. 

  402.           *
    403. 

  403.           * ```
    404. 

  404.           * var ds = db.from("user");
    405. 

  405.           * db.transaction(function(){
    406. 

  406.           *      return ds.insert({
    407. 

  407.           *              firstName:"Jane",
    408. 

  408.           *              lastName:"Gorgenson",
    409. 

  409.           *              password:"password",
    410. 

  410.           *              dateOfBirth:new Date(1956, 1, 3)
    411. 

  411.           *          }).chain(function(){
    412. 

  412.           *              return ds.forEach(function(user){
    413. 

  413.           *                  return ds.where({id:user.id}).update({firstName:user.firstName + 1});
    414. 

  414.           *              });
    415. 

  415.           *      });
    416. 

  416.           * });
    417. 

  417.           * ```
    418. 

  418.           *
    419. 

  419.           * Using the done method
    420. 

  420.           * ```
    421. 

  421.           * var ds = db.from("user");
    422. 

  422.           * db.transaction(function(db, done){
    423. 

  423.           *      ds.insert({
    424. 

  424.           *          firstName:"Jane",
    425. 

  425.           *          lastName:"Gorgenson",
    426. 

  426.           *          password:"password",
    427. 

  427.           *          dateOfBirth:new Date(1956, 1, 3)
    428. 

  428.           *      }).chain(function(){
    429. 

  429.           *          ds.forEach(function(user){
    430. 

  430.           *             return ds.where({id:user.id}).update({firstName:user.firstName + 1});
    431. 

  431.           *          }).classic(done)
    432. 

  432.           *      });
    433. 

  433.           * });
    434. 

  434.           * ```
    435. 

  435.           *
    436. 

  436.           * ```
    437. 

  437.           * //WITH ISOLATION LEVELS
    438. 

  438.           *
    439. 

  439.           * db.supportsTransactionIsolationLevels = true;
    440. 

  440.           * //BEGIN
    441. 

  441.           * //SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ UNCOMMITTED
    442. 

  442.           * //DROP TABLE test1'
    443. 

  443.           * //COMMIT
    444. 

  444.           * DB.transaction({isolation:"uncommited"}, function(d) {
    445. 

  445.           *     return d.run("DROP TABLE test1");
    446. 

  446.           * });
    447. 

  447.           *
    448. 

  448.           * //BEGIN
    449. 

  449.           * //SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ COMMITTED
    450. 

  450.           * //DROP TABLE test1
    451. 

  451.           * //COMMIT
    452. 

  452.           *  DB.transaction({isolation:"committed"}, function(d) {
    453. 

  453.           *      return d.run("DROP TABLE test1");
    454. 

  454.           *  });
    455. 

  455.           *
    456. 

  456.           * //BEGIN
    457. 

  457.           * //SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL REPEATABLE READ'
    458. 

  458.           * //DROP TABLE test1
    459. 

  459.           * //COMMIT
    460. 

  460.           *  DB.transaction({isolation:"repeatable"}, function(d) {
    461. 

  461.           *      return d.run("DROP TABLE test1");
    462. 

  462.           *  });
    463. 

  463.           *
    464. 

  464.           * //BEGIN
    465. 

  465.           * //SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL SERIALIZABLE
    466. 

  466.           * //DROP TABLE test1
    467. 

  467.           * //COMMIT
    468. 

  468.           *  DB.transaction({isolation:"serializable"}, function(d) {
    469. 

  469.           *      return d.run("DROP TABLE test1");
    470. 

  470.           *  });
    471. 

  471.           *
    472. 

  472.           * //With an Error
    473. 

  473.           * //BEGIN
    474. 

  474.           * //DROP TABLE test
    475. 

  475.           * //ROLLBACK
    476. 

  476.           * DB.transaction(function(d) {
    477. 

  477.           *      d.execute('DROP TABLE test');
    478. 

  478.           *      throw "Error";
    479. 

  479.           * });
    480. 

  480.           * ```
    481. 

  481.           *
    482. 

  482.           * @param {Object} [opts={}] options to use when performing the transaction.
    483. 

  483.           * @param {String} [opts.isolation] The transaction isolation level to use for this transaction,
    484. 

  484.           *               should be "uncommitted", "committed", "repeatable", or "serializable",
    485. 

  485.           *               used if given and the database/adapter supports customizable
    486. 

  486.           *               transaction isolation levels.
    487. 

  487.           * @param {String} [opts.prepare] A string to use as the transaction identifier for a
    488. 

  488.           *             prepared transaction (two-phase commit), if the database/adapter
    489. 

  489.           *             supports prepared transactions.
    490. 

  490.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.savepoint] Whether to create a new savepoint for this transaction,
    491. 

  491.           *               only respected if the database/adapter supports savepoints.  By
    492. 

  492.           *               default patio will reuse an existing transaction, so if you want to
    493. 

  493.           *               use a savepoint you must use this option.
    494. 

  494.           * @param {Function} cb a function used to perform the transaction. This function is
    495. 

  495.           * called in the scope of the database by default so one can use this. The funciton is also
    496. 

  496.           * called with the database as the first argument, and a function to be called when the tranaction is complete.
    497. 

  497.           * If you return a promise from the transaction block then you do not need to call the done cb.
    498. 

  498.           *
    499. 

  499.           *
    500. 

  500.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the transaction is complete.
    501. 

  501.           **/
    502. 

  502.          transaction:function (opts, cb) {
    503. 

  503. 1044            if (isFunction(opts)) {
    504. 

  504. 137                cb = opts;
    505. 

  505. 137                opts = {};
    506. 

  506.              } else {
    507. 

  507. 907                opts = opts || {};
    508. 

  508.              }
    509. 

  509. 1044            if (!this.__alreadyInTransaction) {
    510. 

  510. 951                this.__alreadyInTransaction = true;
    511. 

  511. 951                return this.__transaction(null, opts, cb);
    512. 

  512.              } else {
    513. 

  513. 93                var ret = new Promise();
    514. 

  514. 93                var transaction = hitch(this, function () {
    515. 

  515. 93                    this.__transaction(null, opts, cb).then(ret);
    516. 

  516.                  });
    517. 

  517. 93                this.__transactionQueue.enqueue(transaction);
    518. 

  518. 93                return ret.promise();
    519. 

  519.              }
    520. 

  520.          },
    521. 

  521.  
    522. 

  522.          __transactionProxy:function (cb, conn) {
    523. 

  523. 1049            var promises = [];
    524. 

  524. 1049            var repl = [];
    525. 

  525.              //set up our proxy methos
    526. 

  526. 1049            ["transaction", "execute"].forEach(function (n) {
    527. 

  527. 2098                var orig = this[n];
    528. 

  528. 2098                repl.push({name:n, orig:orig});
    529. 

  529. 2098                this[n] = function (arg1, arg2) {
    530. 

  530. 6698                    var ret;
    531. 

  531. 6698                    try {
    532. 

  532. 6698                        if (n === "transaction") {
    533. 

  533.                              //if its a transaction with no options then we just create a promise from what ever is returned
    534. 

  534. 2047                            if (isFunction(arg1)) {
    535. 

  535. 3                                ret = when(arg1.apply(this, [this]));
    536. 

  536.                              } else {
    537. 

  537. 2044                                if (this.supportsSavepoints && !isUndefinedOrNull(arg1.savepoint)) {
    538. 

  538.                                      //if we support save points there is a save point option then we
    539. 

  539.                                      //use __transaction again with the previous connection
    540. 

  540. 5                                    ret = this.__transaction(conn, arg1, arg2);
    541. 

  541.                                  } else {
    542. 

  542.                                      //other wise use the function passed in to get the returned promise
    543. 

  543. 2039                                    ret = when(arg2.apply(this, [this]));
    544. 

  544.                                  }
    545. 

  545.                              }
    546. 

  546.                          } else {
    547. 

  547. 4651                            ret = orig.apply(this, argsToArray(arguments).concat(conn));
    548. 

  548.  
    549. 

  549.                          }
    550. 

  550.                      } catch (e) {
    551. 

  551. 0                        ret = new Promise().errback(e);
    552. 

  552.                      }
    553. 

  553. 6698                    promises.push(when(ret));
    554. 

  554. 6698                    return ret.promise();
    555. 

  555.                  };
    556. 

  556.              }, this);
    557. 

  557. 1049            try {
    558. 

  558. 1049                var transactionP = new comb.Promise();
    559. 

  559. 1049                var cbRet = cb.apply(this, [this, transactionP.resolve.bind(transactionP)]);
    560. 

  560. 1042                if (cbRet && isPromiseLike(cbRet, Promise)) {
    561. 

  561. 1039                    promises.push(cbRet);
    562. 

  562.                  } else {
    563. 

  563. 3                    promises.push(transactionP);
    564. 

  564.                  }
    565. 

  565.              } catch (e) {
    566. 

  566. 7                promises.push(new Promise().errback(e));
    567. 

  567.              }
    568. 

  568. 1049            if (promises.length === 0) {
    569. 

  569. 0                promises.push(new Promise().callback());
    570. 

  570.              }
    571. 

  571. 1049            return new PromiseList(promises).both(hitch(this, function () {
    572. 

  572. 1049                repl.forEach(function (o) {
    573. 

  573. 2098                    this[o.name] = o.orig;
    574. 

  574.                  }, this);
    575. 

  575.              })).promise();
    576. 

  576.  
    577. 

  577.          },
    578. 

  578.  
    579. 

  579.          _getConnection:function () {
    580. 

  580. 2593            return this.pool.getConnection();
    581. 

  581.          },
    582. 

  582.  
    583. 

  583.          _returnConnection:function (conn) {
    584. 

  584. 6059            if (!this.alreadyInTransaction(conn)) {
    585. 

  585. 1549                this.pool.returnConnection(conn);
    586. 

  586.              }
    587. 

  587.          },
    588. 

  588.  
    589. 

  589.          __transaction:function (conn, opts, cb) {
    590. 

  590. 1049            var promise = new Promise();
    591. 

  591. 1049            try {
    592. 

  592. 1049                var connPromise = conn ? new Promise().callback(conn) : this._getConnection().addCallback(hitch(this, function (conn) {
    593. 

  593.                      //add the connection to the transactions
    594. 

  594. 1044                    this.__transactions.push(conn);
    595. 

  595.                      //reset transaction depth to 0, this is used for keeping track of save points.
    596. 

  596. 1044                    conn.__transactionDepth = 0;
    597. 

  597.                  }));
    598. 

  598. 1049                connPromise.then(hitch(this, function (conn) {
    599. 

  599. 1049                    this.__beginTransaction(conn, opts).chain(hitch(this, function () {
    600. 

  600. 1049                        this.__transactionProxy(cb, conn).chain(hitch(this, function (res) {
    601. 

  601. 995                            this.__commitTransaction(conn).chain(hitch(this, "__transactionComplete", promise, "callback", conn), hitch(this, "__transactionComplete", promise, "errback", conn));
    602. 

  602.                          }), hitch(this, "__rollback", promise, conn));
    603. 

  603.                      }), hitch(this, "__transactionComplete", promise, "errback", conn));
    604. 

  604.                  }), hitch(this, "__transactionComplete", promise, "errback"));
    605. 

  605.              } catch (e) {
    606. 

  606. 0                this.logError(e);
    607. 

  607. 0                promise.errback(e);
    608. 

  608.              }
    609. 

  609. 1049            return promise.promise();
    610. 

  610.          },
    611. 

  611.  
    612. 

  612.          __transactionComplete:function (promise, type, conn) {
    613. 

  613. 995            this.__finishTransactionAndCheckForMore(conn);
    614. 

  614. 995            promise[type].apply(promise, argsToArray(arguments).slice(3));
    615. 

  615.          },
    616. 

  616.  
    617. 

  617.          __rollback:function (promise, conn, err) {
    618. 

  618. 54            this.__rollbackTransaction(conn, null, err).both(hitch(this, "__finishTransactionAndCheckForMore", conn)).then(hitch(this, function () {
    619. 

  619. 54                if (conn.__transactionDepth <= 1) {
    620. 

  620. 54                    this.__transactionError(err, promise);
    621. 

  621.                  } else {
    622. 

  622. 0                    promise.errback(err);
    623. 

  623.                  }
    624. 

  624.              }));
    625. 

  625.          },
    626. 

  626.  
    627. 

  627.          __transactionError:function (err, promise) {
    628. 

  628. 54            if (isArray(err)) {
    629. 

  629. 54                for (var i in err) {
    630. 

  630. 54                    if (i in err) {
    631. 

  631. 54                        var e = err[i];
    632. 

  632. 54                        if (isArray(e) && e.length === 2) {
    633. 

  633. 54                            var realE = e[1];
    634. 

  634. 54                            if (realE !== "ROLLBACK") {
    635. 

  635. 53                                promise.errback(new Error(realE));
    636. 

  636. 53                                break;
    637. 

  637.                              } else {
    638. 

  638. 1                                promise.callback();
    639. 

  639. 1                                break;
    640. 

  640.                              }
    641. 

  641.                          } else {
    642. 

  642. 0                            promise.errback(new Error(e));
    643. 

  643. 0                            break;
    644. 

  644.                          }
    645. 

  645.                      }
    646. 

  646.                  }
    647. 

  647.              } else {
    648. 

  648. 0                if (err !== "ROLLBACK") {
    649. 

  649. 0                    throw new Error(err);
    650. 

  650.                  }
    651. 

  651.              }
    652. 

  652.          },
    653. 

  653.  
    654. 

  654.          __finishTransactionAndCheckForMore:function (conn) {
    655. 

  655. 1049            if (this.alreadyInTransaction(conn)) {
    656. 

  656. 1049                if (!this.supportsSavepoints || ((conn.__transactionDepth -= 1) <= 0)) {
    657. 

  657. 1044                    if (conn) {
    658. 

  658. 1044                        this.pool.returnConnection(conn);
    659. 

  659.                      }
    660. 

  660. 1044                    var index, transactions = this.__transactions;
    661. 

  661. 1044                    if ((index = transactions.indexOf(conn)) > -1) {
    662. 

  662. 1044                        transactions.splice(index, 1);
    663. 

  663.                      }
    664. 

  664. 1044                    if (!this.__transactionQueue.isEmpty) {
    665. 

  665. 93                        this.__transactionQueue.dequeue()();
    666. 

  666.                      } else {
    667. 

  667. 951                        this.__alreadyInTransaction = false;
    668. 

  668.                      }
    669. 

  669.                  }
    670. 

  670.              }
    671. 

  671.          },
    672. 

  672.  
    673. 

  673.          //SQL to start a new savepoint
    674. 

  674.          __beginSavepointSql:function (depth) {
    675. 

  675. 5            return format(this._static.SQL_SAVEPOINT, depth);
    676. 

  676.          },
    677. 

  677.  
    678. 

  678.          // Start a new database connection on the given connection
    679. 

  679.          __beginNewTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    680. 

  680. 1035            return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, this.beginTransactionSql).chain(hitch(this, "__setTransactionIsolation", conn, opts))
    681. 

  681.          },
    682. 

  682.  
    683. 

  683.          //Start a new database transaction or a new savepoint on the given connection.
    684. 

  684.          __beginTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    685. 

  685. 1049            var ret;
    686. 

  686. 1049            if (this.supportsSavepoints) {
    687. 

  687. 924                if (conn.__transactionDepth > 0) {
    688. 

  688. 5                    ret = this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, this.__beginSavepointSql(conn.__transactionDepth));
    689. 

  689.                  } else {
    690. 

  690. 919                    ret = this.__beginNewTransaction(conn, opts);
    691. 

  691.                  }
    692. 

  692. 924                conn.__transactionDepth += 1;
    693. 

  693.              } else {
    694. 

  694. 125                ret = this.__beginNewTransaction(conn, opts);
    695. 

  695.              }
    696. 

  696. 1049            return  ret;
    697. 

  697.          },
    698. 

  698.  
    699. 

  699.          // SQL to commit a savepoint
    700. 

  700.          __commitSavepointSql:function (depth) {
    701. 

  701. 3            return format(this.SQL_RELEASE_SAVEPOINT, depth);
    702. 

  702.          },
    703. 

  703.  
    704. 

  704.          //Commit the active transaction on the connection
    705. 

  705.          __commitTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    706. 

  706. 992            opts = opts || {};
    707. 

  707. 992            if (this.supportsSavepoints) {
    708. 

  708. 876                var depth = conn.__transactionDepth;
    709. 

  709. 876                var sql = null;
    710. 

  710. 876                if (depth > 1) {
    711. 

  711. 3                    sql = this.__commitSavepointSql(depth - 1);
    712. 

  712.                  } else {
    713. 

  713. 873                    this.__commiting = true;
    714. 

  714. 873                    sql = this.commitTransactionSql;
    715. 

  715.                  }
    716. 

  716. 876                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, (sql));
    717. 

  717.              } else {
    718. 

  718. 116                this.__commiting = true;
    719. 

  719. 116                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, this.commitTransactionSql);
    720. 

  720.              }
    721. 

  721.          },
    722. 

  722.  
    723. 

  723.  
    724. 

  724.          //SQL to rollback to a savepoint
    725. 

  725.          __rollbackSavepointSql:function (depth) {
    726. 

  726. 1            return format(this.SQL_ROLLBACK_TO_SAVEPOINT, depth);
    727. 

  727.          },
    728. 

  728.  
    729. 

  729.          //Rollback the active transaction on the connection
    730. 

  730.          __rollbackTransaction:function (conn, opts, err) {
    731. 

  731. 54            opts = opts || {};
    732. 

  732. 54            if (this.supportsSavepoints) {
    733. 

  733. 46                var sql, depth = conn.__transactionDepth;
    734. 

  734. 46                if (depth > 1) {
    735. 

  735. 1                    sql = this.__rollbackSavepointSql(depth - 1);
    736. 

  736.                  } else {
    737. 

  737. 45                    this.__commiting = true;
    738. 

  738. 45                    sql = this.rollbackTransactionSql;
    739. 

  739.                  }
    740. 

  740. 46                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, sql);
    741. 

  741.              } else {
    742. 

  742. 8                this.__commiting = false;
    743. 

  743. 8                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, this.rollbackTransactionSql);
    744. 

  744.              }
    745. 

  745.          },
    746. 

  746.  
    747. 

  747.          // Set the transaction isolation level on the given connection
    748. 

  748.          __setTransactionIsolation:function (conn, opts) {
    749. 

  749. 1044            var level;
    750. 

  750. 1044            var ret = new Promise();
    751. 

  751. 1044            if (this.supportsTransactionIsolationLevels && !isUndefinedOrNull(level = isUndefinedOrNull(opts.isolation) ? this.transactionIsolationLevel : opts.isolation)) {
    752. 

  752. 8                return this.__logConnectionExecute(conn, this.__setTransactionIsolationSql(level)).then(ret);
    753. 

  753.              } else {
    754. 

  754. 1036                ret.callback();
    755. 

  755.              }
    756. 

  756. 1036            return ret.promise();
    757. 

  757.          },
    758. 

  758.  
    759. 

  759.          // SQL to set the transaction isolation level
    760. 

  760.          __setTransactionIsolationSql:function (level) {
    761. 

  761. 8            return format("SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL %s", this.TRANSACTION_ISOLATION_LEVELS[level]);
    762. 

  762.          },
    763. 

  763.  
    764. 

  764.          //Convert the given default, which should be a database specific string, into
    765. 

  765.          //a javascript object.
    766. 

  766.          __columnSchemaToJsDefault:function (def, type) {
    767. 

  767. 465            if (isNull(def) || isUndefined(def)) {
    768. 

  768. 348                return null;
    769. 

  769.              }
    770. 

  770. 117            var origDefault = def, m, datePattern, dateTimePattern, timeStampPattern, timePattern;
    771. 

  771. 117            if (this.type === "postgres" && (m = def.match(this.POSTGRES_DEFAULT_RE)) !== null) {
    772. 

  772. 9                def = m[1] || m[2];
    773. 

  773. 9                dateTimePattern = this.POSTGRES_DATE_TIME_PATTERN;
    774. 

  774. 9                timePattern = this.POSTGRES_TIME_PATTERN;
    775. 

  775.              }
    776. 

  776. 117            if (this.type === "mssql" && (m = def.match(this.MSSQL_DEFAULT_RE)) !== null) {
    777. 

  777. 4                def = m[1] || m[2];
    778. 

  778.              }
    779. 

  779. 117            if (["string", "blob", "date", "datetime", "year", "timestamp", "time", "enum"].indexOf(type) !== -1) {
    780. 

  780. 32                if (this.type === "mysql") {
    781. 

  781. 12                    if (["date", "datetime", "time", "timestamp"].indexOf(type) !== -1 && def.match(this.MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_RE)) {
    782. 

  782. 4                        return null;
    783. 

  783.                      }
    784. 

  784. 8                    origDefault = def = "'" + def + "'".replace("\\", "\\\\");
    785. 

  785.                  }
    786. 

  786. 28                if (!(m = def.match(this.STRING_DEFAULT_RE))) {
    787. 

  787. 2                    return null;
    788. 

  788.                  }
    789. 

  789. 26                def = m[1].replace("''", "'");
    790. 

  790.              }
    791. 

  791. 111            var ret = null;
    792. 

  792. 111            try {
    793. 

  793. 111                switch (type) {
    794. 

  794.                      case "boolean":
    795. 

  795. 6                        if (def.match(/[f0]/i)) {
    796. 

  796. 3                            ret = false;
    797. 

  797. 3                        } else if (def.match(/[t1]/i)) {
    798. 

  798. 3                            ret = true;
    799. 

  799. 0                        } else if (isBoolean(def)) {
    800. 

  800. 0                            ret = def;
    801. 

  801.                          }
    802. 

  802.  
    803. 

  803. 6                        break;
    804. 

  804.                      case "blob":
    805. 

  805. 1                        ret = new Buffer(def);
    806. 

  806. 1                        break;
    807. 

  807.                      case "string":
    808. 

  808.                      case "enum":
    809. 

  809. 13                        ret = def;
    810. 

  810. 13                        break;
    811. 

  811.                      case  "integer":
    812. 

  812. 65                        ret = parseInt(def, 10);
    813. 

  813. 65                        if (isNaN(ret)) {
    814. 

  814. 58                            ret = null;
    815. 

  815.                          }
    816. 

  816. 65                        break;
    817. 

  817.                      case  "float":
    818. 

  818.                      case  "decimal":
    819. 

  819. 11                        ret = parseFloat(def, 10);
    820. 

  820. 11                        if (isNaN(ret)) {
    821. 

  821. 1                            ret = null;
    822. 

  822.                          }
    823. 

  823. 11                        break;
    824. 

  824.                      case "year" :
    825. 

  825. 1                        ret = this.patio.stringToYear(def);
    826. 

  826. 1                        break;
    827. 

  827.                      case "date":
    828. 

  828. 3                        ret = this.patio.stringToDate(def, datePattern);
    829. 

  829. 3                        break;
    830. 

  830.                      case "timestamp":
    831. 

  831. 1                        ret = this.patio.stringToTimeStamp(def, timeStampPattern);
    832. 

  832. 1                        break;
    833. 

  833.                      case "datetime":
    834. 

  834. 4                        ret = this.patio.stringToDateTime(def, dateTimePattern);
    835. 

  835. 4                        break;
    836. 

  836.                      case "time":
    837. 

  837. 3                        ret = this.patio.stringToTime(def, timePattern);
    838. 

  838. 3                        break;
    839. 

  839.                  }
    840. 

  840.              } catch (e) {
    841. 

  841.              }
    842. 

  842. 111            return ret;
    843. 

  843.          },
    844. 

  844.  
    845. 

  845.          /**
    846. 

  846.           * Match the database's column type to a javascript type via a
    847. 

  847.           * regular expression, and return the javascript type as a string
    848. 

  848.           * such as "integer" or "string".
    849. 

  849.           * @private
    850. 

  850.           */
    851. 

  851.          schemaColumnType:function (dbType) {
    852. 

  852. 412            var ret = null, m;
    853. 

  853. 412            if (dbType.match(/^interval$/i)) {
    854. 

  854. 0                ret = "interval";
    855. 

  855. 412            } else if (dbType.match(/^(character( varying)?|n?(var)?char)/i)) {
    856. 

  856. 207                ret = "string";
    857. 

  857. 205            } else if (dbType.match(/^int(eger)?|(big|small|tiny)int/i)) {
    858. 

  858. 130                ret = "integer";
    859. 

  859. 75            } else if (dbType.match(/^date$/i)) {
    860. 

  860. 1                ret = "date";
    861. 

  861. 74            } else if (dbType.match(/^year/i)) {
    862. 

  862. 0                ret = "year";
    863. 

  863. 74            } else if (dbType.match(/^((small)?datetime|timestamp( with(out)? time zone)?)$/i)) {
    864. 

  864. 8                ret = "datetime";
    865. 

  865. 66            } else if (dbType.match(/^time( with(out)? timezone)?$/i)) {
    866. 

  866. 0                ret = "time";
    867. 

  867. 66            } else if (dbType.match(/^(bit|boolean)$/i)) {
    868. 

  868. 0                ret = "boolean";
    869. 

  869. 66            } else if (dbType.match(/^(real|float|double( precision)?)$/i)) {
    870. 

  870. 12                ret = "float";
    871. 

  871. 54            } else if ((m = dbType.match(/^(?:(?:(?:num(?:ber|eric)?|decimal|double)(?:\(\d+,\s*(\d+)\))?)|(?:small)?money)/i))) {
    872. 

  872. 2                ret = m[1] && m[1] === '0' ? "integer" : "decimal";
    873. 

  873. 52            } else if (dbType.match(/n?text/i)) {
    874. 

  874. 37                ret = "text";
    875. 

  875. 15            } else if (dbType.match(/bytea|[bc]lob|image|(var)?binary/i)) {
    876. 

  876. 13                ret = "blob";
    877. 

  877. 2            } else if (dbType.match(/^enum/i)) {
    878. 

  878. 2                ret = "enum";
    879. 

  879. 0            } else if (dbType.match(/^set/i)) {
    880. 

  880. 0                ret = "set";
    881. 

  881.              }
    882. 

  882. 412            return ret;
    883. 

  883.          },
    884. 

  884.  
    885. 

  885.          /**
    886. 

  886.           * Returns true if this DATABASE is currently in a transaction.
    887. 

  887.           *
    888. 

  888.           * @param opts
    889. 

  889.           * @return {Boolean} true if this dabase is currently in a transaction.
    890. 

  890.           */
    891. 

  891.          alreadyInTransaction:function (conn, opts) {
    892. 

  892. 7108            opts = opts || {};
    893. 

  893. 7108            return this.__transactions.indexOf(conn) !== -1 && (!this.supportsSavepoints || !opts.savepoint);
    894. 

  894.          },
    895. 

  895.  
    896. 

  896.          /**@ignore*/
    897. 

  897.          getters:{
    898. 

  898.              /**@lends patio.Database.prototype*/
    899. 

  899.  
    900. 

  900.              /**
    901. 

  901.               * SQL to BEGIN a transaction.
    902. 

  902.               * See {@link patio.Database#SQL_BEGIN} for default,
    903. 

  903.               * @field
    904. 

  904.               * @type String
    905. 

  905.               */
    906. 

  906.              beginTransactionSql:function () {
    907. 

  907. 1044                return this.SQL_BEGIN;
    908. 

  908.              },
    909. 

  909.  
    910. 

  910.              /**
    911.

  31.          /**

  32.           * Abstract Migrator class. This class should be be instantiated directly.

    34.

    35. 

  35.           * @param {patio.Database} db the database to migrate
    36.

    37. 

  37.           * @param {Object} [opts={}] optional parameters.
    38. 

  38.           * @param {String} [opts.column] the column in the table that version information should be stored.
    39.

    42.

    99. 

  99.          /**
    100. 

  100.           * Migrates the database using migration files found in the supplied directory.
    101. 

  101.           * See {@link patio#migrate}
    102. 

  102.           *
    103. 

  103.           * @example
    104. 

  104.           * var DB = patio.connect("my://connection/string");
    105. 

  105.           * patio. migrate(DB, __dirname + "/timestamp_migration").then(function(){
    106. 

  106.           *     console.log("done migrating!");
    107. 

  107.           * });
    108. 

  108.           *
    109. 

  109.           * patio. migrate(DB, __dirname + "/timestamp_migration", {target : 0}).then(function(){
    110. 

  110.           *     console.log("done migrating down!");
    111. 

  111.           * });
    112. 

  112.           *
    113. 

  113.           *
    114. 

  114.           * @param {patio.Database} db the database to migrate
    115. 

  115.           * @param {String} directory directory that the migration files reside in
    116. 

  116.           * @param {Object} [opts={}] optional parameters.
    117. 

  117.           * @param {String} [opts.column] the column in the table that version information should be stored.
    118. 

  118.           * @param {String} [opts.table] the table that version information should be stored.
    119. 

  119.           * @param {Number} [opts.target] the target migration(i.e the migration to migrate up/down to).
    120. 

  120.           * @param {String} [opts.current] the version that the database is currently at if the current version
    121. 

  121.           * is not provided it is retrieved from the database.
    122. 

  122.           *
    123. 

  123.           * @return {Promise} a promise that is resolved once the migration is complete.
    124. 

  124.           */
    125. 

  125.          run:function (db, directory, opts, cb) {
    126. 

  126. 31            if (isFunction(opts)) {
    127. 

  127. 0                cb = opts;
    128. 

  128. 0                opts = {};

  129.              } else {
    130. 

  130. 31                opts = opts || {};
    131. 

  131.              }
    132. 

  132. 31            opts = opts || {};

  133. 31            var ret = new Promise();

  134. 31            return this.__getMigrator(directory).chain(function (migrator) {
    135. 

  135. 31                return new migrator(db, directory, opts).run();
    136. 

  136.              }).classic(cb);
    137. 

  137.          },
    138. 

  138.  
    139. 

  139.          // Choose the Migrator subclass to use.  Uses the TimestampMigrator
    140. 

  140.          // // if the version number appears to be a unix time integer for a year
    141. 

  141.          // after 2005, otherwise uses the IntegerMigrator.
    142. 

  142.          __getMigrator:function (directory) {
    143. 

  143. 31            var retClass = IntegerMigrator, ret = new Promise();

  146. 31                if (l) {

  147. 31                    for (var i = 0; i < l; i++) {

  149. 81                        if (parseInt(path.basename(file).split(this.MIGRATION_SPLITTER)[0], 10) > this.MINIMUM_TIMESTAMP) {

  150. 18                            retClass = TimestampMigrator;

  163.  /**
    164. 

  164.   * @class Migrator that uses the file format {migrationName}.{version}.js, where version starts at 0.
    165.

  180.          run:function () {
    181. 

  181. 13            var ret = new Promise(), DB = this.db;
    182. 

  182. 13            return serial([this._getLatestMigrationVersion.bind(this), this._getCurrentMigrationVersion.bind(this)]).chain(function (res) {
    183. 

  183. 11                var target = res[0], current = res[1];
    184. 

  184. 11                if (current !== target) {
    185. 

  185. 10                    var direction = this.direction = current < target ? "up" : "down", isUp = direction === "up", version = 0;

  186. 10                    return this._getMigrations(current, target, direction).chain(function (migrations) {

  215.          _getMigrations:function (current, target, direction) {
    216. 

  216. 10            var ret = new Promise(), isUp = direction === "up", migrations = [];
    217. 

  217. 10            return when(this._getMigrationFiles()).chain(function (files) {
    218. 

  218. 10                if ((isUp ? target : current - 1) < files.length) {
    219. 

  219. 10                    if (isUp) {
    220. 

  220. 8                        current++;
    221. 

  221.                      }

  222. 10                    for (; isUp ? current <= target : current > target; isUp ? current++ : current--) {

  296.          _getSchemaDataset:function () {

  297. 50            var c = this.column, table = this.table;
    298. 

  298. 50            if (!this.__schemaDataset) {

  299. 11                var ds = this.db.from(table);
    300. 

  300. 11                return this.__createOrAlterMigrationTable().chain(hitch(this, function () {
    301. 

  301. 11                    return ds.isEmpty().chain(hitch(this, function (empty) {
    302.

    303. 

  303. 0                            var item = {};

  304. 0                            item[c] = -1;
    305. 

  305. 0                            this.__schemaDataset = ds;
    306. 

  306. 0                            return ds.insert(item).chain(ds);
    307. 

  307.                          } else {
    308. 

  308. 11                            return ds.count().chain(hitch(this, function (count) {
    309. 

  309. 11                                if (count > 1) {
    310. 

  310. 0                                    throw new Error("More than one row in migrator table");
    311. 

  311.                                  } else {

  312. 11                                    this.__schemaDataset = ds;
    313. 

  313. 11                                    return ds;
    314.

  318.                  }));

  323.  
    324. 

  324.          __createOrAlterMigrationTable:function () {
    325. 

  325. 11            var c = this.column, table = this.table, db = this.db;
    326. 

  326. 11            var ds = this.db.from(table);
    327. 

  327. 11            var ret = new Promise();
    328. 

  328. 11            return db.tableExists(table).chain(hitch(this, function (exists) {
    329. 

  329. 11                if (!exists) {
    330. 

  330. 7                    return db.createTable(table, function () {
    331. 

  331. 7                        this.column(c, "integer", {"default":-1, allowNull:false});
    332. 

  332.                      });
    333. 

  333.                  } else {
    334.

    335.

  350.  
    351. 

  351.  
    352. 

  352.  /**
    353. 

  353.   * @class Migrator that uses the file format {migrationName}.{timestamp}.js, where the timestamp
    354. 

  354.   * can be anything greater than 20000101.
    355. 

  355.   *
    356. 

  356.   * @name TimestampMigrator
    357. 

  357.   * @augments patio.migrations.Migrator
    358. 

  358.   * @memberOf patio.migrations
    359. 

  359.   */
    360. 

  360. 1var TimestampMigrator = define(Migrator, {
    361. 

  361.      instance:{
    362. 

  362.  
    363. 

  363.          constructor:function (db, directory, opts) {
    364. 

  364. 18            this._super(arguments);
    365. 

  365. 18            opts = opts || {};
    366. 

  366. 18            this.target = opts.target;
    367. 

  367.          },
    368. 

  368.  
    369. 

  369.          run:function () {
    370. 

  370. 18            var ret = new Promise(), DB = this.db, column = this.column;
    371. 

  371. 18            return serial([this.__getMigrationFiles.bind(this), this._getSchemaDataset.bind(this)]).chain(function (res) {
    372. 

  372. 18                var migrations = res[0], ds = res[1];
    373. 

  373. 18                return asyncArray(migrations).forEach(function (curr) {
    374. 

  374. 70                    var file = curr[0], migration = curr[1], direction = curr[2];
    375. 

  375. 70                    var now = new Date();
    376. 

  376. 70                    DB.logInfo("Begin applying migration file %s, direction: %s", file, direction);
    377. 

  377. 70                    return DB.transaction(hitch(this, function () {
    378. 

  378. 70                        var fileLowerCase = file.toLowerCase();
    379. 

  379. 70                        var query = {};
    380. 

  380. 70                        query[column] = fileLowerCase;
    381. 

  381. 70                        if (!isFunction(migration[direction])) {
    382. 

  382. 0                            return (direction === "up" ? ds.insert(query) : ds.filter(query).remove());
    383. 

  383.                          } else {
    384. 

  384. 70                            var nextP = new Promise();
    385. 

  385. 70                            var dirP = migration[direction].apply(DB, [DB, nextP.resolve.bind(nextP)]);
    386. 

  386. 68                            return (comb.isPromiseLike(dirP) ? dirP : nextP).chain(function () {
    387. 

  387. 68                                return (direction === "up" ? ds.insert(query) : ds.filter(query).remove());
    388. 

  388.                              }.bind(this));
    389. 

  389.                          }
    390. 

  390.                      })).chain(function () {
    391. 

  391. 68                            DB.logInfo("Finished applying migration file %s, direction: %s, took % 4dms seconds", file, direction, new Date() - now);
    392. 

  392.                          });
    393. 

  393.                  }, this, 1);
    394. 

  394.              });
    395. 

  395.          },
    396. 

  396.  
    397. 

  397.          getFileNames:function () {
    398. 

  398. 37            return asyncArray(this._super(arguments)).sort(function (f1, f2) {
    399. 

  399. 184                var ret = this.getMigrationVersionFromFile(f1) - this.getMigrationVersionFromFile(f2);
    400. 

  400. 184                if (ret === 0) {
    401. 

  401. 4                    var b1 = baseName(f1, ".js").split("."),
    402. 

  402.                          b2 = baseName(f2, ".js").split(".");
    403. 

  403. 4                    b1 = b1[b1.length - 1];
    404. 

  404. 4                    b2 = b2[b2.length - 1];
    405. 

  405. 4                    ret = b1 > b1 ? 1 : b1 < b2 ? -1 : 0;
    406. 

  406.                  }
    407. 

  407. 184                return ret;
    408. 

  408.              }.bind(this));
    409. 

  409.          },
    410. 

  410.  
    411. 

  411.          __getAppliedMigrations:function () {
    412. 

  412. 18            if (!this.__appliedMigrations) {
    413. 

  413. 18                return this._getSchemaDataset().chain(hitch(this, function (ds) {
    414. 

  414. 18                    return when(ds.selectOrderMap(this.column), this.getFileNames()).chain(hitch(this, function (res) {
    415. 

  415. 18                        var appliedMigrations = res[0], files = res[1].map(function (f) {
    416. 

  416. 92                            return path.basename(f).toLowerCase();
    417. 

  417.                          });
    418. 

  418. 18                        var l = appliedMigrations.length;
    419. 

  419. 18                        if (l) {
    420. 

  420. 9                            for (var i = 0; i < l; i++) {

  421. 39                                if (files.indexOf(appliedMigrations[i]) == -1) {
    422. 

  422. 0                                    throw new MigrationError("Applied migrations file not found in directory " + appliedMigrations[i]);

    424. 

  424.                              }

    430.

    431. 

  431.  
    432. 

  432.                      }));

  433.                  }));

  439.          __getMigrationFiles:function () {
    440. 

  440. 18            var upMigrations = [], downMigrations = [], target = this.target;
    441. 

  441. 18            if (!this.__migrationFiles) {
    442. 

  442. 18                return when(this.getFileNames(), this.__getAppliedMigrations()).chain(hitch(this, function (res) {
    443. 

  443. 18                    var files = res[0], appliedMigrations = res[1];
    444. 

  444. 18                    var l = files.length;
    445. 

  445. 18                    if (l > 0) {
    446. 

  446. 18                        for (var i = 0; i < l; i++) {
    447. 

  447. 92                            var file = files[i], f = path.basename(file), fLowerCase = f.toLowerCase(), index = appliedMigrations.indexOf(fLowerCase);
    448. 

  448. 92                            if (!isUndefined(target)) {
    449. 

  449. 48                                var version = this.getMigrationVersionFromFile(f);
    450. 

  450. 48                                if (version > target || (version === 0 && target === version)) {
    451. 

  451. 35                                    if (index !== -1) {
    452. 

  452. 26                                        downMigrations.push([f, require(file), "down"]);
    453. 

  453.                                      }
    454. 

  454. 13                                } else if (index === -1) {
    455. 

  455. 9                                    upMigrations.push([f, require(file), "up"]);
    456. 

  456.                                  }
    457. 

  457. 44                            } else if (index === -1) {
    458. 

  458. 35                                upMigrations.push([f, require(file), "up"]);
    459. 

  459.                              }
    460. 

  460.                          }
    461. 

  461. 18                        this.__migrationFiles = upMigrations.concat(downMigrations.reverse());

  462. 18                        return this.__migrationFiles;

  484.          __convertSchemaInfo:function () {

  490. 1                    if (l > 0) {

  491. 1                        for (var i = 0; i < l; i++) {

  493. 7                            if (this.getMigrationVersionFromFile(f) <= version) {

  513. 10                        this.column(c, String, {primaryKey:true});

    515. 

  515. 10                        if (intMigratorExists) {

  45. 1var clauseMethods = function (type, clauses) {
    46. 

  46. 13    if (isString(clauses)) {
    47. 

  47. 13        clauses = clauses.split(" ");
    48. 

  48.      }
    49. 

  49. 13    return clauses.map(function (clause) {

    51.
