    52. 

  52.  };
    53. 

  53.  
    54. 

  54. 1define(null, {
    55. 

  55.  
    56. 

  56.      instance:{
    57. 

  57.          /**@lends patio.Dataset.prototype*/
    58. 

  58.  
    59. 

  59.          /**
    60. 

  60.           * Dataset mixin that provides functions to the {@link patio.dataset.Dataset} to
    61. 

  61.           * create SELECT, UPDATE, CREATE, and DELETE SQL statements, based off of the the
    62. 

  62.           * methods invoked in the {@link patio.dataset._Query}
    63. 

  63.           * mixin. This class should not be used directly by
    64. 

  64.           *
    65. 

  65.           * @constructs
    66. 

  66.           * @memberOf patio.dataset
    67. 

  67.           * @name _Query
    68. 

  68.           *
    69. 

  69.           * @property {String} sql Readonly property that returns a SELECT statement.
    70. 

  70.           * @property {String} deleteSql DELETE SQL query string.  See {@link patio.dataset._Actions#delete}.
    71. 

  71.           *
    72. 

  72.           *      <pre class="code">
    73. 

  73.           *       dataset.filter(function(){
    74. 

  74.           *           return this.price.gte(100);
    75. 

  75.           *       }).deleteSql;
    76. 

  76.           *           // => "DELETE FROM items WHERE (price >= 100)"
    77. 

  77.           *      </pre>
    78. 

  78.           * @property {String} selectSql  Returns a SELECT SQL query string.
    79. 

  79.           *
    80. 

  80.           *      <pre class="code">
    81. 

  81.           *
    82. 

  82.           *       DB.from("items").selectSql;
    83. 

  83.           *              //=> "SELECT * FROM items"
    84. 

  84.           *      </pre>
    85. 

  85.           * @property {String} truncateSql Returns a TRUNCATE SQL query string.  See {@link patio.dataset._Actions#truncate}
    86. 

  86.           *
    87. 

  87.           *      <pre class="code">
    88. 

  88.           *
    89. 

  89.           *       DB.from("items").truncateSql();
    90. 

  90.           *              //=> 'TRUNCATE items'
    91. 

  91.           *      </pre>
    92. 

  92.           * @property {String} exists  Returns an EXISTS clause for the dataset as a {@link patio.sql.LiteralString}.
    93. 

  93.           *
    94. 

  94.           *      <pre class="code">
    95. 

  95.           *
    96. 

  96.           *       var ds = DB.from("test");
    97. 

  97.           *       ds.filter(ds.filter(sql.price.lt(100))).exists()).sql;
    98. 

  98.           *              //=> 'SELECT * FROM test WHERE (EXISTS (SELECT * FROM test WHERE (price < 100)))'
    99. 

  99.           *
    100. 

  100.           *      </pre>
    101. 

  101.           **/
    102. 

  102.          constructor:function () {
    103. 

  103.              //We initialize these here because otherwise
    104. 

  104.              //the will be blank because of recursive dependencies.
    105. 

  105. 28756            !patio && (patio = require("../index"));
    106. 

  106. 28756            !Dataset && (Dataset = patio.Dataset);
    107. 

  107. 28756            this._super(arguments);
    108. 

  108.          },
    109. 

  109.  
    110. 

  110.          /**
    111. 

  111.           * Returns an INSERT SQL query string.  See {@link patio.dataset._Actions#insert}
    112. 

  112.           *
    113. 

  113.           * @example
    114. 

  114.           *
    115. 

  115.           *
    116. 

  116.           * DB.from("items").insertSql({a : 1});
    117. 

  117.           *      //=> INSERT INTO items (a) VALUES (1)
    118. 

  118.           *
    119. 

  119.           * var ds = DB.from("test");
    120. 

  120.           *
    121. 

  121.           * //default values
    122. 

  122.           * ds.insertSql();
    123. 

  123.           *      //=> INSERT INTO test DEFAULT VALUES
    124. 

  124.           *
    125. 

  125.           * //with hash
    126. 

  126.           * ds.insertSql({name:'wxyz', price:342});
    127. 

  127.           *      //=> INSERT INTO test (name, price) VALUES ('wxyz', 342)
    128. 

  128.           * ds.insertSql({});
    129. 

  129.           *      //=> INSERT INTO test DEFAULT VALUES
    130. 

  130.           *
    131. 

  131.           * //object that has a values property
    132. 

  132.           * ds.insertSql({values:{a:1}});
    133. 

  133.           *      //=> INSERT INTO test (a) VALUES (1)
    134. 

  134.           *
    135. 

  135.           * //arbitrary value
    136. 

  136.           * ds.insertSql(123);
    137. 

  137.           *      //=> INSERT INTO test VALUES (123)
    138. 

  138.           *
    139. 

  139.           * //with dataset
    140. 

  140.           * ds.insertSql(DB.from("something").filter({x:2}));
    141. 

  141.           *      //=> INSERT INTO test SELECT * FROM something WHERE (x = 2)
    142. 

  142.           *
    143. 

  143.           * //with array
    144. 

  144.           * ds.insertSql('a', 2, 6.5);
    145. 

  145.           *      //=> INSERT INTO test VALUES ('a', 2, 6.5)
    146. 

  146.           *
    147. 

  147.           * @throws {patio.QueryError} if there are Different number of values and columns given to insertSql or
    148. 

  148.           *                                  if an invalid BooleanExpresion is given.
    149. 

  149.           *
    150. 

  150.           * @param {patio.Dataset|patio.sql.LiteralString|Array|Object|patio.sql.BooleanExpression|...} values  values to
    151. 

  151.           *      insert into the database. The INSERT statement generated depends on the type.
    152. 

  152.           *      <ul>
    153. 

  153.           *          <li>Empty object| Or no arugments: then DEFAULT VALUES is used.</li>
    154. 

  154.           *          <li>Object: the keys will be used as the columns, and values will be the values inserted.</li>
    155. 

  155.           *          <li>Single {@link patio.Dataset} : an insert with subselect will be performed.</li>
    156. 

  156.           *          <li>Array with {@link patio.Dataset} : The array will be used for columns and a subselect will performed with the dataset for the values.</li>
    157. 

  157.           *          <li>{@link patio.sql.LiteralString} : the literal value will be used.</li>
    158. 

  158.           *          <li>Single Array : the values in the array will be used as the VALUES clause.</li>
    159. 

  159.           *          <li>Two Arrays: the first array is the columns the second array is the values.</li>
    160. 

  160.           *          <li>{@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} : the expression will be used as the values.
    161. 

  161.           *          <li>An arbitrary number of arguments : the {@link patio.Dataset#literal} version of the values will be used</li>
    162. 

  162.           *      </ul>
    163. 

  163.           *
    164. 

  164.           *
    165. 

  165.           * @return {String} a INSERT SQL query string
    166. 

  166.           */
    167. 

  167.          insertSql:function (values) {
    168. 

  168. 1485            values = argsToArray(arguments);
    169. 

  169. 1485            var opts = this.__opts;
    170. 

  170. 1485            if (opts.sql) {
    171. 

  171. 0                return this._staticSql(opts.sql);
    172. 

  172.              }
    173. 

  173. 1485            this.__checkModificationAllowed();
    174. 

  174.  
    175. 

  175. 1481            var columns = [];
    176. 

  176.  
    177. 

  177. 1481            switch (values.length) {
    178. 

  178.                  case 0 :
    179. 

  179.                      //we have no values
    180. 

  180. 14                    return this.insertSql({});
    181. 

  181.                  case 1 :
    182. 

  182. 1389                    var vals = values[0], v;
    183. 

  183. 1389                    if (isInstanceOf(vals, Dataset, LiteralString) || isArray(vals)) {
    184. 

  184. 10                        values = vals;
    185. 

  185. 1379                    } else if (vals.hasOwnProperty("values") && isObject((v = vals.values))) {
    186. 

  186. 2                        return this.insertSql(v);
    187. 

  187. 1377                    } else if (isHash(vals)) {
    188. 

  188. 1371                        vals = merge({}, opts.defaults || {}, vals);
    189. 

  189. 1371                        vals = merge({}, vals, opts.overrides || {});
    190. 

  190. 1371                        values = [];
    191. 

  191. 1371                        for (var i in vals) {
    192. 

  192. 6706                            columns.push(i);
    193. 

  193. 6706                            values.push(vals[i]);
    194. 

  194.                          }
    195. 

  195. 6                    } else if (isInstanceOf(vals, BooleanExpression)) {
    196. 

  196. 1                        var op = vals.op;
    197. 

  197. 1                        values = [];
    198. 

  198. 1                        if (!isUndefinedOrNull(this._static.TWO_ARITY_OPERATORS[op])) {
    199. 

  199. 1                            var args = vals.args;
    200. 

  200. 1                            columns.push(args[0]);
    201. 

  201. 1                            values.push(args[1]);
    202. 

  202.                          } else {
    203. 

  203. 0                            throw new QueryError("Invalid Expression op: " + op);
    204. 

  204.                          }
    205. 

  205.                      }
    206. 

  206. 1387                    break;
    207. 

  207.                  case 2 :
    208. 

  208. 75                    var v0 = values[0], v1 = values[1]
    209. 

  209. 75                    if (isArray(v0) && isArray(v1) || isInstanceOf(v1, Dataset, LiteralString)) {
    210. 

  210. 70                        columns = v0, values = v1;
    211. 

  211. 70                        if (isArray(values) && columns.length != values.length) {
    212. 

  212. 0                            throw new QueryError("Different number of values and columns given to insertSql");
    213. 

  213.                          }
    214. 

  214.                      }
    215. 

  215. 75                    break;
    216. 

  216.              }
    217. 

  217. 1465            columns = columns.map(function (k) {
    218. 

  218. 6807                return isString(k) ? new Identifier(k) : k;
    219. 

  219.              }, this);
    220. 

  220. 1465            return this.mergeOptions({columns:columns, values:values})._insertSql();
    221. 

  221.          },
    222. 

  222.  
    223. 

  223.          /**
    224. 

  224.           * Returns an array of insert statements for inserting multiple records.
    225. 

  225.           * This method is used by {@link patio.dataset._Actions#multiInsert} to format insert statements.
    226. 

  226.           * <b>This method is not typically used directly.</b>
    227. 

  227.           *
    228. 

  228.           * <p>
    229. 

  229.           *      <b>Note:</b>This method should be overridden by descendants if there is support for
    230. 

  230.           *                      inserting multiple records in a single SQL statement.
    231. 

  231.           * </p>
    232. 

  232.           *
    233. 

  233.           * @param {Array} columns The columns to insert values for.
    234. 

  234.           *                  This array will be used as the base for each values item in the values array.
    235. 

  235.           * @param {Array[Array]} values Array of arrays of values to insert into the columns.
    236. 

  236.           *
    237. 

  237.           * @return {String[]} array of insert statements.
    238. 

  238.           */
    239. 

  239.          multiInsertSql:function (columns, values) {
    240. 

  240. 28            return values.map(function (r) {
    241. 

  241. 56                return this.insertSql(columns, r)
    242. 

  242.              }, this);
    243. 

  243.          },
    244. 

  244.  
    245. 

  245.          /**
    246. 

  246.           *Formats an UPDATE statement using the given values.  See {@link patio.dataset._Actions#update}.
    247. 

  247.           *
    248. 

  248.           * @example
    249. 

  249.           *
    250. 

  250.           * DB.from("items").updateSql({price : 100, category : 'software'});
    251. 

  251.           *      //=> "UPDATE items SET price = 100, category = 'software'
    252. 

  252.           *
    253. 

  253.           * @throw {QueryError} If the dataset is grouped or includes more than one table.
    254. 

  254.           *
    255. 

  255.           * @param {*...} Variable number of values to update the table with.
    256. 

  256.           *  The UPDATE statement created depends on the values passed in.
    257. 

  257.           *          <ul>
    258. 

  258.           *              <li>Object : the keys will be used as the columns and the values will be the values to set to columns to</li>
    259. 

  259.           *              <li>{@link patio.sql.Expression} : the {@link patio.dataset._Sql#literal} representation of the
    260. 

  260.           *                      {@link patio.sql.Expression} will be used as the value
    261. 

  261.           *              </li>
    262. 

  262.           *              </li> Other : the {@link patio.dataset._Sql#literal} value will be used as the value</li>
    263. 

  263.           *          </ul>
    264. 

  264.           *
    265. 

  265.           * @return {String} the UPDATE statement.
    266. 

  266.           */
    267. 

  267.          updateSql:function (values) {
    268. 

  268. 237            values = argsToArray(arguments);
    269. 

  269. 237            if (this.__opts.sql) return this._staticSql(this.__opts.sql);
    270. 

  270. 237            this.__checkModificationAllowed();
    271. 

  271. 233            return this.mergeOptions({values:values})._updateSql();
    272. 

  272.          },
    273. 

  273.  
    274. 

  274.  
    275. 

  275.          /**
    276. 

  276.           * Returns a qualified column name (including a table name) if the column
    277. 

  277.           * name isn't already qualified.
    278. 

  278.           *
    279. 

  279.           * @example
    280. 

  280.           *
    281. 

  281.           * dataset.qualifiedColumnName("b1", "items");
    282. 

  282.           *      //=> items.b1
    283. 

  283.           *
    284. 

  284.           * dataset.qualifiedColumnName("ccc__b"));
    285. 

  285.           *      //=> 'ccc.b'
    286. 

  286.           *
    287. 

  287.           * dataset.qualifiedColumnName("ccc__b", "items"));
    288. 

  288.           *      //=> 'ccc.b'
    289. 

  289.           *
    290. 

  290.           * @param {String} column the column to qualify. If the column is already qualified (e.g. ccc__b) then the
    291. 

  291.           *                        table name (e.g. ccc) will override the provided table.
    292. 

  292.           *
    293. 

  293.           * @param {String} table the name of the table to qualify the column to.
    294. 

  294.           *
    295. 

  295.           * @return {String} the qualified column name..
    296. 

  296.           *
    297. 

  297.           */
    298. 

  298.          qualifiedColumnName:function (column, table) {
    299. 

  299. 1216            if (isString(column)) {
    300. 

  300. 1213                var parts = this._splitString(column);
    301. 

  301. 1213                var columnTable = parts[0], alias = parts[2], tableAlias;
    302. 

  302. 1213                column = parts[1];
    303. 

  303. 1213                if (!columnTable) {
    304. 

  304. 1211                    if (isInstanceOf(table, Identifier)) {
    305. 

  305. 1188                        table = table.value;
    306. 

  306.                      }
    307. 

  307. 1211                    if (isInstanceOf(table, AliasedExpression)) {
    308. 

  308. 0                        tableAlias = table.alias;
    309. 

  309. 1211                    } else if (isInstanceOf(table, QualifiedIdentifier)) {
    310. 

  310. 1                        tableAlias = table;
    311. 

  311.                      } else {
    312. 

  312. 1210                        parts = this._splitString(table);
    313. 

  313. 1210                        var schema = parts[0], tableAlias = parts[2];
    314. 

  314. 1210                        table = parts[1];
    315. 

  315. 1210                        if (schema) {
    316. 

  316. 0                            tableAlias = new Identifier(tableAlias) || new QualifiedIdentifier(schema, table);
    317. 

  317.                          }
    318. 

  318.                      }
    319. 

  319. 1211                    columnTable = tableAlias || table;
    320. 

  320.                  }
    321. 

  321. 1213                return new QualifiedIdentifier(columnTable, column);
    322. 

  322. 3            } else if (isInstanceOf(column, Identifier)) {
    323. 

  323. 0                return column.qualify(table);
    324. 

  324.              } else {
    325. 

  325. 3                return column;
    326. 

  326.              }
    327. 

  327.          },
    328. 

  328.  
    329. 

  329.          /**
    330. 

  330.           * Creates a unique table alias that hasn't already been used in this dataset.
    331. 

  331.           *
    332. 

  332.           * @example
    333. 

  333.           *
    334. 

  334.           * DB.from("table").unusedTableAlias("t");
    335. 

  335.           *       //=> "t"
    336. 

  336.           *
    337. 

  337.           * DB.from("table").unusedTableAlias("table");
    338. 

  338.           *   //=> "table0"
    339. 

  339.           *
    340. 

  340.           * DB.from("table", "table0"]).unusedTableAlias("table");
    341. 

  341.           *   //=> "table1"
    342. 

  342.           *
    343. 

  343.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} tableAlias the table to get an unused alias for.
    344. 

  344.           *
    345. 

  345.           * @return {String} the implicit alias that is in tableAlias with a possible "N"
    346. 

  346.           *                  if the alias has already been used, where N is an integer starting at 0.
    347. 

  347.           */
    348. 

  348.          unusedTableAlias:function (tableAlias) {
    349. 

  349. 11            tableAlias = this._toTableName(tableAlias);
    350. 

  350. 11            var usedAliases = [], from, join;
    351. 

  351. 11            if ((from = this.__opts.from) != null) {
    352. 

  352. 11                usedAliases = usedAliases.concat(from.map(function (n) {
    353. 

  353. 13                    return this._toTableName(n)
    354. 

  354.                  }, this));
    355. 

  355.              }
    356. 

  356. 11            if ((join = this.__opts.join) != null) {
    357. 

  357. 1                usedAliases = usedAliases.concat(join.map(function (join) {
    358. 

  358. 1                    if (join.tableAlias) {
    359. 

  359. 0                        return this.__toAliasedTableName(join.tableAlias);
    360. 

  360.                      } else {
    361. 

  361. 1                        return this._toTableName(join.table);
    362. 

  362.                      }
    363. 

  363.                  }, this));
    364. 

  364.              }
    365. 

  365. 11            if (usedAliases.indexOf(tableAlias) != -1) {
    366. 

  366. 10                var base = tableAlias, i = 0;
    367. 

  367. 10                do {
    368. 

  368. 13                    tableAlias = string.format("%s%d", base, i++);
    369. 

  369.                  } while (usedAliases.indexOf(tableAlias) != -1)
    370. 

  370.              }
    371. 

  371. 11            return tableAlias;
    372. 

  372.          },
    373. 

  373.  
    374. 

  374.          /**
    375. 

  375.           * Returns a literal representation of a value to be used as part
    376. 

  376.           * of an SQL expression.
    377. 

  377.           *
    378. 

  378.           * @example
    379. 

  379.           *
    380. 

  380.           *  DB.from("items").literal("abc'def\\") //=> "'abc''def\\\\'"
    381. 

  381.           *  DB.from("items").literal("items__id") //=> "items.id"
    382. 

  382.           *  DB.from("items").literal([1, 2, 3]) //=> "(1, 2, 3)"
    383. 

  383.           *  DB.from("items").literal(DB.from("items")) //=> "(SELECT * FROM items)"
    384. 

  384.           *  DB.from("items").literal(sql.x.plus(1).gt("y")); //=> "((x + 1) > y)"
    385. 

  385.           *
    386. 

  386.           * @throws {patio.QueryError} If an unsupported object is given.
    387. 

  387.           * @param {*} v the value to convert the the SQL literal representation
    388. 

  388.           *
    389. 

  389.           * @return {String} a literal representation of the value.
    390. 

  390.           */
    391. 

  391.          literal:function (v) {
    392. 

  392. 44042            if (isInstanceOf(v, LiteralString)) {
    393. 

  393. 218                return "" + v;
    394. 

  394. 43824            } else if (isString(v)) {
    395. 

  395. 6171                return this._literalString(v);
    396. 

  396. 37653            } else if (isNumber(v)) {
    397. 

  397. 7054                return this._literalNumber(v);
    398. 

  398.              }
    399. 

  399. 30599            else if (isInstanceOf(v, Expression)) {
    400. 

  400. 28015                return this._literalExpression(v);
    401. 

  401.              }
    402. 

  402. 2584            else if (isInstanceOf(v, Dataset)) {
    403. 

  403. 104                return this._literalDataset(v);
    404. 

  404.              }
    405. 

  405. 2480            else if (isArray(v)) {
    406. 

  406. 2108                return this._literalArray(v);
    407. 

  407. 372            } else if (isInstanceOf(v, sql.Year)) {
    408. 

  408. 1                return this._literalYear(v);
    409. 

  409. 371            } else if (isInstanceOf(v, sql.TimeStamp, sql.DateTime)) {
    410. 

  410. 31                return this._literalTimestamp(v);
    411. 

  411. 340            } else if (isDate(v)) {
    412. 

  412. 7                return this._literalDate(v);
    413. 

  413. 333            } else if (isInstanceOf(v, sql.Time)) {
    414. 

  414. 1                return this._literalTime(v);
    415. 

  415. 332            } else if (Buffer.isBuffer(v)) {
    416. 

  416. 11                return this._literalBuffer(v);
    417. 

  417. 321            } else if (isNull(v)) {
    418. 

  418. 232                return this._literalNull();
    419. 

  419.              }
    420. 

  420. 89            else if (isBoolean(v)) {
    421. 

  421. 79                return this._literalBoolean(v);
    422. 

  422.              }
    423. 

  423. 10            else if (isHash(v)) {
    424. 

  424. 6                return this._literalObject(v);
    425. 

  425.              } else {
    426. 

  426. 4                return this._literalOther(v);
    427. 

  427.              }
    428. 

  428.          },
    429. 

  429.  
    430. 

  430.          //BEGIN PROTECTED
    431. 

  431.  
    432. 

  432.  
    433. 

  433.          /**
    434. 

  434.           *
    435. 

  435.           * Qualify the given expression to the given table.
    436. 

  436.           * @param {patio.sql.Expression} column the expression to qualify
    437. 

  437.           * @param table the table to qualify the expression to
    438. 

  438.           */
    439. 

  439.          _qualifiedExpression:function (e, table) {
    440. 

  440. 349            var h, i, args;
    441. 

  441. 349            if (isString(e)) {
    442. 

  442.                  //this should not be hit but here just for completeness
    443. 

  443. 0                return this.stringToIdentifier(e);
    444. 

  444. 349            } else if (isArray(e)) {
    445. 

  445. 73                return e.map(function (exp) {
    446. 

  446. 164                    return this._qualifiedExpression(exp, table);
    447. 

  447.                  }, this);
    448. 

  448. 276            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, Identifier)) {
    449. 

  449. 59                return new QualifiedIdentifier(table, e);
    450. 

  450. 217            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, OrderedExpression)) {
    451. 

  451. 2                return new OrderedExpression(this._qualifiedExpression(e.expression, table), e.descending,
    452. 

  452.                      {nulls:e.nulls});
    453. 

  453. 215            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, AliasedExpression)) {
    454. 

  454. 72                return new AliasedExpression(this._qualifiedExpression(e.expression, table), e.alias);
    455. 

  455. 143            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, CaseExpression)) {
    456. 

  456. 2                args = [this._qualifiedExpression(e.conditions, table), this._qualifiedExpression(e.def, table)];
    457. 

  457. 2                if (e.hasExpression) {
    458. 

  458. 1                    args.push(this._qualifiedExpression(e.expression, table));
    459. 

  459.                  }
    460. 

  460. 2                return CaseExpression.fromArgs(args);
    461. 

  461. 141            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, Cast)) {
    462. 

  462. 1                return new Cast(this._qualifiedExpression(e.expr, table), e.type);
    463. 

  463. 140            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, SQLFunction)) {
    464. 

  464. 2                return SQLFunction.fromArgs([e.f].concat(this._qualifiedExpression(e.args, table)));
    465. 

  465. 138            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, ComplexExpression)) {
    466. 

  466. 30                return ComplexExpression.fromArgs([e.op].concat(this._qualifiedExpression(e.args, table)));
    467. 

  467. 108            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, SubScript)) {
    468. 

  468. 1                return new SubScript(this._qualifiedExpression(e.f, table), this._qualifiedExpression(e.sub, table));
    469. 

  469. 107            } else if (isInstanceOf(e, PlaceHolderLiteralString)) {
    470. 

  470. 3                args = [];
    471. 

  471. 3                var eArgs = e.args;
    472. 

  472. 3                if (isHash(eArgs)) {
    473. 

  473. 1                    h = {};
    474. 

  474. 1                    for (i in eArgs) {
    475. 

  475. 2                        h[i] = this._qualifiedExpression(eArgs[i], table);
    476. 

  476.                      }
    477. 

  477. 1                    args = h;
    478. 

  478.                  } else {
    479. 

  479. 2                    args = this._qualifiedExpression(eArgs, table);
    480. 

  480.                  }
    481. 

  481. 3                return new PlaceHolderLiteralString(e.str, args, e.parens);
    482. 

  482.  
    483. 

  483. 104            } else if (isHash(e)) {
    484. 

  484. 0                h = {};
    485. 

  485. 0                for (i in e) {
    486. 

  486. 0                    h[this._qualifiedExpression(i, table) + ""] = this._qualifiedExpression(e[i], table);
    487. 

  487.                  }
    488. 

  488. 0                return h;
    489. 

  489.              } else {
    490. 

  490. 104                return e;
    491. 

  491.              }
    492. 

  492.          },
    493. 

  493.  
    494. 

  494.          /**
    495. 

  495.           * Returns a string that is the name of the table.
    496. 

  496.           *
    497. 

  497.           * @throws {patio.QueryError} If the name is not a String {@link patio.sql.Identifier},
    498. 

  498.           * {@link patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier} or {@link patio.sql.AliasedExpression}.
    499. 

  499.           *
    500. 

  500.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier|patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} name
    501. 

  501.           *          the object to get the table name from.
    502. 

  502.           *
    503. 

  503.           * @return {String} the name of the table.
    504. 

  504.           */
    505. 

  505.          _toTableName:function (name) {
    506. 

  506. 67            var ret;
    507. 

  507. 67            if (isString(name)) {
    508. 

  508. 10                var parts = this._splitString(name);
    509. 

  509. 10                var schema = parts[0], table = parts[1], alias = parts[2];
    510. 

  510. 10                ret = (schema || alias) ? alias || table : table;
    511. 

  511. 57            } else if (isInstanceOf(name, Identifier)) {
    512. 

  512. 54                ret = name.value;
    513. 

  513. 3            } else if (isInstanceOf(name, QualifiedIdentifier)) {
    514. 

  514. 1                ret = this._toTableName(name.column);
    515. 

  515. 2            } else if (isInstanceOf(name, AliasedExpression)) {
    516. 

  516. 2                ret = this.__toAliasedTableName(name.alias);
    517. 

  517.              } else {
    518. 

  518. 0                throw new QueryError("Invalid object to retrieve the table name from");
    519. 

  519.              }
    520. 

  520. 67            return ret;
    521. 

  521.          },
    522. 

  522.  
    523. 

  523.          /**
    524. 

  524.           * Return the unaliased part of the identifier.  Handles both
    525. 

  525.           * implicit aliases in strings, as well as {@link patio.sql.AliasedExpression}s.
    526. 

  526.           * Other objects are returned as is.
    527. 

  527.           *
    528. 

  528.           * @param {String|patio.sql.AliasedExpression|*} tableAlias the object to un alias
    529. 

  529.           *
    530. 

  530.           * @return {patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|String|*} the unaliased portion of the identifier
    531. 

  531.           */
    532. 

  532.          _unaliasedIdentifier:function (c) {
    533. 

  533. 35            if (isString(c)) {
    534. 

  534. 30                var parts = this._splitString(c);
    535. 

  535. 30                var table = parts[0], column = parts[1];
    536. 

  536. 30                if (table) {
    537. 

  537. 5                    return new QualifiedIdentifier(table, column);
    538. 

  538.                  }
    539. 

  539. 25                return column;
    540. 

  540.  
    541. 

  541. 5            } else if (isInstanceOf(c, AliasedExpression)) {
    542. 

  542. 3                return c.expression;
    543. 

  543.              } else {
    544. 

  544. 2                return c;
    545. 

  545.              }
    546. 

  546.          },
    547. 

  547.  
    548. 

  548.          /**
    549. 

  549.           * Return a [@link patio.sql._Query#fromSelf} dataset if an order or limit is specified, so it works as expected
    550. 

  550.           * with UNION, EXCEPT, and INTERSECT clauses.
    551. 

  551.           */
    552. 

  552.          _compoundFromSelf:function () {
    553. 

  553. 102            var opts = this.__opts;
    554. 

  554. 102            return (opts["limit"] || opts["order"]) ? this.fromSelf() : this;
    555. 

  555.          },
    556. 

  556.  
    557. 

  557.          /**
    558. 

  558.           * Return true if the dataset has a non-null value for any key in opts.
    559. 

  559.           * @param opts the options to compate this datasets options to
    560. 

  560.           *
    561. 

  561.           * @return {Boolean} true if the dataset has a non-null value for any key in opts.
    562. 

  562.           */
    563. 

  563.          _optionsOverlap:function (opts) {
    564. 

  564. 143            var o = [];
    565. 

  565. 143            for (var i in this.__opts) {
    566. 

  566. 349                if (!isUndefinedOrNull(this.__opts[i])) {
    567. 

  567. 200                    o.push(i);
    568. 

  568.                  }
    569. 

  569.              }
    570. 

  570. 143            return !(intersect(compact(o), opts).length == 0);
    571. 

  571.          },
    572. 

  572.  
    573. 

  573.          //Formats in INSERT statement using the stored columns and values.
    574. 

  574.          _insertSql:function () {
    575. 

  575. 1457            return this._clauseSql("insert");
    576. 

  576.          },
    577. 

  577.  
    578. 

  578.          //Formats an UPDATE statement using the stored values.
    579. 

  579.          _updateSql:function () {
    580. 

  580. 233            return this._clauseSql("update")
    581. 

  581.          },
    582. 

  582.          //Formats the truncate statement.  Assumes the table given has already been
    583. 

  583.          //literalized.
    584. 

  584.          _truncateSql:function (table) {
    585. 

  585. 29            return "TRUNCATE TABLE" + table;
    586. 

  586.          },
    587. 

  587.  
    588. 

  588.  
    589. 

  589.          //Prepares an SQL statement by calling all clause methods for the given statement type.
    590. 

  590.          _clauseSql:function (type) {
    591. 

  591. 6681            var sql = [("" + type).toUpperCase()];
    592. 

  592. 6681            try {
    593. 

  593. 6681                this._static[sql + "_CLAUSE_METHODS"].forEach(function (m) {
    594. 

  594. 66469                    if (m.match("With")) {
    595. 

  595. 6404                        this[m](sql);
    596. 

  596.                      } else {
    597. 

  597. 60065                        var sqlRet = this[m]();
    598. 

  598. 60063                        if (sqlRet) {
    599. 

  599. 21382                            sql.push(sqlRet);
    600. 

  600.                          }
    601. 

  601.                      }
    602. 

  602.                  }, this);
    603. 

  603.              } catch (e) {
    604. 

  604. 2                throw e;
    605. 

  605.              }
    606. 

  606. 6679            return sql.join("");
    607. 

  607.          },
    608. 

  608.  
    609. 

  609.  
    610. 

  610.          //SQL fragment specifying the table to insert INTO
    611. 

  611.          _insertIntoSql:function (sql) {
    612. 

  612. 1466            return string.format(" INTO%s", this._sourceList(this.__opts.from));
    613. 

  613.          },
    614. 

  614.  
    615. 

  615.          //SQL fragment specifying the columns to insert into
    616. 

  616.          _insertColumnsSql:function (sql) {
    617. 

  617. 1456            var columns = this.__opts.columns, ret = "";
    618. 

  618. 1456            if (columns && columns.length) {
    619. 

  619. 1403                ret = " (" + columns.map(
    620. 

  620.                      function (c) {
    621. 

  621. 6807                        return c.toString(this);
    622. 

  622.                      }, this).join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR) + ")";
    623. 

  623.              }
    624. 

  624. 1456            return ret;
    625. 

  625.          },
    626. 

  626.  
    627. 

  627.          //SQL fragment specifying the values to insert.
    628. 

  628.          _insertValuesSql:function () {
    629. 

  629. 1456            var values = this.__opts.values, ret = [];
    630. 

  630. 1456            if (isArray(values)) {
    631. 

  631. 1438                ret.push(values.length == 0 ? " DEFAULT VALUES" : " VALUES " + this.literal(values));
    632. 

  632. 18            } else if (isInstanceOf(values, Dataset)) {
    633. 

  633. 6                ret.push(" " + this._subselectSql(values));
    634. 

  634. 12            } else if (isInstanceOf(values, LiteralString)) {
    635. 

  635. 11                ret.push(" " + values.toString(this));
    636. 

  636.              } else {
    637. 

  637. 1                throw new QueryError("Unsupported INSERT values type, should be an array or dataset");
    638. 

  638.              }
    639. 

  639. 1455            return ret.join("");
    640. 

  640.          },
    641. 

  641.  
    642. 

  642.          //SQL fragment for Array
    643. 

  643.          _arraySql:function (a) {
    644. 

  644. 2109            return !a.length ? '(NULL)' : "(" + this.__expressionList(a) + ")";
    645. 

  645.          },
    646. 

  646.  
    647. 

  647.          //This method quotes the given name with the SQL standard double quote.
    648. 

  648.          //should be overridden by subclasses to provide quoting not matching the
    649. 

  649.          //SQL standard, such as backtick (used by MySQL and SQLite).
    650. 

  650.          _quotedIdentifier:function (name) {
    651. 

  651. 15            return string.format("\"%s\"", ("" + name).replace('"', '""'));
    652. 

  652.          },
    653. 

  653.  
    654. 

  654.  
    655. 

  655.          /*
    656. 

  656.           This section is for easier adapter overrides of sql formatting. These metthods are used by patio.sql.* toString
    657. 

  657.           methods to generate sql.
    658. 

  658.           */
    659. 

  659.  
    660. 

  660.          /**
    661. 

  661.           * @private  For internal use by patio
    662. 

  662.           *
    663. 

  663.           * SQL fragment for AliasedExpression
    664. 

  664.           */
    665. 

  665.          aliasedExpressionSql:function (ae) {
    666. 

  666. 842            return this.__asSql(this.literal(ae.expression), ae.alias);
    667. 

  667.          },
    668. 

  668.  
    669. 

  669.          /**
    670. 

  670.           * @private For internal use by patio
    671. 

  671.           * SQL fragment for BooleanConstants
    672. 

  672.           * */
    673. 

  673.          booleanConstantSql:function (constant) {
    674. 

  674. 12            return this.literal(constant)
    675. 

  675.          },
    676. 

  676.  
    677. 

  677.          /**
    678. 

  678.           * @private For internal use by patio
    679. 

  679.           * SQL fragment for CaseExpression
    680. 

  680.           */
    681. 

  681.          caseExpressionSql:function (ce) {
    682. 

  682. 2            var sql = ['(CASE '];
    683. 

  683. 2            if (ce.expression) {
    684. 

  684. 1                sql.push(this.literal(ce.expression), " ");
    685. 

  685.              }
    686. 

  686. 2            var conds = ce.conditions;
    687. 

  687. 2            if (isArray(conds)) {
    688. 

  688. 2                conds.forEach(function (cond) {
    689. 

  689. 2                    sql.push(format("WHEN %s THEN %s", this.literal(cond[0]), this.literal(cond[1])));
    690. 

  690.                  }, this);
    691. 

  691. 0            } else if (isHash(conds)) {
    692. 

  692. 0                for (var i in conds) {
    693. 

  693. 0                    sql.push(format("WHEN %s THEN %s", this.literal(i), this.literal(conds[i])));
    694. 

  694.                  }
    695. 

  695.              }
    696. 

  696. 2            return format("%s ELSE %s END)", sql.join(""), this.literal(ce.def));
    697. 

  697.          },
    698. 

  698.  
    699. 

  699.          /**
    700. 

  700.           * @private For internal use by patio
    701. 

  701.           * SQL fragment for the SQL CAST expression
    702. 

  702.           * */
    703. 

  703.          castSql:function (expr, type) {
    704. 

  704. 2            return string.format("CAST(%s AS %s)", this.literal(expr), this.db.castTypeLiteral(type));
    705. 

  705.          },
    706. 

  706.  
    707. 

  707.          /**
    708. 

  708.           * @private For internal use by patio
    709. 

  709.           * SQL fragment for specifying all columns in a given table
    710. 

  710.           **/
    711. 

  711.          columnAllSql:function (ca) {
    712. 

  712. 19            return  string.format("%s.*", this.quoteSchemaTable(ca.table));
    713. 

  713.          },
    714. 

  714.  
    715. 

  715.          /**
    716. 

  716.           * @private For internal use by patio
    717. 

  717.           * SQL fragment for complex expressions
    718. 

  718.           **/
    719. 

  719.          complexExpressionSql:function (op, args) {
    720. 

  720. 6571            var newOp;
    721. 

  721. 6571            var isOperators = this._static.IS_OPERATORS, isLiterals = this._static.IS_LITERALS;
    722. 

  722. 6571            if ((newOp = isOperators[op]) != null) {
    723. 

  723. 259                var r = args[1], v = isNull(r) ? isLiterals.NULL : isLiterals[r];
    724. 

  724. 259                if (r == null || this.supportsIsTrue) {
    725. 

  725. 259                    if (isUndefined(v)) {
    726. 

  726. 0                        throw new QueryError(string.format("Invalid argument('%s') used for IS operator", r));
    727. 

  727.                      }
    728. 

  728. 259                    l = args[0];
    729. 

  729. 259                    return string.format("(%s %s %s)", isString(l) ? l : this.literal(l), newOp, v);
    730. 

  730. 0                } else if (op == "IS") {
    731. 

  731. 0                    return this.complexExpressionSql("EQ", args);
    732. 

  732.                  } else {
    733. 

  733. 0                    return this.complexExpressionSql("OR",
    734. 

  734.                          [BooleanExpression.fromArgs(["NEQ"].concat(args)), new BooleanExpression("IS", args[0],
    735. 

  735.                              null)]);
    736. 

  736.                  }
    737. 

  737.  
    738. 

  738. 6312            } else if (["IN", "NOTIN"].indexOf(op) != -1) {
    739. 

  739. 17                var cols = args[0], vals = args[1], colArray = isArray(cols), valArray = false, emptyValArray = false;
    740. 

  740.  
    741. 

  741. 17                if (isArray(vals)) {
    742. 

  742. 13                    valArray = true;
    743. 

  743. 13                    emptyValArray = vals.length == 0;
    744. 

  744.                  }
    745. 

  745. 17                if (colArray) {
    746. 

  746. 6                    if (emptyValArray) {
    747. 

  747. 2                        if (op == "IN") {
    748. 

  748. 1                            return this.literal(BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs(cols.map(function (x) {
    749. 

  749. 2                                return  [x, x];
    750. 

  750.                              }), "AND", true));
    751. 

  751.                          } else {
    752. 

  752. 1                            return this.literal({1:1});
    753. 

  753.                          }
    754. 

  754. 4                    } else if (!this.supportsMultipleColumnIn) {
    755. 

  755. 0                        if (valArray) {
    756. 

  756. 0                            var expr = BooleanExpression.fromArgs(["OR"].concat(vals.map(function (vs) {
    757. 

  757. 0                                return BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs(array.zip(cols, vs))
    758. 

  758.                              })));
    759. 

  759. 0                            return this.literal(op == "IN" ? expr : expr.invert())
    760. 

  760.                          }
    761. 

  761.                      } else {
    762. 

  762.                          //If the columns and values are both arrays, use _arraySql instead of
    763. 

  763.                          //literal so that if values is an array of two element arrays, it
    764. 

  764.                          //will be treated as a value list instead of a condition specifier.
    765. 

  765. 4                        return format("(%s %s %s)", isString(cols) ? cols : this.literal(cols),
    766. 

  766.                              ComplexExpression.IN_OPERATORS[op],
    767. 

  767.                              valArray ? this._arraySql(vals) : this.literal(vals));
    768. 

  768.                      }
    769. 

  769.                  }
    770. 

  770.                  else {
    771. 

  771. 11                    if (emptyValArray) {
    772. 

  772. 1                        if (op == "IN") {
    773. 

  773. 1                            return this.literal(BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs([
    774. 

  774.                                  [cols, cols]
    775. 

  775.                              ], "AND", true));
    776. 

  776.                          } else {
    777. 

  777. 0                            return this.literal({1:1});
    778. 

  778.                          }
    779. 

  779.                      } else {
    780. 

  780. 10                        return format("(%s %s %s)", isString(cols) ? cols : this.literal(cols),
    781. 

  781.                              ComplexExpression.IN_OPERATORS[op], this.literal(vals));
    782. 

  782.                      }
    783. 

  783.                  }
    784. 

  784. 6295            } else if ((newOp = this._static.TWO_ARITY_OPERATORS[op]) != null) {
    785. 

  785. 5315                var l = args[0];
    786. 

  786. 5315                return format("(%s %s %s)", isString(l) ? l : this.literal(l), newOp,
    787. 

  787.                      this.literal(args[1]));
    788. 

  788. 980            } else if ((newOp = this._static.N_ARITY_OPERATORS[op]) != null) {
    789. 

  789. 946                return string.format("(%s)", args.map(this.literal, this).join(" " + newOp + " "));
    790. 

  790. 34            } else if (op == "NOT") {
    791. 

  791. 5                return string.format("NOT %s", this.literal(args[0]));
    792. 

  792. 29            } else if (op == "NOOP") {
    793. 

  793. 29                return this.literal(args[0]);
    794. 

  794.              } else {
    795. 

  795. 0                throw new QueryError("Invalid operator " + op);
    796. 

  796.              }
    797. 

  797.          },
    798. 

  798.  
    799. 

  799.          /**
    800. 

  800.           * @private For internal use by patio
    801. 

  801.           *
    802. 

  802.           * SQL fragment for constants
    803. 

  803.           * */
    804. 

  804.          constantSql:function (constant) {
    805. 

  805. 6            return "" + constant;
    806. 

  806.          },
    807. 

  807.  
    808. 

  808.          /**
    809. 

  809.           * @private For internal use by patio
    810. 

  810.           *
    811. 

  811.           * SQL fragment specifying an SQL function call
    812. 

  812.           * */
    813. 

  813.          functionSql:function (f) {
    814. 

  814. 565            var args = f.args
    815. 

  815. 565            return string.format("%s%s", f.f, args.length == 0 ? '()' : this.literal(args));
    816. 

  816.          },
    817. 

  817.  
    818. 

  818.          /**
    819. 

  819.           * @private For internal use by patio
    820. 

  820.           * SQL fragment specifying a JOIN clause without ON or USING.
    821. 

  821.           * */
    822. 

  822.          joinClauseSql:function (jc) {
    823. 

  823. 934            var table = jc.table
    824. 

  824. 934            var tableAlias = jc.tableAlias
    825. 

  825. 934            if (table === tableAlias) {
    826. 

  826. 37                tableAlias = null;
    827. 

  827.              }
    828. 

  828. 934            var tref = this.__tableRef(table);
    829. 

  829. 934            return string.format(" %s %s", this._joinTypeSql(jc.joinType),
    830. 

  830.                  tableAlias ? this.__asSql(tref, tableAlias) : tref);
    831. 

  831.          },
    832. 

  832.  
    833. 

  833.          /**
    834. 

  834.           * @private For internal use by patio
    835. 

  835.           * SQL fragment specifying a JOIN clause with ON.
    836. 

  836.           **/
    837. 

  837.          joinOnClauseSql:function (jc) {
    838. 

  838. 815            return string.format("%s ON %s", this.joinClauseSql(jc), this.literal(this._filterExpr(jc.on)));
    839. 

  839.          },
    840. 

  840.  
    841. 

  841.          /**
    842. 

  842.           * @private For internal use by patio
    843. 

  843.           * SQL fragment specifying a JOIN clause with USING.
    844. 

  844.           **/
    845. 

  845.          joinUsingClauseSql:function (jc) {
    846. 

  846. 102            return string.format("%s USING (%s)", this.joinClauseSql(jc), this.__columnList(jc.using));
    847. 

  847.          },
    848. 

  848.  
    849. 

  849.          /**
    850. 

  850.           * @private For internal use by patio
    851. 

  851.           * SQL fragment for NegativeBooleanConstants.
    852. 

  852.           **/
    853. 

  853.          negativeBooleanConstantSql:function (constant) {
    854. 

  854. 2            return string.format("NOT %s", this.booleanConstantSql(constant));
    855. 

  855.          },
    856. 

  856.  
    857. 

  857.          /**
    858. 

  858.           * @private For internal use by patio
    859. 

  859.           *
    860. 

  860.           * SQL fragment for the ordered expression, used in the ORDER BY
    861. 

  861.           * clause.
    862. 

  862.           */
    863. 

  863.          orderedExpressionSql:function (oe) {
    864. 

  864. 73            var s = string.format("%s %s", this.literal(oe.expression), oe.descending ? "DESC" : "ASC");
    865. 

  865. 73            if (oe.nulls) {
    866. 

  866. 7                s = string.format("%s NULLS %s", s, oe.nulls == "first" ? "FIRST" : "LAST");
    867. 

  867.              }
    868. 

  868. 73            return s;
    869. 

  869.          },
    870. 

  870.  
    871. 

  871.          /**
    872. 

  872.           * @private For internal use by patio
    873. 

  873.           * SQL fragment for a literal string with placeholders
    874. 

  874.           * */
    875. 

  875.          placeholderLiteralStringSql:function (pls) {
    876. 

  876. 55            var args = pls.args;
    877. 

  877. 55            var s;
    878. 

  878. 55            if (isHash(args)) {
    879. 

  879. 6                for (var i in args) {
    880. 

  880. 10                    args[i] = this.literal(args[i]);
    881. 

  881.                  }
    882. 

  882. 6                s = string.format(pls.str, args);
    883. 

  883.              } else {
    884. 

  884. 49                s = pls.str.replace(this._static.QUESTION_MARK, "%s");
    885. 

  885. 49                args = toArray(args).map(this.literal, this);
    886. 

  886. 49                s = string.format(s, args);
    887. 

  887.  
    888. 

  888.              }
    889. 

  889. 55            if (pls.parens) {
    890. 

  890. 30                s = string.format("(%s)", s);
    891. 

  891.              }
    892. 

  892. 55            return s;
    893. 

  893.          },
    894. 

  894.  
    895. 

  895.  
    896. 

  896.          /**
    897. 

  897.           * @private For internal use by patio
    898. 

  898.           * SQL fragment for the qualifed identifier, specifying
    899. 

  899.           * a table and a column (or schema and table).
    900. 

  900.           */
    901. 

  901.          qualifiedIdentifierSql:function (qcr) {
    902. 

  902. 4208            return [qcr.table, qcr.column].map(
    903. 

  903.                  function (x) {
    904. 

  904. 8416                    return [QualifiedIdentifier, Identifier, String].some(function (c) {
    905. 

  905. 23723                        return x instanceof c
    906. 

  906.                      }) ? this.literal(x) : this.quoteIdentifier(x)
    907. 

  907.                  }, this).join('.');
    908. 

  908.          },
    909. 

  909.  
    910. 

  910.          /**
    911. 

  911.           * @private For internal use by patio
    912. 

  912.           *
    913. 

  913.           * Adds quoting to identifiers (columns and tables). If identifiers are not
    914. 

  914.           * being quoted, returns name as a string.  If identifiers are being quoted
    915. 

  915.           * quote the name with {@link patio.dataset._Sql#_quotedIdentifier}.
    916. 

  916.           */
    917. 

  917.          quoteIdentifier:function (name) {
    918. 

  918. 33186            if (isInstanceOf(name, LiteralString)) {
    919. 

  919. 260                return name;
    920. 

  920.              } else {
    921. 

  921. 32926                if (isInstanceOf(name, Identifier)) {
    922. 

  922. 22344                    name = name.value;
    923. 

  923.                  }
    924. 

  924. 32926                name = this.inputIdentifier(name);
    925. 

  925. 32926                if (this.quoteIdentifiers) {
    926. 

  926. 25848                    name = this._quotedIdentifier(name)
    927. 

  927.                  }
    928. 

  928.              }
    929. 

  929. 32926            return name;
    930. 

  930.          },
    931. 

  931.  
    932. 

  932.          /**
    933. 

  933.           * @private For internal use by patio
    934. 

  934.           *
    935. 

  935.           * Modify the identifier returned from the database based on the
    936. 

  936.           * identifierOutputMethod.
    937. 

  937.           */
    938. 

  938.          inputIdentifier:function (v) {
    939. 

  939. 33079            var i = this.__identifierInputMethod;
    940. 

  940. 33079            v = v.toString(this);
    941. 

  941. 33079            return !isUndefinedOrNull(i) ?
    942. 

  942.                  isFunction(v[i]) ?
    943. 

  943.                      v[i]() :
    944. 

  944.                      isFunction(comb[i]) ?
    945. 

  945.                          comb[i](v)
    946. 

  946.                          : v
    947. 

  947.                  : v;
    948. 

  948.          },
    949. 

  949.  
    950. 

  950.          /**
    951. 

  951.           * @private For internal use by patio
    952. 

  952.           *
    953. 

  953.           * Modify the identifier sent to the database based on the
    954. 

  954.           * identifierOutputMethod.
    955. 

  955.           */
    956. 

  956.          outputIdentifier:function (v) {
    957. 

  957. 20202            (v == '' && (v = 'untitled'));
    958. 

  958. 20202            var i = this.__identifierOutputMethod;
    959. 

  959. 20202            return !isUndefinedOrNull(i) ?
    960. 

  960.                  isFunction(v[i]) ?
    961. 

  961.                      v[i]() :
    962. 

  962.                      isFunction(comb[i]) ?
    963. 

  963.                          comb[i](v)
    964. 

  964.                          : v
    965. 

  965.                  : v;
    966. 

  966.          },
    967. 

  967.  
    968. 

  968.          /**
    969. 

  969.           * @private For For internal use by patio
    970. 

  970.           *
    971. 

  971.           * Separates the schema from the table and returns a string with them
    972. 

  972.           * quoted (if quoting identifiers)
    973. 

  973.           */
    974. 

  974.          quoteSchemaTable:function (table) {
    975. 

  975. 2240            var parts = this.schemaAndTable(table);
    976. 

  976. 2240            var schema = parts[0];
    977. 

  977. 2240            table = parts[1];
    978. 

  978. 2240            return string.format("%s%s", schema ? this.quoteIdentifier(schema) + "." : "", this.quoteIdentifier(table));
    979. 

  979.          },
    980. 

  980.  
    981. 

  981.  
    982. 

  982.          /**
    983. 

  983.           * @private For For internal use by patio
    984. 

  984.           * Split the schema information from the table
    985. 

  985.           */
    986. 

  986.          schemaAndTable:function (tableName) {
    987. 

  987. 2450            var sch = this.db ? this.db.defaultSchema || null : null;
    988. 

  988. 2450            if (isString(tableName)) {
    989. 

  989. 1004                var parts = this._splitString(tableName);
    990. 

  990. 1004                var s = parts[0], table = parts[1];
    991. 

  991. 1004                return [s || sch, table];
    992. 

  992. 1446            } else if (isInstanceOf(tableName, QualifiedIdentifier)) {
    993. 

  993. 3                return [tableName.table, tableName.column]
    994. 

  994. 1443            } else if (isInstanceOf(tableName, Identifier)) {
    995. 

  995. 1443                return [null, tableName.value];
    996. 

  996.              } else {
    997. 

  997. 0                throw new QueryError("table should be a QualifiedIdentifier, Identifier, or String");
    998. 

  998.              }
    999. 

  999.          },
    1000. 

  1000.  
    1001. 

  1001.          /**
    1002. 

  1002.           * @private For For internal use by patio
    1003. 

  1003.           * SQL fragment for specifying subscripts (SQL array accesses)
    1004. 

  1004.           * */
    1005. 

  1005.          subscriptSql:function (s) {
    1006. 

  1006. 76            return string.format("%s[%s]", this.literal(s.f), this.__expressionList(s.sub));
    1007. 

  1007.          },
    1008. 

  1008.  
    1009. 

  1009.  
    1010. 

  1010.          /**
    1011. 

  1011.           * Do a simple join of the arguments (which should be strings) separated by commas
    1012. 

  1012.           * */
    1013. 

  1013.          __argumentList:function (args) {
    1014. 

  1014. 2            return args.join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR)
    1015. 

  1015.          },
    1016. 

  1016.  
    1017. 

  1017.          /**
    1018. 

  1018.           * SQL fragment for specifying an alias.  expression should already be literalized.
    1019. 

  1019.           */
    1020. 

  1020.          __asSql:function (expression, alias) {
    1021. 

  1021. 937            return string.format("%s AS %s", expression, this.quoteIdentifier(alias));
    1022. 

  1022.          },
    1023. 

  1023.  
    1024. 

  1024.          /**
    1025. 

  1025.           * Converts an array of column names into a comma seperated string of
    1026. 

  1026.           * column names. If the array is empty, a wildcard (*) is returned.
    1027. 

  1027.           */
    1028. 

  1028.          __columnList:function (columns) {
    1029. 

  1029. 5449            return (!columns || columns.length == 0) ? this._static.WILDCARD : this.__expressionList(columns);
    1030. 

  1030.          },
    1031. 

  1031.  
    1032. 

  1032.          /**
    1033. 

  1033.           * The alias to use for datasets, takes a number to make sure the name is unique.
    1034. 

  1034.           * */
    1035. 

  1035.          _datasetAlias:function (number) {
    1036. 

  1036. 96            return this._static.DATASET_ALIAS_BASE_NAME + number;
    1037. 

  1037.          },
    1038. 

  1038.  
    1039. 

  1039.          /**
    1040. 

  1040.           * Converts an array of expressions into a comma separated string of
    1041. 

  1041.           * expressions.
    1042. 

  1042.           */
    1043. 

  1043.          __expressionList:function (columns) {
    1044. 

  1044. 4248            return columns.map(this.literal, this).join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR);
    1045. 

  1045.          },
    1046. 

  1046.  
    1047. 

  1047.          //Format the timestamp based on the default_timestamp_format, with a couple
    1048. 

  1048.          //of modifiers.  First, allow %N to be used for fractions seconds (if the
    1049. 

  1049.          //database supports them), and override %z to always use a numeric offset
    1050. 

  1050.          //of hours and minutes.
    1051. 

  1051.          formatTimestamp:function (v, format) {
    1052. 

  1052. 32            return this.literal(patio.dateToString(v, format));
    1053. 

  1053.          },
    1054. 

  1054.  
    1055. 

  1055.          /**
    1056. 

  1056.           * SQL fragment specifying a JOIN type, splits a camelCased join type
    1057. 

  1057.           * and converts to uppercase/
    1058. 

  1058.           */
    1059. 

  1059.          _joinTypeSql:function (joinType) {
    1060. 

  1060. 931            return (joinType || "").replace(/([a-z]+)|([A-Z][a-z]+)/g,
    1061. 

  1061.                  function (m) {
    1062. 

  1062. 1136                    return m.toUpperCase() + " ";
    1063. 

  1063.                  }
    1064. 

  1064.              ).trimRight() + " JOIN";
    1065. 

  1065.          },
    1066. 

  1066.  
    1067. 

  1067.          /*
    1068. 

  1068.           Methods for converting types to a SQL .
    1069. 

  1069.           */
    1070. 

  1070.  
    1071. 

  1071.          /**
    1072. 

  1072.           * @return SQL fragment for a type of object not handled by {@link patio.dataset._Sql#literal}.
    1073. 

  1073.           * If object has a method sqlLiteral then it is called with this dataset as the first argument,
    1074. 

  1074.           * otherwise raises an error. Classes implementing sqlLiteral should call a class-specific method
    1075. 

  1075.           * on the dataset provided and should add that method to {@link patio.dataset.Dataset}, allowing for adapters
    1076. 

  1076.           * to provide customized literalizations.
    1077. 

  1077.           * If a database specific type is allowed, this should be overriden in a subclass.
    1078. 

  1078.           */
    1079. 

  1079.          _literalOther:function (v) {
    1080. 

  1080. 4            if (isFunction(v.sqlLiteral)) {
    1081. 

  1081. 1                return v.sqlLiteral(this);
    1082. 

  1082.              } else {
    1083. 

  1083. 2                throw string.format("can't express %j as a SQL literal", [v]);
    1084. 

  1084.              }
    1085. 

  1085.          },
    1086. 

  1086.  
    1087. 

  1087.          /**
    1088. 

  1088.           *@return SQL fragment for Buffer, treated as an expression
    1089. 

  1089.           * */
    1090. 

  1090.          _literalBuffer:function (b) {
    1091. 

  1091. 3            return "X'" + b.toString("hex") + "'";
    1092. 

  1092.          },
    1093. 

  1093.  
    1094. 

  1094.          /**
    1095. 

  1095.           *@return SQL fragment for Hash, treated as an expression
    1096. 

  1096.           * */
    1097. 

  1097.          _literalObject:function (v) {
    1098. 

  1098. 6            return this._literalExpression(BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs(v));
    1099. 

  1099.          },
    1100. 

  1100.  
    1101. 

  1101.  
    1102. 

  1102.          /**
    1103. 

  1103.           * @return SQL fragment for Array.  Treats as an expression if an array of all two pairs, or as a SQL array otherwise.
    1104. 

  1104.           */
    1105. 

  1105.          _literalArray:function (v) {
    1106. 

  1106. 2108            return Expression.isConditionSpecifier(v) ? this._literalExpression(BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs(v)) : this._arraySql(v);
    1107. 

  1107.          },
    1108. 

  1108.  
    1109. 

  1109.          /**
    1110. 

  1110.           * @return SQL fragment for a number.
    1111. 

  1111.           */
    1112. 

  1112.          _literalNumber:function (num) {
    1113. 

  1113. 7054            var ret = "" + num;
    1114. 

  1114. 7054            if (isNaN(num) || num == Infinity) {
    1115. 

  1115. 0                ret = string.format("'%s'", ret);
    1116. 

  1116.              }
    1117. 

  1117. 7054            return ret;
    1118. 

  1118.          },
    1119. 

  1119.  
    1120. 

  1120.          /**
    1121. 

  1121.           * @return SQL fragment for Dataset.  Does a subselect inside parantheses.
    1122. 

  1122.           */
    1123. 

  1123.          _literalDataset:function (dataset) {
    1124. 

  1124. 115            return string.format("(%s)", this._subselectSql(dataset));
    1125. 

  1125.          },
    1126. 

  1126.  
    1127. 

  1127.          /**
    1128. 

  1128.           * @return SQL fragment for Date, using the ISO8601 format.
    1129. 

  1129.           */
    1130. 

  1130.          _literalDate:function (date) {
    1131. 

  1131. 7            return (this.requiresSqlStandardDateTimes ? "DATE '" : "'") + patio.dateToString(date) + "'";
    1132. 

  1132.          },
    1133. 

  1133.  
    1134. 

  1134.          /**
    1135. 

  1135.           *@return SQL fragment for a year.
    1136. 

  1136.           */
    1137. 

  1137.          _literalYear:function (o) {
    1138. 

  1138. 1            return patio.dateToString(o, this._static.YEAR_FORMAT);
    1139. 

  1139.          },
    1140. 

  1140.  
    1141. 

  1141.          /**
    1142. 

  1142.           *@return SQL fragment for a timestamp, using the ISO8601 format.
    1143. 

  1143.           */
    1144. 

  1144.          _literalTimestamp:function (v) {
    1145. 

  1145. 31            return this.formatTimestamp(v, this._static.TIMESTAMP_FORMAT)
    1146. 

  1146.          },
    1147. 

  1147.  
    1148. 

  1148.          /**
    1149. 

  1149.           *@return SQL fragment for a timestamp, using the ISO8601 format.
    1150. 

  1150.           */
    1151. 

  1151.          _literalTime:function (v) {
    1152. 

  1152. 1            return this.formatTimestamp(v, this._static.TIME_FORMAT);
    1153. 

  1153.          },
    1154. 

  1154.  
    1155. 

  1155.          /**
    1156. 

  1156.           * @return SQL fragment for a boolean.
    1157. 

  1157.           */
    1158. 

  1158.          _literalBoolean:function (b) {
    1159. 

  1159. 79            return b ? this._static.BOOL_TRUE : this._static.BOOL_FALSE;
    1160. 

  1160.          },
    1161. 

  1161.  
    1162. 

  1162.          /**
    1163. 

  1163.           * @return SQL fragment for SQL::Expression, result depends on the specific type of expression.
    1164. 

  1164.           * */
    1165. 

  1165.          _literalExpression:function (v) {
    1166. 

  1166. 28025            return v.toString(this);
    1167. 

  1167.          },
    1168. 

  1168.  
    1169. 

  1169.          /**
    1170. 

  1170.           *@return SQL fragment for Hash, treated as an expression
    1171. 

  1171.           * */
    1172. 

  1172.          _literalHash:function (v) {
    1173. 

  1173. 0            return this._literalExpression(BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs(v));
    1174. 

  1174.          },
    1175. 

  1175.  
    1176. 

  1176.          /**@return SQL fragment for null*/
    1177. 

  1177.          _literalNull:function () {
    1178. 

  1178. 232            return this._static.NULL;
    1179. 

  1179.          },
    1180. 

  1180.  
    1181. 

  1181.          /**
    1182. 

  1182.           * @return SQL fragment for String.  Doubles \ and ' by default.
    1183. 

  1183.           * */
    1184. 

  1184.          _literalString:function (v) {
    1185. 

  1185. 6120            var parts = this._splitString(v);
    1186. 

  1186. 6120            var table = parts[0], column = parts[1], alias = parts[2];
    1187. 

  1187. 6120            if (!alias) {
    1188. 

  1188. 6120                return column && table ? this._literalExpression(QualifiedIdentifier.fromArgs([table, column])) : "'"
    1189. 

  1189.                      + v.replace(/\\/g, "\\\\").replace(/'/g, "''") + "'"
    1190. 

  1190.              } else {
    1191. 

  1191. 0                return this.literal(new AliasedExpression(column
    1192. 

  1192.                      && table ? QualifiedIdentifier.fromArgs([table, column]) : new Identifier(column), alias));
    1193. 

  1193.              }
    1194. 

  1194.          },
    1195. 

  1195.  
    1196. 

  1196.          /*SQL STATEMENT CREATION METHODS*/
    1197. 

  1197.  
    1198. 

  1198.          _selectQualifySql:function () {
    1199. 

  1199. 4982            var o = this.__opts;
    1200. 

  1200. 4982            var table = this.__opts.alwaysQualify;
    1201. 

  1201. 4982            if (table && !o.sql) {
    1202. 

  1202. 2                array.intersect(Object.keys(o), this._static.QUALIFY_KEYS).forEach(function (k) {
    1203. 

  1203. 2                    o[k] = this._qualifiedExpression(o[k], table);
    1204. 

  1204.                  }, this);
    1205. 

  1205. 2                if (!o.select || isEmpty(o.select)) {
    1206. 

  1206. 2                    o.select = [new ColumnAll(table)];
    1207. 

  1207.                  }
    1208. 

  1208.              }
    1209. 

  1209.          },
    1210. 

  1210.  
    1211. 

  1211.          _deleteQualifySql:function () {
    1212. 

  1212. 948            return this._selectQualifySql.apply(this, arguments);
    1213. 

  1213.          },
    1214. 

  1214.  
    1215. 

  1215.          /**
    1216. 

  1216.           * @return the columns selected
    1217. 

  1217.           * */
    1218. 

  1218.          _selectColumnsSql:function () {
    1219. 

  1219. 4034            return " " + this.__columnList(this.__opts.select);
    1220. 

  1220.          },
    1221. 

  1221.  
    1222. 

  1222.          /**@return the DISTINCT clause.*/
    1223. 

  1223.          _selectDistinctSql:function () {
    1224. 

  1224. 4034            var distinct = this.__opts.distinct, ret = [];
    1225. 

  1225. 4034            if (distinct) {
    1226. 

  1226. 10                ret.push(" DISTINCT");
    1227. 

  1227. 10                if (distinct.length) {
    1228. 

  1228. 4                    ret.push(format(" ON (%s)", this.__expressionList(distinct)));
    1229. 

  1229.                  }
    1230. 

  1230.              }
    1231. 

  1231. 4034            return ret.join("");
    1232. 

  1232.          },
    1233. 

  1233.  
    1234. 

  1234.          /**
    1235. 

  1235.           * @return the EXCEPT, INTERSECT, or UNION clause.
    1236. 

  1236.           * This uses a subselect for the compound datasets used, because using parantheses doesn't
    1237. 

  1237.           * work on all databases.
    1238. 

  1238.           **/
    1239. 

  1239.          _selectCompoundsSql:function () {
    1240. 

  1240. 4034            var opts = this.__opts, compounds = opts.compounds, ret = [];
    1241. 

  1241. 4034            if (compounds) {
    1242. 

  1242. 49                compounds.forEach(function (c) {
    1243. 

  1243. 49                    var type = c[0], dataset = c[1], all = c[2];
    1244. 

  1244. 49                    ret.push(string.format(" %s%s %s", type.toUpperCase(), all ? " ALL" : "", this._subselectSql(dataset)));
    1245. 

  1245.                  }, this);
    1246. 

  1246.              }
    1247. 

  1247. 4034            return ret.join("");
    1248. 

  1248.          },
    1249. 

  1249.  
    1250. 

  1250.          /**
    1251. 

  1251.           * @return the sql to add the list of tables to select FROM
    1252. 

  1252.           **/
    1253. 

  1253.          _selectFromSql:function () {
    1254. 

  1254. 4052            var from = this.__opts.from;
    1255. 

  1255. 4052            return from ? string.format(" %s%s", this._static.FROM, this._sourceList(from)) : "";
    1256. 

  1256.          },
    1257. 

  1257.  
    1258. 

  1258.          /**
    1259. 

  1259.           * @return the GROUP BY clause
    1260. 

  1260.           **/
    1261. 

  1261.          _selectGroupSql:function () {
    1262. 

  1262. 4034            var group = this.__opts.group;
    1263. 

  1263. 4034            return group ? string.format(" GROUP BY %s", this.__expressionList(group)) : "";
    1264. 

  1264.          },
    1265. 

  1265.  
    1266. 

  1266.  
    1267. 

  1267.          /**
    1268. 

  1268.           *@return the sql to add the filter criteria in the HAVING clause
    1269. 

  1269.           **/
    1270. 

  1270.          _selectHavingSql:function () {
    1271. 

  1271. 4034            var having = this.__opts.having;
    1272. 

  1272. 4034            return having ? string.format(" HAVING %s", this.literal(having)) : "";
    1273. 

  1273.          },
    1274. 

  1274.  
    1275. 

  1275.          /**
    1276. 

  1276.           * @return the JOIN clause.
    1277. 

  1277.           **/
    1278. 

  1278.          _selectJoinSql:function () {
    1279. 

  1279. 4037            var join = this.__opts.join, ret = [];
    1280. 

  1280. 4037            if (join) {
    1281. 

  1281. 598                join.forEach(function (j) {
    1282. 

  1282. 934                    ret.push(this.literal(j));
    1283. 

  1283.                  }, this);
    1284. 

  1284.              }
    1285. 

  1285. 4037            return ret.join("");
    1286. 

  1286.          },
    1287. 

  1287.  
    1288. 

  1288.          /**
    1289. 

  1289.           * @return the LIMIT and OFFSET clauses.
    1290. 

  1290.           * */
    1291. 

  1291.          _selectLimitSql:function () {
    1292. 

  1292. 4034            var ret = [], limit = this.__opts.limit, offset = this.__opts.offset;
    1293. 

  1293. 4034            !isUndefined(limit) && !isNull(limit) && (ret.push(format(" LIMIT %s", this.literal(limit))));
    1294. 

  1294. 4034            !isUndefined(offset) && !isNull(offset) && (ret.push(format(" OFFSET %s", this.literal(offset))));
    1295. 

  1295. 4034            return ret.join("");
    1296. 

  1296.          },
    1297. 

  1297.  
    1298. 

  1298.          /**
    1299. 

  1299.           * @return SQL for different locking modes.
    1300. 

  1300.           **/
    1301. 

  1301.          _selectLockSql:function () {
    1302. 

  1302. 4033            var lock = this.__opts.lock, ret = [];
    1303. 

  1303. 4033            if (lock) {
    1304. 

  1304. 3                if (lock == "update") {
    1305. 

  1305. 2                    ret.push(this._static.FOR_UPDATE);
    1306. 

  1306.                  } else {
    1307. 

  1307. 1                    ret.push(" ", lock);
    1308. 

  1308.                  }
    1309. 

  1309.              }
    1310. 

  1310. 4033            return ret.join("");
    1311. 

  1311.          },
    1312. 

  1312.  
    1313. 

  1313.          /**
    1314. 

  1314.           * @return the SQL ORDER BY clause fragment.
    1315. 

  1315.           */
    1316. 

  1316.          _selectOrderSql:function () {
    1317. 

  1317. 4046            var order = this.__opts.order;
    1318. 

  1318. 4046            return order ? string.format(" ORDER BY %s", this.__expressionList(order)) : "";
    1319. 

  1319.          },
    1320. 

  1320.  
    1321. 

  1321.          /**
    1322. 

  1322.           * @return the SQL WHERE clause fragment.
    1323. 

  1323.           */
    1324. 

  1324.          _selectWhereSql:function () {
    1325. 

  1325. 5215            var where = this.__opts.where;
    1326. 

  1326. 5215            return where ? string.format(" WHERE %s", this.literal(where)) : "";
    1327. 

  1327.          },
    1328. 

  1328.  
    1329. 

  1329.          /**
    1330. 

  1330.           * @return SQL WITH clause fragment.
    1331. 

  1331.           * @param sql
    1332. 

  1332.           */
    1333. 

  1333.          _selectWithSql:function (sql) {
    1334. 

  1334. 6404            var wit = this.__opts["with"];
    1335. 

  1335. 6404            if (wit && wit.length) {
    1336. 

  1336.                  //sql.length = 0;
    1337. 

  1337. 8                var base = sql.join("");
    1338. 

  1338. 8                sql.length = 0;
    1339. 

  1339. 8                sql.push([this._selectWithSqlBase(), wit.map(function (w) {
    1340. 

  1340. 11                    return [
    1341. 

  1341.                          this.quoteIdentifier(w.name),
    1342. 

  1342.                          (w.args ? ("(" + this.__argumentList(w.args) + ")") : ""),
    1343. 

  1343.                          " AS ",
    1344. 

  1344.                          this._literalDataset(w.dataset)
    1345. 

  1345.                      ].join("");
    1346. 

  1346.                  }, this).join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR), base].join(" "));
    1347. 

  1347.              }
    1348. 

  1348.          },
    1349. 

  1349.  
    1350. 

  1350.          _deleteWithSql:function () {
    1351. 

  1351. 930            return this._selectWithSql.apply(this, arguments);
    1352. 

  1352.          },
    1353. 

  1353.  
    1354. 

  1354.          _insertWithSql:function () {
    1355. 

  1355. 1320            return this._selectWithSql.apply(this, arguments);
    1356. 

  1356.          },
    1357. 

  1357.  
    1358. 

  1358.          _updateWithSql:function () {
    1359. 

  1359. 206            return this._selectWithSql.apply(this, arguments);
    1360. 

  1360.          },
    1361. 

  1361.  
    1362. 

  1362.          _insertReturningSql:function (sql) {
    1363. 

  1363. 2456            var opts = this.__opts, ret = "";
    1364. 

  1364. 2456            if (opts.hasOwnProperty("returning")) {
    1365. 

  1365. 1313                return [this._static.RETURNING, this.__columnList(array.toArray(opts.returning))].join("");
    1366. 

  1366.              }
    1367. 

  1367. 1143            return ret;
    1368. 

  1368.          },
    1369. 

  1369.  
    1370. 

  1370.          _deleteReturningSql:function () {
    1371. 

  1371. 930            return this._insertReturningSql.apply(this, arguments);
    1372. 

  1372.          },
    1373. 

  1373.  
    1374. 

  1374.          _updateReturningSql:function () {
    1375. 

  1375. 206            return this._insertReturningSql.apply(this, arguments);
    1376. 

  1376.          },
    1377. 

  1377.  
    1378. 

  1378.          /**
    1379. 

  1379.           * @return The base keyword to use for the SQL WITH clause
    1380. 

  1380.           **/
    1381. 

  1381.          _selectWithSqlBase:function () {
    1382. 

  1382. 8            return this._static.SQL_WITH;
    1383. 

  1383.          },
    1384. 

  1384.  
    1385. 

  1385.          /**
    1386. 

  1386.           * @see patio.dataset._Sql#_selectFromSql
    1387. 

  1387.           */
    1388. 

  1388.          _deleteFromSql:function () {
    1389. 

  1389. 18            return this._selectFromSql();
    1390. 

  1390.          },
    1391. 

  1391.  
    1392. 

  1392.          /**
    1393. 

  1393.           * @see patio.dataset._Sql#_selectOrderSql
    1394. 

  1394.           */
    1395. 

  1395.          _deleteOrderSql:function () {
    1396. 

  1396. 10            return this._selectOrderSql();
    1397. 

  1397.          },
    1398. 

  1398.  
    1399. 

  1399.          /**
    1400.

    1424. 

  1424.          _updateTableSql:function (sql) {
