    1433. 

  1433.          /**
    1434. 

  1434.           * @returns The SQL fragment specifying the columns and values to SET.
    1435. 

  1435.           * */
    1436. 

  1436.          _updateSetSql:function () {
    1437. 

  1437. 233            var values = this.__opts.values, defs = this.__opts.defaults, overrides = this.__opts.overrides;
    1438. 

  1438. 233            var st = [" SET "];
    1439. 

  1439. 233            if (isArray(values)) {
    1440. 

  1440. 233                var v = [], mergedDefsAndOverrides = false, length = values.length;
    1441. 

  1441.  
    1442. 

  1442. 233                for (var i = 0; i < length; i++) {
    1443. 

  1443. 229                    var val = values[i];
    1444. 

  1444. 229                    if (isHash(val)) {
    1445. 

  1445. 225                        mergedDefsAndOverrides = true;
    1446. 

  1446. 225                        val = merge({}, defs || {}, val);
    1447. 

  1447. 225                        val = merge({}, val, overrides || {});
    1448. 

  1448. 225                        for (var j in val) {
    1449. 

  1449. 244                            var ident = this.stringToIdentifier(j);
    1450. 

  1450. 244                            v.push(this.quoteIdentifier(ident) + " = " + this.literal(val[j]));
    1451. 

  1451.                          }
    1452. 

  1452. 4                    } else if (isInstanceOf(val, Expression)) {
    1453. 

  1453. 2                        v.push(this._literalExpression(val).replace(/^\(|\)$/g, ""));
    1454. 

  1454.                      } else {
    1455. 

  1455. 2                        v.push(val);
    1456. 

  1456.                      }
    1457. 

  1457.                  }
    1458. 

  1458. 233                if (!mergedDefsAndOverrides) {
    1459. 

  1459. 8                    var val = merge({}, defs || {});
    1460. 

  1460. 8                    val = merge({}, val, overrides || {});
    1461. 

  1461. 8                    for (var i in val) {
    1462. 

  1462. 8                        var ident = this.stringToIdentifier(i);
    1463. 

  1463. 8                        v.push(this.quoteIdentifier(ident) + " = " + this.literal(val[i]));
    1464. 

  1464.                      }
    1465. 

  1465.                  }
    1466. 

  1466. 233                st.push(v.join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR));
    1467. 

  1467.              } else {
    1468. 

  1468. 0                st.push(values);
    1469. 

  1469.              }
    1470. 

  1470.  
    1471. 

  1471. 233            return st.join("");
    1472. 

  1472.          },
    1473. 

  1473.  
    1474. 

  1474.          /**
    1475. 

  1475.           * Converts an array of source names into into a comma separated list.
    1476. 

  1476.           **/
    1477. 

  1477.          _sourceList:function (source) {
    1478. 

  1478. 6705            if (!Array.isArray(source)) {
    1479. 

  1479. 931                source = [source];
    1480. 

  1480.              }
    1481. 

  1481. 6705            if (!source || !source.length) {
    1482. 

  1482. 0                throw new QueryError("No source specified for the query");
    1483. 

  1483.              }
    1484. 

  1484. 6705            return " " + source.map(
    1485. 

  1485.                  function (s) {
    1486. 

  1486. 6920                    return this.__tableRef(s);
    1487. 

  1487.                  }, this).join(this._static.COMMA_SEPARATOR);
    1488. 

  1488.          },
    1489. 

  1489.  
    1490. 

  1490.          /**
    1491. 

  1491.           * @return SQL to use if this dataset uses static SQL.  Since static SQL
    1492. 

  1492.           * can be a PlaceholderLiteralString in addition to a String,
    1493. 

  1493.           * we literalize nonstrings.
    1494. 

  1494.           **/
    1495. 

  1495.          _staticSql:function (sql) {
    1496.

    1497. 

  1497.  
    1498. 

  1498.          },
    1499. 

  1499.

    1506.

    1512. 

  1512.          },
    1513. 

  1513.  
    1514. 

  1514.  
    1515. 

  1515.          //Raise an InvalidOperation exception if deletion is not allowed

  1517.          __checkModificationAllowed:function () {

  1526.          __toAliasedTableName:function (alias) {

  147.               * then {@link patio.Database#quoteIdentifiersDefault} will be used.

    153. 

  153.              quoteIdentifiers:function () {

    155.

    43. 

  43.          /**
    44. 

  44.           * Returns a Promise that is resolved with an array with all records in the dataset.
    45. 

  45.           * If a block is given, the array is iterated over after all items have been loaded.
    46. 

  46.           *
    47. 

  47.           * @example
    48. 

  48.           *
    49. 

  49.           * // SELECT * FROM table
    50. 

  50.           * DB.from("table").all().then(function(res){
    51. 

  51.           *      //res === [{id : 1, ...}, {id : 2, ...}, ...];
    52. 

  52.           * });
    53. 

  53.           * // Iterate over all rows in the table
    54. 

  54.           * var myArr = [];
    55. 

  55.           * var rowPromise = DB.from("table").all(function(row){ myArr.push(row);});
    56. 

  56.           * rowPromise.then(function(rows){
    57. 

  57.           *    //=> rows == myArr;
    58. 

  58.           * });
    59. 

  59.           *
    60. 

  60.           * @param {Function} block a block to be called with each item. The return value of the block is ignored.
    61. 

  61.           * @param {Function} [cb] a block to invoke when the action is done
    62. 

  62.           *
    63. 

  63.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved with an array of rows.
    64. 

  64.           */
    65. 

  65.          all:function (block, cb) {
    66. 

  66. 2731            var a = [];
    67. 

  67. 2731            var ret = asyncArray(this.forEach().chain(this.postLoad.bind(this)));
    68. 

  68. 2731            if (block) {
    69. 

  69. 2                ret = ret.forEach(block);
    70. 

  70.              }
    71. 

  71. 2731            return ret.classic(cb).promise();
    72. 

  72.          },
    73. 

  73.  
    74. 

  74.          /**
    75. 

  75.           * Returns a promise that is resolved with the average value for the given column.
    76. 

  76.           *
    77. 

  77.           * @example
    78. 

  78.           *
    79. 

  79.           * // SELECT avg(number) FROM table LIMIT 1
    80. 

  80.           * DB.from("table").avg("number").then(function(avg){
    81. 

  81.           *      // avg === 3
    82. 

  82.           * });

  83.           *
    84.

    85.

    86. 

  86.           *
    87. 

  87.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved with the average value of the column.
    88. 

  88.           */
    89. 

  89.          avg:function (column, cb) {
    90.

    91. 

  91.          },
    92. 

  92.  
    93. 

  93.          /**

  94.           * Returns a promise that is resolved with the number of records in the dataset.
    95. 

  95.           *
    96. 

  96.           * @example
    97. 

  97.           *
    98. 

  98.           * // SELECT COUNT(*) AS count FROM table LIMIT 1
    99. 

  99.           * DB.from("table").count().then(function(count){
    100. 

  100.           *     //count === 3;
    101. 

  101.           * });
    102. 

  102.           *
    103. 

  103.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    104.

    105. 

  105.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved with the the number of records in the dataset.
    106. 

  106.           */
    107. 

  107.          count:function (cb) {
    108. 

  108. 109            return this.__aggregateDataset().get(sql.COUNT(sql.literal("*")).as("count")).chain(function (res) {
    109. 

  109. 109                return parseInt(res, 10);
    110. 

  110.              }).classic(cb);
    111. 

  111.          },
    112.

    115.

  119.          /**

  120.           * Deletes the records in the dataset.  The returned Promise should be resolved with the

    122. 

  122.           *
    123. 

  123.           * @example

    128.

    135. 

  135.          remove:function (cb) {

    137.

    139. 

  139.          /**
    140. 

  140.           * Iterates over the records in the dataset as they are returned from the
    141. 

  141.           * database adapter.

  142.           *
    143. 

  143.           * @example

    148.

    150. 

  150.           * @param {Function} [block] the block to invoke for each row.

    152.

    153. 

  153.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved when the action has completed.
    154. 

  154.           */
    155. 

  155.          forEach:function (block, cb) {
    156. 

  156. 3347            var rowCb, ret;
    157. 

  157. 3347            if (this.__opts.graph) {
    158. 

  158. 12                ret = this.graphEach(block);
    159.

  160. 3335                ret = this.fetchRows(this.selectSql);
    161.

    167.

    168. 

  168.                  }
    169. 

  169.              }
    170. 

  170. 3347            return ret.classic(cb);
    171. 

  171.          },
    172. 

  172.  
    173. 

  173.          /**
    174. 

  174.           * Returns a promise that is resolved with true if no records exist in the dataset,
    175. 

  175.           * false otherwise.
    176. 

  176.           * @example
    177. 

  177.           *
    178. 

  178.           * // SELECT 1 FROM table LIMIT 1
    179. 

  179.           * DB.from("table").isEmpty().then(function(isEmpty){
    180. 

  180.           *   // isEmpty === false
    181. 

  181.           * });
    182. 

  182.           *
    183. 

  183.           * @param {Function} [cb] a function to callback when action is done
    184. 

  184.           *
    185. 

  185.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved with a boolean indicating if the table is empty.
    186. 

  186.           */
    187. 

  187.          isEmpty:function (cb) {
    188. 

  188. 15            return this.get(1).chain(function (res) {
    189. 

  189. 15                return isUndefinedOrNull(res) || res.length === 0;
    190. 

  190.              }.bind(this)).classic(cb);
    191. 

  191.          },
    192. 

  192.  
    193. 

  193.          /**
    194. 

  194.           * @private
    195. 

  195.           * Executes a select query and fetches records, passing each record to the
    196. 

  196.           * supplied cb. This method should not be called by user code, use {@link patio.Dataset#forEach}
    197. 

  197.           * instead.
    198. 

  198.           */
    199. 

  199.          fetchRows:function (sql) {
    200. 

  200. 0            throw new NotImplemented("fetchRows must be implemented by the adapter");
    201. 

  201.          },
    202. 

  202.  
    203. 

  203.          /**
    204. 

  204.           * If a integer argument is given, it is interpreted as a limit, and then returns all
    205. 

  205.           * matching records up to that limit.
    206. 

  206.           *
    207. 

  207.           * If no arguments are passed, it returns the first matching record.
    208. 

  208.           *
    209. 

  209.           * If a function taking no arguments is passed in as the last parameter then it
    210. 

  210.           * is assumed to be a filter block. If the a funciton is passed in that takes arguments
    211. 

  211.           * then it is assumed to be a callback. You may also pass in both the second to last argument
    212. 

  212.           * being a filter function, and the last being a callback.
    213. 

  213.           *
    214. 

  214.           * If any other type of argument(s) is passed, it is given to {@link patio.Dataset#filter} and the
    215. 

  215.           * first matching record is returned.  Examples:
    216. 

  216.           *
    217. 

  217.           * @example
    218. 

  218.           *
    219. 

  219.           * comb.executeInOrder(DB.from("table"), function(ds){
    220. 

  220.           *   // SELECT * FROM table LIMIT 1
    221. 

  221.           *   ds.first(); // => {id : 7}
    222. 

  222.           *
    223. 

  223.           *   // SELECT * FROM table LIMIT 2
    224. 

  224.           *   ds.first(2); // => [{id : 6}, {id : 4}]
    225. 

  225.           *
    226. 

  226.           *   // SELECT * FROM table WHERE (id = 2) LIMIT 1
    227. 

  227.           *   ds.first({id : 2}) // => {id : 2}
    228. 

  228.           *
    229. 

  229.           *
    230. 

  230.           *  // SELECT * FROM table WHERE (id = 3) LIMIT 1
    231. 

  231.           *   ds.first("id = 3"); // => {id : 3}
    232. 

  232.           *
    233. 

  233.           *   // SELECT * FROM table WHERE (id = 4) LIMIT 1
    234. 

  234.           *   ds.first("id = ?", 4); // => {id : 4}
    235. 

  235.           *
    236. 

  236.           *   // SELECT * FROM table WHERE (id > 2) LIMIT 1
    237. 

  237.           *   ds.first(function(){return this.id.gt(2);}); // => {id : 5}
    238. 

  238.           *
    239. 

  239.           *
    240. 

  240.           *   // SELECT * FROM table WHERE ((id > 4) AND (id < 6)) LIMIT 1
    241. 

  241.           *   ds.first("id > ?", 4, function(){
    242. 

  242.           *          return this.id.lt(6);
    243. 

  243.           *   }); // => {id : 5}
    244. 

  244.           *
    245. 

  245.           *    // SELECT * FROM table WHERE (id < 2) LIMIT 2
    246. 

  246.           *   ds.first(2, function(){
    247. 

  247.           *          return this.id.lt(2)
    248. 

  248.           *   }); // => [{id:1}]
    249. 

  249.           * });
    250. 

  250.           *
    251. 

  251.           * @param {*} args varargs to be used to limit/filter the result set.
    252. 

  252.           *
    253. 

  253.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved with the either the first matching record.
    254. 

  254.           *                        Or an array of items if a limit was provided as the first argument.
    255. 

  255.           */
    256. 

  256.          first:function (args) {
    257. 

  257. 70            args = comb(arguments).toArray();
    258. 

  258. 70            var cb,
    259. 

  259.                  block = isFunction(args[args.length - 1]) ? args.pop() : null;
    260. 

  260. 70            if (block && block.length > 0) {
    261. 

  261. 18                cb = block;
    262. 

  262. 18                block = isFunction(args[args.length - 1]) ? args.pop() : null;
    263. 

  263.              }
    264. 

  264.  
    265. 

  265. 70            var ds = block ? this.filter(block) : this;
    266. 

  266. 70            if (!args.length) {
    267. 

  267. 47                return ds.singleRecord(cb);
    268. 

  268.              } else {
    269. 

  269. 23                args = (args.length === 1) ? args[0] : args;
    270. 

  270. 23                if (isNumber(args)) {
    271. 

  271. 9                    return ds.limit(args).all(null, cb);
    272. 

  272.                  } else {
    273. 

  273. 14                    return ds.filter(args).singleRecord(cb);
    274. 

  274.                  }
    275. 

  275.              }
    276. 

  276.          },
    277. 

  277.  
    278. 

  278.          /**
    279. 

  279.           * Return the column value for the first matching record in the dataset.
    280. 

  280.           *
    281. 

  281.           * @example
    282. 

  282.           *  // SELECT id FROM table LIMIT 1
    283. 

  283.           *  DB.from("table").get("id").then(function(val){
    284. 

  284.           *   // val === 3
    285. 

  285.           *  });
    286. 

  286.           *
    287. 

  287.           *
    288. 

  288.           * // SELECT sum(id) FROM table LIMIT 1
    289. 

  289.           * ds.get(sql.sum("id")).then(function(val){
    290. 

  290.           *      // val === 6;
    291. 

  291.           * });
    292. 

  292.           *
    293. 

  293.           * // SELECT sum(id) FROM table LIMIT 1
    294. 

  294.           * ds.get(function(){
    295. 

  295.           *      return this.sum("id");
    296. 

  296.           * }).then(function(val){
    297. 

  297.           *      // val === 6;
    298. 

  298.           * });
    299. 

  299.           *
    300. 

  300.           * @param {*} column the column to filter on can be anything that
    301. 

  301.           *            {@link patio.Dataset#select} accepts.
    302. 

  302.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    303. 

  303.           *
    304. 

  304.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that will be resolved will the value requested.
    305. 

  305.           */
    306. 

  306.          get:function (column, cb) {
    307. 

  307. 174            return this.select(column).singleValue(cb);
    308. 

  308.          },
    309. 

  309.  
    310. 

  310.          /**
    311. 

  311.           * Inserts multiple records into the associated table. This method can be
    312. 

  312.           * used to efficiently insert a large number of records into a table in a
    313. 

  313.           * single query if the database supports it. Inserts
    314. 

  314.           * are automatically wrapped in a transaction.
    315. 

  315.           *
    316. 

  316.           * This method is called with a columns array and an array of value arrays:
    317. 

  317.           * <pre class="code">
    318. 

  318.           *   // INSERT INTO table (x, y) VALUES (1, 2)
    319. 

  319.           *   // INSERT INTO table (x, y) VALUES (3, 4)
    320. 

  320.           *   DB.from("table").import(["x", "y"], [[1, 2], [3, 4]]).
    321. 

  321.           * </pre>
    322. 

  322.           *
    323. 

  323.           * This method also accepts a dataset instead of an array of value arrays:
    324. 

  324.           *
    325. 

  325.           * <pre class="code">
    326. 

  326.           *  // INSERT INTO table (x, y) SELECT a, b FROM table2
    327. 

  327.           *  DB.from("table").import(["x", "y"], DB.from("table2").select("a", "b"));
    328. 

  328.           * </pre>
    329. 

  329.           *
    330. 

  330.           * The method also accepts a commitEvery option that specifies
    331. 

  331.           * the number of records to insert per transaction. This is useful especially
    332. 

  332.           * when inserting a large number of records, e.g.:
    333. 

  333.           *
    334. 

  334.           * <pre class="code">
    335. 

  335.           *   // this will commit every 50 records
    336. 

  336.           *  DB.from("table").import(["x", "y"], [[1, 2], [3, 4], ...], {commitEvery : 50});
    337. 

  337.           * </pre>
    338. 

  338.           *
    339. 

  339.           * @param {Array} columns The columns to insert values for.
    340. 

  340.           *                  This array will be used as the base for each values item in the values array.
    341. 

  341.           * @param {Array[Array]} values Array of arrays of values to insert into the columns.
    342. 

  342.           * @param {Object} [opts] options
    343. 

  343.           * @param {Number} [opts.commitEvery] the number of records to insert per transaction.
    344. 

  344.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    345. 

  345.           *
    346. 

  346.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved once all records have been inserted.
    347. 

  347.           */
    348. 

  348.          "import":function (columns, values, opts, cb) {
    349. 

  349. 29            if (isFunction(opts)) {
    350. 

  350. 3                cb = opts;
    351. 

  351. 3                opts = null;
    352. 

  352.              }
    353. 

  353. 29            opts = opts || {};
    354. 

  354. 29            var ret;
    355. 

  355. 29            if (isInstanceOf(values, Dataset)) {
    356. 

  356. 2                ret = this.db.transaction(hitch(this, function () {
    357. 

  357. 2                    return this.insert(columns, values);
    358. 

  358.                  }));
    359. 

  359.              } else {
    360. 

  360. 27                ret = new Promise();
    361. 

  361. 27                if (!values.length) {
    362. 

  362. 0                    ret.callback();
    363. 

  363. 27                } else if (!columns.length) {
    364. 

  364. 0                    throw new QueryError("Invalid columns in import");
    365. 

  365.                  }
    366. 

  366.  
    367. 

  367. 27                var sliceSize = opts.commitEvery || opts.slice;
    368. 

  368. 27                if (sliceSize) {
    369. 

  369. 10                    var offset = 0;
    370. 

  370. 10                    var execute = function () {
    371. 

  371. 30                        if (offset >= values.length) {
    372. 

  372. 10                            ret.callback();
    373. 

  373. 10                            return;
    374. 

  374.                          }
    375. 

  375. 20                        this.db.transaction(opts, hitch(this, function () {
    376. 

  376. 20                            return when(this.multiInsertSql(columns, values.slice(offset, sliceSize + offset)).map(hitch(this, function (st) {
    377. 

  377. 28                                return this.executeDui(st);
    378. 

  378.                              })));
    379. 

  379.                          })).then(hitch(this, function () {
    380. 

  380. 20                            offset += sliceSize;
    381. 

  381. 20                            execute();
    382. 

  382.                          }), ret);
    383. 

  383.                      }.bind(this);
    384. 

  384. 10                    execute();
    385. 

  385.                  } else {
    386. 

  386. 17                    var statements = this.multiInsertSql(columns, values);
    387. 

  387. 17                    ret = this.db.transaction(function () {
    388. 

  388. 17                        return when(statements.map(function (st) {
    389. 

  389. 37                            return this.executeDui(st);
    390. 

  390.                          }.bind(this)));
    391. 

  391.                      }.bind(this));
    392. 

  392.                  }
    393. 

  393.              }
    394. 

  394. 29            return ret.classic(cb).promise();
    395. 

  395.          },
    396. 

  396.  
    397. 

  397.          /**
    398. 

  398.           * This is the recommended function to do the insert of multiple items into the
    399. 

  399.           * database. This acts as a proxy to the {@link patio.Dataset#import} method so
    400. 

  400.           * one can use an array of hashes rather than an array of columns and an array of values.
    401. 

  401.           * See {@link patio.Dataset#import} for more information regarding the method of inserting.
    402. 

  402.           * <p>
    403. 

  403.           *     <b>NOTE:</b>All hashes should have the same keys other wise some values could be missed</b>
    404. 

  404.           * </p>
    405. 

  405.           *
    406. 

  406.           * @example
    407. 

  407.           *
    408. 

  408.           * // INSERT INTO table (x) VALUES (1)
    409. 

  409.           * // INSERT INTO table (x) VALUES (2)
    410. 

  410.           * DB.from("table").multiInsert([{x : 1}, {x : 2}]).then(function(){
    411. 

  411.           *     //...do something
    412. 

  412.           * })
    413. 

  413.           *
    414. 

  414.           * //commit every 50 inserts
    415. 

  415.           * DB.from("table").multiInsert([{x : 1}, {x : 2},....], {commitEvery : 50}).then(function(){
    416. 

  416.           *     //...do something
    417. 

  417.           * });
    418. 

  418.           *
    419. 

  419.           * @param {Object[]} hashes an array of objects to insert into the database. The keys of
    420. 

  420.           * the first item in the array will be used to look up columns in all subsequent objects. If the
    421. 

  421.           * array is empty then the promise is resolved immediatly.
    422. 

  422.           *
    423. 

  423.           * @param {Object} opts See {@link patio.Dataset#import}.
    424. 

  424.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    425. 

  425.           *
    426. 

  426.           * @return {comb.Promise} See {@link patio.Dataset#import} for return functionality.
    427. 

  427.           */
    428. 

  428.          multiInsert:function (hashes, opts, cb) {
    429. 

  429. 18            if (isFunction(opts)) {
    430. 

  430. 5                cb = opts;
    431. 

  431. 5                opts = null;
    432. 

  432.              }
    433. 

  433. 18            opts = opts || {};
    434. 

  434. 18            hashes = hashes || [];
    435. 

  435. 18            var ret = new Promise();
    436. 

  436. 18            if (!hashes.length) {
    437. 

  437. 2                ret.callback();
    438. 

  438.              } else {
    439. 

  439. 16                var columns = Object.keys(hashes[0]);
    440. 

  440. 16                ret = this["import"](columns, hashes.map(function (h) {
    441. 

  441. 48                    return columns.map(function (c) {
    442. 

  442. 48                        return h[c];
    443. 

  443.                      });
    444. 

  444.                  }), opts, cb);
    445. 

  445.              }
    446. 

  446. 18            return ret.classic(cb).promise();
    447. 

  447.          },
    448. 

  448.  
    449. 

  449.          /**
    450. 

  450.           * Inserts values into the associated table. The returned value is generally
    451. 

  451.           * the value of the primary key for the inserted row, but that is adapter dependent.
    452. 

  452.           *
    453. 

  453.           * @example
    454. 

  454.           *
    455. 

  455.           * // INSERT INTO items DEFAULT VALUES
    456. 

  456.           * DB.from("items").insert()
    457. 

  457.           *
    458. 

  458.           * // INSERT INTO items DEFAULT VALUES
    459. 

  459.           * DB.from("items").insert({});
    460. 

  460.           *
    461. 

  461.           * // INSERT INTO items VALUES (1, 2, 3)
    462. 

  462.           * DB.from("items").insert([1,2,3]);
    463. 

  463.           *
    464. 

  464.           * // INSERT INTO items (a, b) VALUES (1, 2)
    465. 

  465.           * DB.from("items").insert(["a", "b"], [1,2]);
    466. 

  466.           *
    467. 

  467.           * // INSERT INTO items (a, b) VALUES (1, 2)
    468. 

  468.           * DB.from("items").insert({a : 1, b : 2});
    469. 

  469.           *
    470. 

  470.           * // INSERT INTO items SELECT * FROM old_items
    471. 

  471.           * DB.from("items").insert(DB.from("old_items"));
    472. 

  472.           *
    473. 

  473.           * // INSERT INTO items (a, b) SELECT * FROM old_items
    474. 

  474.           * DB.from("items").insert(["a", "b"], DB.from("old_items"));
    475. 

  475.           *
    476. 

  476.           *
    477. 

  477.           *
    478. 

  478.           * @param {patio.Dataset|patio.sql.LiteralString|Array|Object|patio.sql.BooleanExpression|...} values  values to
    479. 

  479.           *      insert into the database. The INSERT statement generated depends on the type.
    480. 

  480.           *      <ul>
    481. 

  481.           *          <li>Empty object| Or no arugments: then DEFAULT VALUES is used.</li>
    482. 

  482.           *          <li>Object: the keys will be used as the columns, and values will be the values inserted.</li>
    483. 

  483.           *          <li>Single {@link patio.Dataset} : an insert with subselect will be performed.</li>
    484. 

  484.           *          <li>Array with {@link patio.Dataset} : The array will be used for columns and a subselect will performed with the dataset for the values.</li>
    485. 

  485.           *          <li>{@link patio.sql.LiteralString} : the literal value will be used.</li>
    486. 

  486.           *          <li>Single Array : the values in the array will be used as the VALUES clause.</li>
    487. 

  487.           *          <li>Two Arrays: the first array is the columns the second array is the values.</li>
    488. 

  488.           *          <li>{@link patio.sql.BooleanExpression} : the expression will be used as the values.
    489. 

  489.           *          <li>An arbitrary number of arguments : the {@link patio.Dataset#literal} version of the values will be used</li>
    490. 

  490.           *      </ul>
    491. 

  491.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    492. 

  492.           *
    493. 

  493.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is typically resolved with the ID of the inserted row.
    494. 

  494.           */
    495. 

  495.          insert:function () {
    496. 

  496. 1317            var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    497. 

  497. 1317            var cb = isFunction(args[args.length - 1]) ? args.pop() : null;
    498. 

  498. 1317            return this.executeInsert(this.insertSql.apply(this, args)).classic(cb);
    499. 

  499.          },
    500. 

  500.  
    501. 

  501.          /**
    502. 

  502.           * @see patio.Dataset#insert
    503. 

  503.           */
    504. 

  504.          save:function () {
    505. 

  505. 0            return this.insert.apply(this, arguments);
    506. 

  506.          },
    507. 

  507.  
    508. 

  508.          /**
    509. 

  509.           * Inserts multiple values. If a block is given it is invoked for each
    510. 

  510.           * item in the given array before inserting it.  See {@link patio.Dataset#multiInsert} as
    511. 

  511.           * a possible faster version that inserts multiple records in one SQL statement.
    512. 

  512.           *
    513. 

  513.           * <b> Params see @link patio.Dataset#insert</b>
    514. 

  514.           *
    515. 

  515.           * @example
    516. 

  516.           *
    517. 

  517.           * DB.from("table").insertMultiple([{x : 1}, {x : 2}]);
    518. 

  518.           *      //=> INSERT INTO table (x) VALUES (1)
    519. 

  519.           *      //=> INSERT INTO table (x) VALUES (2)
    520. 

  520.           *
    521. 

  521.           * DB.from("table").insertMultiple([{x : 1}, {x : 2}], function(row){
    522. 

  522.           *      row.y = row.x * 2;
    523. 

  523.           * });
    524. 

  524.           *      //=> INSERT INTO table (x, y) VALUES (1, 2)
    525. 

  525.           *      //=> INSERT INTO table (x, y) VALUES (2, 4)
    526. 

  526.           *
    527. 

  527.           * @param array See {@link patio.Dataset#insert} for possible values.
    528. 

  528.           * @param {Function} [block] a function to be called before each item is inserted.
    529. 

  529.           * @param {Function} [cb] a function to be called when the aciton is complete
    530. 

  530.           *
    531. 

  531.           * @return {comb.PromiseList} a promiseList that should be resolved with the id of each item inserted
    532. 

  532.           *          in the order that was in the array.
    533. 

  533.           */
    534. 

  534.          insertMultiple:function (array, block, cb) {
    535. 

  535. 4            var promises, ret;
    536. 

  536. 4            if (block) {
    537. 

  537. 2                ret = when(array.map(function (i) {
    538. 

  538. 6                    return this.insert(block(i));
    539. 

  539.                  }, this));
    540. 

  540.              } else {
    541. 

  541. 2                ret = when(array.map(function (i) {
    542. 

  542. 8                    return this.insert(i);
    543. 

  543.                  }, this));
    544. 

  544.              }
    545. 

  545. 4            return ret.classic(cb).promise();
    546. 

  546.          },
    547. 

  547.  
    548. 

  548.          /**
    549. 

  549.           * @see patio.Dataset#insertMultiple
    550. 

  550.           */
    551. 

  551.          saveMultiple:function () {
    552. 

  552. 0            return this.insertMultiple.apply(this, arguments);
    553. 

  553.          },
    554. 

  554.  
    555. 

  555.          /**
    556. 

  556.           * Returns a promise that is resolved with the interval between minimum and maximum values
    557. 

  557.           * for the given column.
    558. 

  558.           *
    559. 

  559.           * @example
    560. 

  560.           *  // SELECT (max(id) - min(id)) FROM table LIMIT 1
    561. 

  561.           *   DB.from("table").interval("id").then(function(interval){
    562. 

  562.           *      //(e.g) interval === 6
    563. 

  563.           *   });
    564. 

  564.           *
    565. 

  565.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column to find the interval of.
    566. 

  566.           * @param {Function} [cb] a function to be called when the aciton is complete
    567. 

  567.           *
    568. 

  568.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that will be resolved with the interval between the min and max values
    569. 

  569.           * of the column.
    570. 

  570.           */
    571. 

  571.          interval:function (column, cb) {
    572. 

  572. 8            return this.__aggregateDataset().get(sql.max(column).minus(sql.min(column)), cb);
    573. 

  573.          },
    574. 

  574.  
    575. 

  575.          /**
    576. 

  576.           * Reverses the order and then runs first.  Note that this
    577. 

  577.           * will not necessarily give you the last record in the dataset,
    578. 

  578.           * unless you have an unambiguous order.
    579. 

  579.           *
    580. 

  580.           * @example
    581. 

  581.           *
    582. 

  582.           *  // SELECT * FROM table ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 1
    583. 

  583.           *  DB.from("table").order("id").last().then(function(lastItem){
    584. 

  584.           *      //...(e.g lastItem === {id : 10})
    585. 

  585.           *  });
    586. 

  586.           *
    587. 

  587.           *  // SELECT * FROM table ORDER BY id ASC LIMIT 2
    588. 

  588.           *   DB.from("table").order(sql.id.desc()).last(2).then(function(lastItems){
    589. 

  589.           *      //...(e.g lastItems === [{id : 1}, {id : 2});
    590. 

  590.           *  });
    591. 

  591.           *
    592. 

  592.           * @throws {patio.error.QueryError} If there is not currently an order for this dataset.
    593. 

  593.           *
    594. 

  594.           * @param {*} args See {@link patio.Dataset#first} for argument types.
    595. 

  595.           *
    596. 

  596.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that will be resolved with a single object or array depending on the
    597. 

  597.           * arguments provided.
    598. 

  598.           */
    599. 

  599.          last:function (args) {
    600. 

  600. 32            if (!this.__opts.order) {
    601. 

  601. 4                throw new QueryError("No order specified");
    602. 

  602.              }
    603. 

  603. 28            var ds = this.reverse();
    604. 

  604. 28            return ds.first.apply(ds, arguments);
    605. 

  605.          },
    606. 

  606.  
    607. 

  607.          /**
    608. 

  608.           * Maps column values for each record in the dataset (if a column name is
    609. 

  609.           * given).
    610. 

  610.           *
    611. 

  611.           * @example
    612. 

  612.           *
    613. 

  613.           * // SELECT * FROM table
    614. 

  614.           * DB.from("table").map("id").then(function(ids){
    615. 

  615.           *   // e.g. ids === [1, 2, 3, ...]
    616. 

  616.           * });
    617. 

  617.           *
    618. 

  618.           *  // SELECT * FROM table
    619. 

  619.           * DB.from("table").map(function(r){
    620. 

  620.           *      return r.id * 2;
    621. 

  621.           * }).then(function(ids){
    622. 

  622.           *     // e.g. ids === [2, 4, 6, ...]
    623. 

  623.           * });
    624. 

  624.           *
    625. 

  625.           * @param {Function|String} column if a string is provided then then it is assumed
    626. 

  626.           * to be the name of a column in that table and the value of the column for each row
    627. 

  627.           * will be returned. If column is a function then the return value of the function will
    628. 

  628.           * be used.
    629. 

  629.           * @param {Function} [cb] a function to be called when the aciton is complete
    630. 

  630.           *
    631. 

  631.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise resolved with the array of mapped values.
    632. 

  632.           */
    633. 

  633.          map:function (column, cb) {
    634. 

  634. 531            var ret = this.forEach();
    635. 

  635. 531            column && (ret = ret[isFunction(column) ? "map" : "pluck"](column))
    636. 

  636. 531            return ret.classic(cb).promise();
    637. 

  637.          },
    638. 

  638.  
    639. 

  639.          /**
    640. 

  640.           * Returns a promise resolved with  the maximum value for the given column.
    641. 

  641.           *
    642. 

  642.           * @example
    643. 

  643.           *
    644. 

  644.           * // SELECT max(id) FROM table LIMIT 1
    645. 

  645.           * DB.from("table").max("id").then(function(max){
    646. 

  646.           *   // e.g. max === 10.
    647. 

  647.           * });
    648. 

  648.           *
    649. 

  649.           *
    650. 

  650.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the column to find the maximum value for.
    651. 

  651.           * @param {Function} [cb] callback to invoke when action is done
    652. 

  652.           *
    653. 

  653.           * @return {*} the maximum value for the column.
    654. 

  654.           */
    655. 

  655.          max:function (column, cb) {
    656. 

  656. 4            return this.__aggregateDataset().get(sql.max(this.stringToIdentifier(column)), cb);
    657. 

  657.          },
    658. 

  658.  
    659. 

  659.          /**
    660. 

  660.           * Returns a promise resolved with  the minimum value for the given column.
    661. 

  661.           *
    662. 

  662.           * @example
    663. 

  663.           *
    664. 

  664.           * // SELECT min(id) FROM table LIMIT 1
    665. 

  665.           * DB.from("table").min("id").then(function(min){
    666. 

  666.           *   // e.g. max === 0.
    667. 

  667.           * });
    668. 

  668.           *
    669. 

  669.           *
    670. 

  670.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the column to find the minimum value for.
    671. 

  671.           * @param {Function} [cb] callback to invoke when action is done
    672. 

  672.           *
    673. 

  673.           * @return {*} the minimum value for the column.
    674. 

  674.           */
    675. 

  675.          min:function (column, cb) {
    676. 

  676. 4            return this.__aggregateDataset().get(sql.min(this.stringToIdentifier(column)), cb);
    677. 

  677.          },
    678. 

  678.  
    679. 

  679.          /**
    680. 

  680.           * Returns a promise resolved with  a range from the minimum and maximum values for the
    681. 

  681.           * given column.
    682. 

  682.           *
    683. 

  683.           * @example
    684. 

  684.           *  // SELECT max(id) AS v1, min(id) AS v2 FROM table LIMIT 1
    685. 

  685.           *  DB.from("table").range("id").then(function(min, max){
    686. 

  686.           *      //e.g min === 1 AND max === 10
    687. 

  687.           *  });
    688. 

  688.           *
    689. 

  689.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} column the column to find the min and max value for.
    690. 

  690.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    691. 

  691.           *
    692. 

  692.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved with the min and max value, as the first
    693. 

  693.           * and second args respectively.
    694. 

  694.           */
    695. 

  695.          range:function (column, cb) {
    696. 

  696. 8            var ret = new Promise();
    697. 

  697. 8            this.__aggregateDataset()
    698. 

  698.                  .select(sql.min(this.stringToIdentifier(column)).as("v1"), sql.max(this.stringToIdentifier(column)).as("v2"))
    699. 

  699.                  .first()
    700. 

  700.                  .then(function (r) {
    701. 

  701. 8                    ret.callback(r.v1, r.v2);
    702. 

  702.                  }, ret);
    703. 

  703. 8            return ret.classic(cb).promise();
    704. 

  704.          },
    705. 

  705.  
    706. 

  706.  
    707. 

  707.          /**
    708. 

  708.           * Selects the column given (either as an argument or as a callback), and
    709. 

  709.           * returns an array of all values of that column in the dataset.  If you
    710. 

  710.           * give a block argument that returns an array with multiple entries,
    711. 

  711.           * the contents of the resulting array are undefined.
    712. 

  712.           *
    713. 

  713.           *
    714. 

  714.           * @example
    715. 

  715.           *  // SELECT id FROM table
    716. 

  716.           *  DB.from("table").selectMap("id").then(function(selectMap){
    717. 

  717.           *   // e,g. selectMap === [3, 5, 8, 1, ...]
    718. 

  718.           * });
    719. 

  719.           *
    720. 

  720.           * // SELECT abs(id) FROM table
    721. 

  721.           * DB.from("table").selectMap(function(){
    722. 

  722.           *      return this.abs("id");
    723. 

  723.           * }).then(function(selectMap){
    724. 

  724.           *   //e.g selectMap === [3, 5, 8, 1, ...]
    725. 

  725.           * });
    726. 

  726.           *
    727. 

  727.           * @param {*} column  The column to return the values for.
    728. 

  728.           *      See {@link patio.Dataset#select} for valid column values.
    729. 

  729.           * @param {Function} [cb] a function to be called when the aciton is complete
    730. 

  730.           *
    731. 

  731.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise resolved with the array of mapped values.
    732. 

  732.           */
    733. 

  733.          selectMap:function (column, cb) {
    734. 

  734. 13            var ds = this.naked().ungraphed().select(column), col;
    735. 

  735. 13            return ds.map(function (r) {
    736. 

  736. 29                return r[col || (col = Object.keys(r)[0])];
    737. 

  737.              }, cb);
    738. 

  738.          },
    739. 

  739.  
    740. 

  740.          /**
    741. 

  741.           * The same as {@link patio.Dataset#selectMap}, but in addition orders the array by the column.
    742. 

  742.           *
    743. 

  743.           * @example
    744. 

  744.           * // SELECT id FROM table ORDER BY id
    745. 

  745.           * DB.from("table").selectOrderMap("id").then(function(mappedIds){
    746. 

  746.           *   //e.g. [1, 2, 3, 4, ...]
    747. 

  747.           * });
    748. 

  748.           *
    749. 

  749.           *  // SELECT abs(id) FROM table ORDER BY abs(id)
    750. 

  750.           *  DB.from("table").selectOrderMap(function(){
    751. 

  751.           *          return this.abs("id");
    752. 

  752.           *  }).then(function(mappedIds){
    753. 

  753.           *      //e.g. [1, 2, 3, 4, ...]
    754. 

  754.           *  });
    755. 

  755.           *
    756. 

  756.           * @param {*} column  The column to return the values for.
    757. 

  757.           *      See {@link patio.Dataset#select} for valid column values.
    758. 

  758.           *
    759. 

  759.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise resolved with the array of mapped values.
    760. 

  760.           */
    761. 

  761.          selectOrderMap:function (column, cb) {
    762. 

  762. 28            var col, ds = this.naked()
    763. 

  763.                  .ungraphed()
    764. 

  764.                  .select(column)
    765. 

  765.                  .order(isFunction(column) ? column : this._unaliasedIdentifier(column));
    766. 

  766. 28            return ds.map(function (r) {
    767. 

  767. 59                return r[col || (col = Object.keys(r)[0])];
    768. 

  768.              }, cb);
    769. 

  769.          },
    770. 

  770.  
    771. 

  771.          /**
    772. 

  772.           * Same as {@link patio.Dataset#singleRecord} but accepts arguments
    773. 

  773.           * to filter the dataset. See {@link patio.Dataset#filter} for argument types.
    774. 

  774.           *
    775. 

  775.           * <b>NOTE</b> If the last argument is a function that accepts arguments it is not assumed to
    776. 

  776.           * be a filter function but instead a callback.
    777. 

  777.           *
    778. 

  778.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise resolved with a single row from the database that matched the filter.
    779. 

  779.           */
    780. 

  780.          one:function () {
    781. 

  781. 1610            var args = comb(arguments).toArray(), cb;
    782. 

  782. 1610            var last = args[args.length - 1];
    783. 

  783. 1610            if (isFunction(last) && last.length > 0) {
    784. 

  784. 0                cb = args.pop();
    785. 

  785.              }
    786. 

  786. 1610            var ret = this;
    787. 

  787. 1610            if (args.length) {
    788. 

  788. 2                ret = ret.filter.apply(ret, args)
    789. 

  789.              }
    790. 

  790. 1610            return ret.singleRecord(cb);
    791. 

  791.          },
    792. 

  792.  
    793. 

  793.          /**
    794. 

  794.           * Returns a promise resolved with  the first record in the dataset, or null if the dataset
    795. 

  795.           * has no records. Users should probably use {@link patio.Dataset#first} instead of
    796. 

  796.           * this method.
    797. 

  797.           *
    798. 

  798.           * @example
    799. 

  799.           *
    800. 

  800.           * //'SELECT * FROM test LIMIT 1'
    801. 

  801.           * DB.from("test").singleRecord().then(function(r) {
    802. 

  802.           *     //e.g r === {id : 1, name : "firstName"}
    803. 

  803.           * });
    804. 

  804.           *
    805. 

  805.           * @param {Function} [cb] a function to be called when the aciton is complete
    806. 

  806.           *
    807. 

  807.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise resolved with the first record returned from the query.
    808. 

  808.           */
    809. 

  809.          singleRecord:function (cb) {
    810. 

  810. 1870            return this.mergeOptions({limit:1}).all().chain(function (r) {
    811. 

  811. 1867                return r && r.length ? r[0] : null;
    812. 

  812.              }).classic(cb).promise();
    813. 

  813.          },
    814. 

  814.  
    815. 

  815.          /**
    816. 

  816.           * Returns a promise resolved with the first value of the first record in the dataset.
    817. 

  817.           * Returns null if dataset is empty.  Users should generally use
    818. 

  818.           * {@link patio.Dataset#get} instead of this method.
    819. 

  819.           *
    820. 

  820.           * @example
    821. 

  821.           *
    822. 

  822.           * //'SELECT * FROM test LIMIT 1'
    823. 

  823.           * DB.from("test").singleValue().then(function(r) {
    824. 

  824.           *     //e.g r === 1
    825. 

  825.           * });
    826. 

  826.           *
    827. 

  827.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    828. 

  828.           *
    829. 

  829.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that will be resolved with the first value of the first row returned
    830. 

  830.           * from the dataset.
    831. 

  831.           *
    832. 

  832.           */
    833. 

  833.          singleValue:function (cb) {
    834. 

  834. 195            return this.naked().ungraphed().singleRecord().chain(function (r) {
    835. 

  835. 192                return r ? r[Object.keys(r)[0]] : null;
    836. 

  836.              }).classic(cb).promise();
    837. 

  837.          },
    838. 

  838.  
    839. 

  839.          /**
    840. 

  840.           * Returns a promise resolved the sum for the given column.
    841. 

  841.           *
    842. 

  842.           * @example
    843. 

  843.           *
    844. 

  844.           *  // SELECT sum(id) FROM table LIMIT 1
    845. 

  845.           * DB.from("table").sum("id").then(function(sum){
    846. 

  846.           *   // e.g sum === 55
    847. 

  847.           * });
    848. 

  848.           *
    849. 

  849.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier\patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} column
    850. 

  850.           * the column to find the sum of.
    851. 

  851.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    852. 

  852.           *
    853. 

  853.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise resolved with the sum of the column.
    854. 

  854.           */
    855. 

  855.          sum:function (column, cb) {
    856. 

  856. 4            return this.__aggregateDataset().get(sql.sum(this.stringToIdentifier(column)), cb);
    857. 

  857.          },
    858. 

  858.  
    859. 

  859.  
    860. 

  860.          /**
    861. 

  861.           * Returns a promise resolved with a string in CSV format containing the dataset records. By
    862. 

  862.           * default the CSV representation includes the column titles in the
    863. 

  863.           * first line. You can turn that off by passing false as the
    864. 

  864.           * includeColumnTitles argument.
    865. 

  865.           *
    866. 

  866.           * <p>
    867. 

  867.           *    <b>NOTE:</b> This does not use a CSV library or handle quoting of values in
    868. 

  868.           *          any way.  If any values in any of the rows could include commas or line
    869. 

  869.           *          endings, you shouldn't use this.
    870. 

  870.           * </p>
    871. 

  871.           *
    872. 

  872.           * @example
    873. 

  873.           *  // SELECT * FROM table
    874. 

  874.           *  DB.from("table").toCsv().then(function(csv){
    875. 

  875.           *      console.log(csv);
    876. 

  876.           *      //outputs
    877. 

  877.           *        id,name
    878. 

  878.           *        1,Jim
    879. 

  879.           *        2,Bob
    880. 

  880.           *  });
    881. 

  881.           *
    882. 

  882.           *    // SELECT * FROM table
    883. 

  883.           *  DB.from("table").toCsv(false).then(function(csv){
    884. 

  884.           *      console.log(csv);
    885. 

  885.           *      //outputs
    886. 

  886.           *        1,Jim
    887. 

  887.           *        2,Bob
    888. 

  888.           *  });
    889. 

  889.           *
    890. 

  890.           *  @param {Boolean} [includeColumnTitles=true] Set to false to prevent the printing of the column
    891. 

  891.           *  titles as the first line.
    892. 

  892.           *
    893. 

  893.           *  @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    894. 

  894.           *
    895. 

  895.           *  @return {comb.Promise} a promise that will be resolved with the CSV string of the results of the
    896. 

  896.           *  query.
    897. 

  897.           */
    898. 

  898.          toCsv:function (includeColumnTitles, cb) {
    899. 

  899. 4            var n = this.naked();
    900. 

  900. 4            if (isFunction(includeColumnTitles)) {
    901. 

  901. 1                cb = includeColumnTitles;
    902. 

  902. 1                includeColumnTitles = true;
    903. 

  903.              }
    904. 

  904. 4            includeColumnTitles = isBoolean(includeColumnTitles) ? includeColumnTitles : true;
    905. 

  905. 4            return n.columns.chain(function (cols) {
    906. 

  906. 4                var vals = [];
    907. 

  907. 4                if (includeColumnTitles) {
    908. 

  908. 2                    vals.push(cols.join(", "));
    909. 

  909.                  }
    910. 

  910. 4                return n.forEach(function (r) {
    911. 

  911. 12                    vals.push(cols.map(function (c) {
    912. 

  912. 36                        return r[c] || "";
    913. 

  913.                      }).join(", "));
    914. 

  914.                  }).chain(function () {
    915. 

  915. 4                        return vals.join("\r\n") + "\r\n";
    916. 

  916.                      });
    917. 

  917.              }.bind(this)).classic(cb).promise();
    918. 

  918.          },
    919. 

  919.  
    920. 

  920.          /**
    921. 

  921.           * Returns a promise resolved with a hash with keyColumn values as keys and valueColumn values as
    922. 

  922.           * values.  Similar to {@link patio.Dataset#toHash}, but only selects the two columns.
    923. 

  923.           *
    924. 

  924.           * @example
    925. 

  925.           *  // SELECT id, name FROM table
    926. 

  926.           *  DB.from("table").selectHash("id", "name").then(function(hash){
    927. 

  927.           *   // e.g {1 : 'a', 2 : 'b', ...}
    928. 

  928.           *  });
    929. 

  929.           *
    930. 

  930.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier\patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} keyColumn the column
    931. 

  931.           * to use as the key in the hash.
    932. 

  932.           *
    933. 

  933.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier\patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} valueColumn the column
    934. 

  934.           * to use as the value in the hash.
    935. 

  935.           *
    936. 

  936.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    937. 

  937.           *
    938. 

  938.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved with an array of hashes, that have the keyColumn
    939. 

  939.           * as the key and the valueColumn as the value.
    940. 

  940.           */
    941. 

  941.          selectHash:function (keyColumn, valueColumn, cb) {
    942. 

  942. 8            var map = {}, args = comb.argsToArray(arguments);
    943. 

  943. 8            cb = isFunction(args[args.length - 1]) ? args.pop() : null;
    944. 

  944. 8            var ret = new Promise();
    945. 

  945. 8            var k = this.__hashIdentifierToName(keyColumn),
    946. 

  946.                  v = this.__hashIdentifierToName(valueColumn);
    947. 

  947. 8            return this.select.apply(this, args).map(function (r) {
    948. 

  948. 16                map[r[k]] = v ? r[v] : r;
    949. 

  949.              }).chain(map).classic(cb).promise();
    950. 

  950.          },
    951. 

  951.  
    952. 

  952.          /**
    953. 

  953.           * Returns a promise resolved with a hash with one column used as key and another used as value.
    954. 

  954.           * If rows have duplicate values for the key column, the latter row(s)
    955. 

  955.           * will overwrite the value of the previous row(s). If the valueColumn
    956. 

  956.           * is not given or null, uses the entire hash as the value.
    957. 

  957.           *
    958. 

  958.           * @example
    959. 

  959.           *  // SELECT * FROM table
    960. 

  960.           *  DB.from("table").toHash("id", "name").then(function(hash){
    961. 

  961.           *    // {1 : 'Jim', 2 : 'Bob', ...}
    962. 

  962.           *  });
    963. 

  963.           *
    964. 

  964.           * // SELECT * FROM table
    965. 

  965.           * DB.from("table").toHash("id").then(function(hash){
    966. 

  966.           *   // {1 : {id : 1, name : 'Jim'}, 2 : {id : 2, name : 'Bob'}, ...}
    967. 

  967.           * });
    968. 

  968.           *
    969. 

  969.           *  @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier\patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} keyColumn the column
    970. 

  970.           *  to use as the key in the returned hash.
    971. 

  971.           *
    972. 

  972.           *  @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier\patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} [keyValue=null] the
    973. 

  973.           *  key of the column to use as the value in the hash
    974. 

  974.           *
    975. 

  975.           *  @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    976. 

  976.           *
    977. 

  977.           *  @return {comb.Promise} a promise that will be resolved with the resulting hash.
    978. 

  978.           */
    979. 

  979.          toHash:function (keyColumn, valueColumn, cb) {
    980. 

  980. 8            var ret = new Promise(), map = {};
    981. 

  981. 8            if (isFunction(valueColumn)) {
    982. 

  982. 2                cb = valueColumn;
    983. 

  983. 2                valueColumn = null;
    984. 

  984.              }
    985. 

  985. 8            var k = this.__hashIdentifierToName(keyColumn), v = this.__hashIdentifierToName(valueColumn);
    986. 

  986. 8            var mapPromise = this.map(function (r) {
    987. 

  987. 24                map[r[k]] = v ? r[v] : r;
    988. 

  988.              });
    989. 

  989. 8            mapPromise.then(function () {
    990. 

  990. 8                ret.callback(map);
    991. 

  991.              }, ret);
    992. 

  992. 8            return ret.classic(cb).promise();
    993. 

  993.          },
    994. 

  994.  
    995. 

  995.          /**
    996. 

  996.           * Truncates the dataset.  Returns a promise that is resolved once truncation is complete.
    997. 

  997.           *
    998. 

  998.           * @example
    999. 

  999.           *
    1000. 

  1000.           * // TRUNCATE table
    1001. 

  1001.           * DB.from("table").truncate().then(function(){
    1002. 

  1002.           *     //...do something
    1003. 

  1003.           * });
    1004. 

  1004.           *
    1005. 

  1005.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    1006. 

  1006.           *
    1007. 

  1007.           * @return {comb.Promise} a promise that is resolved once truncation is complete.
    1008. 

  1008.           */
    1009. 

  1009.          truncate:function (cb) {
    1010. 

  1010. 28            return this.executeDdl(this.truncateSql).classic(cb);
    1011. 

  1011.          },
    1012. 

  1012.  
    1013. 

  1013.          /**
    1014. 

  1014.           * Updates values for the dataset.  The returned promise is resolved with a value that is generally the
    1015. 

  1015.           * number of rows updated, but that is adapter dependent.
    1016. 

  1016.           *
    1017. 

  1017.           * @example
    1018. 

  1018.           * // UPDATE table SET x = NULL
    1019. 

  1019.           *  DB.from("table").update({x : null}).then(function(numRowsUpdated){
    1020. 

  1020.           *      //e.g. numRowsUpdated === 10
    1021. 

  1021.           *  });
    1022. 

  1022.           *
    1023. 

  1023.           * // UPDATE table SET x = (x + 1), y = 0
    1024. 

  1024.           * DB.from("table").update({ x : sql.x.plus(1), y : 0}).then(function(numRowsUpdated){
    1025. 

  1025.           *   // e.g. numRowsUpdated === 10
    1026. 

  1026.           * });
    1027. 

  1027.           *
    1028. 

  1028.           * @param {Object} values See {@link patio.Dataset#updateSql} for parameter types.
    1029. 

  1029.           * @param {Function} [cb] the callback to invoke when the action is done.
    1030. 

  1030.           *
    1031. 

  1031.           * @return {comb.Promise}  a promise that is generally resolved with the
    1032. 

  1032.           * number of rows updated, but that is adapter dependent.
    1033. 

  1033.           */
    1034. 

  1034.          update:function (values, cb) {
    1035. 

  1035. 204            return this.executeDui(this.updateSql(values)).classic(cb);
    1036. 

  1036.          },
    1037. 

  1037.  
    1038. 

  1038.          /**
    1039. 

  1039.           * @see patio.Dataset#set
    1040. 

  1040.           */
    1041. 

  1041.          set:function () {
    1042. 

  1042. 1            this.update.apply(this, arguments);
    1043. 

  1043.          },
    1044. 

  1044.  
    1045. 

  1045.          /**
    1046. 

  1046.           * @private
    1047. 

  1047.           * Execute the given select SQL on the database using execute. Use the
    1048. 

  1048.           * readOnly server unless a specific server is set.
    1049. 

  1049.           */
    1050. 

  1050.          execute:function (sql, opts) {
    1051. 

  1051. 3147            return this.db.execute(sql, merge({server:this.__opts.server || "readOnly"}, opts || {}));
    1052. 

  1052.          },
    1053. 

  1053.  
    1054. 

  1054.          /**
    1055. 

  1055.           * @private
    1056. 

  1056.           * Execute the given SQL on the database using {@link patio.Database#executeDdl}.
    1057. 

  1057.           */
    1058. 

  1058.          executeDdl:function (sql, opts) {
    1059. 

  1059. 28            return this.db.executeDdl(sql, this.__defaultServerOpts(opts || {}));
    1060. 

  1060.          },
    1061. 

  1061.  
    1062. 

  1062.          /**
    1063. 

  1063.           * @private
    1064. 

  1064.           * Execute the given SQL on the database using {@link patio.Database#executeDui}.
    1065. 

  1065.           */
    1066. 

  1066.          executeDui:function (sql, opts) {
    1067. 

  1067. 1252            return this.db.executeDui(sql, this.__defaultServerOpts(opts || {}));
    1068. 

  1068.          },
    1069. 

  1069.  
    1070. 

  1070.          /**
    1071. 

  1071.           * @private
    1072. 

  1072.           * Execute the given SQL on the database using {@link patio.Database#executeInsert}.
    1073. 

  1073.           */
    1074. 

  1074.          executeInsert:function (sql, opts) {
    1075. 

  1075. 1317            return this.db.executeInsert(sql, this.__defaultServerOpts(opts || {}));
    1076. 

  1076.          },
    1077. 

  1077.  
    1078. 

  1078.          /**
    1079. 

  1079.           * This is run inside {@link patio.Dataset#all}, after all of the records have been loaded
    1080. 

  1080.           * via {@link patio.Dataset#forEach}, but before any block passed to all is called.  It is called with
    1081. 

  1081.           * a single argument, an array of all returned records.  Does nothing by
    1082. 

  1082.           * default.
    1083. 

  1083.           */
    1084. 

  1084.          postLoad:function (allRecords) {
    1085. 

  1085. 2728            return allRecords;
    1086. 

  1086.          },
    1087. 

  1087.  
    1088. 

  1088.          /**
    1089. 

  1089.           * @private
    1090. 

  1090.           *
    1091. 

  1091.           * Clone of this dataset usable in aggregate operations.  Does
    1092. 

  1092.           * a {@link patio.Dataset#fromSelf} if dataset contains any parameters that would
    1093. 

  1093.           * affect normal aggregation, or just removes an existing
    1094. 

  1094.           * order if not.
    1095. 

  1095.           */
    1096. 

  1096.          __aggregateDataset:function () {
    1097. 

  1097. 143            return this._optionsOverlap(this._static.COUNT_FROM_SELF_OPTS) ? this.fromSelf() : this.unordered();
    1098. 

  1098.          },
    1099. 

  1099.  
    1100. 

  1100.          /**
    1101. 

  1101.           * @private
    1102. 

  1102.           * Set the server to use to "default" unless it is already set in the passed opts
    1103. 

  1103.           */
    1104. 

  1104.          __defaultServerOpts:function (opts) {
    1105. 

  1105. 2597            return merge({server:this.__opts.server || "default"}, opts || {});
    1106. 

  1106.          },
    1107. 

  1107.  
    1108. 

  1108.          /**
    1109. 

  1109.           * @private
    1110. 

  1110.           *
    1111. 

  1111.           * Returns the string version of the identifier.
    1112. 

  1112.           *
    1113. 

  1113.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier\patio.sql.QualifiedIdentifier|patio.sql.AliasedExpression} identifier
    1114. 

  1114.           *      identifier to resolve to a string.
    1115. 

  1115.           * @return {String} the string version of the identifier.
    1116. 

  1116.           */
    1117. 

  1117.          __hashIdentifierToName:function (identifier) {
    1118. 

  1118. 60            return isString(identifier) ? this.__hashIdentifierToName(this.stringToIdentifier(identifier)) :
    1119. 

  1119.                  isInstanceOf(identifier, Identifier) ? identifier.value :
    1120. 

  1120.                      isInstanceOf(identifier, QualifiedIdentifier) ? identifier.column :
    1121. 

  1121.                          isInstanceOf(identifier, AliasedExpression) ? identifier.alias : identifier;
    1122. 

  1122.          },
    1123. 

  1123.  
    1124. 

  1124.          /**@ignore*/
    1125. 

  1125.          getters:{
    1126. 

  1126.              /**@lends patio.Dataset.prototype*/
    1127. 

  1127.              /**
    1128. 

  1128.               * @field
    1129. 

  1129.               * @type {comb.Promise}
    1130. 

  1130.               *
    1131. 

  1131.               *  Returns a promise that is resolved with the columns in the result set in order as an array of strings.
    1132. 

  1132.               * If the columns are currently cached, then the promise is immediately resolved with the cached value. Otherwise,
    1133. 

  1133.               * a SELECT query is performed to retrieve a single row in order to get the columns.
    1134. 

  1134.               *
    1135. 

  1135.               * If you are looking for all columns for a single table and maybe some information about
    1136. 

  1136.               * each column (e.g. database type), see {@link patio.Database#schema}.
    1137. 

  1137.               *
    1138. 

  1138.               * <pre class="code">
    1139. 

  1139.               *  DB.from("table").columns.then(function(columns){
    1140. 

  1140.               *        // => ["id", "name"]
    1141. 

  1141.               *   });
    1142. 

  1142.               * </pre>
    1143. 

  1143.               **/
    1144. 

  1144.              columns:function () {
    1145. 

  1145. 21                if (this.__columns) {
    1146. 

  1146. 8                    return asyncArray(this.__columns);
    1147. 

  1147.                  } else {
    1148. 

  1148. 13                    var ds = this.unfiltered().unordered().mergeOptions({distinct:null, limit:1});
    1149. 

  1149. 13                    return asyncArray(ds.forEach().chain(function () {
    1150. 

  1150. 13                        return (this.__columns = ds.__columns || []);
    1151. 

  1151.                      }.bind(this)));
    1152. 

  1152.                  }
    1153. 

  1153.              }
    1154. 

  1154.          }
    1155. 

  1155.      },
    1156. 

  1156.  
    1157. 

  1157.      "static":{
    1158. 

  1158.  
    1159. 

  1159.          /**@lends patio.Dataset*/
    1160. 

  1160.  
    1161. 

  1161.          /**
    1162. 

  1162.           * List of action methods avaiable on the dataset.
    1163. 

  1163.           *
    1164. 

  1164.           * @type String[]
    1165. 

  1165.           * @default ['all', 'one', 'avg', 'count', 'columns', 'remove', 'forEach', 'isEmpty', 'first',
    1166. 

  1166.           *          'get', 'import', 'insert', 'save', 'insertMultiple', 'saveMultiple', 'interval', 'last',
    1167. 

  1167.           *          'map', 'max', 'min', 'multiInsert', 'range', 'selectHash', 'selectMap', 'selectOrderMap', 'set',
    1168. 

  1168.           *          'singleRecord', 'singleValue', 'sum', 'toCsv', 'toHash', 'truncate', 'update']
    1169. 

  1169.           */
    1170. 

  1170.          ACTION_METHODS:['all', 'one', 'avg', 'count', 'columns', 'remove', 'forEach', 'isEmpty', 'first',
    1171. 

  1171.              'get', 'import', 'insert', 'save', 'insertMultiple', 'saveMultiple', 'interval', 'last',
    1172. 

  1172.              'map', 'max', 'min', 'multiInsert', 'range', 'selectHash', 'selectMap', 'selectOrderMap', 'set',
    1173. 

  1173.              'singleRecord', 'singleValue', 'sum', 'toCsv', 'toHash', 'truncate', 'update'],
    1174. 

  1174.  
    1175. 

  1175.          /**
    1176. 

  1176.           * List of options that can interfere with the aggregation of a {@link patio.Dataset}
    1177. 

  1177.           * @type String[]
    1178. 

  1178.           * @default ["distinct", "group", "sql", "limit", "compounds"]
    1179. 

  1179.           */
    1180. 

  1180.          COUNT_FROM_SELF_OPTS:["distinct", "group", "sql", "limit", "compounds"]
    1181. 

  1181.      }
    1182. 

  1182.  }).as(module);
    1183. 

  1183.

  20. 1exports.AssociationPlugin = comb.define(null, {
    21. 

  21.  
    22. 

  22.      instance:{
    23. 

  23.          /**@lends patio.Model.prototype*/
    24. 

  24.  
    25. 

  25.          /**
    26. 

  26.           * @ignore
    27. 

  27.           * <p>Plugin to expose association capability.</p>
    28. 

  28.           *
    29. 

  29.           * The associations exposed include
    30. 

  30.           *
    31. 

  31.           * <ul>
    32. 

  32.           *     <li><b>oneToMany</b> - Foreign key in associated model's table points to this
    33. 

  33.           *         model's primary key.   Each current model object can be associated with
    34. 

  34.           *         more than one associated model objects.  Each associated model object
    35. 

  35.           *         can be associated with only one current model object.</li>
    36. 

  36.           *     <li><b>manyToOne</b> - Foreign key in current model's table points to
    37. 

  37.           *         associated model's primary key.  Each associated model object can
    38. 

  38.           *         be associated with more than one current model objects.  Each current
    39. 

  39.           *         model object can be associated with only one associated model object.</li>
    40. 

  40.           *     <li><b>oneToOne</b> - Similar to one_to_many in terms of foreign keys, but
    41. 

  41.           *         only one object is associated to the current object through the
    42. 

  42.           *         association.  The methods created are similar to many_to_one, except
    43. 

  43.           *         that the one_to_one setter method saves the passed object./li>
    44. 

  44.           *     <li><b>manyToMany</b> - A join table is used that has a foreign key that points
    45. 

  45.           *         to this model's primary key and a foreign key that points to the
    46. 

  46.           *         associated model's primary key.  Each current model object can be
    47. 

  47.           *         associated with many associated model objects, and each associated
    48. 

  48.           *         model object can be associated with many current model objects./li>
    49. 

  49.           * </ul>
    50. 

  50.           *
    51. 

  51.           * @constructs
    52. 

  52.           *
    53. 

  53.           */
    54. 

  54.          constructor:function () {
    55. 

  55. 3189            if (comb.isUndefinedOrNull(this.__associations)) {
    56. 

  56. 3061                this.__associations = {};
    57. 

  57.              }
    58. 

  58. 3189            this._super(arguments);
    59. 

  59.          },
    60. 

  60.  
    61. 

  61.          reload:function () {

    63. 

  63. 15            return this._super(arguments);
    64. 

  64.          },
    65.

    123.

  127.          /**

  128.           *Creates a ONE_TO_MANY association.

    142.

    143.

    145.

    146.

    147.

    148.

    149. 

  149.           *              this._super("arguments");
    150. 

  150.           *              this.manyToOne("biologicalFather");
    151.

    152. 

  152.           *     }
    153. 

  153.           * });
    154. 

  154.           *
    155. 

  155.           */
    156. 

  156.          oneToMany:function (name, options, filter) {
    157. 

  157. 13            return this.associate(this.ONE_TO_MANY, name, options, filter);
    158. 

  158.          },
    159. 

  159.  
    160. 

  160.          /**
    161. 

  161.           * Creates a MANY_TO_ONE association.
    162. 

  162.           * See {@link patio.plugins.AssociationPlugin.oneToMany}.
    163. 

  163.           * See {@link patio.plugins.AssociationPlugin.associate}
    164.

  167.          },
    168. 

  168.  
    169. 

  169.          /**

  183.           *
