    190. 

  190.           *      }
    191. 

  191.           * });
    192. 

  192.           */
    193. 

  193.          oneToOne:function (name, options, filter) {
    194. 

  194. 8            return this.associate(this.ONE_TO_ONE, name, options, filter);
    195. 

  195.          },
    196. 

  196.  
    197. 

  197.          /**
    198. 

  198.           * Creates a MANY_TO_MANY relationship between models.
    199. 

  199.           * See {@link patio.plugins.AssociationPlugin.associate} for options.
    200. 

  200.           *
    201. 

  201.           * @example
    202. 

  202.           *
    203. 

  203.           *  patio.addModel("class", {
    204. 

  204.           *      static:{
    205. 

  205.           *          init:function(){
    206. 

  206.           *              this._super("arguments");
    207. 

  207.           *              this.manyToMany("students", {fetchType:this.fetchType.EAGER, order : [sql.firstName.desc(), sql.lastName.desc()]});
    208. 

  208.           *          }
    209. 

  209.           *      }
    210. 

  210.           * });
    211. 

  211.           * patio.addModel("student", {
    212. 

  212.           *      instance:{
    213. 

  213.           *          enroll:function(clas){
    214. 

  214.           *              if (comb.isArray(clas)) {
    215. 

  215.           *                  return this.addClasses(clas);
    216. 

  216.           *              } else {
    217. 

  217.           *                  return this.addClass(clas);
    218. 

  218.           *              }
    219. 

  219.           *          }
    220. 

  220.           *      },
    221. 

  221.           *      static:{
    222. 

  222.           *          init:function(){
    223. 

  223.           *              this._super("arguments");
    224. 

  224.           *              this.manyToMany("classes", {fetchType:this.fetchType.EAGER, order : sql.name.desc()});
    225. 

  225.           *          }
    226. 

  226.           *      }
    227. 

  227.           });
    228. 

  228.           *
    229. 

  229.           */
    230. 

  230.          manyToMany:function (name, options, filter) {
    231. 

  231. 18            return this.associate(this.MANY_TO_MANY, name, options, filter);
    232. 

  232.          },
    233. 

  233.  
    234. 

  234.          /**
    235. 

  235.           * Associates a related model with the current model. The following types are
    236. 

  236.           * supported:
    237. 

  237.           *
    238. 

  238.           * <ul>
    239. 

  239.           *     <li><b>oneToMany</b> - Foreign key in associated model's table points to this
    240. 

  240.           *         model's primary key.   Each current model object can be associated with
    241. 

  241.           *         more than one associated model objects.  Each associated model object
    242. 

  242.           *         can be associated with only one current model object.</li>
    243. 

  243.           *     <li><b>manyToOne</b> - Foreign key in current model's table points to
    244. 

  244.           *         associated model's primary key.  Each associated model object can
    245. 

  245.           *         be associated with more than one current model objects.  Each current
    246. 

  246.           *         model object can be associated with only one associated model object.</li>
    247. 

  247.           *     <li><b>oneToOne</b> - Similar to one_to_many in terms of foreign keys, but
    248. 

  248.           *         only one object is associated to the current object through the
    249. 

  249.           *         association.  The methods created are similar to many_to_one, except
    250. 

  250.           *         that the one_to_one setter method saves the passed object./li>
    251. 

  251.           *     <li><b>manyToMany</b> - A join table is used that has a foreign key that points
    252. 

  252.           *         to this model's primary key and a foreign key that points to the
    253. 

  253.           *         associated model's primary key.  Each current model object can be
    254. 

  254.           *         associated with many associated model objects, and each associated
    255. 

  255.           *         model object can be associated with many current model objects.</li>
    256. 

  256.           * </ul>
    257. 

  257.           *
    258. 

  258.           * @param {patio.Model.ONE_TO_ONE|patio.Model.ONE_TO_MANY|patio.Model.MANY_TO_ONE|patio.Model.MANY_TO_MANY} type the
    259. 

  259.           *          type of association that is to be created.
    260. 

  260.           * @param {String} name the name of the association, the name specified will be exposed as a property on instances
    261. 

  261.           * of the model.
    262. 

  262.           @param {Object} [options] additional options.
    263. 

  263.           * The following options can be supplied:
    264. 

  264.           * <ul>
    265. 

  265.           *   <li><b>model</b> - The associated class or its name. If not  given, uses the association's name,
    266. 

  266.           *    which is singularized unless the type is MANY_TO_ONE or ONE_TO_ONE</li>
    267. 

  267.           *   <li><b>query</b> - The conditions to use to filter the association, can be any argument passed
    268. 

  268.           *   to {@link patio.Dataset#filter}.</li>
    269. 

  269.           *   <li><b>dataset</b> - A function that is called in the scope of the model and called with the model as the
    270. 

  270.           *     first argument. The function must return a dataset that can be used as the base for all dataset
    271. 

  271.           *     operations.<b>NOTE:</b>The dataset returned will have all options applied to it.</li>
    272. 

  272.           *   <li><b>distinct</b> Use the DISTINCT clause when selecting associated objects.
    273. 

  273.           *   See {@link patio.Dataset#distinct}.</li>
    274. 

  274.           *   <li><b>limit</b> : Limit the number of records to the provided value.  Use
    275. 

  275.           *     an array with two elements for the value to specify a limit (first element) and an
    276. 

  276.           *     offset (second element). See {@link patio.Dataset#limit}.</li>
    277. 

  277.           *   <li><b>order</b> : the column/s order the association dataset by.  Can be a
    278. 

  278.           *     one or more columns.
    279. 

  279.           *     See {@link patio.Dataset#order}.</li>
    280. 

  280.           *   <li><b>readOnly</b> : Do not add a setter method (for MANY_TO_ONE or ONE_TO_ONE associations),
    281. 

  281.           *     or add/remove/removeAll methods (for ONE_TO_MANY and MANY_TO_MANY associations).</li>
    282. 

  282.           *   <li><b>select</b> : the columns to select.  Defaults to the associated class's
    283. 

  283.           *     tableName.* in a MANY_TO_MANY association, which means it doesn't include the attributes from the
    284. 

  284.           *     join table.  If you want to include the join table attributes, you can
    285. 

  285.           *     use this option, but beware that the join table attributes can clash with
    286. 

  286.           *     attributes from the model table, so you should alias any attributes that have
    287. 

  287.           *     the same name in both the join table and the associated table.</li>
    288. 

  288.           *   </ul>
    289. 

  289.           *   ManyToOne additional options:
    290. 

  290.           *   <ul>
    291. 

  291.           *      <li><b>key</b> : foreignKey in current model's table that references
    292. 

  292.           *          associated model's primary key.  Defaults to : "{tableName}Id".  Can use an
    293. 

  293.           *          array of strings for a composite key association.</li>
    294. 

  294.           *       <li><b>primaryKey</b> : column in the associated table that the <b>key</b> option references.
    295. 

  295.           *              Defaults to the primary key of the associated table. Can use an
    296. 

  296.           *              array of strings for a composite key association.</li>
    297. 

  297.           *   </ul>
    298. 

  298.           * OneToMany and OneToOne additional options:
    299. 

  299.           * <ul>
    300. 

  300.           *      <li><b>key</b> : foreign key in associated model's table that references
    301. 

  301.           *             current model's primary key, as a string.  Defaults to
    302. 

  302.           *             "{thisTableName}Id".  Can use an array of columns for a composite key association.</li>
    303. 

  303.           *      <li><b>primaryKey</b> : column in the current table that <b>key</b> option references.
    304. 

  304.           *             Defaults to primary key of the current table. Can use an array of strings for a
    305. 

  305.           *             composite key association.</li>
    306. 

  306.           * </ul>
    307. 

  307.           *
    308. 

  308.           * ManyToMany additional options:
    309. 

  309.           *   <ul>
    310. 

  310.           *      <li><b>joinTable</b> : name of table that includes the foreign keys to both
    311. 

  311.           *          the current model and the associated model.  Defaults to the name
    312. 

  312.           *          of current model and name of associated model, pluralized,
    313. 

  313.           *          sorted, and joined with '' and camelized.
    314. 

  314.           *      <li><b>leftKey</b> : foreign key in join table that points to current model's
    315. 

  315.           *          primary key. Defaults to :"{tableName}Id".
    316. 

  316.           *          Can use an array of strings for a composite key association.
    317. 

  317.           *      <li><b>leftPrimaryKey</b> - column in current table that <b>leftKey</b> points to.
    318. 

  318.           *          Defaults to primary key of current table.  Can use an array of strings for a
    319. 

  319.           *          composite key association.
    320. 

  320.           *      <li><b>rightKey</b> : foreign key in join table that points to associated
    321. 

  321.           *          model's primary key.  Defaults to Defaults to :"{associatedTableName}Id".
    322. 

  322.           *          Can use an array of strings for a composite key association.
    323. 

  323.           *      <li><b>rightPrimaryKey</b> : column in associated table that <b>rightKey</b> points to.
    324. 

  324.           *          Defaults to primary key of the associated table.  Can use an
    325. 

  325.           *          array of strings for a composite key association.
    326. 

  326.           *  </ul>
    327. 

  327.           * @param {Function} [filter] optional function to filter the dataset after all other options have been applied.
    328. 

  328.           *
    329. 

  329.           */
    330. 

  330.          associate:function (type, name, options, filter) {
    331. 

  331. 55            if (comb.isFunction(options)) {
    332. 

  332. 1                filter = options;
    333. 

  333. 1                options = {};
    334. 

  334.              }
    335. 

  335. 55            this.__associations = this.__associations || {manyToMany:{}, oneToMany:{}, manyToOne:{}, oneToOne:{}};
    336. 

  336. 55            var assoc = new associations[type](comb.merge({model:name}, options), this.patio, filter);
    337. 

  337. 55            assoc.inject(this, name);
    338. 

  338. 55            this.__associations[type][name] = assoc;
    339. 

  339. 55            this.emit("associate", type, this);
    340. 

  340. 55            return this;
    341. 

  341.          },
    342. 

  342.  
    343. 

  343.          sync:function (cb) {
    344. 

  344. 4026            if (!this.synced && this.hasAssociations) {
    345. 

  345. 47                return this._super().chain(function () {
    346. 

  346. 47                    var associations = this.__associations;
    347. 

  347. 47                    return asyncArray(Object.keys(associations)).map(function (type) {
    348. 

  348. 188                        var types = associations[type];
    349. 

  349. 188                        return asyncArray(Object.keys(types)).map(function (name) {
    350. 

  350. 55                            return types[name].model.sync();
    351. 

  351.                          }, 1);
    352. 

  352.                      }, 1);
    353. 

  353.  
    354. 

  354.                  }.bind(this));
    355. 

  355.              } else {
    356. 

  356. 3979                return this._super(arguments);
    357. 

  357.              }
    358. 

  358.          },
    359. 

  359.  
    360. 

  360.          __isReciprocalAssociation:function (assoc, pAssoc) {
    361. 

  361. 1312            var keys = assoc._getAssociationKey(), leftKey = keys[0], rightKey = keys[1];
    362. 

  362. 1312            var pKeys = pAssoc._getAssociationKey(), pLeftKey = pKeys[0], pRightKey = pKeys[1];
    363. 

  363. 1312            return leftKey.every(function (k, i) {
    364. 

  364. 1312                return pRightKey[i] === k;
    365. 

  365.              }) && rightKey.every(function (k, i) {
    366. 

  366. 1312                return pLeftKey[i] === k;
    367. 

  367.              }) && assoc.parent === pAssoc.model;
    368. 

  368.          },
    369. 

  369.  
    370. 

  370.          _findAssociation:function (assoc) {
    371. 

  371. 1312            var ret = null;
    372. 

  372. 1312            if (!comb.isEmpty(this.__associations)) {
    373. 

  373. 1312                var type = assoc.type, recipTypes = RECIPROCAL_ASSOC[type];
    374. 

  374. 1312                for (var i in recipTypes) {
    375. 

  375. 1331                    var recipType = recipTypes[i];
    376. 

  376. 1331                    var potentialAssociations = this.__associations[recipType];
    377. 

  377. 1331                    var found = false;
    378. 

  378. 1331                    for (var i in potentialAssociations) {
    379. 

  379. 1312                        var pAssoc = potentialAssociations[i];
    380. 

  380. 1312                        if (this.__isReciprocalAssociation(assoc, pAssoc)) {
    381. 

  381. 1299                            ret = [i, pAssoc], found = true;
    382. 

  382. 1299                            break;
    383. 

  383.                          }
    384. 

  384.                      }
    385. 

  385. 1331                    if (found) {
    386. 

  386. 1299                        break;
    387. 

  387.                      }
    388. 

  388.  
    389. 

  389.                  }
    390. 

  390.              }
    391. 

  391. 1312            return ret;
    392. 

  392.          },
    393. 

  393.  
    394. 

  394.          _clearAssociationsForType:function (type, clazz, model) {
    395. 

  395. 0            this._findAssociationsForType(type, clazz).forEach(function (assoc) {
    396. 

  396. 0                assoc._clearAssociations(model);

  400.          _reloadAssociationsForType:function (type, clazz, model) {

  404. 121            return (pl.length ? new PromiseList(pl) : new Promise().callback()).promise();

    406. 

  406.  
    407. 

  407.          _findAssociationsForType:function (type, clazz) {
    408. 

  408. 121            var associations = this.__associations[type], ret = [];
    409. 

  409. 121            for (var i in associations) {
    410. 

  410. 243                var assoc = associations[i];

  411. 243                if (assoc.model == clazz) {
    412. 

  412. 243                    ret.push(assoc);
    413. 

  413.                  }

    415. 

  415. 121            return ret;
    416.

  271. 1function shouldValidate(opts, def) {
    272. 

  272. 111    opts = opts || {};
    273. 

  273. 111    return combIsBoolean(opts.validate) ? opts.validate : def;
    274. 

  274.  }
    275. 

  275.  
    276. 

  276. 1function validateHook(prop, next, opts) {
    277. 

  277. 111    if (shouldValidate(opts, prop) && !this.isValid()) {
    278. 

  278. 44        next(flatten(toArray(this.errors).map(function (entry) {
    279. 

  279. 62            return entry[1].map(function (err) {
    280. 

  280. 47                return new Error(err);
    281. 

  281.              });
    282. 

  282.          })));
    283. 

  283.      } else {
    284. 

  284. 67        next();
    285. 

  285.      }
    286. 

  286.  }
    287. 

  287.  
    288. 

  288. 1define(null, {
    289. 

  289.  
    290. 

  290.      instance:{
    291. 

  291.  
    292. 

  292.          /**
    293. 

  293.           * A validation plugin for patio models. This plugin adds a <code>validate</code> method to each {@link patio.Model}
    294. 

  294.           * class that adds it as a plugin. This plugin does not include most typecast checks as <code>patio</code> already checks
    295. 

  295.           * types upon column assignment.
    296. 

  296.           *
    297. 

  297.           * To do single col validation
    298. 

  298.           * {@code
    299. 

  299.           *
    300. 

  300.           * var Model = patio.addModel("validator", {
    301. 

  301.           *      plugins:[ValidatorPlugin]
    302. 

  302.           * });
    303. 

  303.           * //this ensures column assignment
    304. 

  304.           * Model.validate("col1").isNotNull().isAlphaNumeric().hasLength(1, 10);
    305. 

  305.           * //col2 does not have to be assigned but if it is it must match /hello/ig.
    306. 

  306.           * Model.validate("col2").like(/hello/ig);
    307. 

  307.           * //Ensures that the emailAddress column is a valid email address.
    308. 

  308.           * Model.validate("emailAddress").isEmailAddress();
    309. 

  309.           * }
    310. 

  310.           *
    311. 

  311.           * Or you can do a mass validation through a callback.
    312. 

  312.           * {@code
    313. 

  313.           *
    314. 

  314.           * var Model = patio.addModel("validator", {
    315. 

  315.           *      plugins:[ValidatorPlugin]
    316. 

  316.           * });
    317. 

  317.           * Model.validate(function(validate){
    318. 

  318.           *      //this ensures column assignment
    319. 

  319.           *      validate("col1").isNotNull().isAlphaNumeric().hasLength(1, 10);
    320. 

  320.           *      //col2 does not have to be assigned but if it is it must match /hello/ig.
    321. 

  321.           *      validate("col2").isLike(/hello/ig);
    322. 

  322.           *      //Ensures that the emailAddress column is a valid email address.
    323. 

  323.           *      validate("emailAddress").isEmail();
    324. 

  324.           * });
    325. 

  325.           * }
    326. 

  326.           *
    327. 

  327.           * To check if a {@link patio.Model} is valid you can run the <code>isValid</code> method.
    328. 

  328.           *
    329. 

  329.           * {@code
    330. 

  330.           * var model1 = new Model({col2 : 'grape', emailAddress : "test"}),
    331. 

  331.           *     model2 = new Model({col1 : "grape", col2 : "hello", emailAddress : "test@test.com"});
    332. 

  332.           *
    333. 

  333.           * model1.isValid() //false
    334. 

  334.           * model2.isValid() //true
    335. 

  335.           * }
    336. 

  336.           *
    337. 

  337.           * To get the errors associated with an invalid model you can access the errors property
    338. 

  338.           *
    339. 

  339.           * {@code
    340. 

  340.           * model1.errors; //{ col1: [ 'col1 must be defined.' ],
    341. 

  341.           *                //  col2: [ 'col2 must be like /hello/gi got grape.' ],
    342. 

  342.           *                //  emailAddress: [ 'emailAddress must be a valid Email Address got test' ] }
    343. 

  343.           * }
    344. 

  344.           *
    345. 

  345.           * Validation is also run pre save and pre update. To prevent this you can specify the <code>validate</code> option
    346. 

  346.           *
    347. 

  347.           * {@code
    348. 

  348.           * model1.save(null, {validate : false});
    349. 

  349.           * model2.save(null, {validate : false});
    350. 

  350.           * }
    351. 

  351.           *
    352. 

  352.           * Or you can specify the class level properties <code>validateOnSave</code> and <code>validateOnUpdate</code>
    353. 

  353.           * to false respectively
    354. 

  354.           * {@code
    355. 

  355.           * Model.validateOnSave = false;
    356. 

  356.           * Model.validateOnUpdate = false;
    357. 

  357.           * }
    358. 

  358.           *
    359. 

  359.           * Avaiable validation methods are.
    360. 

  360.           *
    361. 

  361.           * <ul>
    362. 

  362.           *  <li><code>isAfter</code> : check that a date is after a specified date</li>
    363. 

  363.           *  <li><code>isBefore</code> : check that a date is after before a specified date </li>
    364. 

  364.           *  <li><code>isDefined</code> : ensure that a column is defined</li>
    365. 

  365.           *  <li><code>isNotDefined</code> : ensure that a column is not defined</li>
    366. 

  366.           *  <li><code>isNotNull</code> : ensure that a column is defined and not null</li>
    367. 

  367.           *  <li><code>isNull</code> : ensure that a column is not defined or null</li>
    368. 

  368.           *  <li><code>isEq</code> : ensure that a column equals a value <b>this uses deep equal</b></li>
    369. 

  369.           *  <li><code>isNeq</code> : ensure that a column does not equal a value <b>this uses deep equal</b></li>
    370. 

  370.           *  <li><code>isLike</code> : ensure that a column is like a value, can be a regexp or string</li>
    371. 

  371.           *  <li><code>isNotLike</code> : ensure that a column is not like a value, can be a regexp or string</li>
    372. 

  372.           *  <li><code>isLt</code> : ensure that a column is less than a value</li>
    373. 

  373.           *  <li><code>isGt</code> : ensure that a column is greater than a value</li>
    374. 

  374.           *  <li><code>isLte</code> : ensure that a column is less than or equal to a value</li>
    375. 

  375.           *  <li><code>isGte</code> : ensure that a column is greater than or equal to a value</li>
    376. 

  376.           *  <li><code>isIn</code> : ensure that a column is contained in an array of values</li>
    377. 

  377.           *  <li><code>isNotIn</code> : ensure that a column is not contained in an array of values</li>
    378. 

  378.           *  <li><code>isMacAddress</code> : ensure that a column is a valid MAC address</li>
    379. 

  379.           *  <li><code>isIPAddress</code> : ensure that a column is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address</li>
    380. 

  380.           *  <li><code>isIPv4Address</code> : ensure that a column is a valid IPv4 address</li>
    381. 

  381.           *  <li><code>isIPv6Address</code> : ensure that a column is a valid IPv6 address</li>
    382. 

  382.           *  <li><code>isUUID</code> : ensure that a column is a valid UUID</li>
    383. 

  383.           *  <li><code>isEmail</code> : ensure that a column is a valid email address</li>
    384. 

  384.           *  <li><code>isUrl</code> : ensure than a column is a valid URL</li>
    385. 

  385.           *  <li><code>isAlpha</code> : ensure than a column is all letters</li>
    386. 

  386.           *  <li><code>isAlphaNumeric</code> : ensure than a column is all letters or numbers</li>
    387. 

  387.           *  <li><code>hasLength</code> : ensure than a column is fits within the specified length accepts a min and optional max value</li>
    388. 

  388.           *  <li><code>isLowercase</code> : ensure than a column is lowercase</li>
    389. 

  389.           *  <li><code>isUppercase</code> : ensure than a column is uppercase</li>
    390. 

  390.           *  <li><code>isEmpty</code> : ensure than a column empty (i.e. a blank string)</li>
    391. 

  391.           *  <li><code>isNotEmpty</code> : ensure than a column not empty (i.e. not a blank string)</li>
    392. 

  392.           *  <li><code>isCreditCard</code> : ensure than a is a valid credit card number</li>
    393. 

  393.           *  <li><code>check</code> : accepts a function to perform validation</li>
    394. 

  394.           * </ul>
    395. 

  395.           *
    396. 

  396.           * All of the validation methods are chainable, and accept an options argument.
    397. 

  397.           *
    398. 

  398.           * The options include
    399. 

  399.           * <ul>
    400. 

  400.           *     <li><code>message</code> : a message to return if a column fails validation. The message can include <code>{val}</code> and <code>{col}</code>
    401. 

  401.           *     replacements which will insert the invalid value and the column name.
    402. 

  402.           *     </li>
    403. 

  403.           *     <li><code>[onlyDefined=true]</code> : set to false to run the method even if the column value is not defined.</li>
    404. 

  404.           *     <li><code>[onlyNotNull=true]</code> : set to false to run the method even if the column value is null.</li>
    405. 

  405.           * </ul>
    406. 

  406.           *
    407. 

  407.           *
    408. 

  408.           * @constructs
    409. 

  409.           * @name ValidatorPlugin
    410. 

  410.           * @memberOf patio.plugins
    411. 

  411.           * @property {Object} [errors={}] the validation errors for this model.
    412. 

  412.           *
    413. 

  413.           */
    414. 

  414.          constructor:function () {
    415. 

  415. 110            this._super(arguments);
    416. 

  416. 110            this.errors = {};
    417. 

  417.          },
    418. 

  418.  
    419. 

  419.          /**
    420. 

  420.           * Validates a model, returning an array of error messages for each invalid property.
    421. 

  421.           * @return {String[]} an array of error messages for each invalid property.
    422. 

  422.           */
    423. 

  423.          validate:function () {
    424. 

  424. 154            this.errors = {};
    425. 

  425. 154            return flatten(this._static.validators.map(function runValidator(validator) {
    426. 

  426. 208                var col = validator.col, val = this.__values[validator.col], ret = validator.validate(val);
    427. 

  427. 208                this.errors[col] = ret;
    428. 

  428. 208                return ret;
    429. 

  429.              }, this));
    430. 

  430.          },
    431. 

  431.  
    432. 

  432.          /**
    433. 

  433.           * Returns if this model passes validation.
    434. 

  434.           *
    435. 

  435.           * @return {Boolean}
    436. 

  436.           */
    437. 

  437.          isValid:function () {
    438. 

  438. 154            return this.validate().length === 0;
    439. 

  439.          }
    440. 

  440.      },
    441. 

  441.  
    442. 

  442.      "static":{
    443. 

  443.          /**@lends patio.plugins.ValidatorPlugin*/
    444. 

  444.  
    445. 

  445.          /**
    446. 

  446.           * Set to false to prevent model validation when saving.
    447. 

  447.           * @default true
    448. 

  448.           */
    449. 

  449.          validateOnSave:true,
    450. 

  450.  
    451. 

  451.          /**
    452. 

  452.           * Set to false to prevent model validation when updating.
    453. 

  453.           * @default true
    454. 

  454.           */
    455. 

  455.          validateOnUpdate:true,
    456. 

  456.  
    457. 

  457.          init:function () {
    458. 

  458. 34            this._super(arguments);
    459. 

  459.          },
    460. 

  460.  
    461. 

  461.          __initValidation:function () {
    462. 

  462. 41            if (!this.__isValidationInited) {
    463. 

  463. 33                this.validators = [];
    464. 

  464. 33                this.pre("save", function preSaveValidate(next, opts) {
    465. 

  465. 110                    validateHook.call(this, this._static.validateOnSave, next, opts);
    466. 

  466.                  });
    467. 

  467. 33                this.pre("update", function preUpdateValidate(next, opts) {
    468. 

  468. 1                    validateHook.call(this, this._static.validateOnSave, next, opts);
    469. 

  469.                  });
    470. 

  470. 33                this.__isValidationInited = true;
    471. 

  471.              }
    472. 

  472.          },
    473. 

  473.  
    474. 

  474.          __getValidator:function validator(name) {
    475. 

  475. 42            var ret = new Validator(name);
    476. 

  476. 42            this.validators.push(ret);
    477. 

  477. 42            return ret;
    478. 

  478.          },
    479. 

  479.  
    480. 

  480.          /**
    481. 

  481.           * Sets up validation for a model.
    482. 

  482.           *
    483. 

  483.           * To do single col validation
    484. 

  484.           * {@code
    485. 

  485.           *
    486. 

  486.           * var Model = patio.addModel("validator", {
    487. 

  487.           *      plugins:[ValidatorPlugin]
    488. 

  488.           * });
    489. 

  489.           * //this ensures column assignment
    490. 

  490.           * Model.validate("col1").isDefined().isAlphaNumeric().hasLength(1, 10);
    491. 

  491.           * //col2 does not have to be assigned but if it is it must match /hello/ig.
    492. 

  492.           * Model.validate("col2").like(/hello/ig);
    493. 

  493.           * //Ensures that the emailAddress column is a valid email address.
    494. 

  494.           * Model.validate("emailAddress").isEmailAddress();
    495. 

  495.           * }
    496. 

  496.           *
    497. 

  497.           * Or you can do a mass validation through a callback.
    498. 

  498.           * {@code
    499. 

  499.           *
    500. 

  500.           * var Model = patio.addModel("validator", {
    501. 

  501.           *      plugins:[ValidatorPlugin]
    502. 

  502.           * });
    503. 

  503.           * Model.validate(function(validate){
    504. 

  504.           *      //this ensures column assignment
    505. 

  505.           *      validate("col1").isDefined().isAlphaNumeric().hasLength(1, 10);
    506. 

  506.           *      //col2 does not have to be assigned but if it is it must match /hello/ig.
    507. 

  507.           *      validate("col2").isLike(/hello/ig);
    508. 

  508.           *      //Ensures that the emailAddress column is a valid email address.
    509. 

  509.           *      validate("emailAddress").isEmail();
    510. 

  510.           * });
    511. 

  511.           * }
    512. 

  512.           *
    513. 

  513.           *
    514. 

  514.           * @param {String|Function} name the name of the column, or a callback that accepts a function to create validators.
    515. 

  515.           *
    516. 

  516.           * @throws {patio.ModelError} if name is not a function or string.
    517. 

  517.           * @return {patio.Model|Validator} returns a validator if name is a string, other wise returns this for chaining.
    518. 

  518.           */
    519. 

  519.          validate:function (name) {
    520. 

  520. 41            this.__initValidation();
    521. 

  521. 41            var ret;
    522. 

  522. 41            if (isFunction(name)) {
    523. 

  523. 1                name.apply(this, [this.__getValidator.bind(this)]);
    524. 

  524. 1                ret = this;
    525. 

  525. 40            } else if (isString(name)) {
    526. 

  526. 40                ret = this.__getValidator(name);
    527. 

  527.              } else {
    528. 

  528. 0                throw new ModelError("name is must be a string or function when validating");
    529. 

  529.              }
    530. 

  530. 41            return ret;
    531. 

  531.          }
    532. 

  532.      }
    533. 

  533.  
    534. 

  534.  }).as(module);
    535. 

  535.

  40. 1function conditionedJoin(type) {
    41.

    42.

  45. 1function unConditionJoin(type, table) {
    46. 

  46. 6    var args = argsToArray(arguments, 1);
    47. 

  47. 6    return this.joinTable.apply(this, [type, table]);
    48. 

  48.  }

    66.

    67.

    72.
