    1136. 

  1136.  
    1137. 

  1137.          /**
    1138. 

  1138.           *
    1139. 

  1139.           * Returns a cloned dataset with a greater than or equal to expression added to the WHERE
    1140. 

  1140.           * clause.
    1141. 

  1141.           *
    1142. 

  1142.           * @example
    1143. 

  1143.           *  DB.from("test").gte({x : 1});
    1144. 

  1144.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE (x >= 1)
    1145. 

  1145.           *  DB.from("test").gte({x : 1, y : 10});
    1146. 

  1146.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE ((x >= 1) AND (y >= 10))
    1147. 

  1147.           *
    1148. 

  1148.           * @param {Object} obj object used to create the greater than or equal to expression.
    1149. 

  1149.           *
    1150. 

  1150.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the greater than or equal to expression added to the WHERE clause.
    1151. 

  1151.           */
    1152. 

  1152.          gte:function (arr) {
    1153. 

  1153. 2            arr = this.__arrayToConditionSpecifier(argsToArray(arguments), "gte");
    1154. 

  1154. 2            return this.filter(this.__createBoolExpression("gte", arr));
    1155. 

  1155.          },
    1156. 

  1156.  
    1157. 

  1157.          /**
    1158. 

  1158.           *
    1159. 

  1159.           * Returns a cloned dataset with a less than or equal to expression added to the WHERE
    1160. 

  1160.           * clause.
    1161. 

  1161.           *
    1162. 

  1162.           * @example
    1163. 

  1163.           *  DB.from("test").gte({x : 1});
    1164. 

  1164.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE (x <= 1)
    1165. 

  1165.           *  DB.from("test").gte({x : 1, y : 10});
    1166. 

  1166.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE ((x <= 1) AND (y <= 10))
    1167. 

  1167.           *
    1168. 

  1168.           * @param {Object} obj object used to create the less than or equal to expression.
    1169. 

  1169.           *
    1170. 

  1170.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the less than or equal to expression added to the WHERE clause.
    1171. 

  1171.           */
    1172. 

  1172.          lte:function (obj) {
    1173. 

  1173. 2            var arr = this.__arrayToConditionSpecifier(argsToArray(arguments), "lte");
    1174. 

  1174. 2            return this.filter(this.__createBoolExpression("lte", obj));
    1175. 

  1175.          },
    1176. 

  1176.  
    1177. 

  1177.          /**
    1178. 

  1178.           * Returns a cloned dataset with a between clause added
    1179. 

  1179.           * to the where clause.
    1180. 

  1180.           *
    1181. 

  1181.           * @example
    1182. 

  1182.           *  ds.notBetween({x:[1, 2]}).sql;
    1183. 

  1183.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE ((x >= 1) OR (x <= 2))
    1184. 

  1184.           *
    1185. 

  1185.           *  ds.find({x:{notBetween:[1, 2]}}).sql;
    1186. 

  1186.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE ((x >= 1) OR (x <= 2))
    1187. 

  1187.           * @param {Object} obj object where the key is the column and the value is an array where the first element
    1188. 

  1188.           *                     is the item to be greater than or equal to than and the second item is less than or equal to than.
    1189. 

  1189.           *
    1190. 

  1190.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with a between clause added
    1191. 

  1191.           * to the where clause.
    1192. 

  1192.           */
    1193. 

  1193.          between:function (obj) {
    1194. 

  1194. 2            return this.filter(this.__createBetweenExpression(obj));
    1195. 

  1195.          },
    1196. 

  1196.  
    1197. 

  1197.          /**
    1198. 

  1198.           * Returns a cloned dataset with a not between clause added
    1199. 

  1199.           * to the where clause.
    1200. 

  1200.           *
    1201. 

  1201.           * @example
    1202. 

  1202.           *  ds.notBetween({x:[1, 2]}).sql;
    1203. 

  1203.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE ((x < 1) OR (x > 2))
    1204. 

  1204.           *
    1205. 

  1205.           *  ds.find({x:{notBetween:[1, 2]}}).sql;
    1206. 

  1206.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM test WHERE ((x < 1) OR (x > 2))
    1207. 

  1207.           * @param {Object} obj object where the key is the column and the value is an array where the first element
    1208. 

  1208.           *                     is the item to be less than and the second item is greater than.
    1209. 

  1209.           *
    1210. 

  1210.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with a not between clause added
    1211. 

  1211.           * to the where clause.
    1212. 

  1212.           */
    1213. 

  1213.          notBetween:function (obj) {
    1214. 

  1214. 2            return this.filter(this.__createBetweenExpression(obj, true));
    1215. 

  1215.          },
    1216. 

  1216.  
    1217. 

  1217.          /**
    1218. 

  1218.           * Returns a cloned dataset with the given lock style.  If style is a
    1219. 

  1219.           * string, it will be used directly.Currently "update" is respected
    1220. 

  1220.           * by most databases, and "share" is supported by some.
    1221. 

  1221.           *
    1222. 

  1222.           * @example
    1223. 

  1223.           * DB.from("items").lockStyle('FOR SHARE') # SELECT * FROM items FOR SHARE
    1224. 

  1224.           *
    1225. 

  1225.           * @param {String} style the lock style to use.
    1226. 

  1226.           *
    1227. 

  1227.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned datase with the given lock style.
    1228. 

  1228.           **/
    1229. 

  1229.          lockStyle:function (style) {
    1230. 

  1230. 4            return this.mergeOptions({lock:style});
    1231. 

  1231.          },
    1232. 

  1232.  
    1233. 

  1233.          /**
    1234. 

  1234.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the order changed. If the dataset has an
    1235. 

  1235.           * existing order, it is ignored and overwritten with this order. If null is given
    1236. 

  1236.           * the returned dataset has no order. This can accept multiple arguments
    1237. 

  1237.           * of varying kinds, such as SQL functions.  This also takes a function similar
    1238. 

  1238.           * to {@link patio.Dataset#filter}
    1239. 

  1239.           *
    1240. 

  1240.           * @example
    1241. 

  1241.           *
    1242. 

  1242.           *  DB.from("items").order("name")
    1243. 

  1243.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY name
    1244. 

  1244.           *
    1245. 

  1245.           *  DB.from("items").order("a", "b")
    1246. 

  1246.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY a, b
    1247. 

  1247.           *
    1248. 

  1248.           *  DB.from("items").order(sql.literal('a + b'))
    1249. 

  1249.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY a + b
    1250. 

  1250.           *
    1251. 

  1251.           *  DB.from("items").order(sql.identifier("a").plus("b"))
    1252. 

  1252.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY (a + b)
    1253. 

  1253.           *
    1254. 

  1254.           *  DB.from("items").order(sql.identifier("name").desc())
    1255. 

  1255.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY name DESC
    1256. 

  1256.           *
    1257. 

  1257.           *  DB.from("items").order(sql.identifier("name").asc({nulls : "last"))
    1258. 

  1258.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY name ASC NULLS LAST
    1259. 

  1259.           *
    1260. 

  1260.           *  DB.from("items").order(function(){
    1261. 

  1261.           *          return this.sum("name").desc();
    1262. 

  1262.           *  }); //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY sum(name) DESC
    1263. 

  1263.           *
    1264. 

  1264.           *  DB.from("items").order(null)
    1265. 

  1265.           *          //=>SELECT * FROM items
    1266. 

  1266.           *  @param arg variable number of arguments similar to {@link patio.Dataset#filter}
    1267. 

  1267.           *
    1268. 

  1268.           *  @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the order changed.
    1269. 

  1269.           * */
    1270. 

  1270.          order:function (args) {
    1271. 

  1271. 413            args = argsToArray(arguments);
    1272. 

  1272. 413            var order = [];
    1273. 

  1273. 413            args = compact(args).length ? args : null;
    1274. 

  1274. 413            if (args) {
    1275. 

  1275. 271                args.forEach(function (a) {
    1276. 

  1276. 334                    if (isString(a)) {
    1277. 

  1277. 212                        order.push(this.stringToIdentifier(a));
    1278. 

  1278. 122                    } else if (isFunction(a)) {
    1279. 

  1279. 16                        var res = a.apply(sql, [sql]);
    1280. 

  1280. 16                        order = order.concat(isArray(res) ? res : [res]);
    1281. 

  1281.                      } else {
    1282. 

  1282. 106                        order.push(a);
    1283. 

  1283.                      }
    1284. 

  1284.                  }, this);
    1285. 

  1285.              } else {
    1286. 

  1286. 142                order = null;
    1287. 

  1287.              }
    1288. 

  1288. 413            return this.mergeOptions({order:order});
    1289. 

  1289.          },
    1290. 

  1290.  
    1291. 

  1291.          /**
    1292. 

  1292.           * Alias of {@link patio.Dataset#orderMore};
    1293. 

  1293.           */
    1294. 

  1294.          orderAppend:function () {
    1295. 

  1295. 4            return this.orderMore.apply(this, arguments);
    1296. 

  1296.          },
    1297. 

  1297.  
    1298. 

  1298.          /**
    1299. 

  1299.           * @see patio.Dataset#order
    1300. 

  1300.           */
    1301. 

  1301.          orderBy:function () {
    1302. 

  1302. 6            return this.order.apply(this, arguments);
    1303. 

  1303.          },
    1304. 

  1304.  
    1305. 

  1305.          /**
    1306. 

  1306.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the order columns added
    1307. 

  1307.           * to the end of the existing order. For more detail
    1308. 

  1308.           * @see patio.Dataset#order
    1309. 

  1309.           *
    1310. 

  1310.           * @example
    1311. 

  1311.           *
    1312. 

  1312.           * DB.from("items").order("a").order("b");
    1313. 

  1313.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY b
    1314. 

  1314.           *
    1315. 

  1315.           * DB.from("items").order("a").orderMore("b");
    1316. 

  1316.           *      //=>SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY a, b
    1317. 

  1317.           */
    1318. 

  1318.          orderMore:function () {
    1319. 

  1319. 11            var args = argsToArray(arguments);
    1320. 

  1320. 11            if (this.__opts.order) {
    1321. 

  1321. 9                args = this.__opts.order.concat(args);
    1322. 

  1322.              }
    1323. 

  1323. 11            return this.order.apply(this, args);
    1324. 

  1324.          },
    1325. 

  1325.  
    1326. 

  1326.          /**
    1327. 

  1327.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the order columns added
    1328. 

  1328.           * to the beginning of the existing order. For more detail
    1329. 

  1329.           * @see patio.Dataset#order
    1330. 

  1330.           *
    1331. 

  1331.           * @example
    1332. 

  1332.           * DB.from("items").order("a").order("b");
    1333. 

  1333.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY b
    1334. 

  1334.           *
    1335. 

  1335.           * DB.from("items").order("a").orderPrepend("b");
    1336. 

  1336.           *      //=>SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY b, a
    1337. 

  1337.           *
    1338. 

  1338.           *
    1339. 

  1339.           **/
    1340. 

  1340.          orderPrepend:function () {
    1341. 

  1341. 4            var ds = this.order.apply(this, arguments);
    1342. 

  1342. 4            return this.__opts.order ? ds.orderMore.apply(ds, this.__opts.order) : ds;
    1343. 

  1343.          },
    1344. 

  1344.  
    1345. 

  1345.          /**
    1346. 

  1346.           * Qualify to the given table, or {@link patio.Dataset#firstSourceAlias} if not table is given.
    1347. 

  1347.           *
    1348. 

  1348.           * @example
    1349. 

  1349.           * DB.from("items").filter({id : 1}).qualify();
    1350. 

  1350.           *    //=> SELECT items.* FROM items WHERE (items.id = 1)
    1351. 

  1351.           *
    1352. 

  1352.           * DB.from("items").filter({id : 1}).qualify("i");
    1353. 

  1353.           *   //=> SELECT i.* FROM items WHERE (i.id = 1)
    1354. 

  1354.           *
    1355. 

  1355.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} [table={@link patio.Dataset#firstSourceAlias}] the table name to qualify to.
    1356. 

  1356.           *
    1357. 

  1357.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset qualified to the table or {@link patio.Dataset#firstSourceAlias}
    1358. 

  1358.           **/
    1359. 

  1359.          qualify:function (table) {
    1360. 

  1360. 19            table = table || this.firstSourceAlias;
    1361. 

  1361. 19            return this.qualifyTo(table);
    1362. 

  1362.          },
    1363. 

  1363.  
    1364. 

  1364.          /**
    1365. 

  1365.           * Qualify the dataset to its current first source(first from clause).  This is useful
    1366. 

  1366.           * if you have unqualified identifiers in the query that all refer to
    1367. 

  1367.           * the first source, and you want to join to another table which
    1368. 

  1368.           * has columns with the same name as columns in the current dataset.
    1369. 

  1369.           * See {@link patio.Dataset#qualifyTo}
    1370. 

  1370.           *
    1371. 

  1371.           * @example
    1372. 

  1372.           *
    1373. 

  1373.           * DB.from("items").filter({id : 1}).qualifyToFirstSource();
    1374. 

  1374.           *      //=> SELECT items.* FROM items WHERE (items.id = 1)
    1375. 

  1375.           *
    1376. 

  1376.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset that is qualified with the first source.
    1377. 

  1377.           * */
    1378. 

  1378.          qualifyToFirstSource:function () {
    1379. 

  1379. 18            return this.qualifyTo(this.firstSourceAlias);
    1380. 

  1380.          },
    1381. 

  1381.  
    1382. 

  1382.          /**
    1383. 

  1383.           * Return a copy of the dataset with unqualified identifiers in the
    1384. 

  1384.           * SELECT, WHERE, GROUP, HAVING, and ORDER clauses qualified by the
    1385. 

  1385.           * given table. If no columns are currently selected, select all
    1386. 

  1386.           * columns of the given table.
    1387. 

  1387.           *
    1388. 

  1388.           * @example
    1389. 

  1389.           *   DB.from("items").filter({id : 1}).qualifyTo("i");
    1390. 

  1390.           *      //=> SELECT i.* FROM items WHERE (i.id = 1)
    1391. 

  1391.           *
    1392. 

  1392.           * @param {String} table the name to qualify identifier to.
    1393. 

  1393.           *
    1394. 

  1394.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with unqualified identifiers qualified.
    1395. 

  1395.           */
    1396. 

  1396.          qualifyTo:function (table) {
    1397. 

  1397. 40            var o = this.__opts;
    1398. 

  1398. 40            if (o.sql) {
    1399. 

  1399. 2                return this.mergeOptions();
    1400. 

  1400.              }
    1401. 

  1401. 38            var h = {};
    1402. 

  1402. 38            array.intersect(Object.keys(o), this._static.QUALIFY_KEYS).forEach(function (k) {
    1403. 

  1403. 65                h[k] = this._qualifiedExpression(o[k], table);
    1404. 

  1404.              }, this);
    1405. 

  1405. 38            if (!o.select || isEmpty(o.select)) {
    1406. 

  1406. 14                h.select = [new ColumnAll(table)];
    1407. 

  1407.              }
    1408. 

  1408. 38            return this.mergeOptions(h);
    1409. 

  1409.          },
    1410. 

  1410.  
    1411. 

  1411.          /**
    1412. 

  1412.           * Same as {@link patio.Dataset@qualifyTo} except that it forces qualification on methods called
    1413. 

  1413.           * after it has been called.
    1414. 

  1414.           *
    1415. 

  1415.           * @example
    1416. 

  1416.           *
    1417. 

  1417.           * //qualfyTo would generate
    1418. 

  1418.           * DB.from("items").qualifyTo("i").filter({id : 1});
    1419. 

  1419.           *      //=> SELECT i.* FROM items WHERE (id = 1)
    1420. 

  1420.           *
    1421. 

  1421.           * //alwaysQualify qualifies filter also.
    1422. 

  1422.           * DB.from("items").alwaysQualify("i").filter({id : 1});
    1423. 

  1423.           *      //=> SELECT i.* FROM items WHERE (i.id = 1)
    1424. 

  1424.           *
    1425. 

  1425.           *
    1426. 

  1426.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} [table=this.firstSourceAlias] the table to qualify to.
    1427. 

  1427.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset that will always qualify.
    1428. 

  1428.           */
    1429. 

  1429.          alwaysQualify:function (table) {
    1430. 

  1430. 3            return this.mergeOptions({alwaysQualify:table || this.firstSourceAlias});
    1431. 

  1431.          },
    1432. 

  1432.  
    1433. 

  1433.  
    1434. 

  1434.          /**
    1435. 

  1435.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the order reversed. If no order is
    1436. 

  1436.           * given, the existing order is inverted.
    1437. 

  1437.           *
    1438. 

  1438.           * @example
    1439. 

  1439.           * DB.from("items").reverse("id");
    1440. 

  1440.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY id DESC
    1441. 

  1441.           *
    1442. 

  1442.           * DB.from("items").order("id").reverse();
    1443. 

  1443.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY id DESC
    1444. 

  1444.           *
    1445. 

  1445.           * DB.from("items").order("id").reverse(sql.identifier("name").asc);
    1446. 

  1446.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items ORDER BY name ASC
    1447. 

  1447.           *
    1448. 

  1448.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier|Function} args variable number of columns add to order before reversing.
    1449. 

  1449.           *
    1450. 

  1450.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the order reversed.
    1451. 

  1451.           *
    1452. 

  1452.           **/
    1453. 

  1453.          reverse:function (args) {
    1454. 

  1454. 46            args = argsToArray(arguments);
    1455. 

  1455. 46            return this.order.apply(this, this._invertOrder(args.length ? args : this.__opts.order));
    1456. 

  1456.          },
    1457. 

  1457.  
    1458. 

  1458.          /**
    1459. 

  1459.           * @see patio.Dataset#reverse
    1460. 

  1460.           */
    1461. 

  1461.          reverseOrder:function () {
    1462. 

  1462. 16            return this.reverse.apply(this, arguments);
    1463. 

  1463.          },
    1464. 

  1464.  
    1465. 

  1465.          /**
    1466. 

  1466.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the columns selected changed
    1467. 

  1467.           * to the given columns. This also takes a function similar to {@link patio.Dataset#filter}
    1468. 

  1468.           *
    1469. 

  1469.           * @example
    1470. 

  1470.           *   DB.from("items").select("a");
    1471. 

  1471.           *      //=> SELECT a FROM items
    1472. 

  1472.           *
    1473. 

  1473.           *   DB.from("items").select("a", "b");
    1474. 

  1474.           *      //=> SELECT a, b FROM items
    1475. 

  1475.           *
    1476. 

  1476.           *   DB.from("items").select("a", function(){
    1477. 

  1477.           *          return this.sum("b")
    1478. 

  1478.           *   }).sql;  //=> SELECT a, sum(b) FROM items
    1479. 

  1479.           *
    1480. 

  1480.           *  @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier|Function} args variable number of colums to select
    1481. 

  1481.           *  @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the columns selected changed.
    1482. 

  1482.           */
    1483. 

  1483.          select:function (args) {
    1484. 

  1484. 500            args = flatten(argsToArray(arguments));
    1485. 

  1485. 500            var columns = [];
    1486. 

  1486. 500            args.forEach(function (c) {
    1487. 

  1487. 920                if (isFunction(c)) {
    1488. 

  1488. 23                    var res = c.apply(sql, [sql]);
    1489. 

  1489. 23                    columns = columns.concat(isArray(res) ? res : [res]);
    1490. 

  1490.                  } else {
    1491. 

  1491. 897                    columns.push(c);
    1492. 

  1492.                  }
    1493. 

  1493.              });
    1494. 

  1494. 500            var select = [];
    1495. 

  1495. 500            columns.forEach(function (c) {
    1496. 

  1496. 923                if (isHash(c)) {
    1497. 

  1497. 3                    for (var i in c) {
    1498. 

  1498. 4                        select.push(new AliasedExpression(new Identifier(i), c[i]));
    1499. 

  1499.                      }
    1500. 

  1500. 920                } else if (isString(c)) {
    1501. 

  1501. 371                    select.push(this.stringToIdentifier(c));
    1502. 

  1502.                  } else {
    1503. 

  1503. 549                    select.push(c);
    1504. 

  1504.                  }
    1505. 

  1505.              }, this);
    1506. 

  1506. 500            return this.mergeOptions({select:select});
    1507. 

  1507.  
    1508. 

  1508.          },
    1509. 

  1509.  
    1510. 

  1510.          /**
    1511. 

  1511.           * Returns a cloned dataset that selects *.
    1512. 

  1512.           *
    1513. 

  1513.           * @return {patio.Dataset}  a cloned dataset that selects *.
    1514. 

  1514.           */
    1515. 

  1515.          selectAll:function () {
    1516. 

  1516. 6            return this.mergeOptions({select:null});
    1517. 

  1517.          },
    1518. 

  1518.  
    1519. 

  1519.          /**
    1520. 

  1520.           * Selects the columns if only if there is not already select sources.
    1521. 

  1521.           *
    1522. 

  1522.           * @example
    1523. 

  1523.           *
    1524. 

  1524.           * var ds = DB.from("items"); //SELECT * FROM items
    1525. 

  1525.           *
    1526. 

  1526.           * ds.select("a"); //SELECT a FROM items;
    1527. 

  1527.           * ds.select("a").selectIfNoSource("a", "b"). //SELECT a FROM items;
    1528. 

  1528.           * ds.selectIfNoSource("a", "b"). //SELECT a, b FROM items;
    1529. 

  1529.           *
    1530. 

  1530.           * @param cols columns to select if there is not already select sources.
    1531. 

  1531.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the appropriate select sources.
    1532. 

  1532.           */
    1533. 

  1533.          selectIfNoSource:function (cols) {
    1534. 

  1534. 0            var ret;
    1535. 

  1535. 0            if (!this.hasSelectSource) {
    1536. 

  1536. 0                ret = this.select.apply(this, arguments);
    1537. 

  1537.              } else {
    1538. 

  1538. 0                ret = this.mergeOptions();
    1539. 

  1539.              }
    1540. 

  1540. 0            return ret;
    1541. 

  1541.          },
    1542. 

  1542.  
    1543. 

  1543.          /**
    1544. 

  1544.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the given columns added
    1545. 

  1545.           * to the existing selected columns. If no columns are currently selected,
    1546. 

  1546.           * it will select the columns given in addition to *.
    1547. 

  1547.           *
    1548. 

  1548.           * @example
    1549. 

  1549.           *   DB.from("items").select("a").selectAppend("b").sql;
    1550. 

  1550.           *      //=> SELECT b FROM items
    1551. 

  1551.           *
    1552. 

  1552.           *   DB.from("items").select("a").selectAppend("b", "c", "d").sql
    1553. 

  1553.           *      //=> SELECT a, b, c, d FROM items
    1554. 

  1554.           *
    1555. 

  1555.           *   DB.from("items").selectAppend("b").sql
    1556. 

  1556.           *      //=> SELECT *, b FROM items
    1557. 

  1557.           *
    1558. 

  1558.           * @param [...] cols variable number of columns to add to the select statement
    1559. 

  1559.           *
    1560. 

  1560.           * @return {patio.Dataset} returns a cloned dataset with the new select columns appended.
    1561. 

  1561.           */
    1562. 

  1562.          selectAppend:function (cols) {
    1563. 

  1563. 7            cols = argsToArray(arguments);
    1564. 

  1564. 7            var currentSelect = this.__opts.select;
    1565. 

  1565. 7            if (!currentSelect || !currentSelect.length) {
    1566. 

  1566. 3                currentSelect = [this._static.WILDCARD];
    1567. 

  1567.              }
    1568. 

  1568. 7            return this.select.apply(this, currentSelect.concat(cols));
    1569. 

  1569.          },
    1570. 

  1570.  
    1571. 

  1571.          /**
    1572. 

  1572.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the given columns added
    1573. 

  1573.           * to the existing selected columns. If no columns are currently selected
    1574. 

  1574.           * it will just select the columns given.
    1575. 

  1575.           *
    1576. 

  1576.           * @example
    1577. 

  1577.           *   DB.from("items").select("a").select("b").sql;
    1578. 

  1578.           *      //=> SELECT b FROM items
    1579. 

  1579.           *
    1580. 

  1580.           *   DB.from("items").select("a").selectMore("b", "c", "d").sql
    1581. 

  1581.           *      //=> SELECT a, b, c, d FROM items
    1582. 

  1582.           *
    1583. 

  1583.           *   DB.from("items").selectMore("b").sql
    1584. 

  1584.           *      //=> SELECT b FROM items
    1585. 

  1585.           *
    1586. 

  1586.           * @param [...] cols variable number of columns to add to the select statement
    1587. 

  1587.           *
    1588. 

  1588.           * @return {patio.Dataset} returns a cloned dataset with the new select columns appended.
    1589. 

  1589.           */
    1590. 

  1590.          selectMore:function (cols) {
    1591. 

  1591. 10            cols = argsToArray(arguments);
    1592. 

  1592. 10            var currentSelect = this.__opts.select;
    1593. 

  1593. 10            return this.select.apply(this, (currentSelect || []).concat(cols));
    1594. 

  1594.          },
    1595. 

  1595.  
    1596. 

  1596.          /**
    1597. 

  1597.           * Set the default values for insert and update statements.  The values hash passed
    1598. 

  1598.           * to insert or update are merged into this hash, so any values in the hash passed
    1599. 

  1599.           * to insert or update will override values passed to this method.
    1600. 

  1600.           *
    1601. 

  1601.           *  @example
    1602. 

  1602.           *   DB.from("items").setDefaults({a : 'a', c : 'c'}).insert({a : 'd', b : 'b'}).insertSql();
    1603. 

  1603.           *      //=> INSERT INTO items (a, c, b) VALUES ('d', 'c', 'b')
    1604. 

  1604.           *
    1605. 

  1605.           * @param {Object} hash object with key value pairs to use as override values
    1606. 

  1606.           *
    1607. 

  1607.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the defaults added to the current datasets defaults.
    1608. 

  1608.           */
    1609. 

  1609.          setDefaults:function (hash) {
    1610. 

  1610. 5            return this.mergeOptions({defaults:merge({}, this.__opts.defaults || {}, hash)});
    1611. 

  1611.          },
    1612. 

  1612.  
    1613. 

  1613.          /**
    1614. 

  1614.           * Set values that override hash arguments given to insert and update statements.
    1615. 

  1615.           * This hash is merged into the hash provided to insert or update, so values
    1616. 

  1616.           * will override any values given in the insert/update hashes.
    1617. 

  1617.           *
    1618. 

  1618.           * @example
    1619. 

  1619.           *   DB.from("items").setOverrides({a : 'a', c : 'c'}).insert({a : 'd', b : 'b'}).insertSql();
    1620. 

  1620.           *      //=> INSERT INTO items (a, c, b) VALUES ('a', 'c', 'b')
    1621. 

  1621.           *
    1622. 

  1622.           * @param {Object} hash object with key value pairs to use as override values
    1623. 

  1623.           *
    1624. 

  1624.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the overrides added to the current datasets overrides.
    1625. 

  1625.           */
    1626. 

  1626.          setOverrides:function (hash) {
    1627. 

  1627. 5            return this.mergeOptions({overrides:merge({}, this.__opts.overrides || {}, hash)});
    1628. 

  1628.          },
    1629. 

  1629.  
    1630. 

  1630.          /**
    1631. 

  1631.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with no filters (HAVING or WHERE clause) applied.
    1632. 

  1632.           * @example
    1633. 

  1633.           *  DB.from("items").group("a").having({a : 1}).where("b").unfiltered().sql;
    1634. 

  1634.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items GROUP BY a
    1635. 

  1635.           *
    1636. 

  1636.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with no HAVING or WHERE clause.
    1637. 

  1637.           */
    1638. 

  1638.          unfiltered:function () {
    1639. 

  1639. 14            return this.mergeOptions({where:null, having:null});
    1640. 

  1640.          },
    1641. 

  1641.  
    1642. 

  1642.          /**
    1643. 

  1643.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with no GROUP or HAVING clause.
    1644. 

  1644.           *
    1645. 

  1645.           * @example
    1646. 

  1646.           *  DB.from("t").group("a").having({a : 1}).where("b").ungrouped().sql;
    1647. 

  1647.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM t WHERE b
    1648. 

  1648.           *
    1649. 

  1649.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with no GROUP or HAVING clause.
    1650. 

  1650.           */
    1651. 

  1651.          ungrouped:function () {
    1652. 

  1652. 1            return this.mergeOptions({group:null, having:null});
    1653. 

  1653.          },
    1654. 

  1654.  
    1655. 

  1655.          /**
    1656. 

  1656.           * Adds a UNION clause using a second dataset object.
    1657. 

  1657.           * A UNION compound dataset returns all rows in either the current dataset
    1658. 

  1658.           * or the given dataset.
    1659. 

  1659.           * Options:
    1660. 

  1660.           * :alias :: Use the given value as the from_self alias
    1661. 

  1661.           * :all :: Set to true to use UNION ALL instead of UNION, so duplicate rows can occur
    1662. 

  1662.           * :from_self :: Set to false to not wrap the returned dataset in a from_self, use with care.
    1663. 

  1663.           *
    1664. 

  1664.           * @example
    1665. 

  1665.           * DB.from("items").union(DB.from("otherItems")).sql;
    1666. 

  1666.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items UNION SELECT * FROM other_items
    1667. 

  1667.           *
    1668. 

  1668.           * DB.from("items").union(DB.from("otherItems"), {all : true, fromSelf : false}).sql;
    1669. 

  1669.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM items UNION ALL SELECT * FROM other_items
    1670. 

  1670.           *
    1671. 

  1671.           * DB.from("items").union(DB.from("otherItems"), {alias : "i"})
    1672. 

  1672.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM (SELECT * FROM items UNION SELECT * FROM other_items) AS i
    1673. 

  1673.           *
    1674. 

  1674.           * @param {patio.Dataset} dataset dataset to union with
    1675. 

  1675.           * @param {Object} opts addional options
    1676. 

  1676.           * @param {String|patio.sql.Identifier} [opts.alias] Alias to use as the fromSelf alias.
    1677. 

  1677.           * @param {Boolean} [opt.all=false] Set to true to use UNION ALL instead of UNION so duplicate rows can occur
    1678. 

  1678.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.fromSelf=true] Set to false to not wrap the returned dataset in a fromSelf.
    1679. 

  1679.           *
    1680. 

  1680.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the union.
    1681. 

  1681.           *
    1682. 

  1682.           */
    1683. 

  1683.          union:function (dataset, opts) {
    1684. 

  1684. 21            opts = isUndefined(opts) ? {} : opts;
    1685. 

  1685. 21            if (!isHash(opts)) {
    1686. 

  1686. 3                opts = {all:opts};
    1687. 

  1687.              }
    1688. 

  1688. 21            return this.compoundClone("union", dataset, opts);
    1689. 

  1689.          },
    1690. 

  1690.  
    1691. 

  1691.          /**
    1692. 

  1692.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with no limit or offset.
    1693. 

  1693.           *
    1694. 

  1694.           * @example
    1695. 

  1695.           *  DB.from("t").limit(10, 20).unlimited().sql;
    1696. 

  1696.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM t
    1697. 

  1697.           *
    1698. 

  1698.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with no limit or offset.
    1699. 

  1699.           */
    1700. 

  1700.          unlimited:function () {
    1701. 

  1701. 1            return this.mergeOptions({limit:null, offset:null});
    1702. 

  1702.          },
    1703. 

  1703.  
    1704. 

  1704.          /**
    1705. 

  1705.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with no order.
    1706. 

  1706.           *
    1707. 

  1707.           * @example
    1708. 

  1708.           *  DB.from("t").order("a", sql.identifier("b").desc()).unordered().sql;
    1709. 

  1709.           *      //=> SELECT * FROM t
    1710. 

  1710.           *
    1711. 

  1711.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with no order.
    1712. 

  1712.           */
    1713. 

  1713.          unordered:function () {
    1714. 

  1714. 139            return this.order(null);
    1715. 

  1715.          },
    1716. 

  1716.  
    1717. 

  1717.          /**
    1718. 

  1718.           * Add a condition to the WHERE clause.  See {@link patio.Dataset#filter} for argument types.
    1719. 

  1719.           *
    1720. 

  1720.           * @example
    1721. 

  1721.           *   DB.from("test").where('price < ? AND id in ?', 100, [1, 2, 3]).sql;
    1722. 

  1722.           *      //=> "SELECT * FROM test WHERE (price < 100 AND id in (1, 2, 3))"
    1723. 

  1723.           *   DB.from("test").where('price < {price} AND id in {ids}', {price:100, ids:[1, 2, 3]}).sql;
    1724. 

  1724.           *      //=> "SELECT * FROM test WHERE (price < 100 AND id in (1, 2, 3))")
    1725. 

  1725.           *
    1726. 

  1726.           */
    1727. 

  1727.          where:function () {
    1728. 

  1728. 333            return this._filter.apply(this, ["where"].concat(argsToArray(arguments)));
    1729. 

  1729.          },
    1730. 

  1730.  
    1731. 

  1731.          /**
    1732. 

  1732.           * Add a common table expression (CTE) with the given name and a dataset that defines the CTE.
    1733. 

  1733.           * A common table expression acts as an inline view for the query.
    1734. 

  1734.           *
    1735. 

  1735.           * @name with
    1736. 

  1736.           * @example
    1737. 

  1737.           *
    1738. 

  1738.           * DB.from("t")["with"]("t", db.from("x"))["with"]("j", db.from("y")).sql;
    1739. 

  1739.           *      //=> 'WITH t AS (SELECT * FROM x), j AS (SELECT * FROM y) SELECT * FROM t'
    1740. 

  1740.           *
    1741. 

  1741.           * DB.from("t")["with"]("t", db.from("x")).withRecursive("j", db.from("y"), db.from("j")).sql;
    1742. 

  1742.           *      //=> 'WITH t AS (SELECT * FROM x), j AS (SELECT * FROM y UNION ALL SELECT * FROM j) SELECT * FROM t'
    1743. 

  1743.           *
    1744. 

  1744.           * DB.from("t")["with"]("t", db.from("x"), {args:["b"]}).sql;
    1745. 

  1745.           *      //=> 'WITH t(b) AS (SELECT * FROM x) SELECT * FROM t'
    1746. 

  1746.           *
    1747. 

  1747.           * @param {String} name the name of the to assign to the CTE.
    1748. 

  1748.           * @param {patio.Dataset} dataset the dataset to use for the CTE.
    1749. 

  1749.           * @param {Object} opts extra options.
    1750. 

  1750.           * @param {String[]} [opts.args] colums/args for the CTE.
    1751. 

  1751.           * @param {Boolean} [opts.recursive] set to true that the CTE is recursive.
    1752. 

  1752.           *
    1753. 

  1753.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the CTE.
    1754. 

  1754.           */
    1755. 

  1755.          "with":function (name, dataset, opts) {
    1756. 

  1756. 6            if (!this.supportsCte) {
    1757. 

  1757. 1                throw new QueryError("this dataset does not support common table expressions");
    1758. 

  1758.              }
    1759. 

  1759. 5            return this.mergeOptions({
    1760. 

  1760.                  "with":(this.__opts["with"] || []).concat([merge(opts || {}, {name:this.stringToIdentifier(name), dataset:dataset})])
    1761. 

  1761.              });
    1762. 

  1762.          },
    1763. 

  1763.  
    1764. 

  1764.          /**
    1765. 

  1765.           * Add a recursive common table expression (CTE) with the given name, a dataset that
    1766. 

  1766.           * defines the nonrecursive part of the CTE, and a dataset that defines the recursive part
    1767. 

  1767.           * of the CTE.
    1768. 

  1768.           *
    1769. 

  1769.           *  @example
    1770. 

  1770.           *
    1771. 

  1771.           * //Sing withRecursive call.
    1772. 

  1772.           * DB.from("t").withRecursive("t", db.from("x"), db.from("t")).sql;
    1773. 

  1773.           *          //=> 'WITH t AS (SELECT * FROM x UNION ALL SELECT * FROM t) SELECT * FROM t'
    1774. 

  1774.           *
    1775. 

  1775.           * //Multiple withRecursive calls.
    1776. 

  1776.           * DB.from("t").withRecursive("t", db.from("x"), db.from("t"))
    1777. 

  1777.           *    .withRecursive("j", db.from("y"), db.from("j")).sql;
    1778. 

  1778.           *          //=> 'WITH t AS (SELECT * FROM x UNION ALL SELECT * FROM t),
    1779. 

  1779.           *                     j AS (SELECT * FROM y UNION ALL SELECT * FROM j) SELECT * FROM t';
    1780. 

  1780.           *
    1781. 

  1781.           * //Adding args
    1782. 

  1782.           * DB.from("t").withRecursive("t", db.from("x"), db.from("t"), {args:["b", "c"]}).sql;
    1783. 

  1783.           *          //=> 'WITH t(b, c) AS (SELECT * FROM x UNION ALL SELECT * FROM t) SELECT * FROM t'
    1784. 

  1784.           *
    1785. 

  1785.           * //Setting union all to false
    1786. 

  1786.           * DB.from("t").withRecursive("t", db.from("x"), db.from("t"), {unionAll:false}).sql;
    1787. 

  1787.           *          //=> 'WITH t AS (SELECT * FROM x UNION SELECT * FROM t) SELECT * FROM t');
    1788. 

  1788.           *
    1789. 

  1789.           * @param {String} name the name to assign to the CTE
    1790. 

  1790.           * @param {patio.Dataset} nonRecursive the non-recursive part of the CTE
    1791. 

  1791.           * @param {patio.Dataset} recursive the recursive part of the CTE
    1792. 

  1792.           * @param {Object} [opts={}] extra options
    1793. 

  1793.           * @param {String[]} [opts.args] columns to include with the CTE
    1794. 

  1794.           * @param {Boolena} [opts.unionAll] set to false to use UNION instead of UNION ALL when combining non recursive
    1795. 

  1795.           *                                with recursive.
    1796. 

  1796.           *
    1797. 

  1797.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the CTE.
    1798. 

  1798.           */
    1799. 

  1799.          withRecursive:function (name, nonRecursive, recursive, opts) {
    1800. 

  1800. 7            if (!this.supportsCte) {
    1801. 

  1801. 1                throw new QueryError("This dataset does not support common table expressions");
    1802. 

  1802.              }
    1803. 

  1803. 6            opts = opts || {};
    1804. 

  1804. 6            var wit = (this.__opts["with"] || []).concat([merge(opts, {recursive:true, name:this.stringToIdentifier(name), dataset:nonRecursive.union(recursive, {all:opts.unionAll != false, fromSelf:false})})]);
    1805. 

  1805. 6            return this.mergeOptions({"with":wit});
    1806. 

  1806.          },
    1807. 

  1807.  
    1808. 

  1808.          /**
    1809. 

  1809.           * Returns a copy of the dataset with the static SQL used.  This is useful if you want
    1810. 

  1810.           * to keep the same {@link patio.Dataset#rowCb}/{@link patio.Dataset#graph},
    1811. 

  1811.           *  but change the SQL used to custom SQL.
    1812. 

  1812.           *
    1813. 

  1813.           * @example
    1814. 

  1814.           *  DB.from("items").withSql('SELECT * FROM foo')
    1815. 

  1815.           *          //=> SELECT * FROM foo
    1816. 

  1816.           *
    1817. 

  1817.           *  @param {String} sql sql for the dataset to use.
    1818. 

  1818.           *
    1819. 

  1819.           *  @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with the static sql set.
    1820. 

  1820.           */
    1821. 

  1821.          withSql:function (sql) {
    1822. 

  1822. 46            var args = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1);
    1823. 

  1823. 46            if (args.length) {
    1824. 

  1824. 23                sql = new PlaceHolderLiteralString(sql, args)
    1825. 

  1825.              }
    1826. 

  1826. 46            return this.mergeOptions({sql:sql});
    1827. 

  1827.          },
    1828. 

  1828.  
    1829. 

  1829.  
    1830. 

  1830.          /**
    1831. 

  1831.           * Add the dataset to the list of compounds
    1832. 

  1832.           *
    1833. 

  1833.           * @param {String} type the type of compound (i.e. "union", "intersect")
    1834. 

  1834.           * @param {patio.Dataset} dataset the dataset to add to
    1835. 

  1835.           * @param [Object] [options={}] compound option to use (i.e {all : true})
    1836. 

  1836.           *
    1837. 

  1837.           * @return {patio.Dataset} ds with the dataset added to the compounds.
    1838. 

  1838.           */
    1839. 

  1839.          compoundClone:function (type, dataset, options) {
    1840. 

  1840. 51            var ds = this._compoundFromSelf().mergeOptions({compounds:(array.toArray(this.__opts.compounds || [])).concat([
    1841. 

  1841.                  [type, dataset._compoundFromSelf(), options.all]
    1842. 

  1842.              ])});
    1843. 

  1843. 51            return options.fromSelf === false ? ds : ds.fromSelf(options);
    1844. 

  1844.          },
    1845. 

  1845.  
    1846. 

  1846.          /**
    1847. 

  1847.           * Returns the a cloned dataset with out the {@link patio.Dataset#rowCb}
    1848. 

  1848.           *
    1849. 

  1849.           * @example
    1850. 

  1850.           * var ds = DB.from("test");
    1851. 

  1851.           * ds.rowCb = function(r){
    1852. 

  1852.           *     r.a = r.a * 2;
    1853. 

  1853.           * }
    1854. 

  1854.           *
    1855. 

  1855.           * ds.all().then(function(ret){
    1856. 

  1856.           *      //ret === [{a : 4}, {a : 6}]
    1857. 

  1857.           * });
    1858. 

  1858.           * ds.naked().all().then(function(ret){
    1859. 

  1859.           *      //ret ===  [{a : 2}, {a : 3}];
    1860. 

  1860.           * });
    1861. 

  1861.           *
    1862. 

  1862.           * @return {patio.Dataset} a cloned dataset with out the {@link patio.Dataset#rowCb}
    1863. 

  1863.           */
    1864. 

  1864.          naked:function () {
    1865. 

  1865. 2567            var ds = this.mergeOptions({});
    1866. 

  1866. 2567            ds.rowCb = null;
    1867. 

  1867. 2567            return ds;
    1868. 

  1868.          },
    1869. 

  1869.  
    1870. 

  1870.          /**
    1871. 

  1871.           * @private
    1872. 

  1872.           * Protected
    1873. 

  1873.           *
    1874. 

  1874.           * Internal filter method so it works on either the having or where clauses.
    1875. 

  1875.           */
    1876. 

  1876.          _filter:function (clause) {
    1877. 

  1877. 4224            var cond = argsToArray(arguments).slice(1), cb;
    1878. 

  1878. 4224            if (cond.length && isFunction(cond[cond.length - 1])) {
    1879. 

  1879. 59                cb = cond.pop();
    1880. 

  1880.              }
    1881. 

  1881. 4224            cond = cond.length == 1 ? cond[0] : cond
    1882. 

  1882. 4224            if ((cond == null || cond == undefined || cond === "") || (isArray(cond) && cond.length == 0 && !cb) || (isObject(cond) && isEmpty(cond) && !cb)) {
    1883. 

  1883. 386                return this.mergeOptions();
    1884. 

  1884.              } else {
    1885. 

  1885. 3838                cond = this._filterExpr(cond, cb);
    1886. 

  1886. 3835                var cl = this.__opts[clause];
    1887. 

  1887. 3835                cl && (cond = new BooleanExpression("AND", cl, cond));
    1888. 

  1888. 3835                var opts = {};
    1889. 

  1889. 3835                opts[clause] = cond;
    1890. 

  1890. 3835                return this.mergeOptions(opts);
    1891. 

  1891.              }
    1892. 

  1892.          },
    1893. 

  1893.  
    1894. 

  1894.          /**
    1895. 

  1895.           * Splits a possible implicit alias, handling both {@link patio.sql.AliasedExpression}s
    1896. 

  1896.           * and strings.  Returns an array of two elements, with the first being the
    1897. 

  1897.           * main expression, and the second being the alias. Alias may be null if it is a
    1898. 

  1898.           * string that does not contain an alias {table}___{alias}.
    1899. 

  1899.           */
    1900. 

  1900.          _splitAlias:function (c) {
    1901. 

  1901. 782            var ret;
    1902. 

  1902. 782            if (isInstanceOf(c, AliasedExpression)) {
    1903. 

  1903. 5                ret = [c.expression, c.alias];
    1904. 

  1904. 777            } else if (isString(c)) {
    1905. 

  1905. 0                var parts = this._splitString(c), cTable = parts[0], column = parts[1], alias = parts[2];
    1906. 

  1906. 0                if (alias) {
    1907. 

  1907. 0                    ret = [cTable ? new QualifiedIdentifier(cTable, column) : column, alias];
    1908. 

  1908.                  } else {
    1909. 

  1909. 0                    ret = [c, null];
    1910. 

  1910.                  }
    1911. 

  1911.              } else {
    1912. 

  1912. 777                ret = [c, null];
    1913. 

  1913.              }
    1914. 

  1914. 782            return ret;
    1915. 

  1915.          },
    1916. 

  1916.  
    1917. 

  1917.  
    1918. 

  1918.          /**
    1919. 

  1919.           * @private
    1920. 

  1920.           * Inverts the given order by breaking it into a list of column references
    1921. 

  1921.           * and inverting them.
    1922. 

  1922.           *
    1923. 

  1923.           *   ds.invertOrder([sql.identifier("id").desc()]]) //=> [id]
    1924. 

  1924.           *   ds.invertOrder("category", sql.identifier("price").desc()]) #=> [category.desc(), price]
    1925. 

  1925.           */
    1926. 

  1926.  
    1927. 

  1927.          _invertOrder:function (order) {
    1928. 

  1928. 46            var ret = order;
    1929. 

  1929. 46            if (order) {
    1930. 

  1930. 45                ret = order.map(function (o) {
    1931. 

  1931. 57                    if (isInstanceOf(o, OrderedExpression)) {
    1932. 

  1932. 17                        return o.invert();
    1933. 

  1933.                      } else {
    1934. 

  1934. 40                        return new OrderedExpression(isString(o) ? new Identifier(o) : o);
    1935. 

  1935.                      }
    1936. 

  1936.                  }, this);
    1937. 

  1937.              }
    1938. 

  1938. 46            return ret;
    1939. 

  1939.          },
    1940. 

  1940.  
    1941. 

  1941.          /**
    1942. 

  1942.           * Creates a boolean expression that each key is compared to its value using the provided operator.
    1943. 

  1943.           *
    1944. 

  1944.           * @example
    1945. 

  1945.           *
    1946. 

  1946.           * ds.__createBoolExpression("gt", {x : 1, y:2, z : 5}) //=> WHERE ((x > 1) AND (y > 2) AND (z > 5))
    1947. 

  1947.           * ds.__createBoolExpression("gt", [[x, 1], [y,2], [z, 5]) //=> WHERE ((x > 1) AND (y > 2) AND (z > 5))
    1948. 

  1948.           * ds.__createBoolExpression("lt", {x : 1, y:2, z : 5}) //=> WHERE ((x < 1) AND (y < 2) AND (z < 5))
    1949. 

  1949.           * ds.__createBoolExpression("lt", [[x, 1], [y,2], [z, 5]) //=> WHERE ((x < 1) AND (y < 2) AND (z < 5))
    1950. 

  1950.           *
    1951. 

  1951.           * @param {String} op valid boolean expression operator to capare each K,V pair with
    1952. 

  1952.           * @param {Object| Array } obj object or two dimensional array containing key value pairs
    1953. 

  1953.           *
    1954. 

  1954.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} boolean expression joined by a AND of each key value pair compared by the op
    1955. 

  1955.           */
    1956. 

  1956.          __createBoolExpression:function (op, obj) {
    1957. 

  1957. 32            var pairs = [];
    1958. 

  1958. 32            if (Expression.isConditionSpecifier(obj)) {
    1959. 

  1959. 32                if (isHash(obj)) {
    1960. 

  1960. 18                    obj = array.toArray(obj);
    1961. 

  1961.                  }
    1962. 

  1962. 32                obj.forEach(function (pair) {
    1963. 

  1963. 42                    pairs.push(new BooleanExpression(op, new Identifier(pair[0]), pair[1]));
    1964. 

  1964.                  });
    1965. 

  1965.              }
    1966. 

  1966. 32            return pairs.length == 1 ? pairs[0] : BooleanExpression.fromArgs(["AND"].concat(pairs));
    1967. 

  1967.          },
    1968. 

  1968.  
    1969. 

  1969.          /**
    1970. 

  1970.           * @private
    1971. 

  1971.           *
    1972. 

  1972.           * Creates a boolean expression where the key is '>=' value 1 and '<=' value two.
    1973. 

  1973.           *
    1974. 

  1974.           * @example
    1975. 

  1975.           *
    1976. 

  1976.           * ds.__createBetweenExpression({x : [1,2]}) => //=> WHERE ((x >= 1) AND (x <= 10))
    1977. 

  1977.           * ds.__createBetweenExpression({x : [1,2]}, true) => //=> WHERE ((x < 1) OR (x > 10))
    1978. 

  1978.           *
    1979. 

  1979.           * @param {Object} obj object where the keys are columns and the values are two element arrays.
    1980. 

  1980.           * @param {Boolean} [invert] if set to true it inverts the between to make it not between the two values
    1981. 

  1981.           *
    1982. 

  1982.           * @return {patio.sql.BooleanExpression} a boolean expression containing the between expression.
    1983. 

  1983.           */
    1984. 

  1984.          __createBetweenExpression:function (obj, invert) {
    1985. 

  1985. 4            var pairs = [];
    1986. 

  1986. 4            for (var i in obj) {
    1987. 

  1987. 4                var v = obj[i];
    1988. 

  1988. 4                if (isArray(v) && v.length) {
    1989. 

  1989. 2                    var ident = this.stringToIdentifier(i);
    1990. 

  1990. 2                    pairs.push(new BooleanExpression("AND", new BooleanExpression("gte", ident, v[0]), new BooleanExpression("lte", ident, v[1])));
    1991. 

  1991.                  } else {
    1992. 

  1992. 2                    throw new QueryError("Between requires an array for the value");
    1993. 

  1993.                  }
    1994. 

  1994.              }
    1995. 

  1995. 2            var ret = pairs.length == 1 ? pairs[0] : BooleanExpression.fromArgs(["AND"].concat(pairs))
    1996. 

  1996. 2            return invert ? BooleanExpression.invert(ret) : ret;
    1997. 

  1997.          },
    1998. 

  1998.  
    1999. 

  1999.  
    2000. 

  2000.          /**
    2001. 

  2001.           * @private
    2002. 

  2002.           * Converts an array to a two dimensional array where the first element
    2003. 

  2003.           * is the identifier and the second argument is the value that the value should equal
    2004. 

  2004.           * used by is{Null|NotNull|True|NotTrue|False|notFalse} functions to join all the values passed in.
    2005. 

  2005.           * @param {String[]|patio.sql.Identifier} arr array of elements to make a condition specifier out of
    2006. 

  2006.           * @param defaultOp the value to assign a value if one is not provided.
    2007. 

  2007.           *
    2008. 

  2008.           * @return { [[]] } an array of two element arrays.
    2009. 

  2009.           */
    2010. 

  2010.          __arrayToConditionSpecifier:function (arr, defaultOp) {
    2011. 

  2011. 22            var ret = [];
    2012. 

  2012. 22            arr.forEach(function (a) {
    2013. 

  2013. 28                if (isString(a)) {
    2014. 

  2014. 18                    a = this.stringToIdentifier(a);
    2015. 

  2015.                  }
    2016. 

  2016. 28                if (isInstanceOf(a, Identifier)) {
    2017. 

  2017. 18                    ret.push([a, defaultOp]);
    2018. 

  2018. 10                } else if (isHash(a)) {
    2019. 

  2019. 4                    ret = ret.concat(array.toArray(a));
    2020. 

  2020.                  } else {
    2021. 

  2021. 6                    throw new QueryError("Invalid condition specifier " + a);
    2022. 

  2022.                  }
    2023. 

  2023.              }, this);
    2024. 

  2024. 16            return ret;
    2025. 

  2025.          },
    2026. 

  2026.  
    2027. 

  2027.          /**
    2028. 

  2028.           * @private
    2029. 

  2029.           *
    2030. 

  2030.           * SQL expression object based on the expr type.  See {@link patio.Dataset#filter}
    2031. 

  2031.           */
    2032. 

  2032.          _filterExpr:function (expr, cb) {
    2033. 

  2033. 4816            expr = (isUndefined(expr) || isNull(expr) || (isArray(expr) && !expr.length)) ? null : expr;
    2034. 

  2034. 4816            if (expr && cb) {
    2035. 

  2035. 1                return new BooleanExpression("AND", this._filterExpr(expr), this._filterExpr(cb))
    2036. 

  2036. 4815            } else if (cb) {
    2037. 

  2037. 58                expr = cb
    2038. 

  2038.              }
    2039. 

  2039. 4815            if (isInstanceOf(expr, Expression)) {
    2040. 

  2040. 459                if (isInstanceOf(expr, NumericExpression, StringExpression)) {
    2041. 

  2041. 2                    throw new QueryError("Invalid SQL Expression type : " + expr);
    2042. 

  2042.                  }
    2043. 

  2043. 457                return expr;
    2044. 

  2044. 4356            } else if (isArray(expr)) {
    2045. 

  2045. 910                if (expr.length) {
    2046. 

  2046. 910                    var first = expr[0];
    2047. 

  2047. 910                    if (isString(first)) {
    2048. 

  2048. 25                        return new PlaceHolderLiteralString(first, expr.slice(1), true);
    2049. 

  2049. 885                    } else if (Expression.isConditionSpecifier(expr)) {
    2050. 

  2050. 878                        return BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs(expr)
    2051. 

  2051.                      } else {
    2052. 

  2052. 7                        return BooleanExpression.fromArgs(["AND"].concat(expr.map(function (e) {
    2053. 

  2053. 15                            return this._filterExpr(e);
    2054. 

  2054.                          }, this)));
    2055. 

  2055.                      }
    2056. 

  2056.                  }
    2057. 

  2057. 3446            } else if (isFunction(expr)) {
    2058. 

  2058. 59                return this._filterExpr(expr.call(sql, sql));
    2059. 

  2059. 3387            } else if (isBoolean(expr)) {
    2060. 

  2060. 7                return new BooleanExpression("NOOP", expr);
    2061. 

  2061. 3380            } else if (isString(expr)) {
    2062. 

  2062. 1                return this.stringToIdentifier(expr);
    2063. 

  2063. 3379            } else if (isInstanceOf(expr, LiteralString)) {
    2064. 

  2064. 16                return new LiteralString("(" + expr + ")");
    2065. 

  2065. 3363            } else if (isHash(expr)) {
    2066. 

  2066. 3362                return BooleanExpression.fromValuePairs(expr);
    2067. 

  2067.              } else {
    2068. 

  2068. 1                throw new QueryError("Invalid filter argument");
    2069. 

  2069.              }
    2070. 

  2070.          },
    2071. 

  2071.  
    2072. 

  2072.  
    2073. 

  2073.          /**@ignore*/
    2074. 

  2074.          getters:{
    2075. 

  2075.  
    2076. 

  2076.              /**
    2077. 

  2077.               * @ignore
    2078. 

  2078.               * Returns true if this dataset is a simple SELECT * FROM {table}, otherwise false.
    2079. 

  2079.               */
    2080. 

  2080.              isSimpleSelectAll:function () {
    2081. 

  2081. 33                var o = {}, opts = this.__opts, count = 0;
    2082. 

  2082. 33                for (var i in opts) {
    2083. 

  2083. 70                    if (opts[i] != null && this._static.NON_SQL_OPTIONS.indexOf(i) == -1) {
    2084. 

  2084. 37                        o[i] = opts[i];
    2085. 

  2085. 37                        count++;
    2086. 

  2086.                      }
    2087. 

  2087.                  }
    2088. 

  2088. 33                var f = o.from
    2089. 

  2089. 33                return count == 1 && f.length == 1 && (isString(f[0]) || isInstanceOf(f[0], AliasedExpression, Identifier));
    2090. 

  2090.              }
    2091. 

  2091.          }
    2092. 

  2092.      },
    2093. 

  2093.  
    2094. 

  2094.      static:{
    2095. 

  2095.          /**@lends patio.Dataset*/
    2096. 

  2096.  
    2097. 

  2097.          /**
    2098. 

  2098.           * These strings have {name}Join methods created (e.g. {@link patio.Dataset#innerJoin}) that
    2099. 

  2099.           * call {@link patio.Dataset#joinTable} with the string, passing along the arguments and
    2100. 

  2100.           * block from the method call.
    2101. 

  2101.           **/
    2102. 

  2102.          CONDITIONED_JOIN_TYPES:["inner", "fullOuter", "rightOuter", "leftOuter", "full", "right", "left"],
    2103. 

  2103.  
    2104. 

  2104.          /**
    2105. 

  2105.           *
    2106. 

  2106.           * These strings have {name}Join methods created (e.g. naturalJoin) that
    2107. 

  2107.           * call {@link patio.Dataset#joinTable}.  They only accept a single table
    2108. 

  2108.           * argument which is passed to {@link patio.Dataset#joinTable}, and they throw an error
    2109. 

  2109.           * if called with a block.
    2110. 

  2110.           **/
    2111. 

  2111.          UNCONDITIONED_JOIN_TYPES:["natural", "naturalLeft", "naturalRight", "naturalFull", "cross"],
    2112. 

  2112.  
    2113. 

  2113.          /**
    2114. 

  2114.           *  The dataset options that require the removal of cached columns
    2115. 

  2115.           *  if changed.
    2116. 

  2116.           */
    2117. 

  2117.          COLUMN_CHANGE_OPTS:["select", "sql", "from", "join"],
    2118. 

  2118.  
    2119. 

  2119.          /**
    2120. 

  2120.           * Which options don't affect the SQL generation.  Used by {@link patio.Dataset#simpleSelectAll}
    2121. 

  2121.           * to determine if this is a simple SELECT * FROM table.
    2122. 

  2122.           */
    2123. 

  2123.          NON_SQL_OPTIONS:["server", "defaults", "overrides", "graph", "eagerGraph", "graphAliases"],
    2124. 

  2124.  
    2125. 

  2125.  
    2126. 

  2126.          /**
    2127. 

  2127.           *  All methods that return modified datasets with a joined table added.
    2128. 

  2128.           */
    2129. 

  2129.          JOIN_METHODS:["join", "joinTable"],
    2130. 

  2130.  
    2131. 

  2131.          /**
    2132. 

  2132.           * Methods that return modified datasets
    2133. 

  2133.           */
    2134. 

  2134.          QUERY_METHODS:['addGraphAliases', "and", "distinct", "except", "exclude", "filter", "find", "is", "isNot",
    2135. 

  2135.              "eq", "neq", "lt", "lte", "gt", "gte", "forUpdate", "from", "fromSelf", "graph", "grep", "group",
    2136. 

  2136.              "groupAndCount", "groupBy", "having", "intersect", "invert", "limit", "lockStyle", "naked", "or", "order",
    2137. 

  2137.              "orderAppend", "orderBy", "orderMore", "orderPrepend", "qualify", "reverse",
    2138. 

  2138.              "reverseOrder", "select", "selectAll", "selectAppend", "selectMore", "setDefaults",
    2139. 

  2139.              "setGraphAliases", "setOverrides", "unfiltered", "ungraphed", "ungrouped", "union", "unlimited",
    2140. 

  2140.              "unordered", "where", "with", "withRecursive", "withSql"],
    2141. 

  2141.  
    2142. 

  2142.          init:function () {
    2143. 

  2143. 35            this._super(arguments);
    2144. 

  2144.              //initialize our join methods array
    2145. 

  2145. 35            var joinMethods = this.JOIN_METHODS;
    2146. 

  2146. 35            var queryMethods = this.QUERY_METHODS;
    2147. 

  2147. 35            this.UNCONDITIONED_JOIN_TYPES.forEach(function (joinType) {
    2148. 

  2148. 175                var m = joinType + "Join";
    2149. 

  2149. 175                joinMethods.push(m);
    2150. 

  2150. 175                queryMethods.push(m);
    2151. 

  2151.              });
    2152. 

  2152. 35            this.CONDITIONED_JOIN_TYPES.forEach(function (joinType) {
    2153. 

  2153. 245                var m = joinType + "Join";
    2154. 

  2154. 245                joinMethods.push(m);
    2155. 

  2155. 245                queryMethods.push(m);
    2156. 

  2156.              });
    2157. 

  2157. 35            this.QUERY_METHODS = queryMethods.concat(joinMethods);
    2158. 

  2158.          }
    2159. 

  2159.      }
    2160. 

  2160.  }).
    2161. 

  2161.      as(module);

    71. 

  71.  
    72. 

  72.          /* Yield to the block, logging any errors at error level to all loggers,
    73. 

  73.           * and all other queries with the duration at warn or info level.
    74. 

  74.           * */
    75. 

  75.          __logAndExecute:function (sql, args, cb) {
    76. 

  76. 8164            if (isFunction(args)) {
    77. 

  77. 8163                cb = args;
    78. 

  78. 8163                args = null;
    79. 

  79.              }
    80. 

  80.  
    81. 

  81. 8164            if (args) {
    82. 

  82. 0                sql = format("%s; %j", sql, args);
    83. 

  83.              }
    84. 

  84. 8164            sql = sql.trim();
    85. 

  85. 8164            var start = new Date();
    86. 

  86. 8164            var ret = new Promise();
    87. 

  87. 8164            if (isFunction(cb)) {
    88. 

  88. 8163                this.logInfo("Executing; %s", sql);
    89. 

  89. 8163                cb().then(hitch(this, function () {
    90. 

  90. 8088                    this.logDebug("Duration: % 6dms; %s", new Date() - start, sql);
    91. 

  91. 8088                    ret.callback.apply(ret, arguments);
    92. 

  92.                  }), hitch(this, function (err) {
    93. 

  93. 75                    err = new QueryError(format("%s: %s", err.message, sql));
    94. 

  94. 75                    this.logError(err);
    95. 

  95. 75                    ret.errback.apply(ret, [err]);
    96. 

  96.                  }));
    97. 

  97.              } else {
    98. 

  98. 1                throw new QueryError("CB is required");
    99. 

  99.              }
    100. 

  100. 8163            return ret.promise();
    101. 

  101.          },
    102. 

  102.  
    103. 

  103.          /*Log the given SQL and then execute it on the connection, used by
    104. 

  104.           *the transaction code.
    105. 

  105.           * */
    106. 

  106.          __logConnectionExecute:function (conn, sql) {
    107. 

  107. 2103            return this.__logAndExecute(sql, hitch(this, function () {
    108. 

  108. 2103                return conn[this.connectionExecuteMethod](sql);
    109. 

  109.              }));
    110. 

  110.          },
    111.

plugins/inheritance.js
Coverage98.96 SLOC301 LOC96 Missed1 
  1. 1var comb = require("comb"),
    2. 

  2.      Promise = comb.Promise,
    3. 

  3.      PromiseList = comb.PromiseList,
    4. 

  4.      hitch = comb.hitch;
    5. 

  5.  
    6. 

  6.  
    7. 

  7. 1comb.define(null, {
    8. 

  8.      instance:{},
    9. 

  9.      "static":{
    10. 

  10.  
    11. 

  11.          configure:function (model) {
    12. 

  12.  
    13. 

  13.          }
    14. 

  14.      }
    15. 

  15.  }).as(exports, "SingleTableInheritance");
    16. 

  16.  
    17. 

  17.  
    18. 

  18.  /**
    19. 

  19.   * @class This plugin enables
    20. 

  20.   * <a href="http://www.martinfowler.com/eaaCatalog/classTableInheritance.html" target="patioapi">
    21. 

  21.   *     class table inheritance
    22. 

  22.   * </a>.
    23. 

  23.   *
    24. 

  24.   *<div>
    25. 

  25.   *     Consider the following table model.
    26. 

  26.   * @code
    27. 

  27.   *          employee
    28. 

  28.   *            - id
    29. 

  29.   *            - name (varchar)
    30. 

  30.   *            - kind (varchar)
    31. 

  31.   *     /                          \
    32. 

  32.   * staff                        manager
    33. 

  33.   *   - id (fk employee)           - id (fk employee)
    34. 

  34.   *   - manager_id (fk manger)     - numStaff (number)
    35. 

  35.   *                                 |
    36. 

  36.   *                              executive
    37. 

  37.   *                                - id (fk manager)
    38. 

  38.   *
    39. 

  39.   *  <ul>
    40. 

  40.   *      <li><b>employee</b>: This is the parent table of all employee instances.</li>
    41. 

  41.   *      <li><b>staff</b>: Table that inherits from employee where and represents.</li>
    42. 

  42.   *      <li><b>manager</b>: Another subclass of employee.</li>
    43. 

  43.   *      <li><b>executive</b>: Subclass of manager that also inherits from employee through inhertiance</li>
    44. 

  44.   *  </ul>
    45. 

  45.   * <p>
    46. 

  46.   * When setting up you tables the parent table should contain a String column that contains the "kind" of class it is.
    47. 

  47.   * (i.e. employee, staff, manager, executive). This allows the plugin to return the proper instance type when querying
    48. 

  48.   * the tables.
    49. 

  49.   * </p>
    50. 

  50.   * <p>
    51. 

  51.   *     All other tables that inherit from employee should contain a foreign key to their direct super class that is the
    52. 

  52.   *     same name as the primary key of the parent table(<b>employee</b>). So, in the
    53. 

  53.   *     above example <b>staff</b> and <b>manager</b> both contain foreign keys to employee and <b>executive</b> contains
    54. 

  54.   *     a foreign key to <b>manager</b> and they are all named <b>id</b>.
    55. 

  55.   * </p>
    56. 

  56.   *</div>
    57. 

  57.   *
    58. 

  58.   * To set up you models the base super class should contain the ClassTableInheritancePlugin
    59. 

  59.   *
    60. 

  60.   * {@code
    61. 

  61.   * var Employee = (exports.Employee = patio.addModel("employee", {
    62. 

  62.   *      plugins : [patio.plugins.ClassTableInheritancePlugin],
    63. 

  63.   *      static:{
    64. 

  64.   *          init:function () {
    65. 

  65.   *              this._super(arguments);
    66. 

  66.   *              this.configure({key : "kind"});
    67. 

  67.   *          }
    68. 

  68.   *      }
    69. 

  69.   *  }));
    70. 

  70.   * }
    71. 

  71.   * All sub classes should just inherit their super class
    72. 

  72.   * {@code
    73. 

  73.   * var Staff = (exports.Staff =  patio.addModel("staff", Employee, {
    74. 

  74.   *      static:{
    75. 

  75.   *          init:function () {
    76. 

  76.   *              this._super(arguments);
    77. 

  77.   *              this.manyToOne("manager", {key : "managerId", fetchType : this.fetchType.EAGER});
    78. 

  78.   *          }
    79. 

  79.   *      }
    80. 

  80.   * }));
    81. 

  81.   * var Manager = (exports.Manager = patio.addModel("manager", Employee, {
    82. 

  82.   *      static:{
    83. 

  83.   *          init:function () {
    84. 

  84.   *              this._super(arguments);
    85. 

  85.   *              this.oneToMany("staff", {key : "managerId", fetchType : this.fetchType.EAGER});
    86. 

  86.   *          }
    87. 

  87.   *      }
    88. 

  88.   * }));
    89. 

  89.   * }
    90. 

  90.   *
    91. 

  91.   * Executive inherits from manager, and through inheritance will also receive the oneToMany relationship with staff
    92. 

  92.   * {@code
    93. 

  93.   * var Executive = (exports.Executive = patio.addModel("executive",  Manager));
    94. 

  94.   * }
    95. 

  95.   *
    96. 

  96.   * Working with models
    97. 

  97.   *
    98. 

  98.   * {@code
    99. 

  99.   * comb.when(
    100. 

  100.   *     new Employee({name:"Bob"}).save(),
    101. 

  101.   *     new Staff({name:"Greg"}).save(),
    102. 

  102.   *     new Manager({name:"Jane"}).save(),
    103. 

  103.   *     new Executive({name:"Sue"}).save()
    104. 

  104.   * ).then(function(){
    105. 

  105.   *      Employee.all().then(function(emps){
    106. 

  106.   *          var bob = emps[0], greg = emps[1], jane = emps[2], sue = emps[3];
    107. 

  107.   *          console.log(bob instanceof Employee); //true
    108. 

  108.   *          console.log(greg instanceof Employee);  //true
    109. 

  109.   *          console.log(greg instanceof Staff);  //true
    110. 

  110.   *          console.log(jane instanceof Employee);  //true
    111. 

  111.   *          console.log(jane instanceof Manager);  //true
    112. 

  112.   *          console.log(sue instanceof Employee);  //true
    113. 

  113.   *          console.log(sue instanceof Manager);  //true
    114. 

  114.   *          console.log(sue instanceof Executive);  //true
    115. 

  115.   *      });
    116. 

  116.   * });
    117. 

  117.   * }
    118. 

  118.   *
    119. 

  119.   * @name ClassTableInheritancePlugin
    120. 

  120.   * @memberof patio.plugins
    121. 

  121.   */

  177.          // update each column according to the columns in each table
    178. 

  178.          _update:function () {

  179. 4            var q = this._getPrimaryKeyQuery(), changed = this.__changed;
    180. 

  180. 4            var ret = new Promise(),
    181. 

  181.                  modelStatic = this._static,
    182.

  183.                  tables = modelStatic.__ctiTables;

  185. 9                var cols = ctiColumns[table], update = {};

    187. 

  187. 22                    if (!comb.isUndefined(changed[c])) {

    210.

  263.  
    264. 

  264.          /**
    265. 

  265.           * <b>Not typically called by user code</b>. Sets up subclass inheritance.
    266. 

  266.           *
    267. 

  267.           * @param {patio.Model} model model that this class is inheriting from.
    268. 

  268.           */
    269. 

  269.          inherits:function (model) {
    270. 

  270. 3            this._super(arguments);
    271. 

  271. 3            var ctiKey = this.__ctiKey = model.__ctiKey;
    272. 

  272. 3            this.__ctiTables = model.__ctiTables.slice();
    273. 

  273. 3            this.__ctiModels = model.__ctiModels.slice();
    274. 

  274. 3            this.__ctiModels.push(this);
    275. 

  275. 3            this.__ctiTables.push(this.tableName);
    276. 

  276. 3            this.__ctiColumns = comb.merge({}, model.__ctiColumns);
    277. 

  277. 3            this.__ctiColumns[this.tableName] = this.columns;
    278. 

  278. 3            this.__ctiBaseModel = model.__ctiBaseModel;
    279. 

  279.              //copy over our schema
    280. 

  280. 3            var newSchema = comb.merge({}, this.__schema);
    281. 

  281. 3            var schemas = model.__ctiModels.map(
    282. 

  282.                  function (m) {
    283. 

  283. 4                    return m.schema;
    284. 

  284.                  }).reverse();
    285. 

  285. 3            schemas.forEach(function (s) {
    286. 

  286. 4                for (var i in s) {
    287. 

  287. 13                    newSchema[i] = s[i];
    288. 

  288.                  }
    289. 

  289.              }, this);
    290. 

  290. 3            this._setSchema(newSchema);
    291. 

  291. 3            this._setDataset(model.dataset.join(this.tableName, this.primaryKey));
    292. 

  292. 3            this._setPrimaryKey(this.__ctiBaseModel.primaryKey);
    293. 

  293. 3            this.pre("save", function (next) {
    294. 

  294. 5                if (ctiKey) {
    295. 

  295. 5                    this[ctiKey] = this.tableName.toString();
    296. 

  296.                  }
    297. 

  297. 5                next();
    298. 

  298.              });
    299. 

  299.          }

    24. 

  24.  /*
    25. 

  25.   * This file contains dataset graphing related features. All methods return
    26.

    27.

    28.

  30.  //leave for later initialization

  31. 1var Dataset;
    32.

    33. 

  33.  
    34. 

  34.  //checks for a table alies if there isnt one throw an error.
    35. 

  35. 1var raiseAliasError = function (options) {
    36. 

  36. 2    var isAlias = isUndefinedOrNull(options.tableAlias);
    37. 

  37. 2    throw new QueryError(format("this %s has already been used, please specify %s", isAlias ? "alias" : "table", isAlias ? "a different alias" : "an alias in options"));
    38. 

  38.  };
    39. 

  39.
